properties.Name: City of Vaughan Distribution Watermain Condition Assessment
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** "As part of the City's infrastructure review and risk analysis, this project will use Hydro VAC and regular excavations to daylight/expose water mains to assess and log the pipe condition to prioritize future replacements, The actual project value came back lower than the estimated costs due to following reasons: (a) initial scope was developed based on the information available at that time; (b) Market condition and lots of interest within the consulting industry IO NOTE: There is no decrease in scope, only a reduction in tender. This will result in an decrease in Federal Funding of $96,709.50 to be reallocated."
Construction Start Date:2017-12-06
Construction End Date:2018-12-15

properties.Name: Village of Sombra Wastewater Lagoon Optimization
properties.Description:
Project Description:The focus of this project is the overall optimization of the wastewater lagoon, including improvements to the chemical dosing equipment and the implementation of aeration to improve the biological digestion of the sludge within the lagoon. In order to complete repairs of the concrete inlet and outlet structures we are required to remove accumulated wastewater sludge from the Village of Sombra Wastewater Lagoon (Cell 2) . These improvements are critical as the Township looks to meeting existing and future Federal and Provincial requirements. Due to weather-sensitive work that must be completed outside of winter months, we are requesting an extension beyond March 31, 2018, to ensure successful completion of the project.
Construction Start Date:2017-09-01
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Construction of Foundation Drainage Collector (FDC) Pumping Station and Utility Trench dewatering system - in the vicinity of Black Walnut Trail and Cactus Gate (Lisgar)
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** "Construction of a Foundation Drainage Collector Pumping Station and a utility trench dewatering system to address basement water infiltration issues. The objective of the Lisgar Basement Water Infiltration Study was to investigate causes of basement water infiltration in the Lisgar area and to provide a Prioritized Action Plan of mitigation measures for implementation. The Prioritized Action Plan consisted of the following: a) Strategic lining of priority storm sewers to minimize leakage b) Construction of a utility trench dewatering system c) Monitoring to assess the effectiveness of a) and b) Conditional on the results of the above, consider: d) Building permanent FDC pumping station for high flows e) Replace deficient FDC pipe lengths when they reach the end of their lifecycle As such, the City proceeded with lining of strategic storm sewers beginning in December 2016 and completed approximately 3.3 km of pipe lining using City Funding. Subsequent leakage test results indicated that storm sewer lining was not as effective as had been anticipated in preventing stormwater from contributing to the utility trench water build-up. Therefore, Phase 2 of the storm sewer lining program (Doug Leavens Blvd., Osprey Blvd, and Alderwood Trail) has been suspended and the City is moving forward with the construction of an FDC Pumping Station (in addition to the Trench Dewatering System). The objective of all the remedial measures identified in the Prioritized Action Plan remains the same: to mitigate basement water infiltration in the Lisgar area. "
Construction Start Date:2017-01-01
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Decommission and Replace Rennie Road Standpipe with Transmission Line to New Water Reservoir
properties.Description:
Project Description:Demolish the existing Rennie Road standpipe, install a new 2.6 km transmission line to the new Williston Road water reservoir, and install a pressure reducing valve station. This project includes related road work necessary to complete the project.
Construction Start Date:2017-09-08
Construction End Date:2018-12-31

properties.Name: Drinking water upgrade
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project involves supplying the parish of Saint-Urbain with drinking water by means of a new well since one of the two existing wells is contaminated by surface water.
Construction Start Date:2017-09-18
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: New upgrade replacement to Water Treatment Plant Underdrain Filter #2, located inside the Water Treatment Plant on Trader Lane
properties.Description:
Project Description:While the water treatment plant was renewed approximately 10 years ago, the underdrain filters have reached their age. In 2015, a major failure of one of the two underdrain filters caused the system to run at a decreased level. Had the remaining filter failed while running in this limited fashion, the water distribution would have been extremely compromised. Dual media gravity filter #2 requires underdrain rehabilitation. Expected life cycle of these filters is 10-12 years, they were installed in 2005. We are starting to note irregular flow patterns in the media during backwashes, indicating the underdrain components need to be replaced.
Construction Start Date:2017-07-01
Construction End Date:2017-08-31

properties.Name: Control Building - Water Supply
properties.Description:
Project Description:Build a control building and lay 100 m of pipes to enable use of a well in two separate distribution areas.
Construction Start Date:2017-07-03
Construction End Date:2018-06-29

properties.Name: Addition of a phosphate and sulphur removal system
properties.Description:
Project Description:The purpose of the project is to install a drinking water treatment system to remove sulphur. The project also includes the addition of a phosphate removal system to the wastewater treatment plant.
Construction Start Date:2017-06-01
Construction End Date:2017-12-12

properties.Name: Storm sewer installation and remediation in the Thorold South catchment area.
properties.Description:
Project Description:The problem is the storm sewer is undersized or non-existent in some locations. This is a historical issue that directly impacts 375 residents with potential sewer backups and/or basement flooding. The storm sewer pipes that are present are not large enough or are leaking, such that the rainwater gets into the sanitary system and increases overflows both to the environment and the residents. The solution would be to increase conveyance by increasing the pipe size to between 300-600 mm to the storm outlets to encourage the rain water to leave by natural means not through the sanitary system. The area of concern is Beaver Street, Niagara Falls Road, Pilkington Street, Morton Street, Clara Street and Taylor Street. Due to the size and complexity of the project, we are requesting an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline to ensure successful completion of the project.
Construction Start Date:2017-08-28
Construction End Date:2019-02-15

properties.Name: Renewal of water pipes
properties.Description:
Project Description:Pipe renewal work for the maintenance of water services to citizens for some 18 street sections totaling 1.097 km.
Construction Start Date:2017-06-26
Construction End Date:2017-11-30

properties.Name: County Road 2 Master Drainage Plan
properties.Description:
Project Description:A Master Drainage Plan (MDP) will be developed for the County Road 2 corridor to guide the design of storm water infrastructure along County Road 2 within and immediately west of the Town of Cobourg. The MDP will evaluate options for storm water collection, conveyance and management and select a preferred alternative. The MDP will consider the storm water management requirements associated with widening of the future roadway as well the function of the County Road 2 corridor with respect to collecting and conveying storm water from existing/future development north of County Road 2. The preferred alternative will be selected to minimize existing and future flooding risks, protect water quality in the receiving watercourses/wetland and development on lands within existing urban boundaries.
Construction Start Date:2018-02-22
Construction End Date:2019-05-31

properties.Name: Wastewater System Upgrades
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project works will include: - Installation of a Dissolved Air Flotation tank and Moving Bed Biofilm Reactor media into the existing wastewater treatment plant; - Installation of sludge dewatering infrastructure at two wastewater treatment facilities; and, - Upgrade/Replacement of Process Logic Controls at nine lift stations and four wastewater treatment facilities.
Construction Start Date:2017-07-17
Construction End Date:2018-10-31

properties.Name: Willowbrook Water System Improvement Project
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project works will include: - Installation of Process Logic Control system with connections to all existing equipment; - Installation of system alarm; - Antenna pole at reservoir site with concrete base; - Level transducer added into the well; and, - Building upgrades.

Construction End Date:2018-12-21

properties.Name: Renewal of water pipes
properties.Description:
Project Description:Pipe renewal work for the maintenance of water services to citizens for 13 street sections totaling 1.476 km.
Construction Start Date:2017-09-28
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Stormwater Management Slope Stabilization by Rehabilitating an Existing Retaining Wall along the east side of Clarence Street.
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** This project will stabilize the existing slope on the east side of Clarence Street and work will rehabilitate the existing retaining wall to mitigate further storm water erosion damage to the slope. We will also replace the failed culvert. This project identifies the necessary rehabilitation of storm water assets to ensure that proper conveyance of storm water within the vicinity of these creeks. The existing slope has failed, south of Wycliffe Avenue. The failure can be attributed to uncontrolled storm water conveyance due to its proximity to the Humber River and the failure of an existing 2400mm culvert crossing the roadway. Consequently, there are concerns that the existing retaining wall can shift and slide into the creek. Due to delays in developing the agreement, an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline is required. IO NOTE: There is no decrease in scope, only a reduction in tender. This will result in a decrease in Federal Funding of $330,000 to be reallocated.
Construction Start Date:2017-06-01
Construction End Date:2018-09-15

properties.Name: Stormwater Management Facility Rehabilitation (Restoration of Burnett Ave Stormwater Management Facility including removal of sediment and vegetation and restoration of inlet/outlet structures.)
properties.Description:
Project Description:The rehabilitation of stormwater management facilities will include sediment removal, vegetation management, inlet and outlet structure clean out and erosion remediation. The project will ensure capacity for water quantity and quality treatment. Ongoing condition assessments will identify priority locations for rehabilitation works. The removal works are capitalized as they extend the life of the asset.
Construction Start Date:2018-02-02
Construction End Date:2018-09-30

properties.Name: Upgrade to ditches along Guiney Road to prevent flooding and damage to roadway
properties.Description:
Project Description:Stormwater ditches will be created along Guiney Road where none exists to divert stormwater. This will require the removal of rock by blasting in some locations. Two deteriorating culverts will be replaced. This will prevent damage to the roadway and reduce flooding in the spring.
Construction Start Date:2017-08-21
Construction End Date:2017-09-01

properties.Name: Renewal of water pipes
properties.Description:
Project Description:Pipe renewal works aimed at maintaining water services for citizens for 10 stretches of road, totaling 0.687 km.
Construction Start Date:2017-05-23
Construction End Date:2017-11-17

properties.Name: Lemieux Island Water Purification Plant - High Lift Station Heating, Ventilation and Air Conditioning (HVAC) Upgrades
properties.Description:
Project Description:Upgrade and install engineered ventilation system that provides adequate ventilation and humidity controls to the High Lift Pump station building as well as equipment access and serviceability
Construction Start Date:2017-09-28
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Hilldale Rd/ Trendiak Rd Culvert Replacement Program
properties.Description:
Project Description:Replace and Increase capacity of undersized culverts on Hilldale Road and Trendiak Road. On Hilldale Rd the replacement of a 16m long 1200mm Corrugated Steel Pipe (CSP) and a box culvert is required. On Trendiak two (2) 9.5 m long 900mm CSP culverts must be replaced.
Construction Start Date:2017-06-01
Construction End Date:2017-10-01

properties.Name: Oil City/Oil Springs Reservoir Upgrades
properties.Description:
Project Description:This joint project is being undertaken by the Township of Enniskillen and the Village of Oil Springs. Upgrades/replacement to the piping, valves, pumps, Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA) system at the Oil City/Oil Springs Reservoir. The reservoir was built in 1993 and the primary equipment within the reservoir have reached the end of its useful life. The reservoir provides 365,000 gallons of water storage for emergency use within the Township of Enniskillen and Oil Springs water systems. The replacement of aging equipment will reduce the overall electrical consumption at the reservoir. A more current SCADA system will provide remote access and greater control by the local operators of the reservoir. The project will include: 1. the replacement of three 45 hp submersible pumps and variable speed drives with three 30 hp pumps and associated drives; 2. the replacement of the piping and valves to support the pumps; 3. the updating of the operating system (SCADA) for the control of the pumps and alarms; 4. the replacement of the backup stationary diesel generator with a stationary natural gas generator; 5. the replacement of the chlorine pumps. The total eligible costs of the joint project is $200,000. The Municipal Contribution by the Township of Enniskillen is $25,000 and the Municipal contribution by the Village of Oil Springs is $25,000. The Provincial contribution to the project is $50,000. The total federal CWWF contribution of $100,000 will be divided equally between the Township of Enniskillen and the Village of Oil Springs, both of which will be considered ultimate recipients as per the agreement between Canada and Ontario. Due to delays in tendering, we are requesting an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline to ensure successful completion of the project.
Construction Start Date:2016-11-01
Construction End Date:2018-06-30

properties.Name: Design: Dingman Creek Subwatershed Stormwater Infrastructure
properties.Description:
Project Description:This preliminary design is for stream corridors in the Dingman Creek Subwatershed that will protect residents from flooding caused by stormwater, and will also support future growth. The design will incorporate complete-corridor concepts for stormwater, people and wildlife. This approach will result in a return to the original, natural stream stormwater management functions. Future construction projects will be identified.
Construction Start Date:2017-06-26
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Renewal of water pipes
properties.Description:
Project Description:Pipe renewal work for the maintenance of water services to citizens for 12 street sections totaling 2.059 km.
Construction Start Date:2017-04-12
Construction End Date:2017-12-13

properties.Name: Rehabilitation of the existing Watermain with new polyvinyl chloride materials on King Street West (#40-#94)  that serves the Millbrook Community
properties.Description:
Project Description:Replacement of existing Watermain with joint project of reconstructing King Street with the County. The project includes the replacement of very old plastic feeder watermain, with new polyvinyl chloride (PVC) material. The material is old, fragile and subject to breaking and leakage. The replacement includes new watermain, new hydrants, new water services and all new valving. This is the main feeder system between our ground water wells and our community and ensures good quality water for over 600 users & fire protection breaks (currently 600 users plus 1,000 additional residential units per Official Plan designated growth). The project will eliminate breaks and leakage while monitoring resident usage. Objective; The objective is to maintain good quality water for residential, commercial users, provide dependable fire protection and reduce watermain leakage and possible breaks. Scope; The scope was the complete removal & replacement of this section of watermain with new PVC watermain material, remove & replace all copper water services and remove and replace all fire hydrants. This includes all new valving which is integral to controlling the system. Output; The output is a high quality system with no leakage & possible breaks. A more guaranteed water supply to our community and dependable fire protection for the entire community.
Construction Start Date:2017-08-01
Construction End Date:2017-12-13

properties.Name: Pond reinforcement
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project involves the conversion of the existing basins to aerated ponds and the addition of a phosphate removal system.
Construction Start Date:2018-06-01
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Landmark Water Treatment Distribution System Upgrade: Phase II
properties.Description:
Project Description:This is Phase II of a ongoing upgrade to the Local Urban District of Landmark's water distribution and fire protection system. Upgrades will include approximately seven kilometres of new waterlines.
Construction Start Date:2018-07-30
Construction End Date:2019-03-29

properties.Name: Payette Water Pumping Station upgrades
properties.Description:
Project Description:"The replacement of the back up emergency generator at the Payette Pump Station which will include a sizing increase to accommodate future upgrades. The replacement will include the installation of a 400kw generator that will upgrade from the existing 300kw generator. Additionally, the new generator will be a natural gas device which will allow the Town to remove the current diesel fuel storage on site thus removing the risk from a source water protection perspective. Due to delays in developing the Transfer Payment Agreement and subsequent delays in procurement and its impact on construction schedule, we are requesting an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline to ensure successful completion of the project."
Construction Start Date:2017-09-14
Construction End Date:2018-09-28

properties.Name: Structural extension of water services to complete loop on Railway Street
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project is to install 160m of 150mm water main along Railway Street. This project will complete the distribution network in the area and improve the efficacy of the system. This includes increased reliability in delivering drinking water in the area, provide alternate means for isolating main breaks and increase the chlorine residual without having to flush.
Construction Start Date:2017-05-01
Construction End Date:2018-07-31

properties.Name: Albany Wastewater Treatment Facility Upgrades
properties.Description:
Project Description:This project will add additional treatment capacity to the facility with the addition of a new SBR and addresses three issues with the current set up; cooling for the SBR influent water/wastewater heat exchanger, source separation of the tripe waste from wastewater flow (tripe processing equipment) and thickening of WAS prior to storage to eliminate the need for additional tankage (Rotary Drum Thickener)
Construction Start Date:2017-09-05
Construction End Date:2017-10-27

properties.Name: Upgrades to the Harrow-Colchester South Water treatment plant including Low and High Lift Pumps, Motor Control Center Panel and Microstrainer
properties.Description:
Project Description:I) Retrofit 4 old low lift pumps (75.8 L/s, 26.5 L/s, 75.8 L/s, and 90.8 L/s) with new high efficient pumps which include Variable Frequency Drives. This will result in more reliable and efficient operation of the system with less breakdown and, reduce energy and the carbon footprint. ii) Replace aging low lift and high lift Motor Control Center (MCC) Panels with new panels. This will result in more reliable and efficient supply in the system with less breakdown and, reduce energy and the carbon footprint. Aging Motor Control Center panels are also becoming a major health & safety risk. iii) Retrofit 2 old high lift pumps (26.5 L/s, 68.2 L/s) and 1 backwash pump (113.7 L/s) with new high efficient pumps which Variable Frequency Drives. This will result in more reliable and efficient operation of the system with less breakdown and, reduce energy and the carbon footprint. iv) Replace the existing communication line between the low lift building and main building. It is becoming unreliable due to age and failure of this would directly impact the operations of the facility. v) Replace 1 existing microstrainer and associated Motor Control Center panel due to the age, the unit is becoming unreliable and replacement parts are not always available. This will result in a more reliable and efficient operation of the unit with less breakdown and reduce energy and the carbon footprint.
Construction Start Date:2017-08-30
Construction End Date:2018-12-31

properties.Name: The Simcoe Road Stormwater Management Facility Remediation and Restoration Project
properties.Description:
Project Description:The Simcoe Road Stormwater Management Facility Remediation will see the Stormwater Management Facility brought to its original design as recommended in the Town's Comprehensive Stormwater Management Master Plan. Phosphorus loading will be reduced, as the Stormwater Management Facility function will be improved, having a positive impact and improving water quality that enters the West Holland (Lake Simcoe) watershed. These improvements support the initiative of the Lake Simcoe Protection Plan as they relate to phosphorus reduction strategies. This will include the removal of approximately 1900 cubic meters sediments that have accumulated over time and impaired the ponds function. Several structural repairs and area restoration will also be included within the project scope. The removal works are capitalized as they extend the life of the asset.
Construction Start Date:2017-11-06
Construction End Date:2017-12-31

properties.Name: Storm Water Management Pond Maintenance (assessment, cleaning, and rehabilitation)
properties.Description:

The CWWF funding will allow the Town to advance necessary works that would otherwise be deferred into 2018 and 2019.

In the future, the sanitary sewers will need to be replaced where required due to age and maintenance issues. In the future, the watermain will need to be replaced where required in order to accommodate the construction of the new storm sewer trunk. Full road reconstruction including curbs and sidewalks will be included where required. The design requires time and we request an extension to the March 31, 2018 deadline.

Ethel Street retained existing water main and did not require sanitary sewer. Storm sewer was installed as planned. IO NOTE: There is an increase in scope. This will result in an increase in Federal Funding of $452,815.50 to be reallocated from LON-005, LON-009, LON-011 and LON-017."

properties.Name: Restoration of stormdrain outfall
properties.Description:
Project Description:The replacement of the existing deteriorated .75 meter diameter, 18 meter long corrugated culvert with a new .75 meter diameter, 18 meter long corrugated culvert. The existing culvert is failing with signs of holes which is located on Marina Road. This road services our public Marina. This project will prevent local flooding and improve overall management of the catchment area, thus benefiting neighboring communities.
Construction Start Date:2017-11-20
Construction End Date:2017-12-15

properties.Name: Rehabilitation of the Storm water Pond at Bovaird Drive West & Gillingham Drive
properties.Description:
Project Description:"Rehabilitation and retrofitting of the storm water pond at Bovaird Drive West and Gillingham Drive restore the original operational design parameters, meet the current standards for flood control, provide an ""enhanced level of protection"" and enhance thermal mitigation of storm water for the protection of redside dace, an endangered specie. Permanent Pool Volume provided in SWM Facility is 765m3 In 2005, The Region of Peel constructed a storm water Management Facility at Bovaird Drive West and Gillingham Drive a tributary area of 3.74 ha of arterial road drainage. This facility provides storm water Quality Control and Erosion Control and maintain Water Quantity flows below existing flow rates up to the Regional Storm. In 2005 the Ministry of Environment authorized the Region to construct, operate and maintain the prescribed infrastructure, provided that it properly operate and maintain the infrastructure to protect the environment. To demonstrate compliance with the MOECC authorization the Region of Peel operates a monitoring program. The program showed that the facility have deteriorated and that without rehabilitation, will not provide the function as per its original design. The purpose of this project is to restore the original facility functions to protect the environment, enhance the ability of the region through improved technology to operate and maintain the infrastructure, improve the infrastructure efficiency and reduce long term maintenance costs. Following the introduction of MOECC Draft Guidance for Low Impact Development (LID) this project introduce thermal mitigation for the protection of an endangered specie (redside dace). The facilities' design facilitates infiltration of storm water in to the groundwater system at source in order to mimic the natural hydrology of the area, a concept promoted by MOECC . Due to delays in developing the agreement and consequent local priority changes, an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline is required.
Construction Start Date:2017-01-01
Construction End Date:2018-04-30

properties.Name: Polybutylene Water Service Replacement Program (City of Pickering and Town of Ajax)
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** The project involves the replacement of the polybutylene water service with a copper water service from the water main to the property line at 665 homes in the City of Pickering, Town of Ajax and Municipality of Clarington in order to reduce service breaks and water leakage. Common problems associated with polybutylene service connections include: Sharp bends in the pipe resulting in cracks; Buried objects, such as rocks can cause damage and leaks; and, Oxidants, such as chlorine in the water react with the plastic, causing it to become brittle and split. It is estimated that there are approximately 25,000 polybutylene water service connections that were installed in Durham Region in the 1980s. Project is under budget based on awarded tender. IO NOTE: There is no decrease in scope, only a decrease in tender. This will result in a decrease in Federal funding of $128,823 to be reallocated to DUR-009.

A new, steel frame fixed roof primary digester will cover a diameter of approximately 13.7 meters and an operating volume of approximately 1,250 cubic meters. The retrofit will keep the anaerobic digester at a steady, warm temperature. This will optimize the stabilization and transfer of combined primary and waste activated sludge from the liquid treatment train to the secondary digester, increasing the average day flow from 3,397 to 7,182 cubic meters/day.

properties.Name: Replacement of 150m of Eleanor Street Watermain - From Phipps Street to Laird Street
properties.Description:
Project Description:The critical upgrade will consist of the replacement of the existing approximately 60 year old 150mm (Cast Iron / Transite) watermain on Eleanor Street from Phipps Street to Laird Street. The proposed watermain will consist of a 200mm polyvinyl chloride watermain approximately 150m in length. The proposed watermain will increase security of supply directly to 8 households and to the overall distribution system for approximately 26 homes. The project would be a continuation of the Town's on-going objective to identify and replace deteriorating infrastructure prone to breakage and disruption of service.
Construction Start Date:2017-06-27
Construction End Date:2018-07-06

properties.Name: Upgrading of wastewater treatment plants
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project will renovate three wastewater treatment plants: the 50-year old Rock Island activated sludge plant and the 30-year old Beebe Plain and Stanstead Plain aerated-pond plants.
Construction Start Date:2018-06-20
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Extension of the sanitary sewer system - Eastern sector
properties.Description:
Project Description:The purpose of the project is to extend the sanitary sewer system to service 436 permanent residences.
Construction Start Date:2018-04-02
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Leeper Street replacement sanitary sewer from St. Paul Street West to Rykert Street
properties.Description:
Project Description:520m replacement of 375mm diameter and 250mm diameter existing sanitary (combined) sewer with identified deterioration. Project impacts 59 properties directly. In conjunction with storm sewer installation and watermain replacement
Construction Start Date:2017-08-14
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Sanitary Infrastructure Protection and Channel Stabilization of Pomona Creek in Royal Orchard Park South: Geomorphic Study
properties.Description:
Project Description:Channel downcutting threatens to expose 65 linear meters of sanitary infrastructure situated 0.4m beneath the watercourse. A geomorphic study followed by a Class Environmental Assessment with detailed design development is required for sanitary protection works. This study will provide a better understanding of our local water resources and enable innovative designs to reduce sediment inputs into local waterways, improve habitat and provide infrastructure protection. The project is located in Royal Orchard Park south of Royal Orchard Boulevard at Bay Thorn Drive in the City of Markham.
Construction Start Date:2017-05-01
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Bring the water treatment plant up to code
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project will install a gravity line replacing a pumping station to resolve wastewater overflow problems. It is also planned to renovate the water treatment plant (new service building, fine screen, system to bag or sack debris, Parshall flume [channel system] to measure flow, alum tank, duplex alum dosing system, etc.)
Construction Start Date:2018-05-15
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Replacement of Water Mains in Peel
properties.Description:
Project Description:"Replacement of water mains, system improvements and looping of dead-end mains at various locations within the Region of Peel to improve water quality and reliability of the distribution system. This work includes the replacement of watermains ranging in size from 50 to 300 mm on 26 different streets, adding up to a total of 10.4 km in length. Due to delays in developing the Transfer Payment Agreement and subsequent delays in procurement and its impact on construction schedule, we are requesting an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline to ensure successful completion of the project."
Construction Start Date:2017-06-07
Construction End Date:2018-07-31

properties.Name: Replacement of the Heart Lake Conservation Area Water Supply System
properties.Description:
Project Description:Replacement of the water main system at the Heart Lake Conservation Area, including the removal of the existing 200-mm water main and installation of a 1,500 m new 150-mm High-density polyethylene (HDPE) pipe and a 50-mm HDPE loop at the north end of the park.
Construction Start Date:2017-04-01
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Daniel Street Watermain replacement Michael Street to Havey Street
properties.Description:
Project Description:Replacement and upsizing of the Daniel Street watermain. Includes the rehabilitation of an existing asset in the Town's drinking water distribution system and will result in increased capacity and lifespan of the asset.
Construction Start Date:2017-09-25
Construction End Date:2017-11-24

properties.Name: Wastewater Pump Station and Lagoon Upgrade
properties.Description:
Project Description:Objective: Upgrade sewage pumpstation to meet regulatory requirements and increase capacity. Scope: Plan, design and construct upgraded pumping station with new pumps and electrical, diking, and upgraded lagoon with transfer piping and access road upgrade, and all associated works. Output: Upgraded sewage pumpstation and lagoon.
Construction Start Date:2018-08-01
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: New Water Plant Distribution Pump System
properties.Description:
Project Description:Objective: Improve reliability and capacity of water distribution system, and reduce risk of boil water advisories. Scope: Plan, design and construct a new distribution pump with new electrical, and all associated works. Output: New distribution pump.
Construction Start Date:2017-11-01
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Culvert Renewal Program at Various Locations Across the City - Replacement of 121 culverts (small and medium inclusive) to improve drainage flow and protect roadway structures across the City
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** "This request is seeking to shift additional funds into this program to allow the replacement of an additional 47 culverts for a total of 121 culverts. Construction: The City has a significant inventory of drainage culverts ranging from small diameter roadway culverts (typically non-urbanized ditch drainage under roadways and intersections) to larger span drainage structures. This project consists of the replacement of 59 small culverts (<1 m span) and 15 medium (1-3 m span) culverts including: obtaining environmental permits, utility coordination, public notification, installation and maintenance of required environmental protection system, traffic control, site dewatering, removal and disposal of old culvert, installation of new culvert including inlet and outlet components, placement of rip rap & slope protection, installation of guide rail system, landscaping, and reinstatement of roadway. IO NOTE: There is an increase in scope, resulting in an increase in Federal Funding of $2,500,000 to be reallocated from OTT-027, OTT-029, OTT-033, OTT-036, OTT-037 and OTT-039."
Construction Start Date:2016-04-05
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Broadway and Mountain Backlane Sewer and Water Replacement Project
properties.Description:
Project Description:Replacement of approximately four blocks of original sewer and water lines on the backlane of Broadway and Mountain and the backlane of Lake Ave and Bay Ave. This is a main water and sewer line and services 5/8 of the town.
Construction Start Date:2017-07-04
Construction End Date:2017-09-15

properties.Name: Local Urban Development area of Rapid City Wastewater Treatment Lagoon
properties.Description:
Project Description:Project to address necessary study and licencing required for the Local Urban Development area of Rapid City Wastewater Treatment Lagoon.
Construction Start Date:2017-06-21
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Campbell Municipal Drain Upgrade along River Road and Jenkins Drive
properties.Description:
Project Description:The upgrade of the drain along River Road and Jenkins Drive will stabilize the drain banks and improve safety along the 2 roadways and manage stormwaters. The terrain is very flat and soils are prone to erosion.
Construction Start Date:2017-09-01
Construction End Date:2018-11-30

properties.Name: Sewer Separation and Infrastructure Renewal - Planning and design for future projects and construction of one high priority project
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** "This project will accelerate the design phase of projects for the replacement of combined sewers with separated and replace water mains where required  Wistow St, Waterloo St., Talbot Ave. By completing the design project now, including public engagement as most of these are in the downtown core area, the City will be able to separate these combined sewers and reduce overflows to the Thames River much earlier than planned. These projects will support the phosphorous reduction strategies for Lake Erie by reducing bypasses and overflows to the Thames River watershed. Expanded scope to construct Wistow Street; design work only included in the original application. Wistow Street has been identified as a high priority need for immediate construction. This project along with a few future projects will allow the decommissioning the Paardeberg Sanitary Pumping Station. Elimination of this pump station will result in a reduction of sanitary overflows as well as energy savings. IO NOTE: There is an increase in scope. This will result in an increase in Federal Funding of $1,069,889.50 to be reallocated from LON-005, LON-013, LON-020 and LON-023."
Construction Start Date:2017-07-25
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Watermain Cleaning and Relining -  Design and Construction
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** "We will complete structural relining of 400 mm and 450 mm Cast Iron and Ductile Iron Water main to extend its useful life by 60 years along a total length of 2100 metres. (Wortley Road from Beaconsfield to Devonshire  1750 m of 450mm diameter water main. Wortley Road from Base Line to Commissioners  350 m of 450mm diameter water main.) The project will reduce disruptive water main breaks and improve water quality for roughly 250 properties directly fed by the Wortley Road water main. This includes mostly multi-family and single family residential properties, several small businesses including restaurants, retail, offices etc. all along Wortley Road. Scope of work reduced to accommodate increased scope in Sewer Separation Planning (LON0015). Reduced overall length of Water main being cleaned and relined. 340 metres on Wortley road will be lined from Base Line to Commissioners road and 810 metres on Colonel Talbot will be lined from Southdale to CherryGrove. IO NOTE: There is a decrease in scope. This will result in a decrease in Federal Funding of $1,000,000.00 to be reallocated to LON-015."
Construction Start Date:2018-03-27
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Extension of the Water Supply System for Residences
properties.Description:
Project Description:Works to extend the water system to serve 10 residences located on the edge of 8e Street.
Construction Start Date:2017-10-01
Construction End Date:2017-11-30

properties.Name: Replacement of two well pumps at the Crysler Well Heads
properties.Description:
Project Description:Replace the two well pumps for the Township's Municipal well for Crysler. These wells service the Village of Crysler. Approximately 700 people are connected to the municipal drinking water system. The Chlorine Chemical pump is also in need of rehabilitation in order to ensure the drinking water supply is properly treated.
Construction Start Date:2016-04-01
Construction End Date:2017-09-30

properties.Name: Asset Management/Integrated Town Software
properties.Description:
Project Description:The Town of Stratford is looking to purchase an Asset Management system that will link the Town's physical assets to the Town's financial system for better decision making and to ensure that we meet future infrastructure program decision making opportunities. The Province is looking to have Asset Management work completed by March 2018, as well the new Municipal Act is requiring all municipalities to have asset management plan for the municipality. The software will also include modules to link all the Town departments into one software system to improve the functionality and efficiency of all Town departments.
Construction Start Date:2017-09-20
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Renewal of water pipes
properties.Description:
Project Description:Pipe renewal works aimed at maintaining water services for citizens for 2 stretches of road and totaling 0.7 km.

Construction End Date:2018-02-01

properties.Name: Consolidated Waste Water Treatment System
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project works will include: - Geotechnical and archeological site studies; - Environmental Impact Study for new outfall discharge; - Pre-design study to determine conveyance system routing, select treatment technologies, develop process trains and layout, evaluate resource recovery opportunities and future expansion needs; and, - Detailed design and tender package for new WWTP facility and outfall and associated conveyance system upgrade design to replace the Westview, Townsite, Wildwood, and Tla'amin Nation WWTPs and meet all regulatory standards.
Construction Start Date:2017-09-06
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Spokane Street Infrastructure Improvement Project

properties.Name: Water System Backup Power and Pump 6B upgrade

Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Rehabilitation of Barton Farm Stormwater Management Pond (Sediment Removal and disposal)
properties.Description:
Project Description:Accumulated sediment within Barton Stormwater Management Pond will be removed and disposed. The permanent pool volume will be restored to design conditions thereby increasing it's total removal efficiency of suspended solid/phosphorous. Barton Farm stormwater management pond was constructed in the mid 1990s and has not been cleaned out since its construction. The pond services approximately 49 ha of residential subdivision. The removal works are capitalized as they extend the life of the asset.
Construction Start Date:2017-07-01
Construction End Date:2017-12-31

properties.Name: Troback Water Tower Project Phase 1
properties.Description:
Project Description:This project is for the design of a new water reservoir and upgrades to an existing water main in the Village of Telkwa (Village). An access road, security fencing, SCADA control and monitoring system will also be designed. The design stage of the project also includes surveying, a geotechnical investigation and environmental overview assessment.
Construction Start Date:2017-03-23
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Lake Baptiste Dam Upgrade Project
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project works will include: - Raising of the dam; - Widen the spillway to 10m; - Regrade the channel and riprap the spillway; - Remove and replace the existing low level outlet; and - Construction of engineered diversion structure on Macauley Creek.
Construction Start Date:2017-06-01
Construction End Date:2018-11-16

properties.Name: Water Storage Facilities
properties.Description:
Project Description:Project works will include: - Civil and geotechnical engineering works; - Mobilization / demobilization including site clearing, and earthworks; - Demolition of existing concrete storage facilities; - Installation of foundation; - Installation of carbon steel, glass lined water storage facilities and associated work - Roof assembly and installation; - Pipe and valve interconnection; - Electrical controls, instrumentation, and telemetry integration; and, - Commissioning, paving, drainage and site remediation.
Construction Start Date:2018-02-12
Construction End Date:2019-06-28

properties.Name: Upgrades to the Harrow Lagoon and Pump Station including  Aerator, Motor Control Center Panels, Grinder and Sewage Pumps
properties.Description:
Project Description:I) 4 existing surface aerators are highly inefficient in terms of process and energy. Installation of 4 high efficient surface aerators will replace these old and aging aerators and result in better treatment process, energy savings and reduce the carbon footprint. ii) Retrofit raw pumps with new high efficient pumps which include Variable Frequency Drives. This will result in more reliable and efficient supply in the system with less breakdown and, reduce energy and carbon footprint. iii) Installation of an in-line Muffin Monster grinder to cut down troublesome solids and rags that damage pumps and clog valves which cause costly damage and excessive repairs. Currently there is only a manually cleaned bar screen which is conducted on a weekly basis by two operators in a confined space where workers are exposed to a hazardous environment. iv) Replace 1 aging Motor Control Center (MCC) Panel with new panel. This will result in more reliable and efficient supply in the system with less breakdown and, reduce energy and carbon footprint. Aging MCC panels are also becoming a major health & safety risk.
Construction Start Date:2017-08-30
Construction End Date:2018-12-31

properties.Name: Expansion of Reservoir
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project includes the design and construction of the reservoir expansion to meet ACE storage requirements.
Construction Start Date:2017-04-01
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Plummer Road Drainage and Erosion Improvements; install 750mm x 18m stormwater culvert along 300 metres of Plummer Road
properties.Description:
Project Description:Replace Existing Undersized Corrugated Steel Pipe with 750mm diameter x 18m long High-density polyethylene (HDPE) Stormwater Culvert. Granular placement, complete relocation of roadside ditch on 300 m section of Plummer Road by completing rock blasting to provide sufficient road base foreslope which will prevent further road washouts.
Construction Start Date:2017-09-01
Construction End Date:2018-02-28

properties.Name: Replace culverts and raise the grade of Leighton Road at various locations to mitigate flooding, washouts and erosion from spring flooding and high storm events
properties.Description:
Project Description:The upgrade of the storm water facilities will eliminate a flooding and erosion problem when the South River, which parallels Leighton Road, over tops its banks during the spring freshet. Similar problems occur during high storm events as well. The scope of the project is to replace old culverts to improve hydraulics and raise the road in low areas to prevent flooding. The ultimate benefits will be a better road, less maintenance costs for the Municipality, and a cleaner environment
Construction Start Date:2017-06-01
Construction End Date:2017-10-31

properties.Name: Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA) assessment/repair
properties.Description:
Project Description:Project will inspect/upgrade/update/repair the Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA) system. The Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition system is out of date and does not operate as designed. Updates will restore the ability to remotely monitor plant operations. It will alarm problems and allow for faster response times. This will ensure/improve the safety of operations and reduce the health risk in the drinking water and reduce the potential health burden on the provincial system.
Construction Start Date:2017-04-01
Construction End Date:2018-03-30

properties.Name: Stormwater Management Phase 4
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project works will include: - Supply and install reinforced concrete interceptor chamber; - Supply and install manhole structures; - Supply and install stormwater conveyance pipe; and, - Complete system tie-ins including restoration of project site.
Construction Start Date:2016-04-01
Construction End Date:2018-12-19

properties.Name: Huron Street sanitary sewer main relining
properties.Description:
Project Description:Reline a section of 200mm sanitary sewer along a 110m section of Huron Street that is in very poor condition and is at risk of collapse. This has been identified as a priority project in our Asset Management Plan. This project will ensure ongoing municipal sanitary sewer service for the residents of Huron Street while promoting our program to minimize the potential for either infiltration or exfiltration of our sanitary sewer system.
Construction Start Date:2018-02-05
Construction End Date:2018-05-15

properties.Name: Line 3 Road asbestos clay watermain upgrade
properties.Description:
Project Description:This project consists of the removal of an aging asbestos cement watermain installed in 1955 along Line 3 Road in Niagara on the Lake to be replaced by 1000 meters of 150 millimetre diameter polyvinyl chloride (PVC) watermain. In particular, it is beneficial to the residents of this area because of the susceptibility of the older mains to break or rupture under extreme weather conditions. The existing watermain is also undersized; this upgrade will result in better pressure and a truer volume to both households and hydrants.
Construction Start Date:2017-12-04
Construction End Date:2018-05-31

properties.Name: Develop Engineered Tender Ready Drawings for Water / Wastewater Infrastructure Replacement in Balmertown and Cochenour
properties.Description:
Project Description:***Modified project*** See notes for original project information. Development of engineered shovel ready projects that are prepared for tender. The output benefit for the communities is that when projects come up for funding or priority consideration during Asset Management Planning exercises they are construction ready. These water / wastewater projects take into consideration the highest priority roads of Fourth Street (Balmertown), Brewis Avenue (Balmertown), Laneway connecting Lakeview Crescent, Mills Avenue, and Highway 125. (Cochenour), Elliot Street and associated lane (Cochenour), Macintosh Street (Cochenour), Williams Street and associated Lane (Cochenour).
Construction Start Date:2017-10-24
Construction End Date:2017-12-31

properties.Description:
Project Description:Project will supply/install/setup- instrumentation to record filter effluent turbidity to work against the introduction of disinfection by-products (DBPs) and over use of filter sand which will assist the operator in monitoring finished water quality. Completion of this project will ensure that safe reliable drinking water is available and reduce the potential for additional pressure on the province's health care system.
Construction Start Date:2017-04-01
Construction End Date:2018-03-30

properties.Name: Water and Wastewater Holding Tank System Installation
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project will be the purchase of water holding tanks and wastewater facilities, water pumps, water heaters, fixture and fittings. Off reserve benefits of the completion of this project is critical to the safe/ efficient supply of water to the community, thus reducing potential impact on the Province's health system.

Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Watson Lake Lagoon Upgrades
properties.Description:
Project Description:Upgrades to existing lagoon to increase their lifespan, construction of sludge drying beds, a new septage receiving station and fencing.

Construction End Date:2018-11-30

properties.Name: Renewal of water pipes

Project Description:Pipe replacement work for the maintenance of public water services for three road sections totalling 0.571 km

Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Description:
Project Description:Site Services to supply and install Vapor Tite LED replacement lighting. The off-reserve benefit of the project is to ensure/improve the safety of operations and reduce the risk of operations and reduce the risk of environmental contamination both on and off site. Lower energy consumption will reduce usage of "off-grid" diesel powered electric generators and reduce emissions into the environment. Due to the challenges of aligning contractors to work in a remote location, an extension is required beyond March 31, 2018.
Construction Start Date:2018-02-01
Construction End Date:2020-03-31

properties.Name: Stormwater Improvements
properties.Description:
Project Description:Repairing, replacing and improving ditching, culverts and stormwater drainage around sewage lagoon to prevent inflow of stormwater into lagoon, and at various points throughout the community. Off-reserve benefits are protection to receiving environment by improved sediment control.

Construction End Date:2018-03-30

Due to delays in developing the Transfer Payment Agreement and subsequent delays in procurement and its impact on construction schedule, we are requesting an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline to ensure successful completion of the project."

Construction End Date:2018-12-31

properties.Name: Potable Water Dispensing Unit
properties.Description:
Project Description:To Install a Potable Water Dispensing Unit.

properties.Name: New Development Water and Sewer

Project Description:Install 120 m of water, sanitary and storm sewer mains for the development of new housing, services and growth with the Village limits.

properties.Name: Water and Sewer main drive
properties.Description:
Project Description:Installation of water and sewer services on Main Drive.

Construction End Date:2017-09-05

properties.Name: Sanitary Sewer and Storm Water Model Development and Mapping (West)
properties.Description:

Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Extension of Sanitary Sewer System - Acadie and Saint-André Roads
properties.Description:

Improve the existing pumping system by adding equipment to send alarms to the SCADA system and for connecting generators. The project includes related roadwork required to finish the project.

Construction End Date:2019-09-30

properties.Name: New water transmission main - Enfield
properties.Description:

Construction Start Date:2017-08-21
Construction End Date:2017-12-20

properties.Name: Metcalfe Street Reconstruction - Phase 1
properties.Description:
Project Description:The proposed phase 1 of the Metcalfe Street Reconstruction project will commence the rehabilitation of a 1.2KM stretch of Metcalfe Street to improve municipal water supply to citizens and businesses, alleviate historical flooding, protect source water and replace aging underground infrastructure (water, wastewater and stormwater). Increasing flow capacity with new infrastructure will improve municipal water supply in the North end of Guelph, including providing a direct line from the well to the watermain that supplies the Guelph General Hospital. This will allow for a total of three separate supply lines to the hospital and thus reduce water supply risks. The existing well is currently underutilized due to limited capacity in the local watermain system. A large 400 millimetre watermain is proposed from the well on Metcalfe Street to Speedvale Avenue which will connect the well to the 400 millimetre watermain distribution on Speedvale, thus allowing Water Services to maximize flow from the well to the local area. The sanitary sewers on the street are at the end of their service life and would benefit from the asset management proposed in this submission. The storm sewers also require increased capacity to alleviate localized flooding, as identified in the City's Stormwater Management Master Plan. The project will contribute to economic growth while supporting a cleaner and healthier environment in Guelph. Economic outcomes are enhanced by ensuring the project is undertaken quickly, and reduces the risk of a system failure in the future which would require costly repairs and emergency service. Phase 1 Final Design work would start October 2016 with construction April  September 2017. Phase 1 costs are estimated at $3.6 million while the entire project is projected to cost $7.6 million once completed. Due to weather-sensitive work that must be completed outside of winter months, we are requesting an extension beyond March 31,2018, to ensure successful completion
Construction Start Date:2017-05-15
Construction End Date:2018-06-29

properties.Name: Construction of a New 400-mm Water Main on Dundas Street West
properties.Description:
Project Description:"Construction of a 400-mm water main on Dundas Street West from Mississauga Road to Cedarglen Gate to improve security of supply in Pressure Zone 2 as recommended by the Risk Assessment Study for the Water Distribution System. The length of pipe is 3,000 m. Due to the lack of capacity among contractors/engineers in the region, we are requesting an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline to ensure successful completion of the project."
Construction Start Date:2017-05-17
Construction End Date:2018-07-31

properties.Name: Utilities Works Project
properties.Description:
Project Description:"The project work will include: - Removal of approximately 958 lineal meters of AC watermain and replace with PVC pipe; - Removal of approximately 815 lineal meters of AC sewer main and replace with PVC pipe; - Rehabilitation of road, curb and gutter; and, - Related works. "

properties.Name: Drinking water upgrade
properties.Description:

properties.Name: Full watermain and sewer replacement on  Alice Avenue and Karn Street

Will also result in restoration of the surface which includes sidewalk, curb and gutter and road surface as well as sod where required.

Phase 2 includes the construction of approximately 100 household service connections in the Rural Municipality, and three pressure reducing stations. All phases total 250+ km of pipeline, 200+ household service connections in the Rural Municipality and pressure reducing stations.

properties.Name: System Evaluation and Implementation of Green Infrastructure for Stormwater Management

This project will support the Credit Valley Conversation Authority Lands. Due to the need to collect input and interact with other ongoing initiatives, we are requesting an extension beyond March 31, 2018, to ensure successful completion of this project."

Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Improvements to Tracadie Sector Lagoon
properties.Description:
Project Description:Improvement of two lagoons, replacement of a lifting station, improvement of sanitary sewerage stations, improvement of waterworks pumping stations, and reduction of infiltration into the sanitary sewer system..

Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Replacement and relocation of manhole to house the flow meter and replace the flow meter due to flooding.
properties.Description:
Project Description:Relocation of the manhole to house the wastewater flow meter in a proper location where it is dry and replace the outdated flow meter with a new one

The Condition Assessment involved a comprehensive field investigation in Q4-2016 and early Q1-2017 that documented improvements related to standby generators, noise protection, vertical exhaust stacks, electrical wiring, access hatches, pressure gauges, fall arrest, ventilation, impeller operation, bar screen, overflow piping, access hatches. The Ministry of Transportation submitted a drainage petition which includes Compton Court and Edgewood Road. As such, the Ministry will pay for the drainage portion of this project, however, CWWF funds will still be required for the water main replacement design. Add chlorine analyzer and pump to measure clearwell chlorine in order to provide early detection of chlorine residual loss and provide more control of drinking water disinfection. The District has completed an extensive pre-design study including public consultation, and council has endorsed its preferred option (servicing solution) for combined sewer separation. The objective of the project is to complete detailed design for the Humber catchment. Six options were developed, broken down into the two CRD pumping station catchments, the Humber catchment and the Rutland catchment. The two catchments comprise a combined total of 391 existing homes. Option 4 was the chose option and consists of a new shallow stormwater system with localized areas requiring municipality owned stormwater pumping stations for roadway runoff and existing pipe as a sanitary sewer conveyance.

New High-density polyethylene (HDPE) storm sewer ranging in size from 300-450mm diameter will be installed. This project will see the installation of approximately 340m of new storm sewers. The storm sewers will connect to an existing outlet to Otter Creek. The drainage improvement that will result from this project being undertaken will affect 11 residential properties as well as two (2) institutional properties. One currently being utilized as a school and a second where the school children are taken for physical activities. The project will also improve the drainage around the existing arena property which is utilized throughout the year for community functions and sporting events. Due to the lack of capacity among contractors/engineers in the region, we are requesting an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline to ensure successful completion of the project.

properties.Name: Rehabilitation and Clean out of the Town of Shelburne Wastewater Storm Ponds
properties.Description:
Project Description:"This project entails the cleanup and rehabilitation of the Town of Shelburne wastewater storm ponds. During large rainfall events, increased wastewater flows are diverted to these ponds and the wastewater is held and then slowly released to the Shelburne Water Pollution Control Plant for treatment before being discharged as per provincial regulations. Over years of use, these ponds have experienced significant vegetation overgrowth and build up of sewage sludge and biosolids and therefore the storage ponds need to be cleaned out and rehabilitated to ensure their continued use. Given that these ponds are necessary for storing wastewater during significant rainfall events and for managing the flows back to the Shelburne Water Pollution Control Plant, it is critical that this rehabilitation and clean out be completed to avoid any impact to servicing the community and the risk of any adverse environmental impacts. Due to delays in developing the agreement, an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline is required. properties.Name: Reconstruction of the City's main sewage pumping station
properties.Description:
Project Description:"The City of Brockville proposes to replace an existing sanitary sewer pumping station and replace it with a new one. The existing pumping station was constructed in 1962 and upgraded in 1993. It conveys over 90% of the City's wastewater flow to the City's water pollution control center for processing. The station has a rated capacity of 33,000 m3/day and on average pumps 16,500 m3/day. A Schedule B Municipal Class Environmental Assessment (EA) of the pumping station and associated forcemain was completed in 2012 to address current and potential future environmental, technical and operational concerns. The EA identified the following operational issues with the pumping station. 1. The new wet well will be designed and built to accommodate periodic inspections, maintenance and cleaning without having to by-passing untreated sewage to the St. Lawrence River as what happens now. 2. The new mechanical bar screen will be fully automated where screened material will be collected in the appropriate bins rather than accumulating on the floor of the facility and manually placed in garbage bins for disposal, thereby improving the health and safety of the operations staff. 3. The new wet well will be designed and built such that its size and configuration along with the positioning of the pumps will no longer cause cavitation of Pumps 1 and 2, thereby ensuring the City is maximizing the life span of the pumps. 4. The new pump station will be designed and built with an air filtration system. This will ensure that the users of the adjacent City park are not subjected to foul odour as they are currently during the summer months. 5. The new station will have new valves, pumps and other pieces of equipment that can be replaced without by-passing raw sewage to the river."
Construction Start Date:2017-01-09
Construction End Date:2018-12-31

properties.Name: Cedar and Henry Street - Watermain replacement to address water quality issues, and Stormsewer construction
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** "This project will include the replacement of the water main, sanitary sewer repairs and the reconstruction of the road including storm sewers. One of the storm sewer outlets for the Cedar Street project is located on Henry Street, so it will be necessary to reconstruct the existing storm and sanitary sewers on Henry Street as part of the project. Therefore, the block of Henry Street between Everett Street and Cedar Street has been included as part of this project. The storm sewer outlet on Henry street will have its storm sewer extended, a continuation of the project from a few years ago where the portion from Coleman St. to Everett St. had a storm sewer installed as part of the Everett St. Sewer Separation Project. The project will address water quality issues experienced. The water main is shallow and was installed in 1920; replacement is needed. Significant colour issues were experienced in the Cedar St. water main every time the fire hydrant was operated at the fire hall at the end of Cedar St. This indicates an issue on the inside pipe wall of the water main. The hydrant has been removed from regular service until the pipe is replaced. The road surface is in poor condition, and is on a bus route, this makes the project a candidate for reconstruction. In consultation with our Engineering department we could save during tender for BEL-002 because we received very competitive bids. An item covering excess surplus removal has become a very volatile item in our contracts, so estimates are always conservative. It was not needed here. In addition, the utility relocation costs were also completed for less than initially budgeted. Extension Rationale: Previously approved extension to June 30, 2018 - additional months will ensure Cameron Street addition would be fully completed. IO NOTE: There is no decrease in scope, only a decrease in tender. This will result in a decrease in Federal Fun
Construction Start Date:2016-08-31
Construction End Date:2018-06-30

properties.Description:

This project will: 1. Extend the life of the assets; 2. Reduce extraneous inflows of infiltrating groundwater into the sanitary collection system that is presently treated at the Waste Water Treatment Plant unnecessarily; 3. Improve the hydraulic capacity and performance of the sewage collection system by reducing base flows and resistance losses during higher flows; and 4. Improve the environment by reducing potential exfiltration of sewage into the ground or bypassing into combined sewer overflows. Please see attached report OP-16-077 approved by Owen Sound City Council for further details regarding specific locations.

This project includes the replacement of close to 1200m of water mains servicing approximately 100 households. The eligible costs are limited to public/municipal property and assets. Due to delays in developing the agreement, an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline is required. IO NOTE: There is no decrease in scope, only a better forecasted budget and decrease in tender. This will result in a decrease in Federal Funding of $62,500 to be reallocated to GEO-002."

properties.Name: Infrastructure Renewal Project Phase 2 for the rehabilitation of approximately 6.7 km of  water, wastewater and stormwater infrastructure
properties.Description:
Project Description:"Improvements in the water distributions system will improve water quality and fire flows in these area. Overall, the detailed design work will provide for the replacement of approximately 6.7 km of water lines, wastewater and necessary road work. This includes badly corroded 150 and 200 mm unlined cast iron pipe that is presently at the end of its life cycle; allow for the elimination of 3 continuous bleeder lines required to maintain chlorine residue; and will improve efficiencies in the water system by eliminating the need for circulating pumps, reducing the costs of chemicals and energy required to treat the water. The water distribution system is mainly comprised of 150 mm unlined cast iron pipes, one section is 200 mm unlined cast iron and serves 308 households. The design will also include the main feed line from the water treatment plant to the town and the water tower, the main line has been identified as being at the end of useful life and a break in this section could have catastrophic results in the loss of the distribution system, as it is believed that any break would create such a strain on the system that it could lead to a series of breaks once any repair is pressurized. The main feed line is also unlined cast iron and varies from 300  400 mm, is 3200 metres in length and would affect all residents served by the municipal water system, approximately 2,040 households and businesses. Due to the lack of capacity among contractors/engineers in the region, we are requesting an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline to ensure successful completion of the project."
Construction Start Date:2017-07-01
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Replace existing Standby-Power Unit at Wastewater Treatment Plant to meet Facility Requirements
properties.Description:
Project Description:Current standby power at the Wastewater Treatment Plant does not power the entire facility, and processes and controls are lost during power failures. The replacement and upgrade of the existing unit with an anticipated 520 KW Diesel Generator will allow the Town to maintain minimum treatment processes for a facility with an average rated capacity of 5,560 cubic metres per day and a peak rated capacity of 14,200 cubic metres per day serving a population of approximately 6,800. Due to manufacturer/supplier delays, we are requesting an extension beyond March 31, 2018, to ensure successful completion of the project.

properties.Name: Construction of the New Carp Stormwater Management and Snow Disposal Facility on West Brook Drive
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** "Project came in under budget. Excess funds will be moved to another project with an increased scope. Original estimates were based on conceptual/functional level designs and estimated prices from previous years. Based on competitive tender calls the market prices received were lower than originally budgeted. Construction of the new storm water pond and snow disposal facility on West brook Drive. Build a snow disposal facility that will generate a capacity of 357,000 cubic metres to address a capacity shortfall. The snow stock (height: max 15m)pile will maintain a 100m setback from the residence to the east and a 4m high berm will be provided along the east side of the site for sound attenuation.  Lighting will be provided along the internal road and the dump pad.  The face of the snow storage area will be oriented in an eastwest direction so as to maximize the south facing exposure.  A snow meltwater pond (with bottom and sides lined with a manufactured liner) for quality control including an oil/grease interceptor.  A storm water pond on-site with a footprint of between 4 - 5ha.  A lowering of the upstream invert of the existing culvert at the Highway 417 outlet to improve on-site drainage The design was previously completed and revealed that the project had been significantly underfunded. This project is not going forward unless CWWF funds are provided - it is incremental to the approved City budget. The nature and extent of the work require multiple construction seasons. Procurement and construction for this type of work requires more time than that prescribed by the 2018 timeline. Furthermore, the city will not start the process until formal Federal funding approval is provided. This project will require a time extension to ensure successful completion. IO NOTE: There is no decrease in scope, only a decrease in tender. This will result in a decrease in Federal Funding of $1,750,
Construction Start Date:2017-09-01

This system drains an area with 100 houses as well as the hospital and apartment blocks. Dryden suffered an extreme Weather event in August 2016. There is record of approximately 200 houses flooded and over $500,000 damage to City Infrastructure. The current system could not handle it due to condition as well as sizing. properties.Name: Structural lining of 17km of watermains in 29 locations in Toronto
properties.Description:
Project Description:This project will enable the structural lining of an incremental 17 kilometres of watermains in 29 locations in 2017-18. The work on the watermains includes cleaning the interior of existing watermains, and applying a structural liner to the interior of the pipe. Through the installation of an engineered structural liner, this technology is capable of extending the life of existing watermains and addresses complaints such as low water pressure, low water flow or rusty water. Substandard water services, valves and hydrants are replaced in coordination with watermain structural lining. Locations: Portions of The Queensway; The West Mall; The East Mall; Gooch Avenue; North Heights Road; Widdicombe Hill Boulevard; Tidemore Avenue; Carrier Drive; Humber College Blvd; Woodbine Downs Boulevard; Mars Road; Litchfield Court; Charnleigh Court; Islington Avenue and Finch Avenue West (Humber River Crossing); Rivalda Road; Bradstock Road; Gail Grove; Dufferin Street; Sylvan Avenue; Augusta Avenue; Princess Street; Sunlight Park Road/Eastern Avenue/Mosley Street; Kendal Avenue; Dartnell Avenue; MacPherson Avenue; Pleasant Boulevard; Donlands Avenue; Gamble Avenue.

properties.Name: Matachewan First nation water treatment plant equipment upgrade and replacement
properties.Description:
Project Description:The upgrades to the water treatment plant includes replacement and upgrade the Supervisory control and data acquisition (SCADA) computer to a new Window 7 computer with new licenses as it is over 10 years old and currently failing. With the new SCADA comes a new computer with new licenses. Replace three (3) high lift variable speed drives (VFD) as they are failing and not maintaining pressure in the system. Replace 2 (two) failing turbidity meters. Repair 3 sodium hypochlorite pumps with 3 new rebuilt kits. Replace 2 (two) failing chlorine and pH meters. As the water will be less at risk of contamination, this will reduce the burden on the Provincial health system.
Construction Start Date:2017-02-01
Construction End Date:2018-01-04

properties.Name: Upgrades to the Pickerel River Water Treatment Plant and Tower of supervisory control and data acquisition (SCADA) System
properties.Description:
Project Description:Pickerel River water Treatment Plant requires a Supervisory Control Data Acquisition System Upgrade and electrical wiring upgrade to the Water Treatment Tower to ensure water continues to flow out of water treatment tower. We presently have a Bristol Programmable Logic Controller (PLC) system but it is not working sufficiently and is showing signs of failure. We are looking at the installation of an allen bradley compact PLC system. This system is what controls the water treatment plant and water tower which we are urgently in need of to continue to maintain our water to community members to control the chlorine intake and so we don't open the valves. Also with the replacement of a Iconics Genesis Supervisory Control Data Acquisition Software with the Allen bradley factory talk view Supervisory Control Data Acquisition system with development and runtime software for both the Supervisory Control Data Acquisition and Programmable Logic Controller hardware. This equipment will monitor the water and ensure control of water tower and treatment plant. All computer monitoring and all wiring is done at the water tower on-site. The operations must have the same tool and devices. The computer Supervisory Control Data Acquisition control Graphics is one of these components. The new runtime and software will have a one year support. This project will ensure safe, reliable water supply and reduce the potential burden on the Provincial health system.
Construction Start Date:2017-05-11
Construction End Date:2017-12-31

properties.Name: Upgrade of a Community Owned Wastewater System Servicing a 17 home Sub-Division and Public Daycare Located on Stoneridge Circle, Ohsweken, Ontario, N0A 1M0.
properties.Description:
Project Description:"Capital project to complete upgrades as recommended by the Lagoon Needs Study prior to March 31st 2018. If required, we may undertake upgrades if recommended to increase the capacity or lifespan of the peatland system, enhance service to the Six Nations Elected Council owned housing development - Stoneridge Circle and improve environmental outcomes not just on reserve but for surrounding areas. This system was installed in 1999 to service a 17 home sub-division which also has a daycare. This system has never been assessed. The Mississaugas of the New Credit First Nation (New Credit) is located directly to the South of the Six Nations of the Grand River Territory and would greatly benefit from upgrades to the Six Nation wastewater system. They would benefit because they have over 60 residences that rely on the Six Nations sanitation truck service where the Six Nations Public Works Department deploys sanitation trucks to these residences when the home owner calls for service to empty their holding or septic tank, transport the human waste to the Six Nations waste water system and discharge the contents into the Six Nations lagoons for treatment and eventual discharge into the McKenzie Creek.
Construction Start Date:2017-09-14
Construction End Date:2020-03-30
