properties.Name: Upgrade Wastewater Plant
properties.Description:
Project Description:This project will provide pressurized water to the Wastewater Treatment Plant to allow for the installation of a permanent eyewash station and/or shower. This upgrade to the facility will mitigate the health and safety issues for staff that are present due to the use of chemical in the treatment process. It will also be utilized for general hygiene practices as the facility has no water for washing hands. Although municipal water is available to a portion of the Village, it is not available to the street on which the wastewater treatment plant is located and due to the topography, we would not be able to extend a watermain to this location. As a watermain cannot be extended to the wastewater treatment plant, this project would include drilling a well, submersible pump for well, lines from well into the Wastewater treatment plant and plumbing inside to incorporate a sink, eyewash and shower for health and safety reasons. This would also include a small hot water tank to ensure that tepid water is available for the eyewash and warm water for shower and sink. All of the work would be considered a Wastewater project because the watermain cannot be used and all work being completed is only for the wastewater treatment plant. It falls under the category of safer operations of the wastewater facility.
Construction Start Date:2017-09-01
Construction End Date:2018-08-31

properties.Name: Construct  Low Impact Development Stormwater Management Facility within George Burke Park
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** Storm water Low Impact Development (LID) facility treating runoff from the parking lot area within George Burke Park coordinated with new relief sewer in project THU-002-ST-006. A bio filtration facility will provide storm water quality control from approximately 3.2 hectares of drainage area, treating approximately 218 cubic meters of runoff. The footprint of the facility will be approximately 480 square meters. Project was revised to include two (2) facilities: an Oil-Grit Separator and an LID. The rated capacity is approximately 1735 cubic meters with an operational storage of 1500 cubic meters. The project will include all necessary site works and associated piping.

properties.Name: Wastewater Treatment Plant Electrical Transformer Replacement
properties.Description:
Project Description:Replace two existing main electrical transformers at the City's wastewater treatment plant. Scope of work includes a detailed electrical needs assessment, pre-design, design, pre purchase of equipment (due to long lead times), design of the associated works inclusive of poles, overhead and underground cable, transfers, connections etc., purchase and installation of equipment. The assessment and pre-design work will confirm final electrical requirements, utility coordination with Brantford Power and costing. Both transformers are 1000kVA/27.6/4.16kV delta, primary metered units which provide all of the electrical service required to run the plant. These units are of undetermined age although field observations suggest that they are well over 20 years old. Routine maintenance and inspections indicate that both transformers have far exceeded their service lives and should be replaced to reduce the risk of complete failure, potential disruption to the operation of the plant and potential regulatory compliance issues. The existing transformers are also limiting required process improvements as they cannot handle any increased electrical load. The wastewater treatment jobs is the only treatment facility in the City and services approximately 94,000 residents plus businesses. During the event that both transformers fail there is limited back-up capacity through diesel generators and could therefore either pose serious risk to the environment (Grand River receiving body) and potentially homes in the southern most part of the City. Due to delays in developing the Transfer Payment Agreement and subsequent delays in procurement and its impact on construction schedule, we are requesting an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline to ensure successful completion of the project.
Construction Start Date:2017-09-01
Construction End Date:2018-05-07

properties.Name: Construction of a new 1,450 m3 elevated drinking water storage tank to in the community of Ripley
properties.Description:
Project Description:The Ripley Drinking Water System lacks sufficient storage for existing residents and future growth. A new elevated water storage facility will be constructed to service the existing 355 households and accommodate the next 50 years of growth. Due to delays in tendering, we are requesting an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline to ensure successful completion of the project.

properties.Name: Installation of an Emergency Shutoff Valve in the Chlorine Building at the Lakeview Water Treatment Plant
properties.Description:
Project Description:Installation of an emergency shutoff valve in the chlorine building at the Lakeview Water Treatment Plant. The goal of the project charter is to present the technical options available to further enhance the existing safety interlocks of the Lakeview (LKV) chlorine gas system while continuing to meet the Environment Canada E2 Planning regulation through the implementation of emergency auto shut off valves on each gas tonner on the scale. Under the current installation one emergency auto shut off valve is installed for a group of six interconnected tonners on a scale. In this charter both electric and pneumatic options will be presented. The pneumatic operated actuators will use compressed air as the operating gas, while the electrically actuated system will use regular 120 VAC and utilize an online interruptible power supply (UPS) as means of a short term back up power during a power outage.
Construction Start Date:2017-01-01
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Raw Water Main Replacement

The leak detection system provides real time data through a cellular signal, and provides a web based interface for the Water Utilities staff to monitor and analyze. properties.Name: Replacement of 340 meters watermain and 290 meters of sanitary sewers on Janet Street including storm sewer repair, as needed
properties.Description:

The replacement of the sanitary sewers will remove 290 meters of 200mm asbestos cement piping which is in poor condition as detailed in CCTV inspection reports and is failing, with 200mm PVC main. This impacts 29 households and Lakeshore Catholic High School.
Construction Start Date:2018-06-01
Construction End Date:2018-10-31

properties.Name: Upgrade of the main electrical system at the First Street Waterplant
properties.Description:
Project Description:Replace the obsolete 240 Volt electrical system with 600 V system at the First Street Waterplant. The upgrades will result in improved energy efficiency and reduce plant failures thereby reducing incidents of loss of water and loss of fire protection. This is the first step in a long list of upgrades needed at the Waterplant. In order to upgrade anything in our waterplant we need to convert our voltage from 240v to 600v first. The 240v system has given us troubles with inconsistent power and the change was recommended by both Ontario Hydro and the Ontario Clean Water Agency (OCWA). The power coming into the plant is 600v but then we use a temporary transformer to reduce the voltage to 240. Once the system is upgraded to 600vm then we will be able remove the step-down transformer used to bring the electrical feed from 600v to 240v. We will then change the 3 phase motors on our 2 high lift pumps and our backwash pump.
Construction Start Date:2018-01-01
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Niagara Falls Water Treatment Plant Lead Abatement & Filter Repairs (Plant 1 & 2) - located in the City of Niagara Falls
properties.Description:
Project Description:The Niagara Falls Water Treatment Plant supplies drinking water to approximately 127,410 people, and supplies drinking water for over 30 million tourists to the City of Niagara Falls. This Water Treatment Plant is a Class 3 plant. Plants 1 and 2 were built in 1932 and 1950. This project is needed to continue to meet the demands for safe and plentiful drinking water. Upgrades include: - Plant 1 and Plant 2 have multiple layers of paint on the walls, columns, floors, and ceiling of the filter areas. A designated substances survey has confirmed the presence of lead based paint in these areas. The coatings show evidence of failure. This hazardous material must be removed.- Replacement of 8 leaking filter inlet sluice gates (cast iron) at Plant 2 - Inspection of Plant 2 drain gates. There are eight (8) sluice type gates (stainless steel) that need to be evaluated/repaired or replaced. - Filter troughs in Plant 1 are metal construction and have extensive failure of the existing coatings (rusting). These troughs will be either rehabilitated or replaced. - Rehabilitate Plant 2 concrete drain troughs coatings that have failed - All Granulated Activated Carbon (GAC) and sand replaced in Plant 1 and 2 filters - Both plant under-drains are to be evaluated once media has been removed from filters with the intent to repair/replace what is needed. - Heating system improvements are needed for the filter areas in Plant 1 and 2. There are 16 heating units that must be replaced. - Replace plant entrance stairs and construct new accessible ramp visitor's parking lot This assignment will cover construction for this project. Please note that the original contractor had the project scope reduced because of performance and quality issues. This project is a result of the work that was not done as part of the Niagara Falls WTP Filter Building Structural Upgrade. The remaining project items as described above need to be completed under a new contract.
Construction Start Date:2017-11-17
Construction End Date:2019-02-27

properties.Name: Valley Drive Sanitary Sewer Relining
properties.Description:
Project Description:Relining of 200 mm and 250 mm diameter concrete sanitary pipe utilizing cured-in place pipe no dig technology. The current concrete pipe installed in the 1960's is exhibiting interior spalling and loss of interior surface as observed in the most recent CCTV inpsections. The adjoining watermain is in good condition and the road surface has been repaved within the last 3 years making this project an excellent choice for rehabilitation. There is a nursing home and a partial portion of a school campus that utilizes this sanitary sewer. With the school campus that consists of two elementary schools, one high school and a school board office in close proximity to the pipe being proposed for relining, a no dig technology is well suited to keep disruption to a minimum and maximize access to these school facilities in addition to the nursing home during construction along with the approximately 75 residential homes fronting this specific sanitary sewer.
Construction Start Date:2018-02-01
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Gunne Crescent Sanitary Sewer Relining
properties.Description:
Project Description:Relining of 200 mm diameter concrete sanitary pipe utilizing cured-in place pipe no dig technology. The current concrete pipe installed in the 1960's is exhibiting interior spalling and loss of interior surface as observed in the most recent CCTV inspections. The adjoining watermain is in good condition making this project an excellent choice for rehabilitation. This rehabilitation will avoid open cut trenching that will minimize the disruption to approximately 8 residential homes along the length of pipe being rehabilitated.
Construction Start Date:2018-02-01
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Thornbury Water Plant Roof Replacement
properties.Description:
Project Description:The objective of this project is to replace the roof of the Thornbury Water Plant that has reached the end of its useful life. The scope of work is to engage a consulting engineer to complete the detailed design and associated tendering and construction administration tasks culminating in the selection of a contractor and the removal of the existing roof and installation of a new roof. The integrity of the operational systems to provide clean drinking water depends on the soundness of the building facility within it operates. The building envelope, of which the roof is a critical component, protects the treatment equipment from outside elements and is critical to the reliability of equipment. Without a functioning roof in place, water intrusion will lead to electrical failures and corrosion that will dis-able equipment and threaten the plants ability to treat water. Without a sound building housing the equipment, including a sound roof, the treatment plant will be ineffectual.
Construction Start Date:2017-01-20
Construction End Date:2018-05-31

properties.Name: LED Lighting Upgrades at Approximately 42 Wastewater Pumping Stations Across the City
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** "Based on the review of the audit results and a review considering other operational requirements, the project funding can be reduced. Seeking ability to move the excess funds to another approved project with an increased scope of delivery. The scope of work has reduced from 42 Wastewater Pumping Stations to 33. Upgrades to fixtures to allow for new energy efficient lighting. Project will undertake retrofit opportunities of existing metal halide and/or high pressure sodium exterior wall mounted luminaries to new LED and T12 fluorescent to T8 or LED. These changes will reduce the energy consumption at the facility, leading to reductions in operational costs. IO NOTE: Due to the decreased scope, there is a decrease in Federal Funding of $350,000 to be reallocated to OTT-005." Due to additional time required to complete preparatory work (i.e. EAs/soil testing/identifying utilities etc.), we are requesting an extension beyond March 31, 2018, to ensure successful completion of the project.

Construction End Date:2020-03-31

properties.Description:

Many culvert assets have reached or will reach the end of their service life and thus an increased number of reactive replacements are anticipated. This project consists of completing the detailed design of 60 small (<1 m span) culverts including determining soil type, surface water testing, surveying, preparing issued for tender design drawings and tender package, identifying the location of existing utilities, etc. in order to prepare for rehabilitation/construction in the future.
Construction Start Date:2017-04-30
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Water Storage Reservoir Upgrades incl. provision for Emergency Backup Power, SCADA Improvements, Replacement of Corroded Piping, Valves, and Access Hatches, and Construction of Access Road
properties.Description:
Project Description:***Modified project*** See notes for original project information. "Replace corroded piping valves and access hatches. Replace the access and piping with appropriate materials to provide safe access and address pipe leakage. Install a backup generator to provide power to the reservoir PLC to avoid this issue. Install a communication system on a 3G wireless network to solve the reliability issue with communication between the reservoir and water plant. A working access road will be constructed for regular maintenance, inspections, and for emergency situations. A reservoir structural condition review will also be completed as part of the design process to identify critical issues. These items will address issues that directly impact the water system as a whole and upon completion of identified works will extend life expectancy and increase functionality. The upgrades / replacement to the valve and piping at the reservoir cannot be completed with an acceptable health and safety risk to the supply and distribution of our municipal drinking water system. In order to complete the reservoir improvements, it is imperative that we first replace and air scour our Well #2 Pump. Replacing and air scouring Well Pump#2 was scheduled for our regular 2018 budget (Spring 2018). We would accelerate the well and pump maintenance and, once the risk to our drinking water system is reduced to an acceptable level, we would complete the reservoir piping and valve improvements by re-allocating $50,000.00 from the 2018 municipal budget to the reservoir. IO NOTE: This will result in a decrease of $25,000 in Federal Funding and will be reallocated to MATT-001. Extension Request Rationale: Access to the reservoir is now limited due to snow/weather. Remaining project action items must be deferred until the road is accessible again in the spring of 2018."
Construction Start Date:2017-09-11
Construction End Date:2018-05-31

properties.Name: Design and Construction of the McGee Liftstation Replacement
properties.Description:
Project Description:This project is for the design and construction of a replacement sewage liftstation for the existing McGee Liftstation. The existing liftstation is undersized for the current drainage area and has reached the end of its useful life with multiple systems that have or are at risk of failure. The existing building design is poorly laid out and does not meet several current regulations or requirements. An assessment has determined that a replacement is more cost effective that a full liftstation renovation. This project is a necessary first step to address several area sanitary sewer related issues. Incrementality is evidenced as the project cannot proceed due to budget limitations and without Federal/Provincial funding. Incrementality is further evidenced as this project (Liftstation) is the first step in a larger area infrastructure renewal requirement (Draper liftstation, Draper to Dominion gravity sewer, Dominion to Christink Lane gravity sewer, Christink Lane to liftstation gravity sewer, Christie to liftstation gravity sewer).
Construction Start Date:2017-01-28
Construction End Date:2018-07-31

properties.Name: Water pipe replacement

The removal works are capitalized as they extend the life of the asset.

properties.Name: Niagara on the Lake Commons cast iron watermain upgrade
properties.Description:
Project Description:This project consists of the removal of an aging cast iron watermain installed in 1896 that bisects the Niagara on the Lake Commons and a small portion of Fort George between Wellington Street and Ricardo Street. In total, 350 metres of deteriorating pipe will be replaced by 150 millimetre polyvinyl chloride watermain pipe. The new polyvinyl chloride pipe will improve the water pressure and volume for nearby residents and Fort George. It will also reduce the risk of a rupture or break within or near the Fort George property which would undoubtedly disrupt the operations of the Fort.
Construction Start Date:2017-12-09
Construction End Date:2018-05-31

properties.Name: Enhance programmable logic controller (PLC) at the water treatment plant.  Located at the Elk Lake water Treatment plant, 4 First Street which serves 245 houses
properties.Description:
Project Description:Upgrades the Supervisory control and data acquisition (SCADA) system. Items within the Elk Lake water treatment plant programmable logic controller (PLC) enhancements will tie the filter PLC and high lift/low lift together into one system to enable full access to the water plant remotely for operators. Objective: Tie the two separate PLC's together at the plant. This will make the entire plant accessible by remote access and will enhance reliability of the system as a whole Scope: To design, create and install the hardware and software required to perform the above mentioned objective. Provide training to all staff on the new system and satisfy regulators. Output: The final product will be and integrated PLC at the water treatment plant fully functional, tested, licensed and training for staff on the new system
Construction Start Date:2017-07-04
Construction End Date:2017-10-31

properties.Name: Replacement of 700m of watermain on Trench Street (From Major Mackenzie Drive to Mill Street)
properties.Description:
Project Description:This project involves the replacement of 700m of ductile and cast iron watermain on Trench Street that are nearing their end of life and are prone to watermain breaks. This watermain directly services 22 residential households as well as 1 school and 1 hospital.
Construction Start Date:2017-09-18
Construction End Date:2018-05-31

properties.Name: Storage Reservoir Upgrades
properties.Description:
Project Description:This project includes additional treated storage reservoir, high lift pump, electrical, programming, scada, controls & instrumentation, back up power generator.
Construction Start Date:2017-09-01
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Chapleau Objibwe First Nation water treatment plant equipment upgrade
properties.Description:
Project Description:Upgrades include the following: Replacing 3 pressure tanks in the water treatment plant as they are heavily rusted in the inside and causing bladders to rupture. Inspection and repair as needed the water treatment plant generator which has not been serviced in 5 years. Replacing the failed Uninterruptible Power Supply (UPS) battery backup for the Ultra Violet (UV) Lights so that the water is treated with UV at all times. Replacing and upgrade the Supervisory control and data acquisition (SCADA) computer to a new Window 7 computer with new licenses as it is over 10 years old and currently failing. Replacing the 4 baseboard heaters within the water treatment plant, one of which is in the generator room. Replacing or repairing block heater for the backup generator as it is currently not working and could cause start-up issues and damage the generator. Replacing all 8 bulbs and 8 sleeves for the UV units to ensure proper disinfection and lower risk to community. Repairing 3 sodium hypochlorite pumps with 3 new rebuilt kits. Replacing the controller and the sensor for the UV lights as the current one is failing. As the water will be less at risk of contamination, this will reduce the burden on the Provincial health system.
Construction Start Date:2017-02-01
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Wastewater Treatment System Rehabilitation
properties.Description:
Project Description:Objective: Improve efficiency and capacity of lagoon system. Scope: Plan, design and construct an upgraded lagoon, and all associated works. Output: Rehabilitated lagoon.
Construction Start Date:2017-07-27
Construction End Date:2017-08-07

properties.Name: Water Treatment Plant Multiple Turbidity Meter Upgrade
properties.Description:
Project Description:Upgrade of obsolete and end of life Turbidity Meters to newer Turbity Meters that provide continuous monitoring as per Ministry of the Environment and Climate Change regulations, SDWA-Schedule 9 Sec 9-4. Five new Turbidity Meters will be installed coming off each filter (4) and off the treated water (1) supplied to the distribution system. A contractor will be required for installation. These Turbidity meters provide assistance to ensure safe Drinking Water is provided to over 3500 households.
Construction Start Date:2017-04-21
Construction End Date:2017-06-30

properties.Name: Wentworth Street - Sewer Separation, Watermain, and Sanitary Sewer Renewals
properties.Description:
Project Description:Separation of combined sanitary/storm sewer and renewal of watermain and sanitary sewer along Wentworth from Union Street to Elliott Row. This project includes related road work necessary to complete the project.
Construction Start Date:2019-05-01
Construction End Date:2019-10-31

properties.Name: Reconstruction of Peterborough County Road 45 Stormwater Collection System
properties.Description:
Project Description:"Reconstruction of 550 metres of semi-urban road section to full urban cross-section complete with stormwater collection system with consideration for low impact development design factors Due to additional time required to complete preparatory work (i.e. EAs/soil testing/identifying utilities etc.), we are requesting an extension beyond March 31, 2018, to ensure successful completion of the project."
Construction Start Date:2017-07-12
Construction End Date:2018-12-31

properties.Name: Centralized Wastewater Supervisory Control And Data Acquisition (SCADA) Monitoring/Communication
properties.Description:
Project Description:Install a centralized Programmable Logic Controller (PLC)/Supervisory Control And Data Acquisition (SCADA) computer at the Red Lake Water Pollution Control Plant, and radio communication network with each of the remote stations. Station wet well levels, pump start/stops and station alarms would be transmitted to the central Supervisory Control And Data Acquisition (SCADA) computer for monitoring and reporting purposes. Integration of all wastewater systems (9 liftstations and Balmertown Water Pollution Control Plant). The OUPUT Benefit to the community is the reaction time is lessened for system operators to react to system emergencies and reducing downtime due to unexpected/undiagnosed system component failures. This will be a valuable tool for the following reasons: 1. Central control, operator can check the status of any remote station from one convenient location, 2. Troubleshooting tool, operators can use Supervisory Control And Data Acquisition (SCADA) features (trending) to identify, diagnose and resolve pumping station issues and 3. Liability, can be reduced in the event of a basement flooding claim if the pumping station can be proven (through trending) to have been functioning normally at the time of the incident.
Construction Start Date:2017-11-30
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Valve Replacement
properties.Description:
Project Description:Refurbish old valves and piping within water treatment facility. Completion of this project is critical to the safe/ efficient supply of water to the community, thus reducing potential impact on the Province's health care system.
Construction Start Date:2017-04-01
Construction End Date:2018-03-30

properties.Name: Replace damaged submersible pump with submersible shredder pump
properties.Description:
Project Description:Replace damaged submersible pumps with a submersible shredding pump. Existing pump is damaged by cloth from Chronic Care Facility. Rehabilitation will reduce the risk of wastewater spills into the receiving environment, on and off-reserve.
Construction Start Date:2018-04-30
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Water Supply Feasibility Study and Design for Community Lot Servicing
properties.Description:
Project Description:Feasibility and design planning to improve water capacity and water supply services to a populated area of the First Nation. The benefit to off reserve is the increase water distribution capacity for the surrounding area and a more effective water distribution system and consequent reduced potential health impacts on the provincial health care system.
Construction Start Date:2017-10-05
Construction End Date:2018-01-31

properties.Name: Class 4 Septic System Replacements (tank and field) for 3 homes.
properties.Description:
Project Description:"The project will replace 3 individual class 4 septic systems (tank and field) which have exceeded their design life and are showing signs of breakdown. The systems have currently been in operation for over 25 years. The new systems will be installed by a licensed septic installer. The new systems will ensure proper treatment of wastewaster from the homes and will reduce the chances of contamination in nearby receiving environments from failing fields or cracked tanks and pipes. The new systems will also prevent backups of raw sewage back into the homes from failing components ensuring the health and safety of the occupants. Due to delays in provincial project nomination, an extension to March 31, 2019 is required."
Construction Start Date:2017-06-05
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Shickendaz SWM Pond Rehabilitation and Sediment Cleanout including Removal of approximately 60m3 of sediment and installation of an Oil Grit Separator unit
properties.Description:
Project Description:"NEW PROJECT: The Shickandanz Storm Water Management Pond is a rehabilitation, retrofit and sediment cleanout project including removal of approximately 60 m3 of sediment and installation of an Oil Grit Separator unit. The project was identified in the Stormwater Management Facility Maintenance Guidance (SWMFMG) report as a priority for retrofit. The Storm Water Management pond is located in Bowmanville, Ontario draining to Soper Creek; a watercourse that ultimately drains to the Bowmanville Marsh which is a significant coastal wetland. The estimated cost for cleanout of the project is $90,000. The removal works are capitalized as they extend the life of the asset. Due to delays in developing the agreement and consequent local priority changes, an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline is required. IO NOTE: This is a new project to be submitted. This results in an increase in Federal Funding of $40,000 to be reallocated from CLA-002."
Construction Start Date:2018-01-01
Construction End Date:2018-09-15

properties.Name: Water Intake Upgrading Maloney's River

properties.Name: French cove water extension

Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: New Water Treatment Plant and Regional Pipelines Russell-Binscarth
properties.Description:
Project Description:This project is the construction of a new membrane water treatment plant which will treat and soften a groundwater supply to Canadian Drinking Water Quality Guidelines. It will have sufficient capacity to distribute treated water via new pipelines to the communities of Binscarth and Rossburn. This regional water plant will replace 3 existing plants that do not meet current regulations. It will have capacity to extend safe water to other communities in the future. It will provide water to Binscarth, St.Lazare and Rossburn.
Construction Start Date:2017-04-10
Construction End Date:2018-11-30

properties.Name: Community Wastewater System Improvements
properties.Description:
Project Description:"The project work will include: -Improve mixing/aeration of the digesters; -Add synthetic liner to the bottom of an aerated lagoons and digester; and -Replace the bubble diffusers in two lagoons. "

properties.Name: Snook's Road/Extension
properties.Description:

A study is currently underway with a potential source at Deep Bight River being the preferred option. The project also entails water testing and hydrology as part of the program to ascertain the suitability of the source. In addition, the project will extend the watermain towards Adeytown, to connect some additional houses at the end of Deep Bight.

properties.Description:

The line will improve water volumes and pressures required fire water flows in Coniston. Intersection of Balsam Street and 2nd Avenue (MR93), west along Balsam Street to 1st Avenue, along the length of 1st Avenue and into the park to connect with 300 millimetre water line

It is anticipated that this project will minimize internal corrosion and reduce the number of customer complaints relating to taste, odors and discoloration. 78°56'59.616"W  43°53'33.497"N 78°57'47.549"W  43°53'1.289"N 78°57'13.024"W  43°53'5.511"N 78°57'19.262"W  43°52'46.262"N 78°56'53.669"W  43°52'30.185"N 78°56'52.397"W  43°52'16.406"N 78°56'4.388"W  43°52'36.18"N 78°50'54.871"W  43°53'7.315"N 78°51'20.725"W  43°55'4.061"N 78°51'11.935"W  43°51'27.886"N

properties.Name: Renewal of water pipes

properties.Name: Restoration of the Cooksville Creek Stormwater Erosion Control - Mississauga Valley Blvd to Central Pkwy E

properties.Name: Inflow and Infiltration (I/I) into Sanitary Sewer Mitigation and Cast-Iron Watermain Replacement on Churchill Crescent
properties.Description:
Project Description:"This urban road reconstruction project will replace aging and deteriorated municipal infrastructure assets (watermain, storm sewer, and sanitary sewer). The existing cracks in the sanitary sewer are a significant source of inflow and infiltration into the wastewater collection system which contribute to very high peak flows at the Fergus Wastewater Treatment Plant. The watermain has experienced numerous breaks and requires replacement. Due to delays in developing the Transfer Payment Agreement and subsequent delays in procurement and its impact on construction schedule, we are requesting an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline to ensure successful completion of the project."
Construction Start Date:2018-01-02
Construction End Date:2018-12-31

properties.Description:

Construction Start Date:2017-10-03
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Sewage well upgrades at London Road Complex
properties.Description:
Project Description:This sewage well upgrade will see a new pump control panel installed that meets todays code standards, including the installation of enhanced alarm features; replacement of 200 feet of underground conductors between the control panel and the sewage well; replacement of all hard-wired well floats; as well as an inspection and repair of ladder, mounting bolts, railing and platform inside sewage well. Due to additional time required to complete preparatory work (i.e. EAs/soil testing/identifying utilities etc.), we are requesting an extension beyond March 31, 2018, to ensure successful completion of the project.
Construction Start Date:2017-10-04
Construction End Date:2018-05-31

properties.Name: Design / Engineering of Future Capital Works at Wastewater Treatment Plant
properties.Description:
Project Description:In 2014 a Class Environmental Assessment (EA) on the Wastewater Treatment Plant was undertaken to identify a preferred alternative to address projected growth. It was identified that an increase in plant capacity, above the existing average day flow of 5,560 cubic metres per day was not warranted and that foreseeable needs of the Town could be addressed through optimizing the existing plant. Designing a new or modified grit removal system, associated odour control and a new or renovated administration, control and laboratory building would allow the Town to effectively plan for plant optimization identified in the EA. Due to delays in developing the Transfer Payment Agreement and subsequent delays in procurement and its impact on construction schedule, we are requesting an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline to ensure successful completion of the project.
Construction Start Date:2017-07-26
Construction End Date:2018-05-31

properties.Name: Replacement of the Existing 400-mm Water Main on Hurontario Street with a 750-mm Water Main
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** "Replacement of the existing 400-mm water main on Hurontario Street from Burnhamthorpe Road to Rathburn Road, which is in poor condition, with a 750-mm water main to service future intensification in the Mississauga City Centre. The length of pipe being replaced is 730 m. The project budget has been reduced due to recognizing price efficiencies as final tenders are received. The budget will be transferred to other CWWF projects. IO NOTE: There is no decrease in scope, only a decrease in tender. This will result in a decrease in Federal funding of $500,000 to be reallocated."
Construction Start Date:2017-06-01
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Caradoc St. upgrade to 300 mm watermain, replacement of 200 mm sanitary sewer, new culvert installation at Hull Rd crossing.
properties.Description:
Project Description:Replacement of 600 m of trunk watermain which supplies water tower, 300 m of sanitary sewer replacement to address sewer back-up issues, and installation of new storm water culvert to address street flooding on Hull Road.
Construction Start Date:2017-09-05
Construction End Date:2018-05-31

properties.Name: Clarifier Rehabilitation at the Ear Falls Wastewater Treatment Plant
properties.Description:
Project Description:The rehabilitation of the Clarifier System will include the replacement of the interior mechanical components, replacement the exterior roof structure and insulation of the structure.
Construction Start Date:2017-04-01
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Structural Relining of 450mm Concrete Sewer System on Lorne Street (Queen St to CPR Railway)
properties.Description:
Project Description:Lorne Street is a collector roadway that serves as one of two major gateways into the Town's industrial area. The existing road, water and sidewalk assets are all in need of replacement making this corridor the Towns top candidate for reconstruction. Properties within the work area (480m stretch from Queen St to the CPR Railway) include 26 homes, two factories and a commercial strip mall. The reconstruction of Lorne Street proposes to include approximately 430m of new storm sewer ranging in size from 600mm to 750mm. This new storm sewer will enable the separation of existing combined sanitary sewers. Once the segregation project identified (SMF-0001) on this corridor has been completed, the Town is proposing to rehabilitate approximately 485m of 300/350mm asbestos concrete sanitary sewer (circa 1960s) with a new trenchless cure in place liner in order to extend the life of this asset by approximately 50 years. This project will also offer improved environmental outcomes through the elimination of sources of infiltration and inflow from joints, cracks and former drainage connections.
Construction Start Date:2017-07-10
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Replace Water and Sewer to Beaver Trail in order to improve the available capacity and treatment efficiencies to ensure the integrity of the system
properties.Description:
Project Description:Replacement 111 meters of sewer main and 12 service connections, and 111 meters of water main and 12 service connections of infrastructure that is 50+ years old along Beaver Trail. Existing infrastructure is compromised by poor ground conditions and a high water table. Joints are no longer watertight, resulting in significant inflow and infiltration. The wastewater treatment plant experiences high flows and dilute sewage effluent concentrations, reducing available capacity and treatment efficiencies. Aging asbestos cement pipes of the water infrastructure is prone to leakage and breaking. New Polyvinyl Chloride (PVC) pipe with watertight joints will ensure the integrity of the system.
Construction Start Date:2017-04-01
Construction End Date:2018-03-30

properties.Name: Fire Hydrants Restoration
properties.Description:
Project Description:Fire hydrants restoration.
Construction Start Date:2017-07-10
Construction End Date:2017-07-19

properties.Name: Upgrade of Penstock for Lift Station No. 4
properties.Description:
Project Description:Replace penstock for lift station No. 4 with a larger one.

Construction End Date:2018-06-30

properties.Name: CPCP Upgrades
properties.Description:
Project Description:Charlottetown Pollution Control Plan will be expanded to allow for the treatment of wastewater from Stratford and Charlottetown to 2035.
Construction Start Date:2018-03-01
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Village of Port Lambton Wastewater Lagoons Optimization
properties.Description:
Project Description:This project is to optimize the Village of Port Lambton Wastewater Lagoons, including improvements to the chemical dosing equipment and the implementation of aeration to improve the biological digestion of the sludge within the lagoon. To complete repairs to the concrete inlet and outlet structures it is critical that we remove accumulated sludge from the lagoon. These improvements are critical as the Township looks to meeting existing and future Federal and Provincial requirements. Due to weather-sensitive work that must be completed outside of winter months, we are requesting an extension beyond March 31, 2018, to ensure successful completion of the project.
Construction Start Date:2017-09-01
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Upgrade of brick manholes in numerous locations throughout Sturgeon Falls
properties.Description:
Project Description:***Modified project*** See notes for original project information. Numerous brick manholes and old hydrants without steam ports need replacement. Manholes on the verge of collapsing and hydrants that service sensitive areas will be given priority for replacement. 14 manholes and 11 hydrants have been identified for replacement. All manholes and all hydrants are budgeted for $5000 each installed totaling $125,000. Existing storm sewers that are currently leading into sanitary mains will be re-routed to storm sewer system.
Construction Start Date:2017-05-15
Construction End Date:2018-06-30

properties.Name: City-Wide Stormwater Infrastructure Inventory and Condition Assessment
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** "A project to complete the City's inventory of storm water infrastructure, including invert elevations, and condition assessments. This study will inform the Storm water Management Plan and storm water modelling. Study Proposal came in under estimate, and was significantly lower than other proposals received. IO NOTE: There is no decrease in scope, only a decrease in tender. This will result in a decrease in Federal Funding of $44,779.50 to be reallocated."
Construction Start Date:2017-06-01
Construction End Date:2020-03-31

properties.Name: Water Servicing Options Study
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project is a study of water servicing options (Municipal Environmental Assessment) and planning for asset management for drinking water infrastructure.
Construction Start Date:2017-07-14
Construction End Date:2018-12-31

properties.Name: TNRD Utility Systems Master Plan
properties.Description:
Project Description:The Thompson-Nicola Regional District (TNRD) would like to develop a master plan (MP) for the 11 water and 2 sewer systems owned and operated by the TNRD. Capitalizing on already achieved levels identified on the AMBC Roadmap, the MP will review all systems and develop a systematic, sustainable approach to ensure safe, clean, affordable water and wastewater services. Identified priorities will enable the TNRD to prepare financial plans for treatment upgrades and life cycle capital replacements. Building on already achieved asset management plan (Plan) development process, the MP will fill in some of the gaps required for the Plan completion.
Construction Start Date:2017-11-30
Construction End Date:2018-02-28

properties.Name: Replacement of road crossing culvert on County Road 24, close to civic address 2515
properties.Description:
Project Description:The proposed works will consist of the replacement of the road crossings culvert from a 600 mm dia. Corrugated Steel pipe to a same size High Density Polyethylene 320 kilopascal pipe
Construction Start Date:2016-06-14
Construction End Date:2017-10-31

properties.Name: Nith River Wastewater Siphon Twinning
properties.Description:
Project Description:Install a second 200mm diameter wastewater siphon to provide redundancy/security for the siphon crossing. The existing 200mm siphon was installed in 1972 and is made of ductile iron. The existing siphon is operating at approximately 20% of its capacity. The siphon is planned to service the Ninth Peninsula Growth Area which will result in the use of approximately 85% of the single siphon capacity. The project has already been designed, approvals (e.g.. ECA) and permits (Grand River Conservation Authority) have been obtained. Project was tendered in 2015 but due to insufficient funds the project was not awarded for construction and was cancelled. The availability of funding will permit the project to begin immediately in 2017. Due to the lack of capacity among contractors/engineers in the region, we are requesting an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline to ensure successful completion of the project.
Construction Start Date:2017-07-19
Construction End Date:2018-11-18

properties.Name: Sanitary Infrastructure Protection and German Mills Creek Channel Stabilization near Lennox Park: Geomorphic Study
properties.Description:
Project Description:Bank scouring is threatening 70 linear meters of sanitary main that runs parallel underneath German Mills Creek. The depth of cover over the sanitary line is 2.34m. A preliminary geomorphic study is required to assess the extent of the problem and to develop concept design alternatives for sanitary protection works. This study will provide a better understanding of our local water resources and enable innovative designs to reduce sediment inputs into local waterways, improve habitat and provide infrastructure protection. This project is located near Palmer Avenue and Cedar Avenue in the Town of Richmond Hill.
Construction Start Date:2017-05-01
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Construction of a 450-525 mm Relief Storm Sewer from McGill Crescent to the Dalhousie / McMaster St. Area
properties.Description:
Project Description:A local 450mm High-density Polyethylene (HDPE) and 525mm concrete relief sewer into the Dalhousie/McMaster area to provide relief to pocket flooding concerns by increasing sewer capacity and lower inverts to address back up of existing storm sewer connections. Directly benefits approximately 100 households. 82,600 square meters impact area and 125 properties. The total length of sewer is 291 meters.
Construction Start Date:2017-06-01
Construction End Date:2017-10-01

Project Description:Review the Pontiac Pumping Station Drainage Capacity, Optimization and future needs

properties.Name: St Paul Pumping Station Drainage Assessment
properties.Description:
Project Description:Review the St Paul Pumping Station Drainage Capacity, Optimization and future needs
Construction Start Date:2017-03-28
Construction End Date:2018-06-30

properties.Name: Replace and upgrade Thompson Road Sanitary Sewer to meet Growth Demand
properties.Description:
Project Description:Replacement of Polyvinyl Chloride (PVC) pipe from 200mm to 250mm from Manhole 200 to Manhole 201. This section of pipe services the Township's Industrial Park and the current size has been identified as having restricted flows. The replacement and upgrade of this pipe will allow for additional opportunities for growth within our Industrial Park. Due to manufacturer/supplier delays, we are requesting an extension beyond March 31, 2018, to ensure successful completion of the project.
Construction Start Date:2017-11-20
Construction End Date:2017-12-15

properties.Description:

Future capital projects and needs will be identified. Scope of work for the successful consultant was reduced due to knowledge gained during previous work done by the same company. IO NOTE: There is a decrease in scope. This will result in a decrease in Federal Funding of $112,000.00 to be reallocated to LON-004, LON-007, and LON-014."

properties.Name: Design Upgrades for Sewage Pump Station #1 located at 524 Taylor Street, Wiarton (all sewage for the entire Town routes through this pump station)
properties.Description:

Preliminary assessment work has identified provision of equalization storage tanks as a potential means to prevent or reduce the occurrence of bypassing. The proposed project will include a Class Environmental Assessment (Schedule B) to confirm the preferred alternative, as well as project final design and approvals (e.g. Environmental Compliance Approval), and contract preparation in anticipation of construction of the works.

Construction End Date:2018-11-30

properties.Name: Renewal of water pipes
properties.Description:
Project Description:Pipe renewal works to maintain water services to citizens for 12 stretches of road, totaling 1.88 km.
Construction Start Date:2017-06-28
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Stormwater Enhancement along Dufferin, Main, Prince William and Elder Streets
properties.Description:
Project Description:A tap drain will be installed to connect to Dufferin St. where a larger culvert will be installed and the ditch will be graded to the proper depth and slope to drain to the storm drain on Main St. Culverts which are blocked and damaged will be replaced on Prince William St and Elder St to allow storm water to drain. A short section of asphalt will be installed along a section of Argyle St to address a water issue. A storm sewer catch basin will be installed on Central St. to address a water issue.
Construction Start Date:2017-10-01
Construction End Date:2017-12-31

properties.Name: Emerald Water System Disinfection Upgrade
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project works will include: - Construct of a new water treatment building; - Connection of the new WTP to the existing 200 mm raw water main; - Extend power supply and communication line to the new WTP site; - Relocate the mechanical pipes/instruments from existing pump station; - Relocate the underground well head above ground; and, - Upgrades to the pump station including electrical panels.
Construction Start Date:2018-03-26
Construction End Date:2018-12-21

properties.Name: Water Treatment 1 - Chlorine System Rehabilitation
properties.Description:
Project Description:Replace the Trim Chlorination System as it is not working. Completion of this project is critical to the safe/ efficient supply of water to the community, thus reducing potential impact on the Province's health system.
Construction Start Date:2017-01-03
Construction End Date:2017-04-05

properties.Name: Sewage System Upgrade and Improvements
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project works will include: - Pump replacement and electrical and control upgrades for primary lift station; - Purchase and installation of flow measurement equipment; - Re-purpose secondary clarifier; - Upgrade mechanical equipment for both oxidation ditches; - Revise piping and valving; - Supplement secondary clarifier with filter disk technology; - Upgrade headworks; - Upgraded sludge handling; - SCADA integration; and, - Construction of an office, laboratory, and secure storage site.
Construction Start Date:2017-08-01
Construction End Date:2019-04-19

properties.Name: Structural Replacement of a Stormwater Culvert on Dillabough Road
properties.Description:
Project Description:This project will include the replacement of an existing Stormwater Culvert which was due for replacement as part of the road repair due in 2016 according to our Asset Management Plan. Replacement of this culvert will contribute to the prolongation of the life of the road by keeping water off, out of, and away from the road. This project will assist the Township in maintaining our rural stormwater system through culverts, ditches, slope and road design which will reduce the impacts of water running off of land during storm events. The environmental impact of additional runoff can erode watercourses as well as cause flooding after the stormwater collection system is overwhelmed by the additional flow and cause pollutants to enter surface waters during precipitation events.
Construction Start Date:2017-01-08
Construction End Date:2017-10-30

properties.Name: Update 2004 Land Implementation Study for the Water, Sanitary, and Storm Water Systems
properties.Description:
Project Description:Updating the 2004 City of Dryden Land Implementation Study for Water, Wastewater, and Stormsewer. This includes updating computer modeling with new and corrected data. This will assist the City in updating their AMP by identifying problem areas in the system. The August 12th/2016 Extreme Weather Event in Dryden provided the City with evidence that some of the City Infrastructure cannot handle the new climate change extremes. Flooding occurred in areas never affected before. New models of our Storm Sewer system need to be re run to determine where the problem areas are and how to remediate. The Wastewater system backed up as well indicating Inflow and Infiltration should be revisited. The Land Implementation plan ensures any replacement of City assets is done in conjunction with efficiencies and effectiveness that the plan offers. The plan not only provides information where the system is at risk but provides alternatives and preferred options. The plan follows the Municipal Class Environmental Assessment (Class EA) . This master planning process allows for integration of Class EA principles with the infrastructure/asset management process for what is currently existing and for the future. This project covers the entire City.
Construction Start Date:2017-09-01
Construction End Date:2018-01-30

properties.Name: Structural upgrade of Sand Hill area water services
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project will replace 100mm ductile iron pipe with 200mm Polyvinyl Chloride (PVC) pipe along Laronde Road and across Sand Hill Road to connect to the 200mm water main on Tamarack. Further, a portion of the 150mm of ductile iron water main on Cache Bay Road will be replaced with 150mm Polyvinyl Chloride. This project will complete a water main loop, will increase flow and pressure, and reduce or eliminate dirty red water complaints.
Construction Start Date:2017-05-01
Construction End Date:2017-12-31

properties.Name: Corwin Cres. Watermain Replacement - Removal and disposal of existing 1,600 meters of  watermain and replacing with new 1,600 meter watermain
properties.Description:
Project Description:Includes capital construction on 7 streets ; Corwin Cres. Stokes Street; Homestead Crescent; Lindsay Crescent; Laura Crescent; Merle Crescent And Erwin Crescent Project is needed to replace watermain that is in poor condition and in constant need of maintenance and repair. Hydrants will be replaced and two additional hydrants will be added to improve fire flow protection. Project includes new water services with curb stops at the property line for a total of 141 lots. Corwin Crescent - 840 meter of new 150mm diameter watermain.; Stokes Street - 200 meter of new 150mm diameter watermain.; Homestead Crescent - 80 meter of new 150mm diameter watermain and includes 50mm diameter watermain loop at cul-de-sac.; Lindsay Crescent - 75 meter of new 150mm diameter watermain and will include 50mm diameter watermain loop at cul-de-sac.; Laura Crescent - 65 meter of new 150mm diameter watermain and will include 50 mm diameter watermain loop at cul-de-sac. Marle Crescent. - 90 meter of new 150mm diameter watermain and will include 50mm diameter watermain loop at cul-de-sac.; Erwin Crescent - 195 meter of new 200mm diameter watermain and 45 meter of new 150mm diameter watermain and will include 50mm diameter watermain loop at cul-de-sac.
Construction Start Date:2017-08-15
Construction End Date:2018-06-01

properties.Name: Tramore Road Culvert Replacement and Ditching
properties.Description:
Project Description:A major 60" culvert on Tramore Road at Eady Road will be replaced along with various cross and driveway culverts. Approximately 1,800 meters of ditching is required as well in order to eliminate road flooding and wash outs. Project will allow proper stormwater drainage on Tramore road thereby allowing for future resurfacing.
Construction Start Date:2017-08-17
Construction End Date:2017-12-31

properties.Name: Multiple Structural Relining of Watermains under Canadian Pacific Railway Tracks/Yard at 5 locations
properties.Description:
Project Description:Structural Upgrade of 5 watermains crossing underneath the Canadian Pacific Railway (CPR) tracks/yard within the limits of the City of Dryden. These existing Watermains lines feed north Dryden as well as providing looping of the City mains. The watermains have install dates of 1927 to 1980 and range in size from 150mm to 300mm. Should these lines ever develop a leak or break it could be catastrophic as this would split Canada in half with the stoppage of rail traffic, derailment or hazardous goods issue if the leak were to go unnoticed or while repairs are being done. At the very least a very difficult and expensive leak to repair. Structural Liners in these mains would dramatically reduce the risk the City currently holds. Doing these 5 watermains at once in the same year will allow the City to use the economics of scale considering our location and specialized type of work. These 5 mains under the CPR tracks service half the community of Dryden affecting 1750 households. The watermains would be relined at the following locations (includes year installed, diameter, length) 1. West end of Queen Street to Government Road 1927 - 200mm - 110 m 2. Earl Ave/ Queen Street Intersection to Government Rd 1980 - 300mm - 92m 3. 250 King Street to Highway #17 1947 - 150mm - 65m 4. Colonization Ave South to Colonization Ave North 1970 - 300mm - 60m 5. East End of Duke Street to South End of Keith Avenue 1979 - 300mm - 90m
Construction Start Date:2017-07-15
Construction End Date:2018-09-30

properties.Name: Lakeview Place Subdivision Water System Connection Project
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project works will include: - Connection to the Cedar Heights Water System watermain via 210m of pipe; - New Booster station, pumps, piping, valves, flow meter, electrical, fencing and genset; - SCADA system; - Decommission existing booster station and lake pumphouse; - New reservoir level controls and fencing; - Two new lake pumps; - Flow meter; and, - Installation of water meters.
Construction Start Date:2017-05-01
Construction End Date:2018-01-31

properties.Name: East Coulee Lift Station
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project includes the construction of a replacement sewage lift station, a new sludge handling tank and electrical & telecommunication upgrades to improve the operation and reliability of the existing sewage treatment plant. The upgrades include connection to fibre optic network for more reliable monitoring of plant controls & alarms.
Construction Start Date:2017-06-01
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: New Wastewater Pump Station and Mains Upgrade
properties.Description:
Project Description:Objective: Solve back-pressure issues and increase the wastewater system capacity to allow for community growth. Scope: Plan, design and construct appx 600 m of appx 150 mm diameter gravity collection mains, appx 11 manholes, appx 420 m of appx 150 mm diameter gravity mains to lagoon, and all associated works. Output: new gravity collection mains, new manholes, gravity mains to lagoon.
Construction Start Date:2018-01-02
Construction End Date:2018-12-31

properties.Name: Upgrade to Parkhill Watermain Reservoir/ Transmission Main
properties.Description:
Project Description:The upgrades at the Parkhill Reservoir would allow for a direct by-passing of the pumps to the Municipalities water distribution system which would ensure safe drinking water; additionally, improvements and some replacements of the baffles within the facility would make the reservoir structurally sound. Currently there are significant structural deficiencies at the Parkhill Reservoir making these works essential as a long term solution for safe drinking water. Currently, 961 residents pull from this system and the Municipality has had three (3) alerts within the last eight years pertaining to this system. Under current conditions, the existing pumps operate almost 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, 365 days a year. These upgrades would create storage and pump relief within this water system and in turn would also relieve some of the existing demand from our feeder, the Mount Carmel Reservoir (which is under sized), by providing redundancy to the distribution system in the event of another failure to the Lake Huron Primary Water Supply System (LHPWSS).
Construction Start Date:2017-09-11
Construction End Date:2018-05-30

properties.Name: Elgeti water treatment plant (WTP) Energy Efficiency Upgrades for Heating, Insulation and Lighting Systems
properties.Description:
Project Description:Switch to high efficiency electrical or natural gas heaters. Interlock heaters with fresh air vents to disable when generator is running to reduce heat loss. Install rooftop, wall and pipe insulation to reduce heat loss. Replace existing lighting with high efficiency lighting (LED). Install motion and occupancy sensors in appropriate areas.
Construction Start Date:2017-10-12
Construction End Date:2017-11-29

properties.Name: Culvert installation to address localized flooding
properties.Description:
Project Description:Installation of culvert in access road to community, to provide better access to community and address localized flooding. Off-reserve benefits are improved watershed management and minimized erosion impacts on waterbodies.
Construction Start Date:2017-02-01
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Wastewater Collection System Flush
properties.Description:
Project Description:Contract a vacuum service to clean and flush sewage collection piping. Execution of the rehabilitation will ensure wastewater does not enter the environment and negatively impact surrounding communities.
Construction Start Date:2017-04-01
Construction End Date:2018-03-30

properties.Name: Upgrades at Water Treatment Plant
properties.Description:
Project Description:Purchase spare high lift pump to ensure continued water service in case of pump failure. Off-reserve benefits are reduced burden to Provincial Health Care system by ensuring continued clean water to community.
Construction Start Date:2017-02-15
Construction End Date:2018-03-30

properties.Name: Remove underground containers with hydrocarbons from the TsiSnaihne Water Reservoir Building
properties.Description:
Project Description:Remove concrete containers below the TsiSnaihne Water Reservoir Building that contain water with hydrocarbons and analyze surrounding soil. The removal of potential water contaminates reduces the potential impact on the provincial health system and environmental contamination of receiving environment.
Construction Start Date:2018-04-30
Construction End Date:2018-10-31

properties.Name: Huron Brant Pumping Station Improvements
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** "The improvements at the Huron Brant Pumping Station will address the remaining deficiencies listed in the 2013 GD Jewell engineering report. The project's main focus will be replacement of approx. 170m of existing force main with a larger main to allow the pumping station to adequately handle the flow in a high flow situations. Currently in high flow conditions, the community is required to hire pumper trucks to help the station keep up. By avoiding potential spills this project will benefit the off reserve environment. Project scope is increased to include new valves (2), a valve chamber, lights and prefab aluminum entrance hatch. Due to delays in developing the agreement, an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline is required. IO NOTE: Due to the increase in scope, there is an increase in Federal Funding of $9,180.50 to be reallocated from MBQ-002, MBQ-003 and MBQ-004."
Construction Start Date:2018-02-19
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Electoral Area D - Area D Integrated Water System Upgrade
properties.Description:
Project Description:"The project work will include: - Design work to connect to the existing system; - Installation of a 100m casing pipe underneath the Trans Canada (Hwy#1) Highway; - Construction of the water main piping and tie in to the existing water system; and, - Related works."
Construction Start Date:2017-08-08
Construction End Date:2018-03-29

properties.Name: Sewer Lining
properties.Description:
Project Description:Due to the findings in the 2010 report City of St. Johns Sanitary Sewer Inflow/Infiltration Study (Waterford Valley & Temperance Street Catchments) many major problem areas in the sanitary sewer system have been identified as priorities for the removal of extraneous water. To combat this issue this project has set out to install sewer lining in the problem areas.
Construction Start Date:2017-08-01
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Georgetown Lagoon Upgrades Phase III
properties.Description:
Project Description:The existing wastewater treatment plant (WWTP) consists of a stabilization pond which discharges effluent to the harbour that contains a thriving mussel farming industry. The lagoon required upgrades to that the effluent would meet current environmental standards. The upgrades were divided into three phases, with the first two phases being constructed under previous infrastructure programs. Phase III of the upgrades will include the installation of a curtain wall to provide a settling area prior to ultraviolet (UV) disinfection, and a floating aeration system will be installed in the initial cell to provide improved nutrient removal.
Construction Start Date:2017-09-11
Construction End Date:2017-11-10

properties.Name: Construction of tamarac booster station
properties.Description:
Project Description:Replace pressure boost station, secondary chlorination equipment and housing structure / requirement to retain water services and fire protection
Construction Start Date:2017-09-07
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Rehabilitation of Sanitary Sewer Main from Maple Street to Elm Street
properties.Description:
Project Description:Rehabilitation of sanitary sewer main from Maple Street to Elm Street. This project includes related road work necessary to complete the project.
Construction Start Date:2017-10-16
Construction End Date:2018-11-30

properties.Name: Purchase and Install Turbo Blower (with Programmable Logic Controller (PLC)  and Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA) system)
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project will purchase and install Programmable Logic Controller (PLC)/Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA) controls to link the DO (dissolved oxygen) sensors and the turbo blower so the equipment will only be operating when needed. Having a second turbo blower will extend the life of the existing blower and provide a backup to a critical piece of equipment should there be a malfunction or a need for major maintenance. Up to 90% of the electricity requirements of the treatment process is to have blowers infuse oxygen into the system. A turbo blower provides greater efficiency than a conventional blower. A turbo blower is expected to reduce energy consumption by operating at variable speeds. There are dissolved oxygen (DO) sensors mounted in the aeration tanks but there is no automation to signal the blower that more or less oxygen is required therefore, the blower runs continuously (24/7; 365 days per year).
Construction Start Date:2017-05-24
Construction End Date:2018-08-31

properties.Name: Alexandria Lagoon Upgrade Detailed Design in order to meet Federal and Provincial effluent standards/requirements and to address the facility being at 130% of its approved capacity.
properties.Description:
Project Description:Complete a detailed design of the Alexandria Lagoon Facility in order to bring the facility into compliance with its certificate of approval, to comply with federal lagoon effluent criteria and to improve treatment capabilities and efficiencies.
Construction Start Date:2017-07-01
Construction End Date:2019-02-28

properties.Name: Potable Water Tank Maintenance and Retrofit
properties.Description:
Project Description:This project will involve the removal of the water from the tank, and then cleaning and sandblasting to the meta and recoated with a n epoxy that is designed for this use. An air entrainment system will be installed to circulate the water, improving the quality of the water supply.
Construction Start Date:2017-09-08
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Purchase and Installation of Variable Frequency Drive control units at 50 Agnes Street, Charlton.
properties.Description:
Project Description:Objective: Purchase and installation of variable frequency drive capable control units and Programmable Logic Control programming associated with the variable frequency drive installation. This will allow for more efficient communication between equipment which will allow for a better flow based on demand. In turn it will be easier on the pumps, require less maintenance and extend their life. Scope: To purchase and install VFD (variable frequency drive) units compatible to the above mentioned high lift pumps and wire the and program the units to the plants existing PLC (Programmable Logic Control). Output: of this would be a reduction in electricity consumption, enhanced reliability of the high lift system, stabilization of the output pressure to the town.
Construction Start Date:2017-08-01
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Rehabilitation of Cast Iron Watermains on Water Street, Riverdale, and East End Neighbourhoods to improve structural and hydraulic performance.
properties.Description:
Project Description:Approximately 72km of Cornwall`s 279km of watermain have a low performance index (below 20 out of 100). These are mostly unlined cast iron pipes that are at or near the end of their service life and have hydraulic or break history deficiencies. This program will rehabilitate and line approximately 4km of watermains that are deficient.
Construction Start Date:2017-06-15
Construction End Date:2018-11-30

properties.Name: Village of McAdam Water Control System Infrastructure Improvement

properties.Name: Upper York Sewage Servicing Phosphorus Offset Program Pilot study

The Individual Environmental Assessment (IEA) for the Upper York Sewage Servicing project identified a phosphorus offsetting program to achieve imposed phosphorus offset ratios. Conceptual designs were developed during the IEA phase and detailed design and confirmation of proposed conceptual designs are required. Design opportunities such as low impact development, retrofit opportunities and alternative opportunities will be reviewed.

Construction End Date:2020-03-31

properties.Name: County of Forty Mile/Foremost Manyberries Regional Pipeline
properties.Description:

They do not currently have Variable Frequency Drives and installing the same would make these pumps more energy efficient and reduce their operating costs. Change of scope: Buy and install ONE high-lift pump with a variable frequency drive (VFD). Buying one new pump instead of rehabilitating four pumps.
Construction Start Date:2018-03-15
Construction End Date:2018-11-30

properties.Name: Condition Assessment of the Region's Storm Sewer Infrastructure
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information "Detailed condition assessment of the Region of Peel's storm sewer infrastructure to determine its condition and to identify short-term and long-term remedial actions necessary to maintain the storm sewer infrastructure. Permanent Pool Volume provided in SWM Facility is 7823m3 (regional storm) In 2008, The Region of Peel constructed a storm water Management Facility at Mayfield Road and Heart Lake Road to service a tributary area of 22.3 ha, being comprised of 8.7 ha of arterial road drainage and 13.6 ha lands additional area which drains to the arterial road right of way. This facility provides storm water Quality Control (Enhanced Level i.e. 80% Total Suspended Solids removal) and Erosion Control and maintain Water Quantity flows below existing flow rates up to an including the Regional Storm. On June 6, 2008 the Ministry of the Environment issued a Certificate of Approval to the Region of Peel to construct, operate and maintain the prescribed infrastructure, including a condition (No.4) requiring the Region of Peel properly operate and maintain the infrastructure to protect the environment. To demonstrate compliance with the MOE authorization the Region of Peel operates a monitoring program. The program showed that the facility have deteriorated and that without rehabilitation, will not provide the function as per its original design. The purpose of this project is to restore the original facility functions to protect the environment, enhance the ability of the region through improved technology to operate and maintain the infrastructure, improve the infrastructure efficiency and reduce long term maintenance costs. The project budget has been reduced due to receiving a competitive bid and not utilizing the provisional sum and contingency amount. IO NOTE: There is no decrease in scope, but a decrease in tender. This will result in a decrease in Federal Funding of $1,250,000 to be realloc
Construction Start Date:2017-05-24
Construction End Date:2017-07-01

properties.Name: Watermain replacement on King St from Arthur St to Dunlop St., James St from Kings St. to Centre St., & Ontario St. W. from Henry St. to King St.

Please see notes for original project information*** "This project will be replacing 1.0 km of old ductile iron and cast iron water mains with new Polyvinyl Chloride (PVC) water main. The water main will service 70 households and two community centers and looped as part of the ultimate distribution system to provide system security and improved water quality. Project is under budget based on awarded tender. Extension Rationale: The Regional infrastructures, sanitary sewer and waterman replacement, are being constructed in conjunction with the road reconstruction contract administered by the Town of Whitby. There was a delay in the issuing of the tender by the Town of Whitby which resulted in the delay of the water and sewer Regional Works. IO NOTE: There is no decrease in scope, only a decrease in tender. This will result in a decrease in Federal funding of $129,500 to be reallocated to DUR-004 and DUR-018."

Project Description:"Improvements to the water distribution system in Mississauga (Wards 2 and 8) to improve levels of service related to pressure, water quality and reliability according to the Corporate Asset Management Plan. The works include replacing existing water mains and installing new water mains to allow promotion of some areas to a higher pressure zone. This work includes the replacement of watermains ranging in size from 150 to 400 mm on 14 different streets, adding up to a total of 9.2 km in length. Due to delays in developing the Transfer Payment Agreement and subsequent delays in procurement and its impact on construction schedule, we are requesting an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline to ensure successful completion of the project."

Construct replacement along Creighton Avenue of the all water distribution mains, sewer mains, and sewage force mains and associated works. The upgraded water distribution and sewage collection system is designed to meet the demands and future growth of the community for an estimated 40 years

The forcemain is approximately 1.2 kms in length and transports roughly 16,500 m3/day of sewage. The forcemain was constructed in 1964 and operates continuously. The condition of the pipe is unknown.

properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** Replace the existing 300mm ductile iron water main to Polyvinyl Chloride (PVC) on Centre Street from Dufferin Street to Bathurst Street. The existing iron water main requires excessive maintenance and repairs and it is more cost effective to replace it in conjunction with the H2 - Bus Rapid Transit design and construction contract. Due to delays in developing the agreement, an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline is required. IO NOTE: There is no decrease in scope, only a reduction in tender. This will result in a decrease in Federal Funding of $247,189.26 to be reallocated.
Construction Start Date:2016-09-01
Construction End Date:2019-03-30

properties.Name: Sewage Pump Station Upgrades
properties.Description:
Project Description:The sewage pump station upgrades will mitigate impacts such as frequent pump blockages and failures and associated risk of sewer backups, and the risk of contamination of adjacent Green Lake. Construct sewage pump station #1 and 2 building, mechanical, electrical, and control upgrades and all associated works. Two sewage pump stations will be upgraded

properties.Name: Water System Efficiency Plan
properties.Description:
Project Description:The City of Castelgar (City) would like to develop a water system efficiency plan (Plan), that includes explicit modules to optimize hydraulics, storage, pressure zones, capital renewal and leakage to make the system cost-effective. This project will analyze the path of potable water as it extends east and south throughout the community across multiple pressure zones. The Plan will assess system components and functions under various operating scenarios to find the most effective configuration of pressure reducing valves, reservoir, sustaining values and the pressures at individual connections. The outcome of this project will be a clear and consolidated 10-year capital plan that achieves services efficiencies.
Construction Start Date:2017-05-05
Construction End Date:2018-03-30

properties.Name: Terrace Reservoir Capacity Improvement Design
properties.Description:
Project Description:The City of Terrace (City) reservoir capacity improvement design project includes a new precast concrete reservoir with associated piping and valving and other equipment/structures for effective operation and function of the reservoir. The proposed reservoir will be located on land currently owned by the City. Connective piping will be located within City road right-of-way or easements.
