properties.Name: Upgrade of a Communal Waste Water Lagoon System Servicing 12,606 People Located at 1953 4th Line, Ohsweken, Ontario, N0A 1M0.
properties.Description:
Project Description:"The project is to complete upgrades recommended by the Lagoon Needs Study (SIX-001). We are anticipating a need for upgrades in order to increase the capacity/lifespan of the lagoons, enhance service to the Six Nations Community and improve environmental outcomes on reserve, for surrounding municipalities, Ontario and Canada. The scope of the project is unknown until the study (project SIX-001) is completed. Our lagoons have been operating over their capacity since 2006 and our community is growing. We have since added several large community buildings onto our wastewater system and we are working on a 95-unit housing development to address a waiting list of over 1000 families. All Six Nations' wastewater passes through the lagoon system. An improvement of this system will help make rivers and lakes healthier for the municipalities that draw our effluent water downstream from the Grand River for potable water usage. This would have a positive impact on agricultural users and the environment. The phosphorus load reduction targets for Lake Erie could then be achieved as our waste water effluent has been documented to have high phosphorus levels. The Mississauga's of the New Credit First Nation (New Credit) is located directly to the South of the Six Nations of the Grand River Territory and would greatly benefit from upgrades to our wastewater system since they have over 60 residences that rely on our sanitation truck service (home owner calls for service to empty their holding or septic tank, transport the human waste to the Six Nations waste water system and discharge the contents into the Six Nations lagoons for treatment). "
Construction Start Date:2017-09-14
Construction End Date:2020-03-30

properties.Name: Plateau Water Pump Station Project
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project works will include: - Approximately 1,240m of watermain; and, - Construction of a new pump station including structures, mechanical and electrical works and supplies.
Construction Start Date:2017-04-03
Construction End Date:2018-11-30

properties.Name: District of Tofino Wastewater Treatment Plant
properties.Description:
Project Description:The District of Tofino operates a wastewater collection system that discharges untreated wastewater through two outfalls into Duffin Passage. The proposed project includes the geotechnical, environmental and detailed design to construct wastewater treatment infrastructure to comply with regulations, and improve environmental quality for shellfish harvesting and recreational use. The proposed infrastructure includes a secondary wastewater treatment plant, solids handling facility, outfall upgrades, and collection system upgrades to convey wastewater to the selected site. This will service the District, Tla-o-qui-aht First Nation and other stakeholders, and will be designed for an initial 20-year horizon, with options for expansion. The project is separated into two phases, this application is for Phase A, pre-design and detailed design for shovel-ready construction.
Construction Start Date:2017-10-21
Construction End Date:2020-08-03

properties.Name: New Construction of 3 drilled wells at three public facilities within Whitney
properties.Description:
Project Description:Currently the Lester Smith Community Centre and Ambulance Dispatch and Fire Hall (two buildings which are adjacent to each other separated by a road) are serviced by one shallow dug well which is on the Lester Smith property. Water is brought into the Lester Smith Building, treated and used for kitchen, washrooms and rink flooding, waste is also pumped under ground to the adjacent property to supply the ambulance dispatch and Fire Hall where it is ultra-violet (UV) treated again and used for kitchen, washrooms and washing; the issue associated with this is that the production of the well is low and pumping it to a second facility is difficult, resulting in low availability and pressure in both locations. A third building located at 7 Third Avenue is serviced by a well drilled by the Ministry of Natural Resources and Forestry more than 40 years ago, is more than 200 m from the facility and does not provide adequate supply. The objective of this project is to drill a well, which will be properly sealed, provide adequate safe water at each of the three facilities which will provide; better public service to the Recreation Centre, the firehall to fill trucks onsite for fire protection and adequate water to the Municipal Offices and Seniors Centre and reducing the amount of distribution piping and pumping required (i.e. 32 Hay Creek Road Lester Smith Community Centre, 31 Hay Creek Road Ambulance dispatch centre and Fire Hall and 7 Third Avenue Whitney Senior Centre, fitness centre and Township Municipal Office). Each of these locations are open public facilities that serve a few thousand people during regular operations, as well as special events held within them each year. Being able to complete these three wells in one contract would be more cost effective. The result would be more economical for the township to operate and would reduce the risk associated with using a shallow unconfined well to provide water to a public facilities.
Construction Start Date:2017-05-01
Construction End Date:2018-09-30

properties.Name: Rehabilitation of Wastewater collection system pipes and pumping stations
properties.Description:
Project Description:This project will allow the Village to clean and reline the collection pipes for the 43 year old wastewater system. There has been no maintenance of the pipes since installing, except emergency repair. In 2015/16 all lines were cameraed and all required work outlined. There is a great deal of infiltration into the system that in turn fills the lagoons unnecessarily. The project will repair all the lines and increase the life of the collection system for an expected 30 years as well as the long term capacity of the lagoons. The Village is determined to set up a preventive maintenance camera program on a five year cycle after the project is completed to avoid future large expenses due to breaks.
Construction Start Date:2017-07-13
Construction End Date:2017-11-30

properties.Name: New Wastewater Pump Station

Scope: Plan, design and construct a pre-cast appx 3 metre deep manhole, trench drain to the existing sewer lines, new appx 1.5 kW sewer pump, and all associated works. Output: New lift station.
Construction Start Date:2018-02-12
Construction End Date:2018-12-31

properties.Name: Stormwater System Upgrade
properties.Description:
Project Description:Objective: To alleviate stormwater capacity demand on the lift station, minimize flood risks, add to the useful life of the stormwater and wastewater infrastructure. Scope: Plan, design and construct an expanded stormwater surge pond, drainage canals, and expanded street stormwater drainage piping, and all associated works. Output: Upgraded surge pond and drainage canal, new stormwater piping.
Construction Start Date:2017-07-30
Construction End Date:2018-12-31

properties.Name: Addition of three wastewater forcemain valves for the Drayton wastewater forcemain system.
properties.Description:
Project Description:System does not have valves which can cause the lagoon collection chamber to backflow if there is a failure of the forcemain and does not allow for the Township to isolate the wastewater pumping station. Installation of wastewater valves #2 and #3 will also allow the Township to isolate the forcemain that runs under the Conestoga River. Wastewater valve #1 will also allow the Township to isolate the influent flows to the wastewater pumping station to permit repairs and maintenance. Valves will be located as follows: 1) a 350 mm wastewater valve on the inlet pipe to the wastewater pumping station located on the west end of Mill Street (20 Mill Street) adjacent to the Conestoga River; 2) On the wastewater forcemain leaving the wastewater pumping station (20 Mill Street) located on the west end of Mill Street adjacent to the Conestoga River on the east side of the Conestoga River; 3) On the wastewater forcemain located on the west side of the Conestoga River.
Construction Start Date:2017-05-01
Construction End Date:2017-09-30

properties.Name: Rehabilitation of Sewage Plant Building including the roof, generator and Supervisory Control And Data Acquisition computer system replacements

All the improvements will service to extend the life facility and other equipment and ensure the continued effective and safe treatment of the village's wastewater.

properties.Name: Replacement of lids on the digester tanks at Waste Water Treatment Facility at 92 Alexandra Avenue, Point Edward.
properties.Description:
Project Description:Lids on the digester tanks will be replaced in order to make the gas collection and burning system function properly. Gases are currently dissipating into the atmosphere. The seals on the digester lids have broken down over the years and we are concerned that if inspected we could be ordered to remedy the problem within a certain time period. This is a project that we hoped to complete within the next few years but would like to complete it sooner if funding is available. It is not possible to quantify the amount of gas that would be collected and burned off as there is no measuring system available. The end result of the completion of this project would be the elimination of gases being released to the atmosphere.

The hydrants are also tested annually to make sure adequate flow and pressure is available. Flushing is also done to remove sediment from the pipes in order to maintain water clarity and water quality in the distribution pipes. Repair valve box at First Nations office. properties.Name: Oakes Park Trunk Sewer Relining & Maintenance Hole rehabilitiation - located in the Town of Fort Erie
properties.Description:
Project Description:"The project includes: The following are the main components of the project;  1,265 meters of intercept sewer lining. The sewer diameter size 825mm diameter and crosses under one (1) artillery roadway and two (2) Town Parks  Rehabilitation of 19 maintenance holes The Oakes Park trunk sewer in the Town of Fort Erie carries all sanitary sewage from the communities of Crystal Beach and Ridgeway. This represents a population of over 7,100 plus industrial, commercial and institutional sewage generators. This trunk sewer has been in service since 1973 and now has extensive corrosion damage from hydrogen sulphide attack and must be relined/rehabilitated. The corrosion is extensive and immediate action is required to ensure system reliability. Innovative ""Trenchless Technology"" will be used to minimize disruption to the neighborhood including users of Oakes and Sugarbowl parks. This rehabilitation methodology (insertion of a glass reinforced plastic pipe liner) is typically lower in cost and is not only resistant to corrosion from hydrogen sulphide attack but will extend the sewers life by over 50 years. In addition it has the added benefit of a smaller carbon foot print when compared to traditional open-cut digging methods. The project is incremental in nature in that the project had been removed from our 2017 capital budget due to insufficient regional funding required to proceed with the construction phase. The CWWF funding will allow us to proceed with a key infrastructure project."
Construction Start Date:2018-01-15
Construction End Date:2019-02-28

properties.Name: Wastewater System Lining - lining  20 Km of brick, concrete, clay, and Polyvinyl Chloride (PVC) sewers up to 1500mm diameter, to reduce occurrence of structural failure and back-ups
properties.Description:
Project Description:The existing combined and/or sanitary sewers have become structurally and service deficient. Rehabilitation is intended to decrease infiltration, improve hydraulics and restore structural integrity while reducing the risk and liability associated with sewer collapse and backup issues. Internal lining of 20 kilometers of brick, concrete, clay, and Polyvinyl Chloride (PVC) sewers up to 1500mm in diameter, to reduce the occurrence of structural failure and sewermain back-ups to approximately 3500 customers
Construction Start Date:2017-01-02
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Ultraviolet (UV) Disinfection at Durham Wastewater Treatment Plant
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project will replace the chlorine disinfection with Ultraviolet (UV) disinfection rather than chlorination and de-chlorination of the treated effluent. The objective is to achieve a zero chemical discharge to the Saugeen River. The chlorine residual is currently in the order of 0.5mg/L or more whereas the guidelines restrict this level to below 0.02mg/L of total chlorine residual. The treatment plant in the existing condition is unable to comply with the Provincial and Federal treated effluent discharge criteria requirements. This happens due to the chlorine residual level exceeding the guidelines limit. The chlorine residuals are undesirable due to an adverse impact on the natural aquatic environment of the receiving water body i.e. Saugeen River.
Construction Start Date:2017-10-31
Construction End Date:2018-04-30

The watermain has experienced numerous breaks and requires replacement. Due to delays in developing the Transfer Payment Agreement and subsequent delays in procurement and its impact on construction schedule, we are requesting an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline to ensure successful completion of the project."

Please see notes for original project information*** "London has several wet chemical (chlorine) scrubbers at the Adelaide, Pottersburg and Greenway treatment plants and the Clarke Road Pumping Station biofilter. Recent upgrades at other facilities have used ozone disinfection and have also incorporated heat recovery to reduce the seasonal energy required to heat the air as well as reducing maintenance costs. This project will replace the remaining wet chemical scrubbers with ozone and heat recovery. Reduced number of facilities for upgrade. IO NOTE: There is a decrease in scope. This will result in a decrease in Federal Funding of $114,000.00 to be reallocated to LON-014."

properties.Name: South Side Lowlift Sewage Pumping Station Upgrade (pumps/mechanical/electrical/Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA)/Roof/odor control/site works) - Phase 2
properties.Description:
Project Description:The South Side Lowlift Sewage Pumping Station (SPS) is located in the City of Niagara Falls and services over 5,000 residents plus industrial, commercial and institutional needs. This includes Marineland which is one of the largest tourist destinations in the City. In 2011 a condition assessment was completed and identified that major components in the pumping station require replacement and upgrades. This prompted a design assignment to rehabilitate the pumping station. The design work is nearing completion (90%) and the following upgrades are needed:  Pumps (4)  Mechanical systems (internal piping and 15 valves),  Complete replacement of the Electrical and Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA) systems including a new electrical room to meet building code requirements  Roof replacement (new sloped roof to replace existing 1,500 ft² flat roof)  Odor control system  Site works (security fence, laneway paving and landscaping)  Pump station pumping capacity will be improved to meet requirements of the Ministry of Environment & Climate Change Environmental Compliance Approval (MOECC ECA). Currently this station is pumping at 450 l/s and the environmental compliance approval (ECA) stipulates 576 l/s The Combined Sewer Overflow (CSO) Tank and Sewage Pumping Station (SPS) were originally tendered in 2013. Due to unforeseen Contractor performance issues, the project was terminated. In 2015 the Combined Sewer Overflow (CSO) Tank assignment was awarded to a new Contractor. Upgrades to the Sewage Pumping Station (SPS) were not included as part of the new award. The Sewage Pumping Station (SPS) design is 90% complete. The cost estimate for mechanical and electrical upgrades is based on prorated tendered costs from the original tendering phase, and cost estimates for the roof, odor control system and site works are based on consultant 90% design estimate. Final costs will be subject to tender award.
Construction Start Date:2017-02-24
Construction End Date:2018-08-30

properties.Name: Water and Sewer Line Renewal: Phase II
properties.Description:

properties.Name: Addition of Backflow Preventers at Fifth St. Sewage Pumping Station
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** "This project will install a backflow preventer to allow bypass volumes to flow and relieve sewage collection pressure, while preventing river water from entering the sewage collection system during spring thaw. The Fifth St. Sewage Pumping Station is the last pumping station in the Town of Hearst's wastewater collection system. During the spring thaw, the Mattawishkwia River rises to elevations higher than the level of the pumping station's 600mm bypass pipe, thus adding additional volume that is pumped to the sewage lagoons. This added volume from the river increases the volume sent for treatment in the lagoons by at least 15%, increasing energy consumption unnecessarily, causing additional wear and tear on equipment, and most significantly - increasing the potential for sewer backups into houses in the vicinity when the station's pump capacity is exceeded. The original budget estimate was based on a Tideflex-brand check valve. Subsequent supplier inquiries found a competitive product from Elasto-Valve Rubber Products (EVR Products) which is also manufactured in Northern Ontario. Due to delays in developing the agreement and consequent local priority changes, an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline is required. IO NOTE: There is a decrease in scope, resulting in a decrease in Federal Funding of $3,750 to be reallocated to HEA-001."
Construction Start Date:2017-08-24
Construction End Date:2018-05-31

properties.Name: Design and Construction of Graham Creek Stormwater Measures
properties.Description:
Project Description:The existing creek low flow channel armouring has failed since installed in the early 1980s. The resulting toe erosion has caused the erosion of property and increased sedimentation. This project will rehabilitate the existing armoured sections and introduce additional armouring within the reach to protect property. Channel armouring is required to address the overall lack of stormwater rate and volume controls currently within the Graham Creek subwatershed. At this time, in-stream works are required to protect private property from erosion and slope stability issues that are directly related to uncontrolled stormwater conveyance. Rehabilitation measures proposed include rip-rap, gabion baskets as well as additional plantings, and will be fleshed out during detailed design. Extension request for 25% of the costs past the deadline of March 2018 due to potential conflict with fish habitat.
Construction Start Date:2016-08-08
Construction End Date:2019-03-15

properties.Name: Water Treatment Plant Residue Management Phase 2 - Filter Backwash Wastewater Equalization and Treatment
properties.Description:
Project Description:The Town of Perth is aiming to treat all wastewater from siphons, sedimentation tanks, and filter backwashing discharging from the Water Treatment Plant (WTP). Due to a lack of funding at the onset of the project, this is being implemented in 2 phases. Phase 1 is complete and consists of a treatment system for the residue discharge from the settling tanks. Phase 2 (the proposed project) will include a treatment system for filter backwash wastewater and sedimentation tanks. Currently, backwash wastewater is discharged directly to the Tay River without any treatment. This system will provide treatment for approximately 100 m3 of backwash wastewater that is discharged every 2-3 days on average, and wastewater from bi-annual cleaning of the sedimentation tanks. The proposed project includes construction and engineering for an in-ground backwash equalization tank (BET) to provide clarification of the supernatant to meet effluent criteria of 15 mg/L of total suspended solids (TSS) and dechlorination to meet 0.02 mg/L of Total Residual Chlorine (TRC). During filter backwashing, wastewater will be sent by gravity to the BET. The wastewater will settle in the tank for a period of several hours, after which a floating decanting mechanism will be automatically engaged to skim the supernatant from the surface and direct it to the Tay River. Settled solids (sludge) in the BET will then be pumped to the onsite Phase 1 treatment system, which uses passive dewatering through geotextiles (Geotubes). The Geotubes produce high quality filtrate that can be discharged directly into the river. The solids retained in the bags are a source of material for beneficial re-use as landfill cover or other potential construction activities.
Construction Start Date:2017-04-01
Construction End Date:2017-08-31

properties.Name: Monitoring Equipment Upgrades at Water Distribution/Generator Building
properties.Description:
Project Description:We have replaced and/or installed a chart recorder and a chlorine analyser amongst other electronic monitoring equipment. These recent addition and/or upgrades have been wired into the current generator which already supports all 4 pumping stations which include a total of 9 pumps. These new additions and/or upgrades are causing the current generator to be at or exceeding its capacity. The emergency generator currently being used exceeds 24 yrs and is far passed end of life expectancy and could fail at any time regardless of the regular monthly maintenance being done to it. Should this emergency generator fail, there is no back up which would mean the pumping stations and its pumps would not function during power outages which are frequent here. We need to install a sound emergency back up generator that can maintain the amount of electricity required to operate all pumps including electronic monitoring equipment. Such an upgrade to the Water Distribution/Generator Building would benefit all residents who depend on this system for clean, potable water.
Construction Start Date:2016-04-01
Construction End Date:2018-06-30

The preliminary study identified the following :  6 bioretention cells to be constructed within the existing right-of-way  Total length of cells = 142m  Total footprint of bioretention = 396 sq.m.  Total area (runoff from road +lots) treated = approx. 1.4ha  No negative impact to current roadway uses; in addition to improved stormwater management, some potential for traffic calming benefits This project will support the design work for the above."

This will reduce peak flow rates (volume and velocity) and thereby reduce silt, sediment, grit and organic/inorganic material loading in stormwater runoff discharged to Owen Sound Bay from hard surfaces such as roads, parking lots, sidewalks and boulevards etc. as well as from Kenny Drain system channel erosion, thereby protecting and improving water quality of Owen Sound of Georgian Bay. Owen Sound of Georgian Bay is the raw water source for the City of Owen Sound's Water Treatment Plant. The project also includes the construction of channel erosion measures to reduce silt and sediment loading downstream from the Storm Water Management Pond.

The erosion control volume will also be maximized from 1,200 m3 to 2,400 m3 to detain the outflow from the current 24-48 hours, to achieve the current criteria of 120 hours, as much as possible, to ensure the stability of the sensitive receiving system. The redesign and reconstruction will include full landscape restoration of the stormwater management facility with the potential inclusion of a Low Impact Development measure at the outlet of the facility if site conditions permit. The scope of the project involves digging down to the problem valve and frost-damaged water main, then draining the excavation (a naturally wet area) with the services of a hydrovac truck and operator from Thunder Bay (540 km away). The damaged water main, including sections north and south of the Tee-junction feeding the problem hydrant and the line to the hydrant will be replaced with 150-millimetre pre-insulated polyvinyl chloride pipe and the replaced valve and hydrant stem will be insulated. The objective is to avoid future line-freezes and resultant valve and water main damage with the anticipated outcome being a reliable water service to properties served by the line and reliable water supply for fire-suppression.

properties.Name: Drinking Water Supply Transmission Mains and Secondary Membrane Water Treatment
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project works will include: - Installation of approximately 5.5 km of water transmission main; - Installation of secondary backwash treatment from primary membranes; - Mechanical piping and support structure for sand separation at pump station; - Installation of UV module for secondary treatment; and, - Additional requirements for sand separators.
Construction Start Date:2017-07-03
Construction End Date:2019-10-31

properties.Name: Main Lift Station Upgrade
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project includes pumps and wet well sized for the projected population over the next 25 years. New building, electrical controls and backup generator, call outs, SCADA, and automation.
Construction Start Date:2017-06-30
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Subdivision Drainage Plan Study
properties.Description:
Project Description:Topical survey, option analysis and study to determine cause of existing subdivision drainage problems and provide recommendations for the rehabilitation/upgrades to the roadside drainage deficiencies. Benefits include reduced flooding of basements, reduced costs of ground water pumps and improved road safety in flood conditions for off and on reserve population.
Construction Start Date:2017-04-01
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Granular activated carbon (GAC) filter replacement
properties.Description:
Project Description:Project will remove, dispose, replace and put into service the Granular Activated Carbon (GAC) filter(s) which will improve water quality issues. Completion of this project will ensure that safe reliable drinking water is available and reduce the potential for additional pressure on the province's health care.
Construction Start Date:2017-04-01
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Water Treatment Plant Regulatory Upgrades
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project works will include: - Installation of three UV reactors; - Isolation valves and mechanical piping; - Replacement of filter bed media and air scour systems; and - Electrical and SCADA upgrades.
Construction Start Date:2017-07-31
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: New Construction, Standby Emergency Power for various Wells #1, 4, 8, and Hillcrest Pump Station, at Well 4, 4262 Tottenham Road, New Tecumseth
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** These upgrades will provide emergency standby backup power for Municipal Wells #1, 4, 8, and Hillcrest Pump Station, ensuring the security of supply in times of power loss for the residents and businesses of New Tecumseth, including primary employers and health services such as Honda Manufacturing of Canada, Baxter Corporation, and Alliston Memorial Hospital (servicing a population of 24,800 for Alliston and Beeton). The result of these upgrades will increase emergency firm local capacity from 7,839m3 to 11,452m3 during power outages. Original timeframe for these upgrades was scheduled for 2020, and as a result of this funding the upgrades can now be expedited, and will allow for earlier implementation and ensure the continuance of essential services for Town residents and businesses. The original scope of work included for the addition of new exterior pad mounted generators at each location and tie into existing Motor Control Centre's (MCC's) for electrical connections. During design investigation at Well #1 it was determined that the existing configuration could not accommodate the additional equipment and would not meet Electrical Safety Code requirements due to space limitations within the existing facility. As such, a complete building expansion with footings and foundations will be required, increasing the scope and cost of this project. The cost increase associated with this has increased from an original estimated value of $785,000 to $1.4M. This resulted in staff having to delay the project and seek additional funding from Council. The result the delay awaiting receipt of approval of Council and the increased scope of work have drastically increased the timeline associated with this project. Due to delays in developing the agreement, an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline is required.
Construction Start Date:2017-06-11
Construction End Date:2019-05-31

properties.Name: New Wastewater Mains and Pump Station
properties.Description:
Project Description:Objective: Increase capacity and reliability of wastewater collection system. Scope: Plan, design and construct lift station, gravity pipeline, force main, and all associated works. Output: New lift station, gravity main, and new forcemain.
Construction Start Date:2017-09-25
Construction End Date:2018-12-31

properties.Name: Connection of secondary water distribution lines from the Redditt water system to 44 local residents' homes.
properties.Description:
Project Description:The focus of this project is to replace (rehabilitate) the water distribution system from the secondary distribution lines to 44 individual residences. The current system is deteriorated, is at the end of its life, and has suffered a number of breaks. The size of the replacement line to be installed is 25mm poly or copper line. It is anticipated that there will be approximately 1350 meters of line installed. Given the nature of our project and that the work can only be completed during the summer, spring and early autumn, we believe that we would be able to fully complete our project only after March 31, 2018. Therefore, we request and extension to the March 31, 2018 deadline noting that we anticipate being able to complete the project by the end of August 2018. The eligible costs are limited to public/municipal property and assets.
Construction Start Date:2017-08-21
Construction End Date:2018-12-31

properties.Name: Repairs at Water Treatment Plant
properties.Description:
Project Description:Replace old furnaces at water treatment plant to protect water treatment plant from freezing over and to protect important infrastructure. (2) New KLR-200 furnaces - labour, freight and the necessary venting. Off-reserve benefits are reduced burden to provincial health care system by improved water quality.
Construction Start Date:2017-10-01
Construction End Date:2017-12-08

properties.Name: Southwest Middlesex Graham Road Pumping Station/Reservoir Upgrade
properties.Description:
Project Description:Replace an old motor in the pump at the reservoir with a high efficient one to reduce energy consumption and to ensure resiliency in the pumping station/reservoir
Construction Start Date:2017-04-12
Construction End Date:2018-06-30

properties.Name: Combined Sewer Separation
properties.Description:
Project Description:This project consists of separating approximately 1900 m of combined sewers which will reduce the load on the existing sanitary system and reduce the quantity of sewer required to be treated. There are approximately 4.5 km of combined sewers within the City. The City will reconstruct Cobb Lane, Elswick Road, Marcelle Ave and lower West Valley Road (Humber Park to Central). Work to include new separate sanitary and storm sewers, new waterline, street reconstruction and reinstatement.
Construction Start Date:2017-05-23
Construction End Date:2019-07-15

properties.Name: Jd kline filter media and underdrain replacement
properties.Description:
Project Description:Replacement of the existing filter media and underdrains in all eight filters at J.D. Kline Water Supply Plant / majority are beyond recommended life span
Construction Start Date:2017-11-23
Construction End Date:2019-12-31

properties.Name: West Booster Reservoir Replacement and New PRV Station
properties.Description:
Project Description:Replace the West Booster Reservoir. Install new PRV stations on Vallee Lourdes Drive and Sunset Drive as well as a check valve at St. Simon Street. Rationale: Project has been re-scoped; instead of replacing three pumps, the Recipient would like to install an additional PRV station and a check valve. With the revised scope, the project is expected to come in under budget. The Province has proposed to use the savings ($160,000) to fund project 6990-2042 submitted under project list 5.
Construction Start Date:2017-05-23
Construction End Date:2018-07-31

properties.Name: Courtice Water Pollution Control Plant - Resource Recovery Study - Phase 2 (energy and resource recovery)
properties.Description:
Project Description:This Phase 2 study will focus on selected energy and resource recovery options identified in the previously completed Phase 1 study. We will prepare preliminary engineering design options for each measure or combination of measures, and will further develop the process design and economic evaluation for each measure. The options to be further evaluated include biogas optimization (including combined heat plant, renewable natural gas, vehicle biofuel), anaerobic digester optimization (sludge thickening, thermal hydrolysis), and advanced aeration system optimization. Due to delays in developing the Transfer Payment Agreement and subsequent delays in procurement and its impact on construction schedule, we are requesting an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline to ensure successful completion of the project.
Construction Start Date:2017-08-10
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Allen Road installation of new 150 mm watermain to complete looping
properties.Description:
Project Description:New 150 mm Watermain loop from Parkhouse Drive to south of Mill Road (750 m) to provide back-up transmission main and improve pressure/fire flows
Construction Start Date:2017-07-24
Construction End Date:2018-08-11

properties.Name: Lagoon Expansion and Wetland
properties.Description:
Project Description:Construction of a new secondary cell in wastewater treatment facility to improve winter storage capacity, and a four cell engineered wetland for nutrient reduction. This will reduce impacts of effluent on the Rat and Red Rivers, and Lake Winnipeg.
Construction Start Date:2017-05-02
Construction End Date:2017-10-13

properties.Name: Trenton Water Treatment Plant Backwash
properties.Description:
Project Description:In an effort to reduce the demand on the Waste Water Treatment Plant (WWTP) in Trenton, and to reduce operating costs, the City proposes the installation of a floating decant system (including a decant pump and controls) in the Trenton Water Treatment Plants (WTP) backwash waste tanks. This decant system will remove the clear water from the tank and discharge it to the nearby Trent River so that minimum waste is sent to the WWTP. Currently, approximately 6% of the total flow (approx. total flow is 12000 cu.m) to the WWTP is process water, generated from the Trenton WTP. The new decant system would, on average, result in a net reduction of flow to the plant of 400 cubic meters per day and optimization of the City's asset.
Construction Start Date:2017-02-01
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Tilton Lake Road - Culvert Replacement
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** "Replace existing culvert that is failing with a 1800mm x 1200mm concrete box culvert including road restoration and guide rails. The decrease of $163,961 in total project costs ($81,981 in federal funding) is due to the culvert replacement contract tender prices for this scope of work coming in lower than the budgetary estimates. The scope of the project remains the same. IO NOTE: There is no decrease in scope, only a decrease in tender. This will result in a decrease in Federal Funding of $81,981 to be reallocated to IDS17-12."
Construction Start Date:2017-10-02
Construction End Date:2017-12-15

properties.Name: NRDRWC -Wastewater Transmission Line - Lacombe/Blackfalds to Red Deer WWTP
properties.Description:
Project Description:NRDRWWC is constructing a regional wastewater pipeline from the City of Lacombe to the Town of Blackfalds and on the City of Red Deer Wastewater Treatment Plant. The project includes: approximately 26 km of 700 mm (OD) forcemain, 2 wastewater lift stations (Lacombe and Blackfalds), and an odour management facility.
Construction Start Date:2016-05-07
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Water Treatment Plant Retrofit
properties.Description:
Project Description:Upgrade water treatment plant, including the installation a single control system, monitoring equipment and new piping, pumps, and corrosion prevention.
Construction Start Date:2018-11-01
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Meadowbank Wellfield Upgrade
properties.Description:
Project Description:Rehabilitate the Meadowbank Wellfield by replacing well #3 and new yard piping to control building. Upgrade the control building by increasing contact time to meet 4 log reduction standard, and installing a chlorine analyzer and backup power supply.
Construction Start Date:2017-06-05
Construction End Date:2017-11-01

properties.Name: Summerside Wellfield #2
properties.Description:
Project Description:This project consists of the installation of four new wells along with a control building complete with electrical, mechanical, chlorine system, wellhead structures, sitework, water mains from each well to control building and a water main to the City's water infrastructure on an adjacent roadway. The new well field will replace old wells spread throughout the City and help maintain the City's resource of adequate quantity and quality water for years to come.
Construction Start Date:2017-12-01
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Behchoko Water Supply Study
properties.Description:
Project Description:West Channel Intake will be assessed to propose long term solutions , and cost estimates of options to support water supply.
Construction Start Date:2017-01-01
Construction End Date:2018-08-01

properties.Name: Stormwater inflow and infiltration project
properties.Description:
Project Description:Upgrade exisiting storm sewer systems in 4 communities. Project includes replacing 5835m pipe as well as repairing/replacing manholes, catchbasins, and redirecting of stormwater flows, etc. Lower stormwater inflow and infiltration will reduce operating costs of treatment.
Construction Start Date:2017-01-16
Construction End Date:2018-12-31

properties.Name: Connaught Park Trunk Collection Sewer Upgrades
properties.Description:
Project Description:The upgrade will replace an existing trunk sanitary sewer that is undersized for current demands. Additionally, replacement will allow a residential development of approximately 450 homes to proceed. The collection line services approximately 550 existing homes in addition to the future development, a new 450mm diameter Polyvinyl Chloride (PVC) pipe will be installed approximately over the 1,100 meters. Due to regulatory requirements and/or permit delays, we are requesting an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline to ensure successful completion of the project.
Construction Start Date:2016-04-01
Construction End Date:2018-09-30

properties.Name: Replacement of Sanitary Sewer connections on First Avenue: Memorial Avenue to Fort William Road
properties.Description:
Project Description:Replacement of failing sanitary sewer connections coordinated with stormwater and watermain rehabilitation which impacts 17 customers. The sanitary sewer services on this street are old and becoming an ongoing maintenance concern. This work will replace the sanitary sewer services from the sewer main to the property line with modern materials, extending their life by 75-100 years. The 17 services will be replaced with 135mm Polyvinyl Chloride (PVC-SDR 28) pipe, a total of approximately 170 meters of pipe.
Construction Start Date:2017-06-01
Construction End Date:2017-10-01

properties.Name: Aeration System Upgrades to Pond 1, Cell 2 - Phase 2
properties.Description:
Project Description:Replace existing coarse bubble diffuser aeration system in Pond 1, Cell 2 of the lagoon with a floating fine bubble diffuser aeration system.
Construction Start Date:2017-11-14
Construction End Date:2017-11-30

properties.Name: Engineering Design & Approvals for the Dorchester Wastewater Treatment Plant expansion to 1200 cubic meters capacity
properties.Description:
Project Description:"The Dorchester Wastewater Treatment Plant expansion will see the plant capacity increase from 520 to 1200 cubic meters using sequencing batch reactor technology to accommodate current residential and employment lands growth needs. Due to delays in developing the Transfer Payment Agreement and subsequent delays in procurement and its impact on construction schedule, we are requesting an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline to ensure successful completion of the project."
Construction Start Date:2017-07-17
Construction End Date:2018-09-29

properties.Name: Valley Road - Richardson Street Watermain Connection
properties.Description:
Project Description:The proposed watermain connection from Valley Road to Richardson Street will provide a second connection between north and south Rockwood and reduce reliance on 40 year old thin walled watermain which is prone to breaks. This is an important connection as fire storage for Rockwood is located in the south portion. There is a single watermain connection along Highway 7 (Main Street South) in Rockwood which connects north and south Rockwood and there have been recent breaks where fire protection has been lost in north Rockwood. The project would consist of approximately 260 meters of new 250 mm diameter watermain and replacement of approximately 100 meters of existing 150 mm diameter watermain with new 250 watermain. Given the layout of Rockwood, this is the best possible location to provide a much needed second connection point between north and south Rockwood. This connection was identified as a need during the infrastructure review as part of the Townships 2015 Water Rate Study. It was scheduled as a 2019 project in the Final Rate Study.
Construction Start Date:2016-11-01
Construction End Date:2018-06-30

properties.Name: Mont-Cervin, phases 2, 3 and 4
properties.Description:
Project Description:The purpose of the project is to extend the water supply and sewer systems to service 216 permanent residences in the Mont Cervin area.
Construction Start Date:2017-06-01
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Watermain extension on Regional Rd. 25 (Consumers Dr.) extension from east of Thickson Rd. to Thornton Rd. to service industrial lands
properties.Description:
Project Description:This project will be extending the watermain 1.5 km to the east with a proposed 300 mm Polyvinyl Chloride (PVC) watermain. The proposed watermain will service the general/prestige industrial lands in the surrounding area for economic development. March 2019 extension - the Region has requested extension to accommodate the lead time to apply and receive regulatory approvals, procure equipment and extensive construction schedule due to the complexity of the projects
Construction Start Date:2018-01-30
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Stormwater Drainage Study and design of stormwater management facilities(s) to service Lime Kiln Road.
properties.Description:
Project Description:Undertake a stormwater management study for Lime Kiln Road, a haul route for logging, concrete and aggregate providers, as well as a connecting link between 2 County Roads. Define the project's stormwater management design criteria including quantity control, flood protection, water quality, and erosion control methods. Liaise with Ministry of Natural Resources regards to suitable methods of controlling drainage while having regard for wetland protection and natural watercourses affecting the road (base materials and flood conditions) and downstream outlet(s).
Construction Start Date:2017-10-01
Construction End Date:2018-10-31

properties.Name: Steele Valley Stormwater Management Pond Rehabilitation and Repair
properties.Description:
Project Description:The Steele Valley Stormwater Management Pond (SWMF#16) requires pond rehabilitation with alterations to the outlet structure that manages stormwater discharge to Millers Creek during peak storm events, repair to access road, installation of new chain gate and removal of sediment off site as per Ministry of the environment and climate criteria. This project will help maintain the existing wetland and wildlife habitat and prevent localized flooding and erosion issues on Millers Creek, as well as provide water quality improvements through nutrient retention and water filtration that this stormwater management facility provides when operating as designed. This project is a major repair and requires large excavation equipment and hauling away of potentially hazards material which is not routine. Due to weather-sensitive work that must be completed outside of winter months, we are requesting an extension beyond March 31, 2018, to ensure successful completion of the project.
Construction Start Date:2017-07-04
Construction End Date:2018-11-30

properties.Name: Upgrade of equipment of treatment of wastewater in the STEP
properties.Description:
Project Description:Various works to the treatment station: the replacement of the grit chamber; the addition of a screen end, broadcasters with fine bubbles; blowers, the increase in the diameter of the discharge pipe between the pumping station of rehabilitation and the grit chamber, the addition of automation system.
Construction Start Date:2017-10-02
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Construction of a sewer main connecting the Belle Neige sector to Val-Morin
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project will replace the infiltration fields in the centre of the Belle-Neige village and ski centre by connecting the sewer system of this sector to aerated ponds in the Val-David sector. The implementation of a sanitary sewer line between the Belle-Neige sector and the Val-Morin system is planned, as well as the replacement of the water main, the looping of water mains of the Croissant Legault system and the refurbishment of storm sewers. Work also includes renovating Val-Morin's main pumping station and installing a force main.
Construction Start Date:2017-08-07
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: New Wastewater Forcemain
properties.Description:
Project Description:Objective: Resolve capacity and reliability concerns of existing sewage forcemain. Scope: Plan, design and construct appx 760 m of appx 150 mm diameter forcemain, and all associated works. Output: Upgraded sewage forcemain.
Construction Start Date:2017-12-21
Construction End Date:2018-12-31

properties.Name: Ben Nevis & Dewitt Water Pumping Station Upgrade
properties.Description:
Project Description:Replace three pumps and motors and motor control centre to increase the stations firm capacity from 26 L/s to 130 L/s. Repair or replace process valves and piping. Replace emergency generator and associated controls. Repair valve chamber structures, building structural and building architectural elements to increase service life of assets. Replace interior and exterior lighting with high efficiency LED for enhanced security and energy efficiency. Replace site fencing to enhance security on site. Resurface access roadway to increase service life of the asset. This pumping station serves a population of approximately 12,300.
Construction Start Date:2017-10-02
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Construction of 375-450mm Stormwater Separation Sewer on Selkirk Street - Arthur Street to Cuthbertson Place and Cuthbertson Place - Selkirk St to Franklin St.
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** "Storm sewer separation on a portion of Selkirk Street and Cuthbertson Street to construct 175m of new 375-450mm diameter Polyvinyl Chloride (PVC) storm sewers and separate existing catch basins from the combined sewer. Directly services 22 households. 16,500 square meters area of impact. IO NOTE: There is no decrease in scope, only a decrease in tender. This will result in a decrease in Federal Funding of $5,359.50 to be reallocated."
Construction Start Date:2017-06-01
Construction End Date:2018-10-01

properties.Name: Replacement of Existing 150mm Cast Iron Watermain on Court Street - John Street to Bay Street
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** "Replacement of existing 100yr old cast iron water main with 425 m of 200mm Polyvinyl Chloride (PVC) pipe and replacement of lead service connections to property line. This main services 37 residences and businesses. Coordinated with sanitary sewer replacement. IO NOTE: There is no decrease in scope, only a decrease in tender. This will result in a decrease in Federal Funding of $75,978."
Construction Start Date:2017-06-01
Construction End Date:2017-10-01

properties.Name: Water pipe replacement
properties.Description:
Project Description:Pipe replacement work for the maintenance of public water services for 12 road sections totalling 0.874 km.
Construction Start Date:2017-06-05
Construction End Date:2018-11-30

properties.Name: The retention basin of wastewater
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project is to build a underground basin of retention in order to contain the overflows upstream of the treatment plant.
Construction Start Date:2017-05-08
Construction End Date:2018-11-24

properties.Name: Assessment of Noelville Wastewater/Stormwater Infrastructure Upgrades
properties.Description:
Project Description:This project will provide an assessment, feasibility and detailed engineering plan for the rehabilitation and upgrade of the wastewater and stormwater infrastructure in the community of Noelville.
Construction Start Date:2017-08-22
Construction End Date:2018-09-30

properties.Name: Rehabilitation (remediation activities) to specific wastewater collection system areas identified as priorities by technical Feasibility Study and Inspections Report.
properties.Description:
Project Description:Make repairs and rehabilitate damaged mains within the wastewater system in the most critical/priority areas to address inflow and infiltration problems as identified by the inspections and imaging described in the technical Feasibility Study and Inspections report. This rehabilitation will improve system optimization through reduced inflow and infiltration. The Town's wastewater system currently has annual costs that exceed annual revenues. This project will greatly assist in reducing costs and making the system more efficient to alleviate this issue.
Construction Start Date:2017-06-01
Construction End Date:2017-10-31

properties.Name: Looping of the Île-du-Havre-Aubert system
properties.Description:
Project Description:The purpose of the project is to install approximately 2 km of water main to loop the Île-du-Havre-Aubert system.
Construction Start Date:2016-05-01
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Sewage Force Main Upgrade
properties.Description:
Project Description:Design and construction of a 100mm force main from the community of Woodlands to the Woodlands lagoon. This line will service existing commercial businesses, commercial lots and a number of residential homes.
Construction Start Date:2017-11-28
Construction End Date:2018-01-19

properties.Name: Detailed Design and Phase 1A construction for the Edgeley Storm water Management Pond Improvements in the Vaughan Metropolitan Centre
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** "Detailed Design Scope This project will complete the design of improvements to the City's existing storm water management pond. The goal of this project is to create a signature public destination that provides innovative sustainable storm water management, highlights historic and cultural value of the area, incorporates active and passive recreation and advances Vaughans city-building efforts in light of the significant transit investments in the downtown. Redevelopment of Edgeley Pond and Park, as part of the Black Creek corridor renewal, is important to moving development in Vaughan's new downtown forward. The project will involve an extensive consultation with stakeholders, landowners, agencies, and the public. The detailed design process will be developed over 2017 and early 2018. Phase 1A Construction Scope This project will complete the initial phase of construction improvements to the City's existing storm water management pond. This initial phase of the project will involve the majority of civil works including site preparation, mobilization, earthworks, erosion and sediment control. Anticipated start of construction is Q2-2018. Due to delays in developing the agreement and increased project complexity, an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline is required. IO NOTE: As a result of the increased scope, there is an increase in Federal Funding of $517,500 to be reallocated."
Construction Start Date:2016-10-10
Construction End Date:2020-12-31

properties.Name: Installation of Ultraviolet (UV-254) technology to monitor the efficiency of the process removing organic matter at Hearst's Water Treatment Plant
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** "The addition of an ultra violet (UV) Total Organic Compound (TOC) measuring instrument will permit OCWA (Ontario Clean Water Agency - the operator of the Town's water treatment plant) to monitor the efficiency of TOC removal in order to limit the formation of disinfection by-products (DBP) such as Trihalomethanes (THMs). For many years, the Hearst Water Treatment Plant has experienced excessive THMs counts in the water distribution system. The MOECC has ordered the Town to implement a strategy for water treatment to reduce THMs. This technology will enable OCWA to better balance the water treatment chemicals that affect THM levels and optimize the quality of the community's water supply. The budget estimate provided by OCWA for this project utilised data from a 2014 study where different technologies were explored to reduce THMs, including the use of UV254 technology. Since that study, the pricing has come down due to market conditions and available competitive products. In fact, upgraded units have been installed rather than those that were originally considered at the project onset. Due to delays in developing the agreement and consequent local priority changes, an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline is required. IO NOTE: There is no decrease in scope, but a decrease in tender. This will result in a decrease of Federal Funding of $13,000 to be reallocated to HEA-001 and HEA-003."
Construction Start Date:2017-08-17
Construction End Date:2018-03-16

properties.Name: Design and Construction of the Craig Henry Neighborhood Flood Protection Improvements Including Re-profiling and Storm Pipe Upsizing
properties.Description:
Project Description:This project is to complete the design and the construction of various pipe upgrades and reprofiling of depressed driveways to protect homes from flooding. The Craig Henry neighbourhood area has experienced basement flood several times in the recent past. Through studies, various measures have been identified to mitigate the risk of flooding. These measures include reprofiling driveways (14) to protect homes from flooding via surface drainage. Several sections of storm pipe require upsizing including along Knoxdale Road ( 375 metres of 1050 mm storm sewer upsized to 1350 mm), along Woodfield-Lansfield-Kidgrove Gardens the sections of storm sewers requiring upsizing include: 310 metres of 750 mm sewer resized to 1200 mm, 90 metres of 900 mm storm sewer resized to 1200 mm and 160 metres of 1050 mm storm sewer resized to 1200mm. The nature and extent of the work (the design, procurement and construction) are not feasibly achievable within a single construction season and require an extension beyond March 31, 2018 . Furthermore, until formal Federal funding approval is provided, the City cannot complete the procurement for the construction phase of this project.
Construction Start Date:2017-04-18
Construction End Date:2019-09-30

properties.Name: Carmi Water Reservoir Storage Capacity Upgrade
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project works will include: - Mobilization and demobilization; - Construction of a 1,300 m3 water storage reservoir; - Related electrical and instrumentation works; and, - Civil and site works.
Construction Start Date:2017-03-13
Construction End Date:2018-03-01

properties.Name: St. Lawrence Avenue Sewer Separation and Watermain Replacement - Removal/disposal of sanitary sewers and replace with new storm sewer.  Removal/disposal of watermain and replace with new watermain.
properties.Description:
Project Description:Project is needed for sewer separation; to reduce basement flooding potential downstream and combined sewer overflow events. Watermain and roads are in poor condition. Limits extend from Park St. to Simcoe St. and including Ellis St. from St. Lawrence Avenue to approximately 60 meter east. Replace Combined Sewer with 688 meter of new Sanitary Sewer and 776 meter of new Storm Sewers. 688 meter of new Watermain and Road Reconstruction including new sidewalks, curb and gutter. Project includes new sanitary lateral with cleanouts at the property line and new water services with curb stops at the property line for 29 lots. Hydrants will also be replaced.
Construction Start Date:2017-12-04
Construction End Date:2018-07-31

properties.Name: Potable Water Reservoir Upgrade
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project includes the removal of the existing water reservoir and the building of a new 2000m3 water reservoir, as well the connection to the existing system.
Construction Start Date:2017-07-15
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Water Distribution Pumping Station Retrofit
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project includes building structural upgrades, process upgrades, mechanical upgrades and electrical upgrades.
Construction Start Date:2019-03-31
Construction End Date:2020-03-31

properties.Name: New Water Intake and Supply System at Elbow
properties.Description:
Project Description:Objective: Mitigate the risk of failure of the system supplying raw water to the water treatment plant. Scope: Plan, design and construct a lake intake, pump station and appx 1.5 km pipeline to the water treatment plant, and all associated works. Output: New intake structures with fish screens, appx two casing and intake pipes, new pump station, new water supply line at Elbow.
Construction Start Date:2017-04-30
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Repairs and Upgrades to Wastewater Lagoon
properties.Description:
Project Description:Repair outlet valve (both are seized). Reset valve box and install lid, clean out inlet. Remove weeds and brush. Replace deteriorated fencing. Fill required on berm by outlet structure. Off-reserve benefits are protection to receiving environment from wastewater discharge.
Construction Start Date:2017-02-01
Construction End Date:2018-03-01

properties.Name: Rehabilitation of key infrastructure including the chlorine analyzer distribution systen and generator at the Crysler Sewage Pumping Station
properties.Description:
Project Description:Key Infrastructure replacement and rehabilitation include the chlorine analyzer distribution system, the overhaul of the generator, the replacement and installation of an alum feed pump and replacement and installation of a new submersible pump at the lagoon. Without the rehabilitation of the existing generator, the Township would not have a back up power in the event of a power loss. Additionally, this pumping station also receives effluent from Finch's wastewater and sanitary sewer system. Ensuring these key pieces of infrastructure are maintained and rehabilitated will impact approximately 1200 people.
Construction Start Date:2017-04-01
Construction End Date:2017-09-30

properties.Name: Replacement of a 2100mm diameter stormwater culvert on Maple Road.
properties.Description:
Project Description:The replacement of the large stormwater culvert will see the removal of the existing deteriorating pipe, including some ditching work. properties.Name: Replace 2 Turbidity meters, transfer switch and media, and Pump station (1 and 2) chlorine and electrical upgrades

Project objectives: * Improve water filtration process * Upgrade disinfection system monitoring to comply with drinking water regulations * Replace electrical components to extend lifespan of pump station and standby power system at Water Treatment Plant Scope of Work: Refer to attached Water System Upgrade/Rehabilitation Spreadsheet for details Output/Benefit of Project: * Water filtration improvements made at the water treatment plant will impact the whole community (285 households/800 residents) * Booster Pump Station #1 improvements will ensure adequate chlorine residuals for 15+ households * Booster Pump Station #2 improvements will ensure reliable power to increase water pressure for 14 households

properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** "Replace all failed pump motor starters and controls. Rehabilitate the Chemical Dosing system and integrate into the Plant Control system. Provide electrical and mechanical repairs as identified by Water Plant operators. Upgrade and repair all filling starters and control devices in the motor control center. Upgrade RVNR (Reduced Voltage Auto Transformer) motor starters with S/State Soft Starters. The off-reserve benefit of the project is to reduce travel and associated medical costs of patients to attend provincial medical aid due to an illness caused by the ineffective water treatment. Due to the challenges of aligning contractors to work in a remote location, an extension is required beyond March 31, 2018. Additional components have been identified as necessary for this project and have been added to the scope: removal of pressure tanks, installation of new pressure reducing valve. IO NOTE: Due to the increase in scope, there will be an increase in Federal Funding of $23,193 to be reallocated from SAC-002."

Construction End Date:2020-03-31

properties.Name: Rehabilitation of hydrants to allow flushing, and to improve drinking water system pressure and reliability
properties.Description:
Project Description:We will repair damaged hydrants in the community. The hydrants repairs are critical for watermain flushing and for ensuring the watermain pressure is maintained in the system. Once the hydrant works are complete we will be able to flush the system once or twice a year, by letting water flow freely out of hydrants to remove the deposits in the watermains and pipes. Leaving deposits in the pipe will reduce the capacity of the watermains to distribute drinking water in the community. Work will be completed in several locations along Pizhew Road, Mikinaa Road, Madden's Road, Blacky's Bay Road, Roundhouse Road, Killer Hill Road, Aazhawaashiik Road, Indian Road, Onigaming Road, Ketemiikana Drive ,Old Madden Road, Abinoonjii Road, Anishinaabe Road, Achitamoo Road, Mashkiig Road, Powwow Trail Road, and Siibiinsing Road. The project scope will include the following: 1.) We will replace or repair the seal at hydrant #11. This hydrant is near the school rink, and the seal is badly corroded and pitted. Every time it is opened the rubber washer wears away and the metal seat may fail. 2.) We will replace or repair the shaft at Hydrant #14. This hydrant is near Jimmy spruce, and the shaft is bent and is difficult to open and close. 3.) We will replace or repair stripped metal fixtures at hydrant #15. This hydrant is near Fred kelly, and because the metal part is stripped we have to operate it using the shut off valve next to the hydrant creating a serious water pressure issue. 4.) We will purchase and install rubber washer for five hydrants that are chipped or over compressed. To complete the work we will also need to clear the areas around the hydrants, and will install safety markings at each hydrant. The off-reserve benefits of improving the reliability of water services to the community include reducing the risk of system failure and mitigating the potential impact on the health care system of the province.
Construction Start Date:2017-01-02
Construction End Date:2018-03-01

properties.Name: Elmvale Waste Water Treatment Plant Clarifier Covers Design

It is like this across the board for most FN communities trying to utilize this fund. Off-reserve Benefits: Project will prevent an environmental catastrophe from wastewater discharge it would serve the community and surrounding provincial park as well as downstream communities. Project Scope: This project is to acquire the drawings and advice from a registered professional and install the required fill to strengthen the earthen berm. IO NOTE: This project is being submitted based on the fact that LLC-001 can no longer be funded by CWWF. This project will receive the reallocated Federal Funding of $59,839.00 from LLC-002. "

properties.Name: Stormwater Management and Pond Maintenance
properties.Description:
Project Description:"Guelph's stormwater system consists of 477 Kilometres of sewer pipes, 11,900 drain or catch basins, 120 management facilities such as stormwater ponds and 143 oil-grit separators. Guelph's stormwater infrastructure requires rehabilitation, particularly at two of the City's critical facilities. Repair of the two high priority ponds will reduce potential for flooding of local upstream urban areas and significantly improve quality of water and eco-system health of the Eramosa and Speed Rivers and their tributaries. Critical rehabilitation such as inlet/outlet repairs will be completed along with sediment removal to restore the full capacity and benefits of the facilities. Guelph's 2012 Sustainable Infrastructure Report and Infrastructure Scorecard showed that stormwater infrastructure is currently funded at less than half of the estimated amount needed to sustain the system with a $4.1 million funding gap. Construction would begin as of July 1, 2017 with completion by September of 2017, broken down by $1,200,000 for the Tovell Drive at Elmira Road Pond, and $300,000 for the Hilldale Pond. Scope Change Request: The City was able to complete the required repairs to two of its priority ponds (Tovell Drive at Elmira Road Pond and Holldale Pond) through CWWF funding, efficiently and under budget. In addition to these two facilities, the City has prioritized sediment removal for all the City owned stormwater management ponds based on their available capacity. As such, the City would like to request a simple expansion to the project to include: 1. Pond ID: 3 - Hanlon Road/Shadybrook Cresent Pond (Estimated Cost of $650,320) 2. Pond ID: 73 - Hazelwood Drive/Quail Creek Drive Pond (Estimated Cost of $228,100). The scope of work would be the same as previous 2 facilities and the City is confident that it can complete this work in the same efficient manner as was demonstrated previously.
Construction Start Date:2017-09-01
Construction End Date:2020-03-31

properties.Description:

A preliminary geomorphic study is required to assess the extent of the problem and to develop concept design alternatives for sanitary protection works. This study will provide a better understanding of our local water resources and enable innovative designs to reduce sediment inputs into local waterways, improve habitat and provide infrastructure protection. This project is located near Bayview Avenue and Proctor Avenue in the Town of Richmond Hill.
Construction Start Date:2017-05-01
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Replace existing storm sewer and appurtenances, and construct a Stormwater Management Pond
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project will replace and upsize 525m of deteriorating and aging storm sewer, improve inlet infrastructure and provide a stormwater retention facility. The objective of the project is to reduce frequency and extent of surface flooding on public and private properties, and reduce surcharging of storm sewers in high flow events without increasing flows to downstream components of the system. It is also intended to replace aging and failing existing sewers. The existing sewers range from 300 mm to 1050 mm diameter. The new sewers will range from 300 mm to 2100 mm diameter. The existing material is corrugated steel pipe and concrete, and proposed pipe material for small bore pipe is PVC and large bore will be reinforced concrete. One portion of the sewer will be a 1.8m by 1.2m concrete box culvert. The Stormwater Management Facility is designed for a 1 in 100 year return period and the Regional Storm, and design storm volume in the retention facility is approximately 8 hectare-meters (80,000 cubic meters). Due to delays in developing the Transfer Payment Agreement and subsequent delays in procurement and its impact on construction schedule, we are requesting an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline to ensure successful completion of the project.
Construction Start Date:2017-07-17
Construction End Date:2018-11-02

properties.Name: Lagoon UV Disinfection System

properties.Description:

The current concrete pipe installed in the 1960's is presumed to be exhibiting interior spalling and loss of interior surface based in CCTV of a neighbouring pipes that were installed in the same installation period. The adjoining watermain is deemed to be in good condition and the road surface has been repaved within the last 3 years making this project an excellent choice for rehabilitation. This rehabilitation will avoid open cut trenching that will minimize the disruption to approximately 18 residential homes along the length of pipe being rehabilitated.

Due to delays in tendering, we are requesting an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline to ensure successful completion of the project. This project was tendered in Spring 2017, but only one bid was received and the Town of Cobourg requires a minimum of two bids before awarding a contract. There is a clear lack of capacity for contractors to finish the work within the original timeline. The Town will re-tender in the fall when contractor pricing is more competitive, for construction in 2018.

This project affects the community of Freelton.

properties.Name: Newmarket watermain condition assessment program
properties.Description:
Project Description:The Town of Newmarket has aging water infrastructure and there is little information on the condition of its watermains. The lack of condition assessment information increases the risk of failure and the Towns ability to deliver safe and reliable drinking water services. This project will develop a watermain condition assessment program and conduct assessments of critical infrastructure. The program will include utilizing innovative techniques to inspect and determine watermain condition and determine remediation methodology (replace, reline, cathodic protection) using industry best practices. The immediate needs for a watermain condition assessment program include reducing water main breaks and associated water damage, extending the operating life of distribution system watermains, extending budget investments by timely rehabilitation and replacement of aging watermains, decreasing water production and distribution costs by reducing non-revenue water loss and understanding the true condition of the Towns buried assets. Due to delays in developing the Transfer Payment Agreement and subsequent delays in procurement and its impact on construction schedule, we are requesting an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline to ensure successful completion of the project.
Construction Start Date:2017-11-30
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Upgrade the Wastewater Treatment Centre and Construct Tertiary Filter and Blower Buildings for Process Optimization, and Tertiary Treatment to meet Lake Simcoe Effluent phosphorus limits
properties.Description:
Project Description:"The upgrades to the WWTC will reduce phosphorus to less than 0.1 mg/L in the treated effluent prior to effluent entering Lake Simcoe. The project involves construction of a new Tertiary Filter Building (18 m x 22 m) and lift station complete with cloth media filter equipment to facilitate phosphorus removal from the treated effluent. In addition, the upgrade will include the retrofit of the aeration process air equipment as well as the construction of a new blower building for optimization of the WWTC processes, including automation. Due to additional time required to complete preparatory work (i.e. EAs/soil testing/identifying utilities etc.), we are requesting an extension beyond March 31, 2018, to ensure successful completion of the project."
Construction Start Date:2016-11-17
Construction End Date:2018-09-30

properties.Name: Main Street and Mill Lane Storm Sewer Installation
properties.Description:
Project Description:The installation of these storm sewers will consist of high density polyethylene (HDPE) material, 450 mm piping 2 m deep and 175 m in length allowing for proper drainage in this area of Town. This drainage project will affect more than 30 households and assist the flow of that portion of Main Street drainage.
Construction Start Date:2017-04-01
Construction End Date:2017-12-31

properties.Name: King Street cast iron watermain upgrade
properties.Description:
Project Description:This project consists of the removal of an aging cast iron watermain installed in 1891 along King Street in Niagara on the Lake to be replaced by 765 metres of 250 millimetre diameter polyvinyl chloride watermain. Cast iron watermain replacement has been a Town initiative for a number of years and remains a priority until all older watermains have been replaced to conform to the Region and Town standards. In particular, it is beneficial to the residents of this area because of the susceptibility of the older mains to break or rupture under extreme weather conditions. It will also ensure that residents receive the highest quality water supply.
Construction Start Date:2017-12-12
Construction End Date:2018-05-31

properties.Name: Upper York Sewage Servicing Membrane Filtration System Pilot Study
properties.Description:
Project Description:The Upper York Sewage Servicing membrane filtration system performance pilot study will demonstrate the ability of the system to meet performance criteria through a 1 year demonstration. A membrane filtration system will undergo a performance demonstration at the Keswick Water Resource Recovery Facility to ensure the system can meet expected performance for the future Water Reclamation Centre. Attributes such as instantaneous flux, recovery, permeability and phosphorus and solids removal will be evaluated.
Construction Start Date:2017-05-15
Construction End Date:2018-09-30

properties.Name: Improve and replace key infrastructure including pump #2 and flow meter at the Moose Creek Lagoon
properties.Description:
Project Description:The Moose Creek Lagoon has a few key projects that are needed in order to address existing limitations to the treatment of sewage at the Moose Creek Lagoon. Of the pressing infrastructure improvements, pump #2 needs to be replaced, as well as a new 12 inch effluent flow meter as identified in the Master Plan for the Township's water and wastewater treatment facilities. The flow meter forms a critical piece of this infrastructure. Improvements are also needed to modify the main line in order to permit a swab of the main force line. A rebuild of two of the blowers within the Lagoon is also required to extend the life of the blowers.
Construction Start Date:2016-04-01
Construction End Date:2017-09-30

properties.Name: City of Grand Forks 2017 Sewer Phasing Plan
properties.Description:
Project Description:The study will examine and evaluate the feasibility of extending community sewer services to areas of Grand Forks that are currently using on-site septic systems and it will examine the options for dealing with trucked waste in the area and the management of WWTP waste biosolids.
Construction Start Date:2017-02-02
Construction End Date:2018-03-30

properties.Name: Design and Construction of a new Biosolids storage facility to comply with Ministry of Environment and Climate Change guidelines.
properties.Description:
Project Description:The proposed project involves design and construction of a new 1,000,000 Imperial Gallons (4,546 cubic meters) Glass- Fused- to-Steel tank to increase the Biosolids storage capacity at the Hanover waste water treatment plant from 750,000 Imperial Gallons (3,410 cubic meters) to 1,750,000 Imperial Gallons (7,956 cubic meters). The addition of a new Biosolids tank at the waste water treatment plant will provide 240 days of onsite storage as recommended by the Ministry of Environment and Climate Change (MOECC) and mitigate potential environmental risks associated with using temporary Biosolids storage at the waste water treatment plant. Also, with increased Biosolids storage capacity at the waste water treatment plant. The Town will be able to proceed with development of 500 ha (hectares) of lands within our municipal boundary and servicing area. Due to weather-sensitive work that must be completed outside of winter months, we are requesting an extension beyond March 31, 2018, to ensure successful completion of the project. This project requires a period of low ground water flow to accommodate the construction. ECA requirements are currently being completed in order to obtain this approval for late spring construction.
Construction Start Date:2017-10-23
Construction End Date:2018-06-30

properties.Name: Wastewater Treatment Plant - Supervisory control and data acquisition (SCADA) Upgrades
properties.Description:
Project Description:Installation of a new Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA) system for the Waste Water Treatment Plant to address ongoing process and capacity issues. This project is an upgrade to the process automation system which will provide significant increases in system integrity, process efficiency and energy efficiency.
