It will include the supply of computer and backup computer and peripherals. Upgrade iFix software license to current version. Full replacement of Programmable logic controllers (PLC) is also included as well as programming.
Construction Start Date:2017-03-01
Construction End Date:2017-12-01

properties.Name: South Delta Groundwater Well Feasibility Study
properties.Description:
Project Description:Conduct hydrogeological investigation and develop a test groundwater well to estimate short and long term capacity of aquifer.
Construction Start Date:2017-09-25
Construction End Date:2017-09-29

properties.Name: Kaslo Wastewater Treatment Plant Improvements
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project works will include: - Replacement of the Rotating Biological Contactor media, drive shaft and gear box; - Containment and extraction of hazardous atmosphere through installation of solid covers over primary settling tanks, and ventilation equipment; and, - Installation of additional flow metering instrumentation, and interfaces to allow continuous data collection.
Construction Start Date:2018-03-01
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Jousard water reservoir
properties.Description:
Project Description:Construction of potable water reservoir.
Construction Start Date:2017-04-01
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Lift Station Upgrade with SCADA
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project includes the Lift Station Pumps and Controls which are thirty (30) years old and in need of replacement.
Construction Start Date:2018-05-01
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Lift Station Upgrade with SCADA
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project includes the Lift Station Pumps and Controls which are thirty (30) years old and in need of replacement.
Construction Start Date:2017-09-13
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Garden Meadows Reservoir
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project includes major infrastructure repairs to the Garden Meadows Reservoir, which has concrete deterioration to the extent that the community is at risk of contaminated water entering the potable water reservoir.
Construction Start Date:2017-10-31
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Replace Aeration Blowers
properties.Description:
Project Description:Replace 2 1993 50 horsepower blower motors with one high efficiency 75 horsepower motor with anticipated energy savings of 45%
Construction Start Date:2017-10-24
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Treated Water Distribution Upgrades
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project includes water proofing treated water reservoir, supply pump system upgrades, programming, SCADA, controls and instrumentation.
Construction Start Date:2017-04-01
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Class 4 Septic System Replacements (tank and field) for 5 homes.
properties.Description:
Project Description:Animakee Wa Zhing First Nation will conduct the replacement and installation of 5 new individual class 4 septic systems (tank and field). There are 3 individual systems being replaced and there is also currently one system that services two homes which will be replaced with an individual system for each home. The systems have been in operation for approximately 35 years or more and have been assessed by the local Health Canada Environmental Health Officer. A report is on file recommending their replacement. The new systems will be installed by a licensed septic installer (under the Ministry of Housing Building Code Identification Number Program). The new systems will ensure proper treatment of wastewater from the homes and will reduce the chances of contamination in nearby receiving environments (Lake of the Woods) from failing fields or cracked tanks/pipes as indicated in the Health Canada reports. The new systems will also prevent backups of raw sewage back into the homes from failing components ensuring the health and safety of the occupants .
Construction Start Date:2017-06-05
Construction End Date:2017-08-31

properties.Name: Water Treatment System Upgrade
properties.Description:
Project Description:Objective: Mitigate problems in the primary disinfection of drinking water to ensure it meets regulatory and minimum quality. Scope: Plan, design and construct new liquid chlorine controls, injection equipment, decommission chlorine gas equipment, and all associated works. Output: New drinking water disinfection facility.
Construction Start Date:2018-01-08
Construction End Date:2018-12-31

properties.Name: Supervisory Control And Data Acquisition system Installation at the Cornwall Island Water Treatment Plant
properties.Description:
Project Description:Replace failing/obsolete Supervisory Control And Data Acquisition (SCADA) model with current SCADA model. The provision of a safe supply of water would reduce the negative impact on the Provincial health system.
Construction Start Date:2018-04-30
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Wastewater infrastructure upgrades in Kugaaruk and Kimmirut
properties.Description:
Project Description:The wastewater treatment systems in Kugaaruk and Kimmirut do not meet health and/or regulatory standards. This project will incorporate wetland treatment research findings to design and construct the wastewater infrastructure systems to bring the effluent into compliance with current standards. In Kugaaruk, where the current lagoon is leaking directly into the ocean close to a recreation area, the wastewater infrastructure system will be improved to eliminate the leaks and in Kimmirut, where the current method of wastewater treatment involves discharging raw sewage into a ditch which drains directly to the ocean, a new wastewater treatment system will be built.
Construction Start Date:2019-06-01
Construction End Date:2020-03-31

properties.Name: Silverton Water Main Replacement Project
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project works will include: - Replacement of asbestos-cement watermain with 150mm PVC watermain; - Installation of new 150mm watermain; - Installation of 23 new service connections; - Installation of 4 gate valves; - Installation of 2 hydrant assemblies; and, - Asphalt restoration.
Construction Start Date:2017-05-22
Construction End Date:2017-12-13

properties.Name: Rivervale and Oasis Sewer Service Pump Replacements
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project works will include: - Flush lines, pressure gauges, and flow meters; - Installation of 2 impeller pumps and recessed impeller sump; - Installation of variable frequency drives and motor control center; - Necessary electrical instrumentation and monitoring (including process logic controls); - Removal and disposal of pump equipment; and, - New piping spools, rubber isolators or valves.
Construction Start Date:2017-04-10
Construction End Date:2018-03-14

properties.Name: Main Street to Victoria Drive Watermain Looping Project
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project work will include: - Supply and installation of 792m of 250mm watermain; and, - Rehabilitation of roadway impacted by project works.
Construction Start Date:2017-10-17
Construction End Date:2018-08-31

properties.Name: Village Asset Management Assessment
properties.Description:
Project Description:The Village of Pouce Coupe (Village) is looking to implement a long-term Integrated Asset Management Program which includes the development of geographical information systems (GIS) and mapping services. The project will involved data collection for water and sewer infrastructure, updating GIS mapping of all Village infrastructure, providing online access to the Village mapping systems, creating a risk and condition assessment review for water and sewer infrastructure, a review of water usage to assess losses and leakage in the system and initiating strategic planning and priorities to implement a 5 or 10 year capital plan.
Construction Start Date:2018-04-13
Construction End Date:

properties.Name: Pender Harbour, Canoe Road Community Septic Field System Replacement
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project works will include: - Design and Engineering; - Contaminated soil removal; - Drain field (septic field) installation; - Removal of existing old infrastructure; - Site restoration/landscaping; and, - Collection system upgrading.
Construction Start Date:2017-12-03
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Large Subsurface Disposal System (LSSDS) for the Village of Westport
properties.Description:
Project Description:"This project will construct a large sub-surface disposal system (LSSDS) that incorporates sub-surface disposal through a system of receiving beds, piping and pumps. The effluent is dispersed through a receiving area of raised beds and a sand mantel. The distribution of the effluent is accomplished through a system of pumps and valves controlled by an integrated Supervisory control and data acquisition (SCADA) system. The project is a replacement system for effluent disposal only. Existing lagoons will continue to provide biological treatment to the proposed LSSDS system. A project extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline is requested due to the size and complexity of this project."
Construction Start Date:2017-05-01
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Construction of sanitary sewer
properties.Description:
Project Description:Construction of sanitary sewer
Construction Start Date:2017-06-26
Construction End Date:2018-11-30

properties.Name: Wastewater Pump Station Upgrade
properties.Description:
Project Description:Objective: Ensure wastewater works comply with provincial regulations while reducing the risk of emergency wastewater discharge. Scope: Plan, design and construct upgraded lift station including pumps, valves and piping, electrical and emergency generator, and all associated works. Output: Upgraded sewage lift station.
Construction Start Date:2018-05-16
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Water Treatment Plant Chlorination System Upgrades
properties.Description:
Project Description:Service to manufacture, supply, and install dual-pump chlorination system. Completion of this project is critical to the safe/ efficient supply of water to the community, thus reducing potential impact on the Province's health care system.
Construction Start Date:2017-06-01
Construction End Date:2017-11-01

properties.Name: Water Treatment Plant Chlorination System Upgrades
properties.Description:
Project Description:Service to manufacture, supply, and install dual-pump chlorination system which involves design and manufacture of dual pump backboard with pumps, piping, valves, fittings, connections, electrical wiring, and junction box. Off-site system verification and testing to be performed. On-site installation of all mechanical and electrical equipment. Integration into water plant's existing Programmable Logic Controller (PLC) and Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition computer (SCADA) system. Successful completion of this project will ensure that safe, potable water is provided to users - mitigating health risks and burden on Province.
Construction Start Date:2017-06-01
Construction End Date:2017-11-01

properties.Name: Rehabilitation of the Water Treatment Plant
properties.Description:
Project Description:On Site Services to restore safe and reliable plant operation. Replace all failed pump motor starters and controls. Supply and install new Dual Pump Chlorination system. Supply and install Hach Turbidimeters. Provide electrical and mechanical repairs as identified by Water Plant operators. The off-reserve benefit of the project is to reduce travel and associated medical costs of patients to attend provincial medical aid due to an illness caused by the ineffective water treatment. Due to the magnitude and complexity of the project, an extension is required beyond March 31, 2018.
Construction Start Date:2018-02-01
Construction End Date:2020-03-31

properties.Name: Upgrades to Lowlift station.
properties.Description:
Project Description:Provide backup pump to the sewage low lift station. Off-reserve benefits are protection to receiving environment from improved wastewater management.
Construction Start Date:2017-02-01
Construction End Date:2018-03-01

properties.Name: Chlorine Analyzer Rehabilitation
properties.Description:
Project Description:Project will inspect/service/calibrate the chlorine analyzer setup which will help the operator monitor the dosing of chlorine as the filtered water passes to allow the operator to monitor the amount of chlorine being entered into the system. Completion of this project will ensure that safe reliable drinking water is available and reduce the potential for additional pressure on the province's health care system.
Construction Start Date:2017-04-01
Construction End Date:2018-03-30

properties.Name: Phase 1: New Construction on Locke Avenue Water Supply Pipeline for Reliable Access to Safe Drinking Water, and Modernize to Meet Projected Growth
properties.Description:
Project Description:Current Watermain Situation: The Stayner water system provides water to 3,500 residents and 1,592 residential, commercial and industrial structures. Challenges: Currently, there are no water main pipes and municipal water service on Locke Avenue. Residents on Locke avenue are using wells and 5 residential developments draft have been approved to move forward in this area that will require municipal service. Without capital investment to install new pipes and watermain supply, growth will be restricted and there will not be enough water supply to support the additional 2400 units planned for this area. Project: 80 meters (Scott Ave. from Campground to Locke Avenue.) of new 200mm diameter polyvinyl chloride (PVC) piping with 100 years lifespan will be installed to increase flow, assist with fire protection and new developments Project Impact on Improving Reliability of Drinking Water System: Currently, there is no access to municipal water supply on Locke avenue. The construction of new pipelines will provide access to the drinking watermain supply to current residents using wells, increase capacity in our water network and will directly impact approximately 2400 new residential units planned and draft approved for the area. Projects Impact on Accelerating Short-Term Community Infrastructure Investments: This project will allow us to better ensure the provision of safe drinking water and adequate water pressures to the growing Stayner community in the future. Drafts plans for the development of 5000 residential units have been approved in Stayner in 2015 and this project will enhance the network and water capacity for these new developments (2400 residential units: Cappuciti Developments, Emerald Creek Estates, Clearview Park Developments, Estates of Clearview, and Bridle Park developments) and the projected water volume usage which is forecasted to grow from 1800 m3/day in 2016 to 3180 m3/day in 2026 (76% growth).
Construction Start Date:2017-05-01
Construction End Date:2017-11-30

properties.Name: Rehabilitation of Booster Station at Evan John/ Oneida Roads Intersection
properties.Description:
Project Description:Repair leaking pipes, reroute sump pump, install new instrumentation, repair concrete vault. Reducing the risk of infiltration and contamination will reduce the potential negative impact on the province's health system.
Construction Start Date:2016-12-01
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Philrobden Street Water main Replacement
properties.Description:
Project Description:"Replacement of a failing 150mm cast iron water main that has had numerous water main breaks over recent years. The new water main will be increased in size and therefore improve water supply in the area. Due to delays in developing the agreement and revised community critical priorities, an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline is required. IO NOTE: This is a newly proposed project. This will result in an increase in Federal Funding of $105,087.50."
Construction Start Date:2018-02-15
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Ontario Street Reconstruction of Water main & Sanitary
properties.Description:
Project Description:"This project involves the reconstruction of approximately 510m of Ontario St. between 5th Street and Canada Way.  The project will include the replacement of an existing ductile iron water main that is well beyond its useful life expectancy (14 breaks in the past few years), the removal of existing no-corrode sewer laterals, the repair/replacement of various sanitary sewer sections and manholes, and the full reconstruction of the asphalt roadway which is failed and presents an unsafe travel surface. Due to delays in developing the agreement and changes to local priorities, an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline is required. IO NOTE: This is a newly proposed project. This will result in an increase in Federal Funding of $180,000 to be reallocated from MSD-004, MSD-005, MSD-006 and MSD-007."
Construction Start Date:2018-06-01
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Update the current Capital Planning Study to provide additional well water supply for the water plant to meet the current demand and health requirements.
properties.Description:
Project Description:To complete the planning and research necessary to complete a well drilling program to develop a better long term suitable raw water supply for Dokis First Nation's water plant. This is to include the piping and any pre-treatment required. Completion of this project will ensure that safe reliable drinking water is available and reduce the potential for additional pressure on the province's health care. Project does not include capital works.
Construction Start Date:2018-01-25
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Aroland First Nation Sewage Lagoons Remediation
properties.Description:
Project Description:"Aroland First Nation #242 has developed its wastewater and sewage infrastructure back in the 1990's when our first community housing developments were built. Our community has since grown in population and number of homes etc. Our wastewater sewage lagoon is now at capacity due to a number of issues including population growth, new housing developments and new vegetation growing within the lagoon. The community also has a new housing development starting in the Spring of 2017 which will add a further 6 new units into our community housing portfolio. The community has also been allocated 4 new housing lots to build more new units within the next 4 years which will put our community sewage lagoons in danger of being at capacity. Our project consists of remediation of the existing lagoons to deal with issues of new vegetation as well as a removal of solid materials that are filling our lagoon to capacity. Successful completion of this project will ensure that untreated wastewater does not enter the environment and negatively impact surrounding communities. The removal works are capitalized as they extend the life of the asset."
Construction Start Date:2017-05-15
Construction End Date:2017-06-30

properties.Name: Retrofit of Pond 2 - remove overgrown vegetation and create proper storm pond facility with forebay and improve facility performance to enhanced levels
properties.Description:
Project Description:"This pond retrofit would involve removing much of the existing overgrown vegetation and create a proper wetland Storm water Management facility with forebay to allow for proper maintenance. Pond currently provides only basic level control for +-38Ha of industrial land. This retrofit would improve that level to Enhanced. Outlet modifications to achieve proper extended stormwater detention and planting would be proposed to improve visual aesthetics. Due to delays in developing the agreement, an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline is required. IO NOTE: This is a new project, resulting in an increase in Federal Funding of $63,415.00 from the cancellation of ORO-001."
Construction Start Date:2018-03-01
Construction End Date:2018-08-01

properties.Name: Feasibility Study, Hydraulic Analysis, Geotechnical Assessment and Environmental Assessment for a Water Storage Facility
properties.Description:
Project Description:The feasibility study on a water storage facility will include conducting computer hydraulic modelling/simulation using the proposed tower location to assure that volume and height of tower/standpipe meets the requirements; researching the pressure zones and high lift pumps power requirements and model a water tower vs a standpipe; conducting a borehole assessment at the proposed location and assess the soil conditions to ascertain if a tower/standpipe can be constructed.
Construction Start Date:2017-09-15
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Alpine Water System Upgrade
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project works will include: - Installation of approximately 1,300m of 200mm PVC watermain; - Installation of approximately 56 water service connections and 7 fire hydrants; - Installation of water main tie-ins and appurtenances; and, - Boulevard and roadway restoration.
Construction Start Date:2017-07-15
Construction End Date:2018-12-31

properties.Name: Install a new generator to run water treatment plant
properties.Description:
Project Description:There is currently no back-up generator capable of uninterrupted operation of the water treatment plant and when there are power interruption, clean water is not being produced. There is a fire pump which starts and lowers the clear well quickly. A base, electrical equipment and a 50kW diesel generator is needed to ensure proper level of safe water is produced which is a benefit to the community directly and surrounding communities overall. Thus reducing the impact on the Province's health system.
Construction Start Date:2017-02-01
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Haines Junction Lagoon upgrades
properties.Description:
Project Description:Rehabilitation of existing lagoons to increase their lifespan and construction of a septage receiving station
Construction Start Date:2017-09-01
Construction End Date:2018-10-30

properties.Name: Mayo Lift Station
properties.Description:
Project Description:Rehabilitation of the Mayo lift station to extend its service life, installation of a new SCADA system and decommissioning of deteriorated wet well
Construction Start Date:2017-10-13
Construction End Date:2018-08-31

properties.Name: Watermain Program - Phase 2
properties.Description:
Project Description:Installation of new water mains and wastewater collection piping to address frequent leaks and breaks along Staghorn Drive and Beaver Crescent. Installation of new water mains along Waterloo Avenue, Mystery Lake Road, Churchill Drive and Thompson Drive to address frequent leaks and breaks. New valves, fire hydrants, curb stops and services will also be installed. This project ties into the second phase of a water plan to replace the entire water distribution system.
Construction Start Date:2017-06-19
Construction End Date:2017-09-15

properties.Name: Sewer Outfall Replacement
properties.Description:
Project Description:Replace sewer outfall system.
Construction Start Date:2017-05-01
Construction End Date:2019-10-01

properties.Name: Ladysmith Drinking Water Filtration Project
properties.Description:
Project Description:"The project work will include: -Site clearing and grading; -Construction of the filtration plant at existing Arbutus Treatment Plant; -Installation of water tie-in piping; -Site drainage improvements; -Site access improvements; and -Expansion of security fencing and signage. "
Construction Start Date:2017-06-05
Construction End Date:2020-03-31

properties.Name: Lift Station Upgrades - five lift stations
properties.Description:
Project Description:Existing Stations are 30 + years old with deep dry wells. It is difficult to find repair parts and the depth cause a safety hazard for employees.
Construction Start Date:2017-08-15
Construction End Date:2018-11-30

properties.Name: Tongue Hill water transmission main upgrade
properties.Description:
Project Description:The Windsor Water Utility is proposing replacing two cast iron mains running from Windsor Back Road north to King Street that date as far back as 1890s with a single HDPE, or Fusible PVC pipe.
Construction Start Date:2017-07-28
Construction End Date:2018-02-27

properties.Name: Watermain, Sanitary, and Storm Sewer Renewal and Storm Sewer Extension
properties.Description:
Project Description:Renew 320 m of watermain, sanitary sewer, and storm sewer along Gauvin Road. Extend storm sewer by 30 m from Gauvin Road to Champlain Street. Renew sections of watermain and install storm sewer along Bahama and Skyline Street. This project includes related road work necessary to complete the project.
Construction Start Date:2017-05-23
Construction End Date:2017-10-17

properties.Name: Drinking water reservoir repairs
properties.Description:
Project Description:Rehabilitation of sanitary sewer main from Maple Street to Elm Street. This project includes related road work necessary to complete the project.
Construction Start Date:2017-05-01
Construction End Date:2018-09-30

properties.Name: Stormwater Culvert Replacement Project - Village of Wendover
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project consists in replacing the Corrugated Steel Pipe (CSP) located under Principale Street in the Village of Wendover near Camille Road (a private road). The CSP is 2.7 meters in diameter (8.8 feet) and is 43 meters (141 feet) in length. The culvert is situated in a ravine at a depth of more than 8.0 meters (26.2 feet). The bottom of the CSP is corroded and needs to be replaced as soon as possible to avoid further damages and additional costs to Principale Street, the main public highway running east to west in the Village of Wendover. With more than five (5) meters of overburden, there are evident signs of stress on the CSP and roadway. At the approach of the ravine, the surface of the asphalt shows an evident slump. The base of Principale Street will likely further deteriorate with the next winter (freezing) and spring (tawing) conditions. There is a danger for the public safety and limiting the weight of vehicles transiting on Principale Street. Temporary emergency repairs, installation of braces, have been undertaken by the municipality. The CSP will need to be replaced by open cut method meaning that all the above ground and underground utilities and municipal services will need to be supported during the construction process. The entire community of the Village of Wendover will benefit from the culvert replacement.
Construction Start Date:2017-10-08
Construction End Date:2018-05-31

properties.Name: Sewage Lagoon Upgrade
properties.Description:
Project Description:Upgrade sewage lagoon adding 2 cells, and reinforcing berm on existing cell.
Construction Start Date:2018-06-01
Construction End Date:2018-12-01

properties.Name: Sewage Lagoon Upgrade
properties.Description:
Project Description:Complete lagoon upgrades including installing a discharge chute, reinforcing berms around lagoon, install new fencing around secondary cell.
Construction Start Date:2017-06-01
Construction End Date:2018-12-01

properties.Name: Replacement of the unstable deteriorated Marksbury Road storm sewer outfall in the City of Pickering to reduce sediment loads to Lake Ontario
properties.Description:
Project Description:The 750 mm diameter deteriorated, corrugated steel storm sewer outfall pipe running the length of approximately 25 m and the existing gabion basket outfall at the end of Marksbury Road that discharges directly into Lake Ontario, will be replaced with a new 750 mm diameter concrete storm sewer and a newly constructed outfall with erosion protection for energy dissipation. Due to regulatory requirements and/or permit delays, we are requesting an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline to ensure successful completion of the project.
Construction Start Date:2017-04-03
Construction End Date:2020-03-31

properties.Name: Replacement of waste water/sewer pipe on Jacques Street up to lagoon site
properties.Description:
Project Description:Smoke tests of our sewer system conducted in October 2016 demonstrated that there are a number of obstructions in the communitys sewage pipes.  With old infrastructure, it is possible these pipes have collapsed or that they have filled-in with roots or other materials.  Considering the age of the infrastructure [built in 1987], there is more than just a need to clear these pipes, we need to change them altogether. In order to access the damaged pipes, we need to excavate the roadway.  Subsequently, we will repair and replace key sections of the pipes throughout the community.  Lastly, we will need to repair the roadway and resurface with pavement and gravel
Construction Start Date:2017-07-01
Construction End Date:2017-12-31

properties.Name: Mercer's Lane Water and Sewer Upgrade
properties.Description:
Project Description:This project consists of the placement of new sewermain and new watermain to replace the aging infrastructure. This project will also see the placement of asphalt pavement to undertake road repairs resulting from the installation of new water and sewer mains. Rationale: Project extension is requested to accommodate the Town's policy and Engineering Consultant's recommendation that surface course asphalt be placed in the next construction season after installation of underground infrastructure and base course asphalt.
Construction Start Date:2017-07-18
Construction End Date:2018-12-31

properties.Name: Second Feedermain to the Washburn Reservoir and Booster Station
properties.Description:
Project Description:***Modified project*** See notes for original project information. The Washburn Reservoir and Booster Station is a critical component of the water distribution network supplying potable water to the City of Burlington. Currently there is one feedermain from the Burlington Water Purification Plant, under the Queen Elizabeth Way Highway (QEW) to the Washburn Reservoir and Booster Station. This main is 43 years old and a catastrophic failure of this watermain would result in a significant reduction in the level of service, including fire protection, putting 135,000 residents at risk. This project involves installation of 3.95 km of trunk watermain between the Burlington Water Purification Plant and the Washburn Reservoir and Booster Station, this second feedermain will provide security of supply for the Water Distribution system, mitigating potential customer impacts and providing operational flexibility to inspect and repair the existing single feed. This project also involves coordinated replacement of distribution watermains within the project limits. Due to availability of additional funds, and subsequent delay in project submission and its impact on construction schedule, we are requesting an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline to ensure successful completion of the project.
Construction Start Date:2017-08-08
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Renewal of water pipes
properties.Description:
Project Description:Pipe renewal works aimed at maintaining water services for citizens for 6 stretches of road and totaling 1.4 km.
Construction Start Date:2017-08-28
Construction End Date:2017-12-01

properties.Name: Replacement of a feedermain on Bloor St from Grandview St. to Townline Rd.
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project will replace an existing 600mm Ductile Iron watermain currently not in service due to watermain deficiencies. It will be replaced with a 600 mm CPP watermain from Old Grandview St. to Townline Rd. This watermain will service the general/prestige industrial lands in the surrounding area and promote the employment lands for the Courtice Zone 1 water distribution system. Due to delays in developing the Transfer Payment Agreement and subsequent delays in procurement and its impact on construction schedule, we are requesting an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline to ensure successful completion of the project.
Construction Start Date:2018-01-30
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Study update of existing Stormwater Management ponds for sediment removal
properties.Description:
Project Description:This study includes 18 storm water management ponds to complete an overall inventory to quantify existing sediment volumes and identify short term and long term sediment removal requirements. Since the completion of pond needs study in 2011, Town has added many more ponds through subdivision projects. Under this project new ponds and ponds which are not cleaned under the previous study will be studied and bathymetric survey will be completed. Ponds will evaluated based on sediment accumulation and a priority list will be formulated . Based on this list, a pond cleaning program will be prepared and will be executed under capital works or though any other funding opportunities. Due to weather-sensitive work that must be completed outside of winter months, we are requesting an extension beyond March 31, 2018, to ensure successful completion of the project.
Construction Start Date:2017-12-01
Construction End Date:2018-09-30

properties.Name: Milltown Boulevard (King Street to Hawthorne Street) - Watermain and Sanitary Sewer Renewal
properties.Description:
Project Description:Renew approximately 950 m of watermain and sanitary sewer along Milltown Boulevard from King Street to Hawthorne Street. Project also includes looping by extending existing watermains on Watson Street and Rushton Street to Milltown Boulevard. This project includes related road work necessary to complete the project.
Construction Start Date:2017-06-21
Construction End Date:2018-10-31

properties.Name: Whitby Water Supply Plant -installation of new dechlorination equipment to dechlorinate backwash prior to discharge into Lake Ontario
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** "The installation of the dechlorinating equipment will dechlorinate backwash wastewater prior to discharge into Lake Ontario. This new equipment would enable Durham to meet and exceed the Provincial Water Quality Objectives guidelines of total chlorine level under the 0.002 mg/l limit to protect the aquatic life. The following scope changes in the contract caused the final bid price to be substantially higher than the pre-bid estimate:  A sample line from the supernatant trough the conditioning tank room to the pump room.  Additional scope of work in the Instrumentation and Control programming.  Modifications to the chemical feed systems to be panel board mounted and factory assembled.  Upgrades to the solenoid valves, static mixer, pipe and pipe support material.  Clarification on the training and demonstration requirements. IO NOTE: There is an increase in scope, resulting in an increase in Federal Funding of $207,500 to be reallocated."
Construction Start Date:2018-01-30
Construction End Date:2018-03-03

properties.Name: Treated water booster pumping station upgrade (electrical & mechanical) - Kent Avenue Reservoir and Booster Pumping Station - located in the City of Niagara Falls
properties.Description:
Project Description:"The Kent Avenue Reservoir and Booster Pumping Station requires electrical and mechanical upgrades to sustain the storage and delivery of 22 ML (mega liters) of treated water. During peak demands this facility provides treated water to approximately 19,000 residents, plus industrial, commercial and institutional potable water needs. In addition this site supports the entire water delivery system during the annual influx of over 30 million tourists to the City of Niagara Falls. This important upgrade includes the following major components:  Electrical substation including transformer (1500kVA) and switch gear (60 Hz 1600A  Motor Control Centers(600 V, 3ph, 60Hz 1600A)  Electrical panel (HVAC, 240 V Lighting, Diesel Pump) and associated wiring (600V)  Replacement of three pump discharge valves (check and ball valves) This project is currently in final design, and the 90% design estimate shows that additional funds are required to complete the project. The total project cost is inclusive of all cost to deliver the project including design. The federal and provincial CWWF contributions are based solely on the construction costs. The project is incremental in nature in that even though a design was near completion, the project had been removed from our 2017 capital budget due to insufficient regional funding required to proceed with the construction phase. The CWWF funding will allow us to proceed with a key infrastructure project."
Construction Start Date:2017-07-12
Construction End Date:2018-08-30

properties.Name: Trunk Watermain Cathodic Protection Upgrades - Design and Construction
properties.Description:
Project Description:Upgrade Corrosion protection on a steel trunk watermain to extend its service life. This project will install cathodic protection on the 600mm Steel Trunk Watermain on Clarke Road. We will install magnesium anodes to provide cathodic protection of this watermain. Magnesium anodes have an estimated usable lifespan of 15 to 25 years. The project is 4.5km long from Oxford Street East to Trafalgar Street
Construction Start Date:2018-02-13
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Replace aging Backup Generator at the Wastewater Plant
properties.Description:
Project Description:Replace aging backup generator to mitigate the possibility of our inability to treat wastewater in the event of a prolonged power outage. The scope of this project will be to disconnect and remove the old diesel generator and replace it with a new, reliable generator.
Construction Start Date:2017-11-01
Construction End Date:2017-12-31

properties.Name: Relocation and Replacement of Membrane Programmable Logic Controller (PLC) at the Little Current Water Treatment Plant
properties.Description:
Project Description:Due to high levels of moisture and corrosion, the location of the current membrane system PLC has resulted in the PLC cards (input, output and communication) to become heavily corroded which has lead to numerous instances of loss of communication.  This loss of communication results in low chlorine residuals and low clear well levels.  In order to correct the problem the PLC needs to be replaced and relocated to an area of the water plant which is not subject to high moisture and corrosive chemical atmosphere. 
Construction Start Date:2017-05-01
Construction End Date:2017-10-31

properties.Name: 600 mm Storm Sewer Installation on Frederica Street - W Neebing to Dead End
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** "A new 300m long 600mm diameter concrete storm sewer in an area of high groundwater and low slope poorly performing existing ditches within a multi-unit urban area. 29 impacted customers. Additional storm sewer appurtenances were required to address site specific grading and drainage problems. IO NOTE: There is an increase in scope, resulting in an increase in Federal Funding of $40,000 to be reallocated."
Construction Start Date:2017-06-01
Construction End Date:2017-10-01

properties.Name: Construction of a 300mm Stormwater Separation Sewer on McGillivray Street
properties.Description:
Project Description:Storm separation by building 100m of new 300mm Polyvinyl Chloride (PVC) storm sewer and disconnection of catchbasins from combined sewer.
Construction Start Date:2017-06-01
Construction End Date:2017-10-01

properties.Name: Treatment plant upgrade
properties.Description:
Project Description:The purpose of the project is to carry out a major overhaul of the wastewater treatment plant and to add a wastewater phosphate removal system.
Construction Start Date:2017-11-13
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Renewal of water pipes
properties.Description:
Project Description:Pipe renewal works aimed at maintaining water services for citizens for 9 stretches of roads totaling 0.822 km.
Construction Start Date:2017-09-12
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Storm Sewer Outfall Rehabilitation at Spiers Crescent
properties.Description:
Project Description:This project includes implementation of stormwater management improvements, including the installation of an oil/grit separator, and structural repair of the existing storm sewer outfall at Spiers Crescent to improve water quality discharged to a large wetland and ultimately to Carruthers Creek. This project will also include the rehabilitation and sediment cleanout of the wetland at the storm sewer outfall to improve stormwater management. An ecological assessment of the vegetation within the receiving environment will be undertaken. Due to weather-sensitive work that must be completed outside of winter months, we are requesting an extension beyond March 31, 2018, to ensure successful completion of the project.
Construction Start Date:2017-09-01
Construction End Date:2018-11-30

properties.Name: Repair main sewage pump house building
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** "Main sewage pump house building footing is badly damaged due to frost and heaving. Must be repaired in order to prevent further damage to building and contents. After digging, it was noticed that the electrical wires going from the pump house to the exterior pumps were badly damaged over the years and it needed to be replaced immediately. Because a good part of the wires were already uncovered, it was less costly to do it at this time therefore adding cost to the project. IO NOTE: Due to the increase in scope, there is an increase in Federal Funding of $3,000 to be reallocated from OPA-003."
Construction Start Date:2017-10-11
Construction End Date:2017-10-13

properties.Name: Duffin Creek Wastewater Plant Field Testing for Phosphorus Removal
properties.Description:
Project Description:The optimization testing at Duffin Creek Water Pollution Control Plant is to determine the Plants capability to reliably achieve an effluent soluble reactive phosphorus (SRP) concentration of 0.1 mg/L and 0.05 mg/L. Testing will establish primary and secondary dosing rates and locations for ferric chloride and polymer dosing. The laboratory data will be collected throughout the field testing to identify impacts on the biological activated sludge handling and solids handling processes at the plant. The testing will also characterize the performance and define the capacity of the primary and secondary clarifiers for total suspended solids (TSS) and particulate phosphorous removal, determine the final effluent characteristics, and assess operational risk factors for sustaining an SRP removal rate of 0.1 mg/L or lower. There is a need to extend the optimization testing beyond March 31, 2018 to confirm the long term phosphorous reduction limits that can be sustained by stress testing the plant at design flows. This approach will confirm the feasibility and environmental benefits of optimizing phosphorous reduction for the remaining life time of the present plant design.
Construction Start Date:2017-01-01
Construction End Date:2018-07-31

properties.Name: Drilling of Well #4 the village of Norwood to increase capacity and reliability for our residents
properties.Description:
Project Description:Drilling a new raw water source for the Village of Norwood to increase capacity and reliability
Construction Start Date:2016-11-01
Construction End Date:2018-12-31

properties.Name: Construction of New Corrosion Control Building at water treatment plant
properties.Description:
Project Description:New chemical feed and storage facility for the injection of ortho-phosphate into the City's Woodward drinking water supply as a means to reduce concentrations of lead in the drinking water and as required under Provincial regulation. Project includes 230 square meter building, 80 cubic meter chemical storage and all chemical feed mechanical and electrical equipment as required to serve a peak water production of 650MLD. This project will affect the majority of the population within the urban City boundary.
Construction Start Date:2017-04-03
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Condition Inspection, Design and Remediation of Gorham Street watermain
properties.Description:
Project Description:This project will include assessment, engineering, construction, inspection, commissioning of new infrastructure and will determine a strategy to replace or reline the watermain. The immediate needs are to prevent service interruptions, improve customer service and reliability, and manage risk. The 500 meter section of water main on Gorham Street that will be replaced is 40+ years old and has suffered several severe breaks recently. The pipe is 300 mm (12) in size and is constructed of Ductile Iron. Pipe condition is poor due to corrosion. The area that is serviced from this water main includes 20 single family homes, a Church, Fire Hall and a retirement village that includes 2, one hundred unit high rise buildings and 65 townhomes. There is an urgent need to determine the remediation needs of the Gorham Street watermain. The watermain services sensitive customers such as the Towns Fire Department, old age and retirement homes that include 2, one hundred unit high rise buildings and 65 townhomes, a church and local residents. There have been several severe failures recently that have required service interruption for extended periods of time to the noted locations as well as complex and costly repairs. Due to delays in developing the Transfer Payment Agreement and subsequent delays in procurement and its impact on construction schedule, we are requesting an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline to ensure successful completion of the project.
Construction Start Date:2017-09-18
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Renewal of water pipes
properties.Description:
Project Description:Pipe renewal works aimed at maintaining water services for citizens for 9 stretches of road and totaling 1.34 km.
Construction Start Date:2017-04-24
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Pine Valley Storm Headwall and Spillway Rehabiliations
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** Construction of an appropriate storm water management solution to mitigate erosion and sediment deposits from the storm sewer outlet located on Pine Valley Drive, at Club House Road to protect the structural integrity of the roadway. The project includes the installation of plunge pools, weirs, check dams, rip rap and energy dissipaters. Due to delays in developing the agreement, an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline is required. IO NOTE: There is no decrease in scope, only a reduction in tender. This will result in a decrease in Federal Funding of $85,000 to be reallocated.
Construction Start Date:2016-09-01
Construction End Date:2019-03-30

properties.Name: New construction of Culverts/rehabilitation to establish a crown on the road for proper drainage.
properties.Description:
Project Description:The objective is to establish a crown on Hunt Road West to manage storm water and drainage. The scope will include 1.9 km of Hunt Road West beginning at Highway 11/17 which is a feeder road that serves the majority of the south half of the Municipality. The output for the project will be a road that has proper drainage; new culverts, upgraded gravel and an overall rehabilitated road with a new crown resulting in proper storm water drainage. Hunt Road is a feeder road to Highway 11/17 and serves the Majority of the South half of the Township where the majority of the residents live. The project will improve stormwater management through reduced road flooding and improved conveyance in the ditch and culvert system, adjacent to the road.
Construction Start Date:2017-09-01
Construction End Date:2017-12-31

properties.Name: Construction of Maplehurst Avenue Watermain Renewal Project
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** "Project was completed under budget. Seeking ability to move the excess funds to another approved project with an increased scope of delivery. A localized section of the water main at the intersection of Maplehurst Avenue and Carling Avenue will be replaced. The 152mm water main in Maplehurst Avenue passes through the bottom of the 900mm storm sewer in Carling Avenue and connects to the 406mm water main in the north side of Carling Avenue. As part of this work, a 90m section of new water main will be installed on Maplehurst Avenue from Birchdale. This will eliminate part of a Vulnerable Service Area from the system. Road surface reinstatement will be completed as part of the project. IO NOTE: There is no decrease in scope, only a decrease in tender. This will result in a decrease in Federal Funding of $125,000 to be reallocated to OTT-031."
Construction Start Date:2016-07-05
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Repair/Replace 20 Curb Stops Within the Water Distribution System
properties.Description:
Project Description:This project will Repair/Replace 20 Curb Stops ensuring functional valves to provide smoother operation and to allow the Municipality to better manage the water distribution system. At present a large number of curbstops are non-functional which becomes an issue when services need to be connected or disconnected. Improved environmental outcome: Control & Management of treated water; Reduction of waste of treated water; Reduction of contamination to ground due to current leaks and reduce the amount of water and energy needed for production to make up for any losses. As a result, less treatment chemicals are used; reduction of ground excavating due to current water leaks and reduction of the water wasted to drain a water main to perform repairs.
Construction Start Date:2017-10-02
Construction End Date:2018-07-31

properties.Name: Renewal of water pipes
properties.Description:
Project Description:Pipe renewal work for the maintenance of water services to citizens for some 19 street sections totaling 3.632 km.
Construction Start Date:2016-12-07
Construction End Date:2018-06-30

properties.Name: Sanitation in the Lac Bergeron
properties.Description:
Project Description:The work consist in extending the water and sewer systems in the sector of the lake Bergeron to serve 23 residences.
Construction Start Date:2018-05-15
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Reconstruction of open roadside ditches and culvert replacementson the Fish Hatchery Road.
properties.Description:
Project Description:"The rehabilitation of the stormwater collection and diversion management system on the Fish Hatchery Road will see reconstruction of open roadside ditches and new culvert installations. The project's immediate objectives are to improve and maintain clean, healthy water quality in receiving streams as well as reduce flow rates during heavy rainfall and spring run-off events. The project will consist of 18 kilometers (18,000 meters) of ditching and installation of approximately six (6) 12"" x 20' culverts and one (1) 5' x 60' culvert. The Fish Hatchery Road services and provides access to 28 households and the Dorion Fish Culture Station and Sub-Station. The reconstruction of open roadside ditches and new culvert installs will improve water quality issues as vegetation in an open roadway drainage ditch serves as a water filtering system, reducing flow rates allowing for settlement of unwanted substances, therefore, preventing them from entering receiving streams and natural waterways. Due to delays in tendering, we are requesting an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline to ensure successful completion of the project. A project extension is requested due to delayed approval timelines, delays in starting the project, and the availability of securing contractors to start and finish the work within the original timeline."
Construction Start Date:2017-08-03
Construction End Date:2018-06-30

properties.Name: Repair warped and bend polyvinyl chloride piping in collection system
properties.Description:
Project Description:A study was done in 2016 to find issues in the collection system. A polyvinyl chloride pipe from the sanitary system was found to be compressed causing warpage and bending of pipe and will cause breakage in the pipe in the near future. The pipe will be excavated and repaired. Objective: Replace pipe identified in the closed circuit TV inspection of the collection system on Webster street between manholes VN-S 3 and VN-SA2. Only the collapsed pipe be repaired, not the entire section. Scope: To excavate, remove and replace the section of pipe in question and backfill with appropriate material Output: Replaced pipe, which will increase flow capacity and line integrity.
Construction Start Date:2017-08-03
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Stormwater Management Pond# PD47-01 Sediment Management
properties.Description:
Project Description:This project will remove and dispose of 500 m3 of sediment from the pond. The project includes cleaning of outlets and restoration of the disturbed area. Majority of the Towns storm water ponds had been constructed with permanent storage volume (wet ponds). The purpose of the permanent storage volume in a pond is to allow suspended solids (sediment) from the runoff to settle down in the pond bottom and release the treated water to the creek. Over the time, pond will accumulate sediment which will reduce the permanent storage, impacting the sediment removal efficiency of the pond drastically, resulting untreated water released to the Creek. Realising a need for a pond clean out, Town of Whitby conducted a ponds need study in 2011 to evacuate the pond permanent storage capacity and learned majority of the ponds require cleanout as bathymetric survey revealed fair amount of sediment accumulated in the ponds. Under this project accumulated sediment in the pond will be removed allowing required permanent storage in the pond, resulting pond will perform to its design efficiency which will improve the quality of the runoff released to the creeks. The removal works are capitalized as they extend the life of the asset. Due to delays in developing the Transfer Payment Agreement and subsequent delays in procurement and its impact on construction schedule, we are requesting an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline to ensure successful completion of the project.
Construction Start Date:2017-09-01
Construction End Date:2018-10-31

properties.Name: Detailed design and construction of a new in ground water reservoir and a pump station to meet the capacity requirements of existing and future planned growth.
properties.Description:
Project Description:"Detailed design and construction of a new in ground water reservoir and a pump station. The 2012 Town Wide Water and Wastewater Master Servicing Plan identified a servicing deficiency with Churchill's current reservoir storage capacity. The already completed EA estimated the size of the new reservoir at 1000 cubic meter and the pump station having a capacity of 544 cubic meters per day. The proposed pump station would feed the existing water distribution system. Due to additional time required to complete preparatory work (i.e. EAs/soil testing/identifying utilities etc.), we are requesting an extension beyond March 31, 2018, to ensure successful completion of the project."
Construction Start Date:2017-03-01
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Construction of New Storm Sewer Outfall at Westminster Drive
properties.Description:
Project Description:The construction of a new storm sewer outfall to Lake Ontario to support the construction of a new trunk storm sewer along Westminster Drive which will provide improved drainage relief to the Coronation Park neighborhood.
Construction Start Date:2017-09-01
Construction End Date:2018-06-01

properties.Name: Pumphouse Road Water Treatment Plant upgrades to Chart Recorder and Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA) system
properties.Description:
Project Description:Upgrades to the SCADA system include: a Hewlett Packard tower and chart recorder to monitor plant parameters
Construction Start Date:2016-04-30
Construction End Date:2016-07-31

properties.Name: Two (2) Flood Studies for Joshua Creek and Sheldon Creek watersheds
properties.Description:
Project Description:This project will explore necessary flood mitigation works to protect lands and the environment from flooding. The focus area for the two studies will be Joshua Creek and Sheldon Creek watersheds. The CWWF funding allows these studies to advance to 2017.
Construction Start Date:2017-07-01
Construction End Date:2018-12-31

properties.Name: Design and Construction of Shields and Findlay Creek Stormwater Measures for Creek Rehabilitation
properties.Description:
Project Description:The purpose of this project is to rehabilitate existing bank stabilization measures through the introduction of additional plantings and new bank stabilization measures. The bank stabilization measures proposed are the direct result of uncontrolled stormwater conveyance to the receiver (Sheilds Creek), as a result of development. This project will introduce softer measures (plantings, log cribbing, etc.) to stabilize the banks to achieve a stable creek corridor, while protecting property and reducing downstream sedimentation caused by bank undercutting. Extension request for 25% of the costs past the deadline of March 2018 due to potential conflict with fish habitat.
Construction Start Date:2016-09-01
Construction End Date:2017-09-01

properties.Name: Design and Construction of the Bridlewood Neighborhood Localised Flood Protection Improvement Including New Manholes
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** Three large diameter sewers meet at a T-intersection (Milner Downs at Bridgestone). New manholes at this intersection are needed to improve the storm sewer hydraulics. The neighbourhood of Bridlewood has experienced basement flooding several times in the past 20 years. Through studies several pipe sections were identified as requiring upsizing to reduce the risk of flooding. On Palimino and Ckickasaw streets 805 metres of 2100 mm storm trunk sewer will be upsized to 3000 mm. At Milner Downs and Bridgestone 20 metres of 1200 mm storm sewer will be reconfigured to minimize hydraulic losses to lower sewer surcharge.
Construction Start Date:2017-04-18
Construction End Date:2019-09-30

properties.Name: Fraser Street Stormwater System Upgrade
properties.Description:
Project Description:Work involves the rehabilitation and upgrade of old storm water management infrastructure located along Fraser Street in Montague from School Street running toward Queen Street, that has been exhibiting issues with capacity. Upgrades are required to allow future connection of a new government facility that could exceed flow capacity of the existing system. Such upgrades includes storm sewer replacement and road construction including concrete curb, gutter and hot mix asphalt
Construction Start Date:2017-08-15
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Expansion of the Dewatered Biosolids Winter Storage Building
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** "The Biosolids Centralized Storage Facility is a structural steel/concrete composite building with concrete foundation.  The existing winter storage building will be expanded from 12 existing storage bays to 16 bays (4 additional winter storage bays).   The existing 10,000 m2 building will see an expansion of 3,500 m2 in building floor area to accommodate winter storage for the anticipated future increase in dewatered biosolids quantities originating from the County wastewater treatment facilities. It has also been determined that fire suppression technologies must be added to the structure due to the response time from the local rural volunteer fire department. After the initial design and cost evaluation, it was determined that the building was now in need of improved fire suppression technology. This incurred additional design and construction costs. IO NOTE: There is an increase in scope, resulting in an increase in Federal Funding of $18,060.46 to be reallocated from OXF-006."
Construction Start Date:2017-01-01
Construction End Date:2018-05-31

properties.Name: Abruzzi Heights Infrastructure Replacement Design
properties.Description:
Project Description:The District of Elkford (District) would like to design the replacement of the deep infrastructure to modern and efficient standards. This will include designing the water mains and services to the appropriate depth.
Construction Start Date:2017-06-15
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Upgrading of no. 2 highlight pumps at the water treatment plant
properties.Description:
Project Description:Kirkland Lake water treatment plant requires a Replacement of Existing 200HP Highlift pumps as both pumps are past its life expectancies. We encounter multiple pump failure events which compromises our water distribution system pressure. This causes potential risk of health and safety amongst the local population, requiring an upgrade to the highlift pumps. The proposed advance (energy saving) highlift pumps will eliminate this concern as it will reduce the operational costs.
Construction Start Date:2017-01-04
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Sanitary Sewer Manhole Relining at approximately at 18 Locations
properties.Description:
Project Description:This relining project of Manholes is expected to rehabilitate and prolong the life of the asset. Lining offers multiple benefits including the prevention of bricks and concrete breaking off and creating backup, new benching prevents blockages and backups, and limits the amount of groundwater infiltration into our wastewater system that requires treatment . This kind of work is becoming cost prohibitive to the City without larger contracts as the mobilization to Dryden is expensive. Dependent on the area these repairs could affect up to 100 homes and prevent sewer backup.
Construction Start Date:2017-09-11
Construction End Date:2017-09-15

properties.Name: Relining of failing 200mm to 760mm concrete sanitary sewer
properties.Description:
Project Description:The City has identified 6000m of disintegrating and failing concrete tile and reinforced concrete sanitary sewers throughout the municipality. This project will allow the rehabilitation of the identified sanitary sewers by relining the sewers. The life of the assets will be extended by a minimum 50 years and a significant source of infiltration will be removed from the sanitary sewer system. The water pollution control plant will benefit with a reduction in wet weather flows resulting in fewer overflow events to the Avon River and an associated reduction in phosphorus entering the Lake Erie Drainage Basin.
Construction Start Date:2017-03-13
Construction End Date:2017-11-13

properties.Name: Water Supply and Treatment Upgrade
properties.Description:
Project Description:Objective: Resolve treated water quality issues, extend mechanical equipment service life and provide system redundancy. Scope: Plan, design and construct upgraded raw water pump station, supply line, appx five chemical feed systems, upgraded water plant high lift pump system, new UV disinfection system, and all associated works. Output: Upgraded raw water pump station and upgraded water treatment system.
Construction Start Date:2017-10-02
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Water Distribution System Upgrade
properties.Description:
Project Description:Objective: Create a water distribution system that is reliable, provide safe drinking water and enhance firefighting ability. Scope: Plan, design and construct replacement of appx 42 non-functioning water valves within the distribution system, loop piping of appx three sections of water mains, and all associated works. Output: appx 42 new water valves, loop piping for appx three sections of water mains.
Construction Start Date:2017-08-11
Construction End Date:2018-12-31

properties.Name: Major Pre-Cleaning and Closed-Circuit Television (CCTV) Condition Assessment of Wastewater Sewers in Atironto
properties.Description:
Project Description:Project includes the cleaning of all wastewater lines in the Atironto Water system managed by Montague, and then a condition assessment through a Closed-circuit television (CCTV) process. The Township will gain valuable information that will assist in the asset management of the sewer system in Montague. This will take place over approximately 2.25 kms of 150mm polyvinyl chloride sewer lines
Construction Start Date:2017-06-01
Construction End Date:2017-10-01

properties.Name: Upgrade of Flow Meter Installation and Construction of a Protective Insulated Building
properties.Description:
Project Description:A flow meter currently monitors the number of litres going into the lagoon. We need to build an insulated building to prevent the flow meter from freezing up during the winter. This meter is a requirement of the Ministry of the Environment and freezing of the meter is not an excuse for improper reporting of litres flowing into the lagoon.
Construction Start Date:2017-07-01
Construction End Date:2017-08-31

properties.Name: New Water Treatment System
properties.Description:
Project Description:Objective: Provide drinking water that complies with applicable provincial regulations. Scope: Plan, design and construct appx 0.3 l/s membrane water treatment unit, water plant building addition, chlorination system and clearwell baffle upgrades, and all associated works. Output: Upgraded water treatment plant.
Construction Start Date:2017-06-19
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Design and Construction of a Standalone Water Treatment System for the Administration Office and Community Centre to Meet Guidelines and Remove Health and Safety Risks
properties.Description:
Project Description:This project will include the design and construction of a standalone water treatment system for the Administration Office and Community Centre. This is the main and active community building that hosts frequent events and occasions throughout the year. The community is currently serviced by individual groundwater systems which are non-compliant, do not meet Ontario Drinking Water Standards and poses a significant health and safety risk. The community is currently undertaking a project to design and construct a communal water treatment plant; however, due to limitations in funding this project will only be able to provide this communal service to the community core area that services some of the other main community buildings and homes located close to the community core. Due to the location of the Administration Office and Community Centre being located right off a main 400 series highway, away from the community core, this connection to the communal system is not feasible at this time. Therefore, funding under the CWWF is needed for the immediate implementation of a new standalone, secure, safe and reliable water treatment system that would eliminate health and safety issues for the community and the province while providing much need potable water to an essential community building. The existing water supplying the building is non-complaint and we have had to post non-potable Do Not Drink notices.
Construction Start Date:2018-02-16
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Augusta Street Storm Sewer Relining of an existing large diameter trunk storm sewer
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** "Work includes the structural relining of an existing large diameter trunk storm sewer instead of replacing the existing Corrugated Steel Pipe (CSP) that has reached the end of its useful life. Re-line 159m of 600mm diameter CSP on Strachan Street; Re-line 272m of 750m diameter CSP pipe on Strachan Street and Gifford Street to Pine Street; Re-line 57.6m of 1050mm diameter CSP on Augusta Street from John Street to Elias Street. The project will extend the useful life of the asset. Following the competitive tender process, the low bid was significantly lower then originally anticipated. A cost savings is being realized from the original program submission. IO NOTE: There is no decrease in scope, only a decrease in tender. This will result in a decrease in Federal Funding of $55,144 to be reallocated to MPH001."
Construction Start Date:2018-06-08
Construction End Date:

properties.Name: Class 4 Septic System Replacements (tank and field) for 8 homes.
properties.Description:
Project Description:Big Grassy First Nation will replace 8 individual class 4 septic systems (tank and field) which have exceeded their design life and are showing signs of breakdown. The systems have currently been in operation for 36 years (installed in 1980). The new systems will be installed by a licensed septic installer (under the Ministry of Housing Building Code Identification Number Program). The new systems will ensure proper treatment of waste from the homes and will reduce the chances of contamination in nearby receiving environments from failing fields or cracked tanks/pipes. The new systems will also prevent backups of raw sewage back into the homes from failing components ensuring the health and safety of the occupants. Improved health of people will have off-reserve benefits of reducing pressure on the provincial health care system.
Construction Start Date:2017-06-05
Construction End Date:2017-08-31

properties.Name: Water Treatment Upgrades and Repairs
properties.Description:
Project Description:This project will provide the recommended repairs and replacement of key components required to restore engineered designed processes. Completion of this project will ensure that safe reliable drinking water is available and reduce the potential for additional pressure on the province's health care system. Items that will need to be replaced are: 1 x 3HP pump, 1 x 10 HP pump, 1 x 1 HP pump, Filter Actuators, Westech Filters Panel View 1400e, Lighting panel boards, Air scour blower, Chlorine analyzer, pH Analyzer, Chlorine pumps, Injection points for the chemicals. Items that will require programming: Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition computer (SCADA) system, Distribution control system with the Programmable Logic Controller (PLC), Low Lift control system
Construction Start Date:2017-02-06
Construction End Date:2017-02-24

properties.Name: Improvements to water treatability through upgrades in the water treatment plant process due to age of components.
properties.Description:
Project Description:Process equipment in the water treatment plant needs to be upgraded or replaced due to age and lack of replacement parts for raw and treated water analyzers, Turbidity meters, programmable logic controller (PLC) Control Panel and the supervisory control and data acquisition (SCADA) System. Off-reserve benefits are more secure drinking water system with reduced burden to provincial health system.
Construction Start Date:2017-12-01
Construction End Date:2020-04-30

properties.Name: Wastewater System Study, Manhole Renewals, and Lift Station Renewals
properties.Description:
Project Description:Part A: Evaluate wastewater treatment options and study the Village of Stanley's existing wastewater treatment plant. Part B: Assess the Village's wastewater collection system. Develop an infiltration and inflow remediation plan. Part C: Renew and re-line manholes. Install new flow meters. Replace the Southside sewage pumping station and install new back-up power and SCADA system. Modify the Northside pumping station to accept back-up power and SCADA.
Construction Start Date:2017-10-02
Construction End Date:2018-10-31

properties.Name: Replacement of a 150 mm Cast Iron Watermain and a 200 mm Asbestos Cement Sanitary Sewer on Maple Crescent
properties.Description:
Project Description:"This project was originally approved in May 2017. Owing to concerns about program timing, it was cancelled in October 2017 and replaced with project ORA-003. Given the extension we would like to return to this original project as it is a higher priority to our municipality. The existing 150 mm cast iron watermain on Maple Crescent has reached the end of its service life. The 200 mm sanitary sewers on Maple Crescent are constructed of asbestos cement and will also need to be replaced if the watermains are being replaced. This project will include the design and replacement of 500 m of the 150 mm cast iron watermain with Polyvinyl Chloride (PVC), 300 m of 200 mm asbestos cement sanitary sewer with PVC, and 34 water and sanitary service connections. The road will need to be fully reconstructed as a result of this work. Due to delays in developing the agreement, an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline is required."
Construction Start Date:2017-02-01
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Water Plant Upgrades
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project consists of the purchase and installation of a Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA) and the Ultra Violet Treatment (UV) systems to meet provincial water treatment standards.
Construction Start Date:2017-04-01
Construction End Date:2017-11-03

properties.Name: Fort St. James Water Looping Project - Simon Fraser Ave.
properties.Description:
Project Description:"The project work will include: - Replacement of service connections at 15 houses; - Decommissioning of 275m line; - Installation of 275m replacement line; and, - Installation of 1 CV fire hydrant and related works."
Construction Start Date:2017-11-01
Construction End Date:2018-01-05

properties.Name: Water Treatment Plant Backwash Air Scour System
properties.Description:
Project Description:Design, supply, install air scour system to improve filter media cleaning and reduce treated water consumption during backwash cycles of the water plant's two filter trains. This will require: removal of existing filter media, supply and install polyvinyl chloride (PVC) pipes, fittings and air nozzles, blower motor, motor starter, control valves and all associated controls and wiring. Completion of this project is critical to the safe/ efficient supply of water to the community, thus reducing potential impact on the Province's health system.
Construction Start Date:2017-06-01
Construction End Date:2017-11-01

properties.Name: Kinuso Water Distriubtion Pumphouse and Reservoir
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project includes the new water distribution pumphouse and reservoir construction.

Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Lift Station Upgrades
properties.Description:
Project Description:The stations are under-sized for capacity. Outdated electrical controls do not meet current CODE. Power consumption and maintenance is high.
Construction Start Date:2018-05-01
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Borden-Carleton Sewer Extension 2017
properties.Description:
Project Description:Extension of the Borden-Carleton Water/Sewer Utility sewer main from Master Packaging on the Trans Canada along the TCH to the intersection of the TCH and Route 10, connecting seven residential and four large commercial customers.
Construction Start Date:2017-09-05
Construction End Date:2017-10-20

properties.Name: Main Street - Storm Sewer Renewal
properties.Description:
Project Description:Storm sewer renewal along Main Street. This project includes related road work necessary to complete the project.

Construction End Date:2017-11-08

properties.Name: Retrofit of various Sewage Lift Stations
properties.Description:

properties.Description:
