Construction Start Date:2017-09-01
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Repair and replace five curb valves to improve the water distribution system
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** "Repair and / or replace 5 curb valves that are no longer working. The project includes Hydrova services that cost approximately $1000 per valve if we do more than one the same day, the valve itself is approximately four hundred per unit. After completion of the work our distribution system will be safer and if an incident happens it will affect less people. Replacing the curb valves that are not functioning properly increased the safety of our resident infrastructure in case of a break. Also because we detected some leak in the past when we worked on repairing curb valves replacing valves will safe consumption. Furthermore in case of pump failure at the plant that cause a low pressure in the system good working curb valves decrease the risk of contamination. During digging to realign valve boxes and rods, it was discovered that most boxes and rods were corroded and needed to be changed to allow proper opening and closing the valves if ever needed. We have repaired some of our valves but realized that a greater number of valves need to be repaired because of corrosion. If scope change is approved, the remaining valves will be checked and repaired as needed. Due to delays in developing the agreement , an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline is required. IO NOTE: Due to the increase in scope, there is an increase in Federal Funding of $4,000 to be reallocated from OPA-003."
Construction Start Date:2017-06-06
Construction End Date:2018-09-30

properties.Name: Studies to Improve Water Quality Control for Small Watercourses Draining Directly to Lake Ontario
properties.Description:
Project Description:Several fully urbanized small watercourses discharging directly to Lake Ontario (e.g., Clearview Creek, Serson Creek, Lornewood Creek) currently lack stormwater quality controls. Studies will be completed for priority watercourses to identify measures that can be implemented along the stream corridors to improve water quality and enhance the riparian corridor from a natural environment perspective. This project will support the Credit Valley Conversation Authority Lands. Two feasibility studies will be completed for both Clearview Creek and Lornewood Creek as well as a detailed design for Lornewood Creek are included in this work.
Construction Start Date:2017-07-01
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Water and Sewer White's Road and Clarke's Road
properties.Description:
Project Description:Upgrades to the existing water and sewer systems on Whites Road. The project will see the replacement of the current water and sewer systems as well as the subsequent required road work. In addition, the project will also provide upgraded water and sewer services to the residents of Clarke's Road, whose current services are experiencing reliability issues
Construction Start Date:2017-09-19
Construction End Date:2018-12-31

properties.Name: Sewer Outfall from North Cove outfall to Big Pond / Sewer Main Upgrade, phase 2 and Sewage Pumping Station Upgrades
properties.Description:
Project Description:Twin the sewer line from Northern Cove Outfall to Big Pond Road approximately 1350 metres complete with the interception of upstream sewage flow towards Costellos Rd/Northern Cove by way of optimal sewer line routing along the Conception Bay North Highway via Mercers Rd. In addition, the project will also include upgrades to the sewage pumping station to increase its capacity to accommodate peak flows.
Construction Start Date:2017-05-08
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Replacement of Stouffer Street watermain and sanitary sewer, and improvements to the storm sewer sytem
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project includes replacement of the aged and deteriorated watermain and sanitary sewer system, including residential services. A storm sewer system with catch basins will be constructed on the eastern road segment, and the existing storm sewer system on the western road segment will be repaired. The infrastructure services approximately 52 households.
Construction Start Date:2017-11-01
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Post Assessment Repairs to Stormwater Outfalls
properties.Description:
Project Description:Concrete headwall removal and repair of various outfalls following condition assessments. Locations include outfalls on the McIntyre River, McVicar Creek, Neebing River and Neebing-McIntyre Floodway.
Construction Start Date:2017-06-01
Construction End Date:2018-10-01

properties.Name: Rehabilitation (concrete repair and sealing) of the West Reservoir at the Nanticoke Water Treatment Plant
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project involves the replacement of approximately 600 feet of deteriorated floor joint junction strips and the spot repair of delaminated and cracked concrete in the floor slab and support columns in the existing west water reservoir. The west reservoir dimensions are 55 m x 70 m x 9 m and has a storage capacity of 27,250 cubic meters. The west reservoir is one of two identical reservoirs that stores water to service the 5,100 residents of Hagersville, Jarvis and Townsend as well as a large local industry (US Steel).
Construction Start Date:2017-11-01
Construction End Date:2017-12-31

properties.Name: SCADA System
properties.Description:
Project Description:Install a backup system in case of a primary SCADA communications system failure. Design and install an independent link for reliable monitoring of water and wastewater infrastructure including hardware and software upgrades. Perform additional SCADA hardware and software upgrades.
Construction Start Date:2018-01-15
Construction End Date:2018-12-31

properties.Name: Feasibility Study and Inspections: Determine specific areas of rehabilitation focus within the wastewater collection system to improve optimization through reduced inflow and infiltration.
properties.Description:
Project Description:Flushing, smoke testing and camera imaging of 18 kilometers of wastewater mains. Inspection of all manholes. Gravity forced mains will be a focus. Specific locations of focus: Cleak Ave, Monck Street and Vallyview Drive, however the full system will be flushed, imaged (by CCTV) and recorded for examination. Priority rehabilitation projects will be identified that will improve system optimization through reduced inflow and infiltration, which is a serious problem for the system currently (The Town is currently only billing approximately 40% of treated wastewater).
Construction Start Date:2017-04-01
Construction End Date:2018-09-30

properties.Name: Residential Water Service Valve Replacement program
properties.Description:
Project Description:The Water Service Valve Replacement Program would include the replacement of the old 25mm inverted style service valve with new No Lead Ball Valves. These valves are primarily located in one area of town and due to the construction and size of the valve, have seized and become inoperable. There are approximately 200 of these valves in our system. In addition to the valves the project would include replacement of the valve connection rod which corrodes at the connection point to the valve. With todays technology, this work can be performed from the surface with a minimal size hole and by use of Hydro-Excavation. It is unknown how many valve rods have failed but it could be as many as 500 from our 26,000 serviced properties. Project would include retaining a specialized contractor to inspect and replace failing water service valves that are owned and operated by the Town of Newmarket and connect residents to the drinking water distribution system. Aligns with asset management, enhanced customer service, risk management. Supports Council strategy and vision of ensuring effective and efficient services, supporting innovative projects and partnerships and efficient management of capital assets and municipal services to meet existing and future operational demands. This project is required to ensure the Town has the ability to isolate residential water services, which are owned and operated by the Town, to perform emergency isolations, maintenance, repairs and replacement of water meters and other residential related activities that require the water to be shut off. Due to delays in developing the Transfer Payment Agreement and subsequent delays in procurement and its impact on construction schedule, we are requesting an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline to ensure successful completion of the project.
Construction Start Date:2017-09-15
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Rehabilitation of streambanks within the Etibicoke Creek Watershed to mitigate erosion issues locally while conducting studies to identify "at source" opportunities to reduce the potential for erosion
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Revised project *** See Keynotes for previous information The City of Brampton has prepared a City-Wide Erosion Study for the main creek and it's tributaries within the Etobicoke Creek watershed (east Brampton). This project will involve the repair of streambanks that were identified in the erosion study (construction projects). Erosion mitigation projects will be constructed locally within the stream itself, and also examine the upstream catchment area to identify opportunities for innovative source controls using low impact development technologies and also utilize the methodologies developed in the erosion study to inventory and assess the condition of the streams in west Brampton (Fletcher's Creek and Credit Valley River). Due to delays in developing the Transfer Payment Agreement and subsequent delays in procurement and its impact on construction schedule, we are requesting an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline.
Construction Start Date:2017-07-02
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Sewage Lift Station #5 piping rehabilitation and replacement.
properties.Description:
Project Description:Replacement of piping at lift station #5
Construction Start Date:2017-11-01
Construction End Date:2019-03-01

properties.Name: Replacement of the aeration pipes in the treatment plant
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project involves the replacement of the aeration pipes in the wastewater treatment plant.

Construction End Date:2016-12-15

properties.Name: Environmental Risk Assessment for Lagoon
properties.Description:
Project Description:Assess the environmental risk to the lagoon.

Construction End Date:2017-12-31

properties.Name: Ninth Avenue South #345 to #322 Sanitary Sewer Relining
properties.Description:
Project Description:Relining of 200 mm diameter clay tile sanitary pipe utilizing cured-in place pipe no dig technology. The current Clay tile pipe installed many decades ago is exhibiting root infiltration and cracked sections as observed in the most recent CCTV inspections. This rehabilitation will avoid poor or no access to open cut trenching in residential rear yards that would be in close proximity to the homes, under decks, fences etc along the length of pipe being rehabilitated.
Construction Start Date:2018-02-01
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Arthur Wastewater Treatment Plant Upgrade - Detailed Design
properties.Description:
Project Description:Project will prepare detailed engineering design of treatment plant upgrade for re-rating.
Construction Start Date:2016-12-01
Construction End Date:2018-12-31

properties.Name: River Rd Area (Dorothy St, Evan St, & Margery Rd) Sewer Separation and Watermain Replacement Project
properties.Description:
Project Description:"Sewer Separation on Dorothy St, Evan St, and Margery Rd, (i.e., River Rd Area), to construct 665 meters of storm sewers to separate the current combined sewer system and reduce/eliminate combined sewer overflows that go directly to the Welland River. Current estimates of Combined Sewer Overflow to the Welland River can be up to 315,000 cubic meters annually. Storm sewer pipes will range in size from 300mm diameter to 450mm diameter with an overall drainage area of approximately 5.9 hectares. Due to the lack of capacity among contractors/engineers in the region, we are requesting an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline to ensure successful completion of the project."
Construction Start Date:2018-01-08
Construction End Date:2018-05-30

properties.Name: Construction of new well at Municipal Office location to provide clean drinking water to the public
properties.Description:
Project Description:This project will see the construction of a new well at the municipal office. The municipal office hosts many meetings and events, which are open to all residents of Hamilton Township and visitors from other areas. The current water supply is from a well located in the driving lane of the adjacent Public Works yard and increasing maintenance issues for this well have a direct negative effect on the water service at the Township Municipal Office. This project would see a service enhancement that would potentially affect all township residents and visitors and provide safe and cost-effective water.
Construction Start Date:2015-09-15
Construction End Date:2017-11-30

properties.Name: Ivan/Sykes/Paul Sewer Replacement and Restoration
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project will focus on sewer replacement only with the installation of 405m of 200mm Polyvinyl Chloride (PVC) sewer main, and will restore the affected areas. There are no other infrastructure replacement works proposed in this area at this time. This length of sewer main has 6 connections and is a main trunk main for the entire South West Quadrant of the Municipality's Wastewater Collection system.
Construction Start Date:2017-07-10
Construction End Date:2017-12-31

properties.Name: Rehabilitation of Generator and Transfer Switch at the Little Current Main Pump House
properties.Description:
Project Description:This project includes the replacement of an existing generator with a new generator and transfer switch.  The current generator and transfer switch are obsolete and the parts are no longer available.  This is the main sewage pump station for the Town of Little Current and the rehabilitation of the pump is critical to the Little Current water treatment plant operation.
Construction Start Date:2016-06-16
Construction End Date:2017-05-19

properties.Name: Replacement and Installation of existing high lift pumps from 7.5 horsepower to 5 horsepower with variable frequency drives at 50 Agnes Street, Charlton.
properties.Description:
Project Description:Replacement of the existing 7.5 horsepower high lift pumps with new 5 horsepower variable frequency drive capable pumps. We would also inspect and clean the clearwell in preparation for the installation of the new pumps. Scope: Remove and dispose of old pumps, purchase, install, test and commission new pumps and VFD (Variable Frequency Drive) and tie into PLC (process Logic Control) . Clean out clearwell during the replacement as the clearwell will be out of service and this will be a good opportunity to enter and clean. Output: New more efficient pumps installed which modulate depending upon the water demands of the town eliminating the need for a hydropneumatic tank to maintain pressure to the distribution system. Benefits: this project would allow us to remove the hydropneumatic tank - which can not be approved by the CSA (Canadian Standards association) as it has no stamps of approval - and would result in enhanced safety, less maintenance and reduction in electricity costs.
Construction Start Date:2017-08-01
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Design of Damaged Storm Pipe Off Henderson Dr.
properties.Description:
Project Description:This project involves the detailed design preparation for the following works: replacement of approximately 470m of 900mm storm sewer and reconstruction of 250m of road due to the replacement. Re-routing of approximately 120m of 900mm diameter concrete storm sewer currently under a plaza structure.
Construction Start Date:2017-04-15
Construction End Date:2020-03-31

properties.Name: Decommissioning Wells Street Public School Sanitary Sewer
properties.Description:
Project Description:This project will decommission the old clay tile sanitary sewer pipe that runs behind what used to be Wells Street Public school and seven additional private residences and connect these facilities to a newer sanitary sewer line that exists in front of the properties. The decommissioning of the old pipe will include filling it completely with grout and capping both ends so it cannot collapse. The newer sanitary sewer line that the properties will be connected to is a 200mm pipe with existing capacity to add residences to its existing flow.
Construction Start Date:2016-09-15
Construction End Date:2017-07-30

properties.Name: Construction of 1500mm Stormwater Outfall  at James Street - Neebing River to Riverview Drive
properties.Description:
Project Description:A new storm outfall to river and 85m long 1500mm diameter concrete outfall pipe that will replace a deteriorated portion of the municipal storm system. This is stage one of a project to replace other portions of deteriorated sewer extending southerly from the Neebing River. Impact area 555,000 square meters and 330 properties.
Construction Start Date:2017-06-01
Construction End Date:2017-10-01

properties.Name: Update Quality Management Standards for Stormwater Discharge to receiving stream
properties.Description:
Project Description:Engage the services of a consultant to develop a Town Quality Management Standards for Stormwater Discharge - which would include phosphorus and volumetric controls. Installation of Monitors for future use. Due to delays in developing the Transfer Payment Agreement and subsequent delays in procurement and its impact on construction schedule, we are requesting an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline to ensure successful completion of the project.

Construction End Date:2019-11-30

properties.Name: Morenz Lane Sanitary Pumping Station in Grand Bend - Mechanical and Electrical Equipment Replacement
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** "The Morenz Pumping Station is a small local pumping station that is in need of a complete overhaul including piping, electrical and Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA) upgrades. The additional electrical work was found during detail design of the project and is required to be able to undertake the current scope. Extension rationale: The Municipality was delayed on these projects due to the late commitment of funding. The delayed funding made it difficult to complete design, competitively source contractors and complete construction within the originally given date. This was compounded by the seasonality of the projects which cannot be completed during the winters months. IO NOTE: There is an increase in scope, resulting in an increase in Federal Funding of $5,433 to be reallocated from LAM-005."
Construction Start Date:2017-07-02
Construction End Date:2018-11-15

properties.Name: Sanitary Sewer Trenchless Repairs (Township Wide Backlog)
properties.Description:
Project Description:This project includes the repair of sanitary sewers with needs identified during yearly camera inspections. The Township has a backlog of repairs which have not been complete due to a lack of available funds and sanitary cash flow.
Construction Start Date:2017-03-06
Construction End Date:2017-07-28

properties.Name: Drinking water and domestic wastewater infrastructure work - Notre-Dame Street S
properties.Description:
Project Description:The purpose of the project is to extend the water supply and sewer systems in order to service 70 residences.
Construction Start Date:2017-07-15
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Construction of 300 mm Sanitary Sewer Separation on Archibald Street: Dease Street to Leith Street
properties.Description:
Project Description:Storm sewer separation of a combined sewer by construction of 430 m of new 300 mm Polyvinyl Chloride (PVC) sanitary sewers, connections and conversion of existing sewer to storm sewer. Directly services 58 households and businesses. Coordinated with watermain. 37,500 square meter impact area
Construction Start Date:2017-06-01
Construction End Date:2017-10-01

properties.Name: Wingham and Blyth Wastewater Systems Master Plan
properties.Description:
Project Description:***Modified project*** See notes for original project information. This project will assess North Huron's two Wastewater systems as a whole, assess their current conditions primarily of 40km of sanitary sewer mains and of 4 facilities and major components, and help establish a strategic plan for renewal, rehabilitation, address system shortcomings, including rates, and develop multi-year schedules for major item replacements and review rate structures. Careful planning and disciplined sustainable long-term system management is critical in small communities with major infrastructure, and this study would help provide guidance in planning the appropriate system management. There has been an increase in scope to include facility assessment, CCTV Camera work and GIS mapping for asset management. Due to additional time required to complete preparatory work (i.e. EAs/soil testing/identifying utilities etc.), we are requesting an extension beyond March 31, 2018, to ensure successful completion of the project.
Construction Start Date:2017-01-01
Construction End Date:2018-07-15

properties.Name: 2017 Sanitary Sewer Infrastructure Rehabilitation Program
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project works will include: - Draining and removal of sewage sludge from Cell 3; - Removal of the existing lagoon cell liner; - Supply and installation of 20,000m² of 60 mm HDPE liner; - Installation of submerged bubble aeration system and appurtenant air supply pipes; and, - Removal and replacement of main lift station wet well cover including pump removal hatches, and ventilation.
Construction Start Date:2017-06-17
Construction End Date:2018-12-31

properties.Name: Repair/Refurbish North Wastewater Pump Station
properties.Description:
Project Description:The objective of this project is to ensure wastewater can be effectively conveyed to the Wastewater Treatment Plant for proper management. The scope of this project is to: pump down the holding tank, replace aging, corroded piping, guide rails, refurbish the pumps, inspect and repair any cement cracks or deterioration The expected outcome is to extend the useful life of the Wastewater Pump Station to ensure it can reliably convey wastewater through to the Treatment Plant.
Construction Start Date:2018-01-01
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Renewal of water pipes
properties.Description:
Project Description:Travaux de renouvellement de conduites visant le maintien de services deau aux citoyens pour 1 tronçon de rue et totalisant 0,3 km.
Construction Start Date:2017-08-02
Construction End Date:2017-11-21

properties.Name: Fenelon Falls Water Treatment Plant Clearwell Modification Study
properties.Description:
Project Description:Development of a clearwell modification plan for the Fenelon Falls Water Treatment Plant to meet the MOECCs recently announced revised contact time requirements for disinfection at Ontarios water treatment plants. Under current processes, these new requirements will result in the plant falling under capacity. The City is required to provide a plan by April, 2017 to modify the plant to rectify this situation. Detailed design of the identified necessary process modifications will follow on development and MOECC approval of this plan. An additional anticipated change in the MOECC Water Quality Guidelines involving the limits on disinfection by-products known as THMs (Tri-Halo-Methanes) will require a study of the treatment process upstream of the filtration system at the plant. The THM study has been deferred in the past, but may be accelerated to coincide and be included with the clearwell modification plan, if adequate funding is available. The THM study is identified in the 2014 Capacity Assessment for Fenelon Falls. These clearwell modification plan and THM study will ensure regulatory compliance with current and anticipated MOECC Guidelines, aid in providing improved water quality to over 2,500 residents and business consumers in the community and ensure projected capacity requirements in the water system are realized.
Construction Start Date:2017-03-30
Construction End Date:2018-05-31

properties.Name: Renewal of water pipes
properties.Description:
Project Description:Pipe renewal works aimed at maintaining water services for citizens for some 16 stretches of road and totaling 1.236 km.
Construction Start Date:2017-08-21
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Treated Water Reservoir and Pump System Upgrade
properties.Description:
Project Description:Reservoir and pump upgrades include increased distribution pumping capacity and fire pump, standby power to maintain operations during power outages, added treated water storage to include emergency & equalization storage, and chlorine monitor..
Construction Start Date:2017-04-01
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Storm Sewer Closed-Circuit Television Inspection, Condition Data Collection, and Condition Assessment in Various Locations In York Region
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** Inspect storm sewers in various locations across York Region using closed-circuit television technology. This project will consist of inspecting approximately 14 percent of the storm sewer network and providing condition assessments for each location inspected. Recommendations for future repairs are to be provided as part of the work. The output of this work will be included in the Regional storm infrastructure asset management plan to be completed in 2017 and will be included in the Regional capital repair program. Decreased number of storm sewers for inspection. The original scope was to inspect 52km of storm sewers. The new scope with the budget reduction will inspect 21km of storm sewers. IO NOTE: There is a decrease in scope, resulting in a decrease in Federal Funding of $483,000 to be reallocated to YOR-002.
Construction Start Date:2017-08-09

properties.Name: Design for Trenchless Sewer Rehabilitation at no fewer than 34 Locations across the City

The work will improve structural integrity, hydraulic performance, reduce basement flooding, extraneous flows, and improve the overall operation of the system. There are 34 sewer segments with diameters ranging from 225 mm to 1800 mm. The total proposed length is 2800 metres. The locations are scattered across the City.

properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** "Upgrading and deepening of approximately 500m of existing roadside ditches to improve runoff and minimize erosion and flooding issues. Initial estimate done prior to final design and it was required to extend the limits of the drainage improvements beyond the originally anticipated scope, which increased costs. IO NOTE: There is an increase in scope, resulting in an increase in Federal Funding of $15,137.50 to be reallocated."

properties.Name: Upgrade culverts, Ditching Catholic Ch Rd, 5 homes

Construction End Date:2017-08-31

properties.Name: Separation of sewers on Parkdale and Coronation that serve 56 homes
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** "Preparation of plans and specifications to obtain approvals necessary for tendering and constructing this sewer separation project. Works will include sewers, roadway, sidewalks and lighting. The project affects 56 homes that are currently serviced by an aging combination sewer that flows downstream to a separated sewer system. The eligible costs are limited to public/municipal property and assets. Reason for Variance - 1) During the design of Coronation and Parkdale, the consultant found two existing, but unknown combined sewers that required additional sewer flushing, camera and survey work. 2) The existing lighting infrastructure was found to be unusable and had to be replaced. IO NOTE: There is an increase in scope, and will result in an increase in Federal Funding of $18,500.00 to be reallocated from LEA-001."

Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Wastewater Treatment Plant refurbishment of clarifier overflow baffles, restoration of concrete, and installation of new clarifier drive mechanism

Project Description:The original package treatment plant will be refurbished through the sandblasting and painting of the clarifier overflow baffles, rehabilitation of existing concrete, and the installation of a new clarifier drive mechanism.
Construction Start Date:2017-08-03
Construction End Date:2017-12-18

properties.Name: Centre Street cast iron watermain upgrade
properties.Description:
Project Description:This project consists of the removal of an aging cast iron watermain installed in 1891 along Centre Street in Niagara on the Lake to be replaced by 150 metres of 150 millimetre diameter polyvinyl chloride watermain. Cast iron watermain replacement has been a Town initiative for a number of years and remains a priority until all older watermains have been replaced to conform to the Region and Town standards. In particular, it is beneficial to the residents of this area because of the susceptibility of the older mains to break or rupture under extreme weather conditions. It will also ensure that residents receive the highest quality water supply.
Construction Start Date:2017-12-12
Construction End Date:2018-05-31

properties.Name: Hopeton Road and Horton Park Subdivision Watermain Extension
properties.Description:
Project Description:Expansion of the water system to the Hopeton Road and Horton Park Subdivision, including the installation of watermains and all associated infrastructure. Approximately 835 m of conventional watermain will be constructed within the existing area.
Construction Start Date:2017-06-05
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: The Installation of a Stormwater System and Urbanization of North Town Line East from Pemberton Street to Mutual Street.
properties.Description:
Project Description:The urbanization of North Town Line East from Pemberton Street to Mutual Street, including curb & gutters, sidewalks and storm sewers. An "Urban" road section by the Towns standard includes hot-mix asphalt, curb & gutter and sidewalks. This section currently has ditches which insufficiently drain stormwater from the roadway and adjacent residential properties. The project involves the removal of roughly 650 meters of existing roadway including base materials, the installation of approximately 1000 meters of storm sewers (650 meters along roadway and an additional 350 meters to tie into an existing Storm Water Management (SWM) System) and the replacement of the road base and surface. This road section will be completed with curbs and gutter as well as sidewalks. The primary goals/outputs of this project include; installing a storm water system to collect rainwater within the vicinity of this roadway and direct it to a nearby SWM System and to urbanize the cross section of the road to bring it to Town standards (Hot-Mix Asphalt, Curb and Gutter, Sidewalks).
Construction Start Date:2017-04-25
Construction End Date:2017-10-31

properties.Name: Water Infrastructure Renewal Program
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project works will include: - Installation of approximately 1,660m of watermain
Construction Start Date:2017-06-12
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Water and Sewage Infrastructure
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project works will include: - Reconstruct water system on Mildred Avenue between Pooley and Dawson Streets; - Rehabilitation of road works impacted by project works; - Replace aged chlorine pumps at the District's water filtration and purification plant; and, - Installation of a chlorination system to help disinfect effluent flowing from the District's single lagoon primary sewage treatment system into the adjoining willow river.
Construction Start Date:2018-09-03
Construction End Date:2018-10-31

properties.Name: Grafton Communal Water System - Water Meter Replacement Program. Replacement of existing 227 residential and 20 commercial water meters with new water meters on and around 10836 County Road #2.
properties.Description:
Project Description:The current water meters are 25 years old and are inaccurate. This leaves out water that should be accounted for. The replacement of the old water meters with the new meters will see the removal of 277 residential and 20 commercial water meters and have them replaced with 277 residential and 20 commercial new water meters. The Township will have reduced meter reading costs moving forward and the new meters will fit with the principal of conservation by reducing water loss
Construction Start Date:2017-05-31
Construction End Date:2017-12-31

properties.Name: Yarrow Waterworks Reservoir "A" Replacement
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project works will include: - Construction of 1,500 cubic meter concrete reservoir; - Demolition of existing reservoir; - Rock excavation - Slope stabilization; - Reservoir piping appertunances; - Site drainage improvement works; and - Access road repairs.
Construction Start Date:2017-01-05
Construction End Date:2018-11-09

properties.Name: Bell's Road Watermain Extension - Engineering Design Services
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** "Detailed engineering design and specifications for an approx. 2.2km water main extension along the Bell's Road. This will include but limited to a geotechnical investigation, topographical survey, and a hydraulic analysis. This project will inform future capital project(s) leading to the expansion of safe water supply and reduced impacts on the provincial health system. Additional economical benefits beyond the on-reserve community include the increase in revenue that will be obtained by the Deseronto Township for monthly billing. Budget included cost for a survey which is no longer required. IO NOTE: Due to the decrease in scope, there is a decrease in Federal Funding of $5,500.00 to be reallocated to MBQ-001."
Construction Start Date:2017-04-01
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Infrastructure improvement including chlorine analyzer, lift pumps, valves, flow meters and unit heaters at the Moose Creek Water Treatment Facility and Well Heads
properties.Description:
Project Description:This project will include the replacement of key infrastructure within the water treatment plant for the Village of Moose Creek, which services approximately 500 people. Replacement and rehabilitation will occur on the Chlorine Analyzer and the Chlorine Analyzer distribution system, replacing the Cl2 pump, and the high lift pump, replacing the pressure reducing valves for the drinking water supply as well as the unit heater and flow meters on wells #2 and #3. The largest rehabilitation project within the Moose Creek Water Treatment Facility is the replacement of the well pumps for wells #1 and #2 as well as the cameras within each well. This replacement is high on the priority list for replacement as it is an integral piece of infrastructure for providing drinking water. The turbidity analyzer is also in need of replacing as its anticipated life cycle is coming due.
Construction Start Date:2016-04-01
Construction End Date:2017-09-30

properties.Name: Equipment Upgrades at the Water Treatment Plant for Chlorine analyzer, Turbidity meter and singer valve.
properties.Description:
Project Description:Purchase and install replacement parts for chlorine analyzer, turbidity meter and singer valve on site is imperative to ensure continuous service to the residents if any of the original equipment fails.
Construction Start Date:2017-11-05
Construction End Date:2018-06-01

properties.Name: Upgrading of perimeter Safety and Security Fencing to Wastewater Lagoon
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** "Currently the perimeter fence around the lagoon is a 4 foot high farm fence making it easy for hunters and others to trespass on the property. Frost has lifted two of the corner posts and some wildlife are coming under the fence. Foxes, skunks and the occasional bear have been seen on the inside of the fence. The open water at the lagoon is of great concern for public safety. The lagoon is located a short distance on the outskirts of town and it is not under supervision 24/7. We propose to install 1600 meters of a 6 feet high chain link fence complete with gates to secure the property. Our Public Works Department prepared the original estimate for the job. Being a small municipality and with no engineer on staff we did not have the expertise to put together an engineered cost projection for the project. The dollar($) amounts for putting the estimate together were obtained by going to the local supply store and asking prices for the individual items required. The individual prices were then tallied up and we got a total project cost for materials. Then the Public Works department guesstimated on the number of man hours that would be needed to get the job done, multiplied those hours by the average hourly rate and derived the total labour cost which was then added to the estimated material cost and added both costs to arrive at an estimated total cost for the project. What we did not take into consideration was the discounted contractor when purchasing the material as well as the fact that the contractor had all necessary equipment to get the job done quicker and more efficiently. This resulted in an actual cost for the project which was lower than anticipated. IO NOTE: There is no decrease in scope, only a decrease in tender and materials. There is a decrease in Federal Funding of $6,389 to be reallocated to ARMS-004."
Construction Start Date:2017-09-11
Construction End Date:2017-10-20

properties.Name: Replacement of Existing Iron Removal Filters at the McCamus Avenue Water Treatment Plant
properties.Description:
Project Description:Replacement of the two existing Pressurized Iron Removal Filters (in parallel configuration), each with a capacity rating of 3928 cubic metres per day, at the McCamus Avenue Water Treatment Plant.
Construction Start Date:2017-08-01
Construction End Date:2018-05-31

properties.Name: Addition of standby filter cartridge housing for Alpine Water treatment plant
properties.Description:
Project Description:The existing well was deemed under the influence of surface water and the filter housing was required to be upgraded to 1 micron absolute NFS certified housing/filters, however only one of the two existing filter trains was upgraded in 2014. There is currently no redundancy as the back-up filter train is not capable of housing the required filters.
Construction Start Date:2018-01-01
Construction End Date:2018-01-30

properties.Name: Design needed for the separation of the drinking water and the sewer line as the water line is crossing the sewer line.  (phase 1 of 2)
properties.Description:
Project Description:During a study in 2016, it was found that a drinking water line was crossing through the sanitary sewer system. The water line must be separated from the sewer line, which requires an engineered redesign to ensure applicable standards are met and hydraulic integrity of the distribution system is not adversely affected. (Phase 1 of 2, Phase 2 will be the physical separation of the watermain from the sewer main and is further described in next project.) Objective: To create a design to separate the water and sewage piping which presently intersect as identified in the Closed-circuit television inspections. This design must consider the required separation required between sanitary sewers and municipal water system pipe. Scope: Procure Engineering Consultant. Consultant to design an alternate watermain route that meets requirements and can be used to perform or tender construction in Phase 2. Output: Engineered drawing that clearly describe details required by constructors, including but not limited to material, required depths of each utility, backfill required, surfacing required, and any details of use to the contractor.
Construction Start Date:2017-12-01
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Battery Street Sanitary Sewer - Replacement of vitrified clay pipe
properties.Description:
Project Description:OBJECTIVE: The Town is actively adopting wastewater infrastructure renewal projects that improve operation and maintenance requirements, reduce inflow and infiltration, provide enhancements to the natural environment and support long term sustainable infrastructure. SCOPE: The scope of this project includes the replacement of 220 metres of 450mm diameter vitrified clay sanitary sewers from Bertie Street to Catherine Street that were constructed in 1925. The sanitary sewer is in a poor structural state and is beyond the end of its service life. Replacement of the sanitary sewer is the recommended rehabilitation alternative along with the replacement of maintenance holes and sanitary laterals. Additionally, the project includes the replacement of 110 metres of 150mm diameter cast iron watermain constructed in 1920 from Catharine Street to Murray Street. The watermain is beyond the end of its service life and is prone to failure which leads to water quality concerns. Considering the age of the watermain, replacement of the watermain is the recommended rehabilitation alternative. This is a priority project for the Town. Town Council has accelerated this project to design in 2016 and construction in 2017 through administrative report IS-22-2016. The design for this project is currently being completed by an engineering design firm with a planned 2017 construction start. OUTPUT: The estimated reduction in stormwater (inflow & infiltration) entering the wastewater distribution system is approximately 2,300 cubic meters per annum as a direct result of this project. The replacement of the watermain will improve system reliability; reduce operational issues as well as reducing opportunities for negative impacts to water quality. This project will directly contribute to reduce point source sanitary overflows to meet both regulatory requirements and objectives of the remedial action plan for the Niagara River.
Construction Start Date:2017-04-30
Construction End Date:2018-11-16

properties.Name: Badjeros Stormwater Management Study
properties.Description:
Project Description:***Modified project*** See notes for original project information. Badjeros on Grey Road 9 has had ongoing stormwater issues as there is not a suitable outlet for the stormwater as the entire settlement area is in a depression. Grey anticipates completing a stormwater study and likely petitioning for a Municipal Drain, as per the Drainage Act, which would involve the design of a drainage system utilizing ditches, pipes, tiles and possible detention ponds all leading to a proper legal outlet.
Construction Start Date:2017-08-09
Construction End Date:2018-06-30

properties.Name: Replacement of Nine Stormwater Culverts in four different locations across the Township
properties.Description:

This will allow the Township to effectively deal with stormwater run off. The culvert replacement is needed as they have reached the end of their useful life and require replacement to appropriately manage the assets.

Construction End Date:2017-10-01

properties.Name: Water Treatment Plant supervisory control and data acquisition System Upgrade of existing system at 37 Concession Street
properties.Description:
Project Description:The objective is to upgrade the Water treatment plant supervisory control and data acquisition system and include new programmable logic controller (PLC); through design, installation and commissioning of the integrated control system, including training and manual preparation.
Construction Start Date:2017-06-01
Construction End Date:2018-06-30

properties.Name: Performing the capital work to separate the drinking water and the sewer line as the water line is crossing the sewer line.  (phase 2 of 2)
properties.Description:
Project Description:After phase 1 (Design) is complete, the drinking water line that is currently passing through the sanitary sewer line will be physically separated. (phase 2 of 2) Objective: To separate the watermain from the sewer main as required by regulation. Scope: Purchase all required materials, excavate, traffic control, follow all pertinent regulations pertaining to water and sewage infrastructure, follow American Water Works Association disinfection procedure for new construction, provide manpower, perform required sample as per standard, backfill and cover as describe in drawings. Output: Eliminate the cross connection and leave pipework in a state which is up to code to ensure that water safe for human consumption is delivered while ensuring the collection system at the location is also intact and up to code.
Construction Start Date:2017-08-03
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Water Treatment 2- Chlorine Injection repair
properties.Description:
Project Description:Inspect, report, and repair the Chlorine Injection system of water treatment process of the water treatment plant. Completion of this project is critical to the safe/ efficient supply of water to the community, thus reducing potential impact on the Province's health system.
Construction Start Date:2016-12-01
Construction End Date:2017-01-30

properties.Name: Chemical Building
properties.Description:
Project Description:Construction of a new Chemical Bu¡lding at the C¡ty of Brandon Water Treatment Plant will modernize the production, storage, unloading and containment of chemicals required in the treatment processes. The intent is to replace the current disinfection system, centralize anc¡llary chemical systems, and add orthophosphate dosing to bring the finished drinking water into compliance with the Canadian guidelines and Provincial regulations. The new building and process systems would also provide a safer environment with the facility and within the community by moving away from the current chlorine gas based disinfection system.
Construction Start Date:2018-10-08
Construction End Date:2020-03-31

properties.Name: Water Supply and Treatability Study
properties.Description:
Project Description:Conduct a water supply/water treatability study . The study will be over a period of 12 months to determine the best solution for developing an effective and reliable water supply and treatment system. Completion of this study is critical to the safe/ efficient supply of water to the community, thus reducing potential impact on the Province's health care system.
Construction Start Date:2018-03-15
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Design for the ability meet the Wastewater System Effluent Regulations coming into effect on January 1, 2021.
properties.Description:
Project Description:Design for a new Rotating Biological Contactor (RBC), upgrade existing lift station, a new vacuum assisted drying bed, a septage receiving facility and convert chlorination to Ultraviolet (UV) disinfecting system. Successful completion of this project will ensure that untreated wastewater does not enter the environment and negatively impact surrounding communities. Please click Wastewater Systems Effluent Regulations http://laws-lois.justice.gc.ca/eng/regulations/SOR-2012-139. Due to weather-sensitive work that must be completed outside of winter months, we are requesting an extension beyond March 31, 2018, to ensure successful completion of the project.
Construction Start Date:2017-09-18
Construction End Date:2018-11-30

properties.Name: Upgrades at sewage lift station
properties.Description:
Project Description:Purchase spare grinder pump. Pumps are prone to failure, and spare pump will ensure protection against sewage overflows. Off-reserve benefits are protection to receiving environment by minimizing risk of sewage spills.
Construction Start Date:2017-02-15
Construction End Date:2018-03-30

properties.Name: Devils Gap Lift Station Backup Generator Purchase.
properties.Description:
Project Description:A backup generator for the lift station located near the Devils Gap Marina will be purchased. There is currently no backup system in place during emergency power outages. The community currently pumps the lift station out manually with a pumper truck during power outages. There is a risk that the pumper truck may not be able to keep up to the demand, the truck could be broken down during these instances, or an operator may not be present within the community. The lift station is located beside the Devils Gap Marina, in a low lying area within 100 feet of Lake of the Woods. There is a significant risk of overflow of raw sewage into Lake of the woods during a power outage situation. The portable generator will provide a reliable back up system to power the lift station during power outages. The purchase of the generator will ensure wastewater does not enter the environment and negatively impact surrounding communities.
Construction Start Date:2017-06-01
Construction End Date:2017-06-30

properties.Name: Detailed Design and Planning of a Wastewater Management System for Walpole Island First Nation
properties.Description:
Project Description:Project will commission a detailed planning and design for a wastewater collection and treatment solution for Walpole Island First Nation that meets federal regulations for wastewater ( http://laws-lois.justice.gc.ca/eng/regulations/SOR-2012-139/FullText.html ). This will include carrying out community consultation and preliminary environmental impact studies. Off-Reserve benefits include reduction of groundwater contamination and reduction of nutrient loading into the Lake Erie watershed.
Construction Start Date:2017-11-01
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Equipment Upgrades at Water Treatment Plant
properties.Description:
Project Description:Project will purchase spare well pumps and chlorine dosing pumps, rebuild kits for pumps, install or fix chlorine and turbidity analyzers. Off-reserve benefits are more secure and safe drinking water supply leading to reduced burden to provincial health care system.
Construction Start Date:2017-03-01
Construction End Date:2018-03-01

properties.Name: Design and Contract Administration for Community Flooding Control - Installation of new Stormwater Pipe
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project will complete the design and contract administration for Community Stormwater Management Improvements which will be completed to ensure positive drainage and reduced flooding at the Anemeki and Mission Road Intersection. As a result of the existing water main infrastructure located in Mission Road, installation of a drainage conveyance structure along the Community main drainage channel has not been adequately provided. As a result, mitigation measures and temporary provisions have managed flooding of the area. Reconfiguration of the existing watermains (lowering and decommissioning) to allow for the installation of three (3) 750 mm Corrugated Steel Pipe (CSP) culverts has been identified as the conceptual design solution. Alteration to the existing mains include one 600 mm diameter main, one 450 mm diameter drain line, and one 450 mm diameter main. This will also require the installation a new 200 mm diameter waterline on Mission Road, to decommission the 600 mm diameter drain line, and provide water to 4 houses. Completion of this project is critical to the safe/ efficient supply of water to the community, thus reducing potential impact on the Province's health system. Project does not include capital works.
Construction Start Date:2017-02-01
Construction End Date:2017-06-01

properties.Name: Renewal of Wilsey Road Wastewater Pumping Station
properties.Description:
Project Description:Renew the Wilsey Road wastewater pumping station and install backup generator.

properties.Description:
Project Description:The sewage pump station upgrades will mitigate impacts such as property damage due to sewage backups and the risk of contamination of the adjacent Lac Ile a la Crosse. Construct building, mechanical, electrical, control upgrades to SPS #1 and replace SPS #4, and all associated works. One sewage pump station will be upgraded and one will be replaced. Construct replacement of the sewer mains, water mains, service connections, and associated works on Sakitawak Place and Simpson Street. The upgraded sewer collection system and water distribution will mitigate impacts such as property damage and the risk of contamination of Lac Ile a la Crosse due to sewage backups and water leaks.

Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Water System Upgrades and Water/Sewer Chamber Separation
properties.Description:
Project Description:This project will provide the residents of the Inuit Community Governemtn of Nain with a secure supply of clean, safe drinking water from the new Trouser Lake Water Supply Infrastructure. The scope of work includes installation of two new PRV chambers, the connection of the water line to Sands Bank Road and the by pass of the existing pumphouse. The By Pass of the existing pumphouse will allow for the entire Community of Nain to utilize the Trouser Lake Water System, the scope of work will then cover the decommission of the existing system. In addition, the project will also include the reconfiguration of several concrete underground thaw access chambers, through which water and sewer mains currently run, to reroute the sewer mains away from water mains to mitigate the risk of cross-contamination.
Construction Start Date:2017-09-15
Construction End Date:2018-12-31

properties.Description:
Project Description:New sewage pumping station and associated piping to connect four houses to nearest sanitary sewer.

properties.Description:

properties.Name: Replace existing watermains on Mockingbird Lane, Cardinal Lane, Pheasant Lane, Hummingbird Lane and Sandpiper Trail
properties.Description:
Project Description:This watermain project will see the removal of approximately 1370 meters of 150mm diameter deteriorating cast iron pipe, 700 meters of deteriorating copper water services, replacement of aging fire hydrants and watermain gates complete with surface restoration of the boulevards, driveways and asphalt road surfaces. This watermain project will directly service 70 households. Due to the size and complexity of the project, we are requesting an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline to ensure successful completion of the project.
Construction Start Date:2016-10-12
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Old Crow Lagoon upgrades
properties.Description:
Project Description:Upgrades to existing lagoons to increase their lifespan, construction of sludge drying beds and sub-surface wetland. Extending overhead power service to Lagoon.
Construction Start Date:2018-06-01
Construction End Date:2019-10-31

properties.Name: Central Area Planning District stormsewer study including inventory, database updates, GIS mapping and hydraulic modelling to identify stormsewer capacity and future asset needs.
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Revised project *** See Keynotes for previous information The Central Area, which includes the Downtown Core, will be experiencing major growth. This includes the new Peel Memorial Health Centre, a potential university and an influx of residential and business uses. We need to ensure that we have the infrastructure to support it. This work will undertake an assessment of all of the existing storm sewers within the area utilizing the latest technologies to locate, assess the condition and inventory the network using a geospatial database. This project will enhance the coordination efforts by the City of Brampton and the Region of Peel on infrastructure projects (e.g., watermain and sanitary repairs can be coordinated with stormsewer works). The $750,000 decrease in total project costs (i.e. $375,000 in federal CWWF funding) reflects a reduced study area, which instead of studying ALL storm sewers within the Central Area, will now focus on three key priority components of the network (1. Downtown core, 2. Bramalea City Centre and 3. sewers greater than 45 years in age). Due to delays in the development of the Transfer Payment Agreement and subsequent delay in procurement, we are requesting an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline.
Construction Start Date:2017-07-02
Construction End Date:2019-01-30

properties.Name: Strathmere Court - Robinson Drive East to Robinson Drive West - Water Main Lining
properties.Description:
Project Description:Lining water line for an approximate length of 500 metres. Lining will repair the water line and decrease the frequency of breaks.
Construction Start Date:2016-10-10
Construction End Date:2017-10-15

properties.Name: Westmount Avenue - Culvert Replacement @ Hse #430 Greenvale Court
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** "Replace deterioration culvert and road rehabilitation to ensure safe passage and flow of surface and storm water in the water basin. The decrease of $221 ($110 in federal CWWF funding) is due to the scope of work being part of a program and the culvert replacement tender price for this scope of work coming in lower than the budgetary estimates. The scope of the project remains the same. Due to delays in developing the agreement, an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline is required. IO NOTE: There is no decrease in scope, only a decrease in tender. This will result in a decrease in Federal Funding of $110 to be reallocated to IDS17-02"

properties.Name: Wastewater and storm water collection system rehabilitation
properties.Description:
Project Description:Construct pipeline liners at wastewater and stormwater pipelines, and all associated works.

Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Replacement of Blow off Valves throughout Distribution System at 50 Agnes Street, Charlton.
properties.Description:
Project Description:Replacement of blow off valves within the Charlton and Bradley distribution systems required for proper flushing. A proper flushing program is a practice endorsed by the MOECC (Ministry of Environment and Climate Change) and is a requirement of Charltons Drinking Water Quality Management System. Scope: To repair blow offs in Bradley subdivision at highway 560, on Christopher street and on the end of Michael street. To repair blow offs in Charlton on the end of lakeshore street, and at the Charlton school. This will require some digging and parts however the exact nature of the defect will not be know until the underground component is exposed. Output: To have a distribution system capable of being flushed properly. Fix broken blow offs. Benefits: Functioning blow offs enables proper flushing to take place which is a key component of providing clean safe drinking water to the Charlton residents. Flushing helps to remove debris, bacteria, and pathogens and improves aesthetics of the drinking water.
Construction Start Date:2017-08-01
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Sanitary sewer extension in six streets
properties.Description:
Project Description:Sanitary sewer extension in six streets: Augustin South and Alban (500 m), Egbert (600 m), Ben Alain (350 m), Stymiest (2540 m), Godin (500 m), and Octave Breau (730 m). This project includes the associated road work necessary to complete the project.
Construction Start Date:2017-05-21
Construction End Date:2017-09-30

properties.Name: Condition Assessment Program for Mainline Sewers throughout the City
properties.Description:
Project Description:Inspection and analysis of approximately 90 kilometers of sewer 150mm to 5.4 meters in diameter throughout the city using various inspection methods affecting approximately 16,000 customers. Work is prioritized by asset criticality, diameter, functionality and other service level identifiers. Co-ordinated with the capital roads program to provide structural and service conditions and to identify capital rehabilitation and replacement priorities. Assignments to engineering consulting firms and small urgent mainline repairs are also funded from this program.
Construction Start Date:2017-01-02
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Update to Mapping of Water Distribution System (Hornepayne)
properties.Description:
Project Description:The system engineering survey will update as-built maps/drawings for the infrastructure in water distribution system to allow operators, engineers, project managers to better understand the system and how it works. This project will also allow for development of capital asset management plans based on actual infrastructure. Improved environmental outcome: Elimination of unnecessary ground excavations for locates; Reduction of disrupting natural habitat.
Construction Start Date:2017-05-01
Construction End Date:2018-12-31

properties.Name: Treatment of wastewater, water filtration plant of drinking water and patches to the network
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project aims at the rehabilitation of some obsolete components at the filtration plant of the,drinking water, automation and telemetry of wastewater pumping stations and some interventions on the network of sewer.
Construction Start Date:2017-09-29
Construction End Date:2018-01-31

properties.Name: Water Distribution and Sanitary Sewer System Upgrades
properties.Description:
Project Description:"Part A: Replace Eel River Bar water main with a larger pipe to allow Charlo to interconnect to the water network of Balmoral, Eel River Crossing, and Dalhousie. Part B: Upgrade two lift stations for increased flow of effluent. Part C: Renewal of water main and installation of new sanitary sewer line along Craig Road. This project includes related road work necessary to complete the project."
Construction Start Date:2017-06-12
Construction End Date:2019-11-30

properties.Name: Etobicoke Creek Valley Landfill Study for two landfills (technical data) to analyze and document the condition of the landfill to support the City's Downtown Revitalization Project
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Revised project *** See Keynotes for previous information Investigative work on two landfill sites within the Etobicoke Creek valley (south-west of Queen St and Kennedy Road in the vicinity of Centennial Park) to determine the condition and extent of the feature in order to determine if the landfill poses any constraints to flood mitigation alternatives for Downtown Brampton. The project scope will include activities typically undertaken to complete Environmental Site Assessments, and may include historical documentation review, boreholes, surveys and geotechnical assessments. The outcomes of the investigation will be used to refine the design of the flood mitigation infrastructure work identified in Project BRAM-001. Valley reshaping to improve flood storage and conveyance will be required and as such the extent and condition of the landfill is a critical factor. The $200,000 decrease in total project costs (i.e. $100,000 in federal CWWF funding) is due to the fact that background information (studies/records) was discovered after the original estimates were determined, making some tasks reduced in terms of time allocated or removed (e.g., number of locates and boreholes required reduced and time allocated for historical documentation review removed.). Due to delays in the development of the Transfer Payment Agreement and subsequent delays in procurement, we are requesting an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline.
Construction Start Date:2017-09-01
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Agassiz Avenue Infrastructure Improvements Project
properties.Description:
Project Description:"The project work will include: - Upgrades/replacement of existing buried infrastructure including storm sewer, sanitary sewer, and drinking water; - Extension of drinking water service with approximately 50 new services and including fire protection; - Roadway replacement; and, - Related civil, mechanical, electrical works and appurtenances."
Construction Start Date:2017-03-31
Construction End Date:2018-01-31

properties.Name: Water Treatment Plant & Intake Upgrades
properties.Description:

Construct surface water intake upgrade, expand existing treatment building, upgrade treatment process and equipment, and all associated works. Major upgraded portions include water supply and treatment system designed to serve 564 persons.
Construction Start Date:2017-05-23
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Alexander Crescent - Water and Sanitary Sewer Renewal
properties.Description:
Project Description:Renewal of watermain and sanitary sewer along Alexandra Crescent. This project includes related road work necessary to complete the project.
Construction Start Date:2017-05-02
Construction End Date:2017-07-12

properties.Name: Heenan Place Sanitary Sewer Relining - East End
properties.Description:
Project Description:Relining of 200 mm diameter concrete sanitary pipe utilizing cured-in place pipe no dig technology. The current concrete pipe installed in the 1960's is presumed to be exhibiting interior spalling and loss of interior surface based on CCTV of neighbouring pipes that were installed in the same installation period. The adjoining watermain is deemed to be in good condition making this project an excellent choice for rehabilitation. This rehabilitation will avoid open cut trenching that will minimize the disruption to approximately 18 residential homes along the length of pipe being rehabilitated.
Construction Start Date:2018-02-01
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Water and Wastewater Rehabilitation, including Pump System, Chemical Feed Systems, Instrumentation Equipment, Distribution System, Sewage System and General Building Maintenance and Equipment
properties.Description:
Project Description:#1: Update Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA) computer tower at Manitowaning water treatment plant but services Sunsite System and Lagoon operation as well, affects 326 users. #2: Replace defective pressure tank and inline pH probe at Sunsite Estates WTP (64 users), install timer on raw water sample pump at Manitowaning WTP (326 users) #3: Certify beam used as lifting device to lift raw water screen from well at Manitowaning WTP, replace eyewash station tempering valve and install wall thermostat at Sunsite WTP #4: Repair pre-chlorine configuration unit at Sunsite WTP (64 users) and re-purpose Alum board for Zebra Mussel in both WTPs (326 users). #5: Rebuild filter discharge piping on 2 filters at Manitowaning WTP (262 users). #6: SWOB distribution system (326 users affected). #7: Repair sump pump and GFCI for raw sewage flow meter chamber, replace shaft assembly for aerator #6, conduct sludge survey for both cells at Sewage Facility (262 users affected).
Construction Start Date:2017-03-01
Construction End Date:2017-03-30

It will also result in restoration of the surface which includes sidewalk, curb and gutter and road surface as well as sod where required. Due to weather-sensitive work that must be completed outside of winter months, we are requesting an extension beyond March 31, 2018, to ensure successful completion of the project.

Reinstatement of curb and gutter, and asphalt to be completed as well.

properties.Name: Watermain infrastructure improvements on Bridge St., Baker St. and Queen St. through replacement of cast iron watermains.
properties.Description:
Project Description:Replacement of 450 meters of 150mm cast iron watermain with 250mm trunkmain and 500 meters of water service piping to property line on Bridge St. Baker St. Replace 110 meters of 150mm cast iron arterial watermains with 200mm arterial watermains. Queen St. Replace 80 meters of 150mm cast iron arterial watermains with 200mm arterial watermains. Replacement of current standard sizing and all main line isolation valves and fire hydrants with properly sized pumper ports to ensure maximum fire protection. Improvements will provide adequate fire flows to approximately 250 residents, adequate chlorine residuals and domestic flows and eliminate the loss of service to all residents due to watermain breaks and service leaks.

Construction End Date:2017-12-31

properties.Name: Design for the Replacement of the Ash Management Facility at the G.E. Booth Water Pollution Control Plant
properties.Description:
Project Description:"Detailed design for the replacement of the existing ash management facility at the G.E. Booth Water Pollution Control Plant as identified in the recently completed feasibility study. The G.E. Booth facility is relied upon by approximately 800,000 residents in the eastern portion of Peel Region and a small portion of the population in southwest York Region for the treatment of wastewater. Due to regulatory requirements and/or permit delays, we are requesting an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline to ensure successful completion of the project."

Construction End Date:2018-09-30

properties.Name: Design of the Cooksville Creek Stormwater Erosion Control - QEW to Elaine Trail
properties.Description:
Project Description:Municipal Class Environmental Assessment and Design study to address erosion issues along Cooksville Creek to protect property and infrastructure.

Construction End Date:2018-07-31

properties.Name: Sewer System Upgrades
properties.Description:

Construction Start Date:2016-08-22
Construction End Date:2017-01-03

properties.Name: Electrical Upgrades at the Hanlan and Herridge Pumping Stations
properties.Description:
Project Description:"Design and construction of electrical upgrades at the Hanlan Pumping Station and design of electrical upgrades at the Herridge Pumping Station. An assessment was conducted by an electrical engineer in 2014 that identified the need replace aging high voltage electrical installed in the 1970's at both of the stations. The Hanlan Pumping Station provides water to the center and northeast portions of Mississauga and is a key facility that pumps water into Brampton. The Herridge Pumping Station provides water to the southwest portion or Mississauga and conveys water to northwest Mississauga and west Brampton. The cost estimate to upgrade each of these stations is approximately $10,000,000. We are requesting $5,000,000 for each station based on assumptions that spending at each location will reach $5,000,000 by March of 2018. Due to regulatory requirements and/or permit delays, we are requesting an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline to ensure successful completion of the project."
Construction Start Date:2017-05-01
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Separation of Existing Combined Sewers at Florence-Egan-Kerby

Project Description:This project will result in the replacement of waterlines, and separate the storm and sanitary sewers, and reconstruct the road surface to original state. This project will improve the health and safety for our residents and take pressure off our Waste Water Treatment Plant.
Construction Start Date:2016-04-01
Construction End Date:2017-12-31

properties.Name: Sanitary sewer extension, Highway 397 North and South and 1st Street West areas
properties.Description:
Project Description:The purpose of the project is to extend the sanitary sewer system to service 69 permanent residences.

Project Description:Environmental Assessment (EA) & Design to address slope stability and erosion issues along Mary Fix Creek to protect property and infrastructure from stormwater erosion.

Bulk water access is required to support the City-wide building boom and to minimize water theft and non-revenue water Based on expert input scope redefined. IO NOTE: There is additional scope added to the project, and also additional savings. This will result in an decrease in Federal Funding of $88,918 to be reallocated."

Construction End Date:2018-12-31

properties.Name: Renovation of the wastewater treatment plant
properties.Description:

The project will increase the capacity of this aerated pond treatment plant by transforming part of the first pond into a completely mixed mode. The addition of a new disinfection system is also planned.
