Construction End Date:2018-12-15

properties.Name: Replacement of Ultraviolet (UV) Disinfection Equipment at Alton Wells 3 and 4
properties.Description:
Project Description:"Replacement of Ultraviolet (UV) disinfection equipment at Alton Village Wells 3 and 4 and expansion of the building to accommodate the new equipment. Alton Village Wells 3 and 4 serve a population of 1,100. Due to regulatory requirements and/or permit delays, we are requesting an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline to ensure successful completion of the project."
Construction Start Date:2017-07-01
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Clarksburg Water and Wastewater Concept Design
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** "The objective of this project is to establish a long-term solution to provide water and waste water servicing for the community of Clarksburg. This will be accomplished through a Master Plan Municipal Class Environmental Assessment. As part of and in addition to completing the Master Plan Environmental Assessment, an inventory of the existing private septic systems and water wells will be undertaken. This assignment will satisfy Phases 1 and 2 of the Municipal Class Environmental Assessment process using Master Plan methodology and is to culminate in the submission of the Notice of Study Completion and associated documentation for the Schedule B Projects for public review. The documentation is expected to be sufficient that the scope of works is advanced to concept design level of detail and that life cycle cost estimates can be reasonably generated on a per property basis. Schedule C Projects, if any, will be subject to future study to fulfill Phases 3 and 4 prior to implementation. An in-depth field survey and mandatory inspection of the private well and septic systems was initially contemplated. This was revised to be a verbal Q/A survey with the property owner and visual observations. In addition, the amount of expected third party water quality testing was less than initially anticipated. IO NOTE: There is a decrease in scope that will result in a decrease in Federal Funding of $138,590.50 to be reallocated to TBM-003 and TBM-004."
Construction Start Date:2017-06-14
Construction End Date:2018-06-30

properties.Name: Upgrade 10th Street pumping station to prevent contamination of adjacent river
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** "The 10th Street Pumping Station is the second largest sewage pumping station in Hearsts sewage collection system and handles approximately 25% of the 2160 households and businesses served by municipal sanitary services, including the Hospital, Nursing Home, arena and schools. The existing installation, located next to three schools and a pedestrian trail, is not protected against the frequent power failures, therefore causing the inevitable spilling of raw sewage into the Mattawishkwia river. The project comprises of the purchase and installation of an alternate power source (permanent back-up generator including footing and acoustic enclosure), the installation of the natural gas supply which will require lengthy excavation due to the location of the gas main, the related electrical appurtenances to allow the automatic transfer of electrical power to the pumping station, and the installation of decorative security fencing to prevent public access to the proposed back-up generator. Due to the late summer project approval by CWWF and subsequent tender process, much of the preparation work was fortunately completed in fall before the onset of winter. However, delivery and installation of the transfer switch and generator during the winter months will require a temporary protective shelter to be constructed and additional equipment to keep the work area safe and comfortable for the contractor. Due to delays in developing the agreement, an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline is required. IO NOTE: Due to the increase in scope for the temporary protective shelter, there is an increase in federal funding of $5,000 to be reallocated from HEA-003, HEA-005, and HEA-006."
Construction Start Date:2017-08-30
Construction End Date:2018-06-15

properties.Name: Develop and implement backflow prevention / cross connection program
properties.Description:
Project Description:During the Ministrys 2015 annual drinking water inspections, the Drinking Water Inspector recommended that the Town implements a backflow prevention / cross connection program. The town wants to develop a backflow prevention / cross connection program to manage risk, maintain system security and protect drinking water quality. This project will develop an assessment program and stakeholder inspection/calibration requirements. The outcome will integrate with corporate GIS system to allow for unique data collection and data analysis. Work will support the drafting of a proposed backflow prevention by-law for council approval. Due to delays in developing the Transfer Payment Agreement and subsequent delays in procurement and its impact on construction schedule, we are requesting an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline to ensure successful completion of the project.
Construction Start Date:2017-10-31
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: New Wastewater Disposal System
properties.Description:
Project Description:Objective: Reduce environmental impact of lagoon discharge, and reuse effluent for irrigation. Scope: Plan, design and construct appx 4390 m of appx 300 mm diameter lagoon discharge piping, and all associated works. Output: New lagoon discharge piping.
Construction Start Date:2018-05-31
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: New Well and Water Supply Pipeline
properties.Description:
Project Description:Objective: Create a water supply that is reliable, provide safe and healthy water by resolving significant regulatory concerns. Scope: Plan, design and construct appx one well, raw supply pipeline and controls, and all associated works. Output: New well and raw water supply system.
Construction Start Date:2018-03-26
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Design of Stillwater Creek Storm Sewer Upgrades
properties.Description:
Project Description:This project will complete the design for future rehabilitation of 230m of storm sewer that crosses Robertson Rd east of Moodie Dr and outlets at the end of the Holiday Inn Parking Lot. The work will include the 3050mm x 1650mm concrete box storm sewer under Robertson Rd as well as the upstream and downstream 1650mm or 2135mm Corrugated Steel Pipe sewers. A portion of the storm sewer runs within 13m of the Holiday Inn hotel and therefore trenchless rehabilitation including either sliplining or shotcrete lining will need to be considered during the design phase.
Construction Start Date:2017-01-11
Construction End Date:2018-11-01

properties.Name: Replacement of road crossing culvert on County Road 8 north of Baseline Road in Clarence Creek
properties.Description:
Project Description:The proposed works consisted of the replacement of the road crossings culvert from a 1200 mm dia. Corrugated Steel Pipe (CSP) to a same size High Density Polyethylene 320 kilopascal pipe
Construction Start Date:2016-05-01
Construction End Date:2017-10-31

properties.Name: Replacement of 250 mm Sanitary Sewer on Court Street: John Street to Bay Street
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** "Sanitary sewer and connection replacement of a 100 year old pipe system with 250mm Polyvinyl Chloride (PVC) pipe . Coordinated with water main replacement. Length of project is 450m serving 44 customers. IO NOTE: There is no decrease in scope, only a decrease in tender. This will result in a decrease in Federal Funding of $46,488 to be reallocated."
Construction Start Date:2017-06-01
Construction End Date:2017-10-01

properties.Name: Renewal of water pipes
properties.Description:
Project Description:Travaux de renouvellement de conduites visant le maintien de services deau aux citoyens pour quelques 23 tronçons de rue et totalisant 4,545 km.
Construction Start Date:2016-04-28
Construction End Date:2017-07-21

properties.Name: Battery Street Water - Replacement of cast-iron watermain
properties.Description:
Project Description:OBJECTIVE: The Town is actively adopting wastewater infrastructure renewal projects that improve operation and maintenance requirements, reduce inflow and infiltration, provide enhancements to the natural environment and support long term sustainable infrastructure. SCOPE: The scope of this project includes the replacement of 220 metres of 450mm diameter vitrified clay sanitary sewers from Bertie Street to Catherine Street that were constructed in 1925. The sanitary sewer is in a poor structural state and is beyond the end of its service life. Replacement of the sanitary sewer is the recommended rehabilitation alternative along with the replacement of maintenance holes and sanitary laterals. Additionally, the project includes the replacement of 110 metres of 150mm diameter cast iron watermain constructed in 1920 from Catharine Street to Murray Street. The watermain is beyond the end of its service life and is prone to failure which leads to water quality concerns. Considering the age of the watermain, replacement of the watermain is the recommended rehabilitation alternative. This is a priority project for the Town. Town Council has accelerated this project to design in 2016 and construction in 2017 through administrative report IS-22-2016. The design for this project is currently being completed by an engineering design firm with a planned 2017 construction start. OUTPUT: The estimated reduction in stormwater (inflow & infiltration) entering the wastewater distribution system is approximately 2,300 cubic meters per annum as a direct result of this project. The replacement of the watermain will improve system reliability; reduce operational issues as well as reducing opportunities for negative impacts to water quality. This project will directly contribute to reduce point source sanitary overflows to meet both regulatory requirements and objectives of the remedial action plan for the Niagara River.
Construction Start Date:2017-04-30
Construction End Date:2018-11-16

properties.Name: Replacement of the ductile iron watermain (150mm and 300mm diameter) with Polyvinyl Chloride (PVC) watermain on Planchet Road and Basaltic Road and Mckenzie Street
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** This project will replace the existing ductile iron water main (150mm and 300mm diameter) with Polyvinyl Chloride water main in the area of Planchet Road , Basaltic Road and McKenzie Street, Villagewood Crt and Rossmull Crt. Due to delays in developing the agreement, an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline is required. IO NOTE: There is an increase in scope, but a reduction in tender. This will result in a decrease in Federal Funding of $186,094.63 to be reallocated.
Construction Start Date:2017-06-01
Construction End Date:2018-06-30

properties.Name: West Thornhill Flood Control on Three Streets with Structural Sewer Replacement in the City of Markham
properties.Description:
Project Description:To improve extreme weather resiliency the project will upgrade storm sewer capacity consisting of structural drainage system works in the West Thornhill Phase 2B implementation area. Involves sewer construction to upgrade the capacity of the existing storm sewers in the area from a one-in-5-year storm event capacity to a one-in-100 year storm event capacity. Storm sewers to be upgraded include: 1.Proctor Avenue  upgrading existing 1350 mm diameter storm sewer to 1800 mm diameter, 180 m long storm sewer. 2.Henderson Avenue  upgrading existing 1350 mm diameter storm sewer to 1650 mm diameter, 180m long storm sewer. 3.Doncaster Avenue / Grandview Park  A new 1350 mm diameter storm sewer to provide parallel relief capacity to an existing 1200 mm diameter storm sewer. This 250 m section is being proposed through a City owned park. An Oil and Grit separator to treat urban runoff discharges to the receiving Don River watercourse will also be incorporated to enhance water quality and improve aquatic habitat. The objective is to reduce frequency and severity of flood damages in an existing development area (60 years old) with limited resiliency to accommodate extreme rainfall conditions. The scope, defined in the approved Municipal Class Environmental Assessment Study, applies to identified 'flood cluster' vulnerable areas in West Thornhill that were adversely affected by an extreme rainfall event on Aug 19, 2005. The proposed Phase 2B project area is within one of the identified priority flood vulnerable areas. Project output will be higher level of service and enhanced flood conveyance capacity compared to the existing storm drainage system performance - this will be achieved through sewer size increases and inlet capture improvements. Request an extension of 25% of the costs past March 2018 to allow for sewer trench soil settling/consolidation over winter and then application of top asphalt¿ in the following spring.
Construction Start Date:2017-05-01
Construction End Date:2018-08-30

properties.Name: Replacing infrastructure including flow meter and unit heaters at Pumping Station # 1
properties.Description:
Project Description:Key projects would include the replacement of the flow meter at station one as it is nearing the end of its life cycle. The flow meter is one of the critical pieces of infrastructure that's in need of upgrading. There are also 2 unit heaters that are also in need of replacement. This is the last pumping station before the sewage is pumped north to Crysler. The standby generator automatic transfer switch is in need of replacement. This switch is integral to ensuring that in the event of complete power loss, the pumping station has a back up source of power.
Construction Start Date:2017-04-01
Construction End Date:2017-09-30

properties.Name: Relocation of shut off valve at Water Treatment Plant on Nipissing Street, Sturgeon Falls
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project is to install a new 250mm shut off valve to replace an old and badly corroded valve located in the Sturgeon Falls Water Plant. The current valve is in a highly corrosive environment. The new valve will be on the same line, but upstream in a clean environment. The purpose of the valve is in case an emergency shut down is required to a hydrant at the water plant. If a functional valve is not installed, a problem at the hydrant could cause a shutdown of the entire distribution system that supplies water to 8000 people.
Construction Start Date:2017-04-15
Construction End Date:2017-05-02

properties.Name: Water Meter and Service Line Upgrade
properties.Description:
Project Description:Objective: Improve the management and regulatory compliance of the drinking water supply system. Scope: Plan, design and construct appx 3900 replacement water meters and appx 50 lead service lines and sewer service lines, water standpipe tank fill upgrades, water treatment plant filtration system and security system upgrades, 670 m of watermain replacement, sewer connection repair, and all associated works. Output: Replacement of existing water meters and lead service lines and sewer lines within the distribution system, upgrades to water treatment and security.'
Construction Start Date:2017-08-16
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: 13th Avenue Water Line Upgrade
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project works will include: - Replacement of approximately 500m of existing watermain with 150mm plastic pipe; - Installation of approximately 250m of 150mm water pipe; - Construction and restoration including open-cut and directional drilling for ditches, roadway, stream crossing, and water service connections; and, - Related civil and mechanical works and appurtenances.
Construction Start Date:2017-07-31
Construction End Date:2018-06-30

properties.Name: Pinecrest Estates Wastewater Treatment Plant (Sewer) Replacement
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project works will include: - Install a packaged membrane bioreactor wastewater treatment plant (WWTP), equalization tank, sludge holding tank and effluent dosing tank; - Construct WWTP building and install package plant components; - Repurpose existing concrete tank as an aerated sludge digester; - Install a centrifuge for sludge disposal; - Perform required site works to facilitate the new treatment facility; - Re-route influent and effluent piping; - Decommission the existing WWTP; and, - General site work.
Construction Start Date:2018-01-03
Construction End Date:2018-08-31

properties.Name: Ymir Water Storage Reservoir Replacement
properties.Description:

properties.Name: Detailed Water Distribution Analysis to Meet Community Servicing Needs
properties.Description:
Project Description:This project includes a detailed water distribution assessment and analysis that will provide the community and the province with the much-needed water servicing recommendations for the community. This assessment will include the development of a water distribution model that will identify the existing and potential future bottlenecks and/or issues within the water distribution network. The outcome of this undertaking will be the identification of upgrades required to the network that will improve the overall distribution network (i.e. reduce leaks, improve flows, ensure proper chlorination flow and ensure sufficient fire flow). The elimination of bottlenecks and dead-ends within the watermain will promote looping or chlorine mixing for distribution and will maintain a satisfactory chlorine residual. This will help ensure safe drinking water in accordance with Ontario and Federal Regulations which will eliminate the health and safety issue for the community members, reducing the potential for members to visit the provinces health care system. This assessment will also provide drinking water security in the community. If a watermain break was to occur, dead-ended areas in the community would not have access to safe drinking water. This assessment will seek out those bottlenecks and will provide more secure drinking water access to the community, once again minimizing health and safety concerns.

properties.Name: Southwest Leamington Storm Water Management Pond and Outlet Environmental Study and Design

Project Description:"The proposed project is Multi-Category including wastewater and stormwater components, but primarily stormwater. The Southwest Leamington Storm Water Management Pond and Outlet project will support further separation of storm and sanitary sewers in Leamington by eliminating the continuing need to use an existing asset as a combined sewer. A new stormwater outlet will: provide enhanced treatment and storage of stormwater, eliminate combined sewer overflows, and allow additional sanitary collection and conveyance for the existing and future develepments in southwest Leamington by optimizing an existing asset (conversion of existing combined sewer to dedicated sanitary sewer). This Environmental Study assignment will address enhanced service and improved environmental outcomes by providing the planning solution, preferred alternative and preliminary design for the management of surface water in the southwest quadrant of Leamington. Particularly, our Study Area comprises approximately 110 Ha, including 25 Ha of existing residential and institutional landuses serviced by aging combined sewers. The remaining 85 Ha are designated for urban, residential development. The establishment of the appropriate storm water management pond and outlet will allow for the continued separation and elimination of combined sewers in Leamington, and growth. Extension rationale: As this project is likely to proceed as a Schedule 'C' Class EA it is anticipated that the study /design assignment will take some time to to complete. IO NOTE: This will result in an increase in Federal Funding of $87,500.00 to be reallocated from LEA-001 and LEA-002."

These repairs are necessary to ensure the plant is maintained and in proper working order. It is vital the RBC is providing proper treatment of wastewater and the quality of the effluent leaving the plant and being discharged to the receiving environment is acceptable. properties.Name: Niagara Falls Waste Water Treatment Plant Flocculation, Grit and Primary Tank Gate Upgrade - located in the City of Niagara Falls
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project includes:  Installation of the pre-purchased gates valves for the flocculation and grit tanks  Purchase and installation of eighteen (18) new gate valves for the primary tanks. The project is incremental in nature in that the project had been removed from our 2017 capital budget due to insufficient regional funding required to proceed with the construction phase. The CWWF will allow us to proceed with a key infrastructure project. The Niagara Falls Waste Water Treatment Plant (WWTP) treats sewage from approximately 127,410 people, and supports the demand of over 30 million tourists. This Class 4 WWTP was built in 1964 and the Flocculation, Grit and Primary Tank system are original to the plant. Niagara Falls WWTP has operational limitations in the secondary treatment process. The Ministry of Environment and Climate change is aware of this challenge and is strongly encouraging the Region to correct this operational issue. This is a result of significant sulphide loading from the primary tanks to the rotating biological contactors. High levels of hydrogen sulphide are a result of the inability to adequately control retention times in the grit, flocculation and primary tanks. All existing slide gate valves in these tanks have reached the end of their service life (valves in primary tanks 1, 2 and 3 are original 1964). With new valves installed staff will be able to optimize the retention time and effluent flows from the grit, flocculation and primary tanks which will aid in meeting the effluent regulations for toxicity/ nitrification. Replacement costs are based on information from two slide gate valve supply firms which are listed on the Regions Approved Product Equipment List (APEL). Typical mechanical equipment installation costs are 150% of equipment purchase costs.
Construction Start Date:2017-04-03
Construction End Date:2018-08-30

properties.Name: Stormwater Management Pond# PD48-01 Sediment Management
properties.Description:
Project Description:This project will remove and dispose of 1,500 m3 of sediment from the pond. The project includes cleaning of outlets and restoration of the disturbed area. Majority of the Towns storm water ponds had been constructed with permanent storage volume (wet ponds). The purpose of the permanent storage volume in a pond is to allow suspended solids (sediment) from the runoff to settle down in the pond bottom and release the treated water to the creek. Over the time, pond will accumulate sediment which will reduce the permanent storage, impacting the sediment removal efficiency of the pond drastically, resulting untreated water released to the Creek. Realising a need for a pond clean out, Town of Whitby conducted a ponds need study in 2011 to evacuate the pond permanent storage capacity and learned majority of the ponds require cleanout as bathymetric survey revealed fair amount of sediment accumulated in the ponds. Under this project accumulated sediment in the pond will be removed allowing required permanent storage in the pond, resulting pond will perform to its design efficiency which will improve the quality of the runoff released to the creeks. The removal works are capitalized as they extend the life of the asset. Due to delays in developing the Transfer Payment Agreement and subsequent delays in procurement and its impact on construction schedule, we are requesting an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline to ensure successful completion of the project.

Construction End Date:2018-10-31

properties.Name: Station Street Lateral Assessments and Pipe Rehabilitation
properties.Description:
Project Description:Pipe rehabilitation from Manhole 167 (Hornak Rd.) to Manhole 53 (Forest Ave.) The total proposed works are for the construction and installation of a structural liner, grouting, and miscellaneous service repairs in the road allowance. This is a recommended 'no-dig' solution that reduces the impact to the area and reduced impact to the environment. The proposed works to the sewer main are also in preparation for a future project to remove inflow in this critical area. These works will be part of a series of works needed in order to achieve an ultimate goal of MOECC F-5-5 compliance. The structural liners are expected to add approximately 50 years to the life expectancy of the sewers. In 2014 - 2015 the Township completed an Inflow and Infiltration Flow Monitoring and CCTV study on its existing sanitary sewer system. The study identified key areas of sanitary sewer where deficiencies were identified including high levels of infiltration during peak wet weather events. This included sewers on Station Street, Colver Street, and Wade Road. The study noted high level event coefficient of variation (CV) of up to 15.5%, or severe. The study recommends that the areas are critical and need to be considered a priority. Additional CCTV inspections confirmed multiple sources of infiltration, including cracks, displaced joints, and infiltration gushers. A review of the sewer deficiencies determined that a full structural and service repairs within the road allowance is the best approach.
Construction Start Date:2017-04-01
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Lindsay Water Treatment Plant Filter Media Replacement
properties.Description:
Project Description:Replacement of the filter media at the Lindsay Water Treatment Plant. The filtration system consists of five dual media granular activated carbon and sand filters. This project will improve the water quality to over 20,000 residents and business consumers in the communities of Lindsay and Oakwood. Drywell pumping system. Closure and sealing of hydraulic connections from wetwell to drywell, including site drainage system piping isolation to prevent surcharge and backflow into drywell. properties.Name: Detailed Stormwater Management Assessment and Analysis for Disaster Mitigation and to Accommodate Future Community Growth
properties.Description:
Project Description:This project will include a comprehensive stormwater management assessment and analysis that will establish several alternatives to providing the community with a proper stormwater management plan. Under current Federal guidelines, stormwater management has not been a consideration as it is under Provincial legislation. The alternatives will be identified and analysed based on impacts to the environment and public health, as well as social, technical, and economic feasibility. The community is currently serviced by groundwater under the influence of surface water. Surface runoff in the community is prevalent as a result of not having stormwater management in place. Surface runoff affects the quality of groundwater and is therefore a significant threat to the drinking water supply in the community. Surface runoff containing untreated sewage from private residences and cottages combined with agricultural runoff on the Island has also impacted the surrounding Lake Scugog, and the effects are highly visible along the shoreline of the lake. The creation of an effective stormwater management plan will help the community protect its groundwater resource from contamination and protect the natural ecology of Lake Scugog by minimizing the current rate of degradation. In addition, due to the topography of the community being generally flat and surrounded by wetland features, the community often experiences severe flooding and very wet ground conditions. These conditions pose risks to public health and safety of the residents, in addition to limiting the opportunities for economic development and future growth of the community. A comprehensive stormwater management plan will enable the community to plan, guide, monitor, and implement stormwater management initiatives that provide the best mitigative measures for flood control, protection of groundwater (the only viable source of drinking water on the island), and protection of the surrounding Lake Scugog (off reserve benefit).
Construction Start Date:2017-12-01
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

Project Description:This project is for the first phase of a single production well replacement program for the Village of Lumby (Village). The first phase includes a geologic overview to refine the basic aquifer mapping and gain an understanding of the aquifers underlying the Village. It also includes installing two new monitoring wells along with identifying 6 existing neighboring wells for installation of sounding tubes and data loggers. Pump tests of existing wells stress the aquifer to help determine the current limits of each well as well as provide important hydraulic information to understand the sustainability of current pumping rates and the expected pumping rates of the future replacement wells. After sufficient amount of time for data collection and monitoring reports will be prepared on the assessment of the aquifer and a plan for replacement of the existing water well #3.

properties.Name: Robert Adams Pond Rehabilitation and Sediment Cleanout including Removal of approximately 1,200m3 of sediment.
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** "The Robert Adams storm water management Pond was tendered for rehabilitation and sediment cleanout in summer 2016 including removal of 1,200 m3 of sediment. The contract was awarded on the basis of 3 stages to be completed over 3 years. Stage 1 construction was completed in 2016 and funded by the annual budget (approximately $90,000). The remaining Stage 2 and Stage 3 works are scheduled for 2017/2018 construction with an estimated cost of $180,000 remaining to be split over 2 years. We note that Central Lake Ontario Conservation Authority (CLOCA) has expressed their preference to complete the remaining works in 2017 rather than over 2017/2018 to minimize the number of disruptions to the local environment. The project was identified in the SWMFMG report as an immediate priority; the estimated year of sediment removal was 2012. As such, cleanout of the Robert Adams Pond is Claringtons top priority, we have nominated this project on the basis that the funding will accelerate the project for completion in 2017. The storm water management (SWM) pond is located in Courtice, Ontario draining to Farewell Creek. The removal works are capitalized as they extend the life of the asset. The scope was increased to complete cleanout and rehabilitation of the quantity control cell of the Robert Adams Pond because the outlet grate was 90% blocked and required removal of an additional 90m3 of sediment from the pond. This change in scope resulted in an increase of $90,000. Due to delays in developing the agreement , an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline is required. IO NOTE: There is an increase in scope, resulting in an increase in Federal Funding of $45,000 to be reallocated from CLA-002."
Construction Start Date:2017-01-01
Construction End Date:2018-09-15

properties.Name: WILD Regional Waterline Phase 2 to Onoway  and Gunn
properties.Description:
Project Description:The regional water supply lines (approximately 11 km of 150mm and approximately 26 km of 250mm) will be constructed to service Onoway and Gunn and will also have capacity to supply the community of Alexis Nakota Sioux Nation.
Construction Start Date:2016-09-03
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Industrial Wastewater Lagoon Upgrade
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project includes an upgrade to the existing industrial treatment lagoon. Upgrades to the associated existing effluent irrigation system were completed in 2015.
Construction Start Date:2016-04-30
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Fall river water servicing
properties.Description:
Project Description:Installation of approx. 3.5 km of central water services from Windsor Junction Rd. to Fall River Centre via Fall River Road and extend along Highway #2 from the Village Centre to the Highway 102 overpass, along Lockview Road up to the Lockview High School driveway, and include McPherson Drive.
Construction Start Date:2018-09-22
Construction End Date:2018-10-31

properties.Name: Dam Upgrade
properties.Description:
Project Description:This new spillway will help with the flow and ability to control the level of flow into our current town water system.
Construction Start Date:2017-08-20
Construction End Date:2018-12-31

properties.Name: Replacement of Cast Iron Watermain in Hagersville
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project involves the replacement of 700m of 150mm cast iron watermain with 200mm Polyvinyl Chloride (PVC) pipe. The watermain runs through the downtown core of Hagersville and is the main feed to the town. The existing watermain has had numerous breaks over the years and it at the end of its useful life. The existing watermain sizing also represents a flow constriction in the water distribution system.
Construction Start Date:2017-05-15
Construction End Date:2017-09-15

properties.Name: Modernization of the drinking water treatment plant and wastewater phosphate removal equipment
properties.Description:
Project Description:The purpose of the project is to modernize the drinking water distribution system to the water reservoir and to add chemical phosphate removal equipment to the wastewater treatment plant.
Construction Start Date:2017-08-01
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Trunk Storm Sewer Replacement (Moir Street to the Irvine River) to Reduce Risk of Flooding the Downtown Elora and Nearby Neighbourhood
properties.Description:
Project Description:"A condition assessment of the Moir Street Trunk Storm Sewer indicated that the existing sewer has insufficient protective cover and is in extremely poor condition. The trunk storm sewer replacement project will address the deterioration of the existing trunk sewer and reduce the impacts from upstream flooding in downtown Elora and surrounding neighborhoods. Due to delays in developing the Transfer Payment Agreement and subsequent delays in procurement and its impact on construction schedule, we are requesting an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline to ensure successful completion of the project."
Construction Start Date:2018-01-02
Construction End Date:2018-12-31

properties.Name: SCADA System Upgrades Territory-wide
properties.Description:
Project Description:Installation and integration of SCADA systems on ten water facilities operated by Yukon Government: Army Beach (Marsh Lake); Marsh Lake; Carcross; Tagish; Ross River; Deep Creek; Rock Creek; Old Crow; Keno; Mendenhall
Construction Start Date:2017-10-31
Construction End Date:2018-10-31

properties.Name: Water Treatment Plant Upgrades
properties.Description:
Project Description:"The project work will include: - Addition of two adsorption clarifiers; - Refurbishment of old filters with new underdrains, filter media and addition of an air scour system; - Improved chemical dosing facilities and larger storage vessels; - Upgrading and upsizing the UV disinfection system; - Provision of UV disinfection on the settling pond decant water return; - Upsizing of the raw water supply line; and, - Retrofit existing infrastructure and facility. "
Construction Start Date:2017-08-25
Construction End Date:2018-09-30

properties.Name: Replace Clarifier Domes
properties.Description:
Project Description:Current fiberglass domes which have weakened after 30 years of exposure to sunlight will be removed. New geodesic domes will be constructed of aluminum and will installed and will be less susceptible to deterioration and have a longer life expectancy. The new dome will be more efficient and safer, and more able to withstand snowload in winter. There have been incidents of structural failures in other communities.
Construction Start Date:2017-05-24
Construction End Date:2018-08-31

properties.Name: Upgrades to the Generator Programmable Logic Controllers (PLC) at Various Lake-Based Water Transmission Facilities
properties.Description:
Project Description:"Upgrades to the generator PLCs (Programmable Logic Controllers) at various lake-based water transmission facilities to eliminate legacy PLC controllers and to standardize PAIDS programming across the Region's lake-based water transmission system. The following systems need hardware upgrades and recommissioned completely to ensure a reliable emergency power supply: Streetsville Pumping Station, Airport Road Pumping Station, Herridge Pumping Station, East Brampton Pumping Station, and the Hanlan Pumping Station. The following sites need to reprogrammed: West Brampton Pumping Station, Tullamore Pumping Station, Meadowvale Pumping Station, and Beckett Sproule Pumping Station. Due to delays in developing the Transfer Payment Agreement and subsequent delays in procurement and its impact on construction schedule, we are requesting an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline to ensure successful completion of the project."
Construction Start Date:2017-01-17
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Goulds Pumping Station and Force Main repairs (Phase 1)
properties.Description:
Project Description:Construct a new Goulds pumping station and pump the sewage to the Kilbride Trunk Sewer. After the Goulds sewage is added to the Kilbride Trunk Sewer system, it would be treated at the existing Riverhead Wastewater Treatment Plant.
Construction Start Date:2018-01-02
Construction End Date:2019-05-31

properties.Name: Lagoon Expansion - Phase 3, Altona
properties.Description:
Project Description:Phase 3 is the final phase of a wastewater lagoon expansion project which includes an aeration system which will reduce nutrients to current environmental regulations. Phase 1 and 2 expanded lagoon treatment capacity for the Towns current and future population and the aeration system will improve effluent quality prior to discharge.
Construction Start Date:2017-04-10
Construction End Date:2018-03-30

properties.Name: Sewage Lagoon Upgrade
properties.Description:
Project Description:Upgrade sewage lagoon to increase efficiency and performance.
Construction Start Date:2017-01-01
Construction End Date:2019-03-01

properties.Name: Drainage improvements and Low Impact Development at Birch Point and Jumbo Gardens
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** "Drainage improvements and Low Impact Development at Birch Point and Jumbo Gardens. Work involves the redirection of drainage from parking areas to be treated in Storm Water Management Facilities before discharge to watercourses. Scope changed as Low Impact Development Facility did not proceed at Jumbo Gardens. IO NOTE: Due to a decrease in scope, there is a decrease in Federal Funding of $103,180 to be reallocated."
Construction Start Date:2017-06-01
Construction End Date:2018-07-01

properties.Name: Gaudarville pumping station
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project aims to install a rainwater pumping station downstream from Gaudarville in Quebec City.
Construction Start Date:2017-08-29
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Assessment, Construction and Implementation of a Drinking Water System Dead-End Looping Strategy in the Central Pressure Zone
properties.Description:
Project Description:The Town has 54 dead ends within the drinking water system impacting approximately 3000 customers. The Town also had dead end areas between system pressure zones and requires the ability to move water between pressure zones to reduce water age and non-revenue water from flushing and maintenance activities. This project will construct an automated bypass system at each isolated boundary valve and looping of dead end systems where feasible. This will require  assessment, engineering and design to eliminate the critical dead end in the north section of the drinking water system central pressure zone. The intent of the project is to reduce water age, improve water hydraulics and increase chlorine residual in a section of the system that has been prone to adverse water quality, increased flushing, increased non-revenue water, resource time and increased reporting to the MOECC and MOH. Due to delays in developing the Transfer Payment Agreement and subsequent delays in procurement and its impact on construction schedule, we are requesting an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline to ensure successful completion of the project.
Construction Start Date:2017-07-13
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: West Corridor Water Transmission Line Phase 1 - Wembley
properties.Description:
Project Description:Construction of approximately 27 km of 450 mm and 400 mm regional water supply line that will service the Town of Wembley and Hamlet of Dimsdale, with provision in pipe sizing to provide future water to Beaverlodge.
Construction Start Date:2016-12-07
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Conduct an Environmental Assessment to Inform Laurier St. Lagoon Upgrading Plans.
properties.Description:
Project Description:This project will evaluate alternatives to treat excess ammonia and to optimize treatment process for better quality effluent. The facultative sewage lagoon facility is designed to provide treatment of approximately 2,110 cubic meter/day. The lagoon has an effective storage of 334,000 cubic meter. The lagoon serves a population of 3,200.
Construction Start Date:2017-09-01
Construction End Date:2017-12-22

properties.Name: Culvert Replacements
properties.Description:
Project Description:Replacement and upsizing of twin concrete culverts that convey water from McNaughton Brook across Albert Trail. Replace twin culvert that crosses Route 106 along McNaughton Brook. This project includes related road work necessary to complete the project.
Construction Start Date:2017-09-18
Construction End Date:2017-10-09

properties.Name: Force Main/Lagoon Storage Cell Upgrades
properties.Description:
Project Description:The existing undersized lagoon system does not meet environmental requirements. Construct force main, lagoon storage cell expansion, and all associated works. The new forcemain and lagoon system is designed to serve a population of 500 for the next 20 years.
Construction Start Date:2017-06-01
Construction End Date:2018-02-14

properties.Name: Sewage Pumping Station and Force Main Upgrade
properties.Description:
Project Description:The existing sewage pump station and forcemain are undersized, and will be replaced with a pump station and forcemain. Construct sewage pumping station, force main upgrade and all associated works. The new pump station and forcemain are designed to serve for 20 years.
Construction Start Date:2017-06-01
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Plains Road Storm Sewer Replacement (at Plains Road East/C.N.R. Grade Separation)
properties.Description:
Project Description:Replacement of 788 meters of storm sewer that conveys water at the Plains Road/CN Grade Separation, 550 meters west of Brant Street. This sewer was designed to drain to the Upper Hager Creek located to the South but is currently failing and filling with sediment/draining to the existing sandy soil in the area. Originally planned to be constructed with the CN Bridge structure, this project would be able to be advanced and constructed as a stand alone project as the structure repair is outside of the 10 year Capital Forecast. Due to regulatory requirements and/or permit delays, we are requesting an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline to ensure successful completion of the project.
Construction Start Date:2017-09-12
Construction End Date:2018-06-29

properties.Name: Design for a New Sanitary Trunk Sewer on Cawthra Road
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** modified project *** see in notes for original information. "Detailed design for a new sanitary trunk sewer on Cawthra Road from Burnhamthorpe Road East to south of Dundas Street East to service intensification in central Mississauga and to reduce the risk of flooding in the area caused by extreme storm events. Due to the size and complexity of the project, we are requesting an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline to ensure successful completion of the project. Region has developed new design standards to mitigate Inflow & Infiltration (climate change adaptation). This will then mean a different type of pipe material (instead of reinforced gravity pipe will now use concrete pressure pipe) and manhole construction will be required to meet the standard which is more costly. The new difference in material is in strength, it is pressured and increased cost. IO NOTE: There is an increase in scope, resulting in an increase in Federal Funding of $1,000,000 to be reallocated from PEEL-006." Due to the size and complexity of the project, we are requesting an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline to ensure successful completion of the project."
Construction Start Date:2016-04-01
Construction End Date:2018-11-30

properties.Name: District Metering Program
properties.Description:
Project Description:Installation of flow meters on watermains within the distribution system and the creation of a program to monitor and audit the water usage in each district to optimize water usage and identify and repair leaks.
Construction Start Date:2017-10-16
Construction End Date:2018-12-31

properties.Name: Installation of a scum collector and sludge thickener system
properties.Description:
Project Description:The East wastewater treatment plant in Quebec City currently has four sludge thickeners, each of which is 19 metres in diameter. To effectively dispose of scum accumulation on the surface of basins, full sludge scraper systems must be put in place.
Construction Start Date:2017-01-25
Construction End Date:2017-12-01

properties.Name: Alberta Street Sanitary Pumping Station in Grand Bend - Electrical and Mechanical Upgrades including replcement of the Emergency Stand-by Power System
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** "The Alberta pumping station upgrade project will include upgrades to the electrical systems including replacement of the standby generator and Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA) system. The Diesel tank system will also be upgraded to include proper containment measures. This pumping station serves approximately 450 properties. The proposed scope of work triggered further electrical updates required by modern electrical code. The additional electrical work was found during detail design of the project and is required to be able to undertake the current scope. Extension rationale: The Municipality was delayed on these projects due to the late commitment of funding. The delayed funding made it difficult to complete design, competitively source contractors and complete construction within the originally given date. This was compounded by the seasonality of the projects which cannot be completed during the winters months. IO NOTE: There is an increase in scope, resulting in an increase in Federal Funding of $25,223 to be reallocated from LAM-005."
Construction Start Date:2017-07-02
Construction End Date:2018-11-15

properties.Name: Water Treatment Upgrade
properties.Description:
Project Description:The existing water plant must be upgraded to meet health-related regulations for minimum treatment. Construct appx 630 m of 50 mm raw water supply line, distribution piping, treatment system upgrades including two filters for direct filtration, disinfection, submersible pump, and all associated works. The project includes a raw supply upgrade, and a treatment plant upgrade to serve 177 persons.
Construction Start Date:2017-08-28
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Renewal of water pipes
properties.Description:
Project Description:Pipe renewal works aimed at maintaining water services for citizens for 8 stretches of road totaling 0.895 km.
Construction Start Date:2017-09-04
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: East Don River near May Avenue Bank Stabilization and Sanitary Infrastructure Protection Study
properties.Description:
Project Description:Channel migration and downcutting threaten to expose up to 60m of linear sanitary infrastructure located 0.8m beneath the watercourse. A geomorphic study is required to assess the extent of the problem and will be followed by detailed design for sanitary protection works. The assessment provides a better understanding of our local water resources and enables innovative designs to reduce sediment inputs into local waterways, improve habitat and provide infrastructure protection. The project is located near May Avenue and Kersey Crescent in the Town of Richmond Hill.
Construction Start Date:2017-05-01
Construction End Date:2019-12-31

properties.Name: Investigation and Design of 15 culverts in the northern rural areas - City Wide
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** "Investigation and Design of various culverts in preparation for the replacement/ rehabilitation of 15 existing corrugated steel pipe culverts which are located in the northern rural areas of the City of Vaughan. The existing corrugated steel pipes have deteriorated and may impact their ability to convey the desired storm water during a major storm event as well as to protect the structural integrity of the roadway. IO NOTE: There is no decrease in scope, only a decrease in tender. This will result in an decrease in Federal Funding of $13,400 to be reallocated."
Construction Start Date:2018-01-24
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Maplewood Booster Station Controls Upgrades
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** Complete the design for the Upgrade of controls to include variable speed drive's (VFD's) to improve pumps pressure control, starts and stops, eliminate water hammer, and reduce electricity consumption, and TSSA compliant stand-by generator. IO NOTE: There is additional scope added to the project, resulting in an increase in Federal Funding of $13,918.50 to be reallocated.
Construction Start Date:2018-01-15
Construction End Date:2019-02-28

properties.Name: Replacement of corroded soda ash tank system with a new poly tank and stainless feeder at the Nairn Centre Water Treatment Plant
properties.Description:
Project Description:This project will replace the corroded soda ash tank system with a new poly tank and stainless feeder, and will install on-demand hot water tank for providing warm water for chemical mixing to ensure that chemical is dosed correctly for this system. This has the potential to impact the water quality for the entire water system, affecting 100% of the users.
Construction Start Date:2017-12-18
Construction End Date:2018-02-23

properties.Name: German Mills Creek  Bank Stabilization and Sanitary Infrastructure Protection Environmental Assessment Project
properties.Description:
Project Description:This project will complete a Schedule B Municipal Class Environmental Assessment and detailed design for four sanitary protection sites within the project area, including implementation of the highest priority site. The project is located in Bercy Wycliffe and German Mills Settlers Park (John Street and Don Mills Road) in the City of Markham.
Construction Start Date:2017-01-03
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Replacement of Existing Highlift Pumps (2) at Buckhorn Lake Estates
properties.Description:
Project Description:The upgrade/replacement of the highlift pumps will increase energy efficiency by replacing the existing non-submersible pumps with variable frequency drive equipped submersible pumps which will also prevent instances of air locking of the pumps (as the will be submersed) which results in loss of system pressure and adverse water quality incidents.
Construction Start Date:2018-01-01
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Greenfield Phase 1 Water and Sewer Infrastructure
properties.Description:
Project Description:Objective: Meet water and sewer servicing requirements for an approximately $65M anchor agri-food processing plant. Scope: Planning, design and construction of approximately (appx) 1320 m of appx 200mm sanitary sewer and appx 1260 m of appx 200mm PVC water pipe, manholes, gate valves, lift station, connections, hydrants, overland drainage, and all associated works. Output: Water and sewer mains to service an appx 200 ha industrial Greenfield project.
Construction Start Date:2018-06-06
Construction End Date:2018-12-31

properties.Name: Remove accumulated sludge from Hearst Wastewater Treatment Lagoons (cell #1)
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** "Remove by mechanical means approximately 22,000 cubic meters of accumulated sludge from the Hearst Wastewater Treatment Lagoon Cell #1, which is equivalent to 50% of the cell's capacity. The accumulated sludge ""short circuits"" the treatment process, resulting in undesirable effects: higher Biological Oxygen Demand, higher Total Suspended Solids, increased ammonia and increased lagoon odours. The removal works are capitalized as they extend the life of the asset. The potential savings experienced by other projects will allow for additional sludge to be removed from the cell and further extending the lifespan of the lagoon. IO NOTE: There is an increase in scope for additional sludge to be removed, resulting in an increase in Federal Funding of $22,995 to be reallocated from HEA-002 and HEA-003."
Construction Start Date:2017-08-17
Construction End Date:2018-10-26

properties.Name: Rehabilitation of Pelee Island Drainage Pump Station Exhaust and Fuel Systems for Storm Water Management
properties.Description:
Project Description:***Modified project*** See notes for original project information. This rehabilitation project entails diesel fuel and engine exhaust legislative compliance upgrades at the Township of Pelee's 3 drainage pump stations which will ensure operator, building and environmental safety during operations once completed. The diesel powered pumps require exhaust and fuel system redesign and construction to be in compliance with regulations and legislation at each of the drainage pump stations.  These 3 pump stations maintain Pelee Island's stormwater drainage flood control system and provide storm water conveyance from residential, agricultural and commercial properties for approximately 7/8th of Pelee Island's total lands. Additional scope: as well as cement barricades at all 3 pump stations to protect fuel tanks, and cement pads and new fuel tanks at the West and South pumps.
Construction Start Date:2018-08-01
Construction End Date:2018-10-31

properties.Name: Cured-in-Place Storm Sewer Rehabilitation on County Road 12 (Cockburn St.), Berwick Ontario
properties.Description:
Project Description:The existing storm sewer on County Road 12 in Berwick, Ontario, is in poor condition and, if it continues to deteriorate, will soon pose a risk to the public from the undermining of the road (sinkholes). The proposed project would allow the County to repair the sewer with a cured-in-place lining system to avoid its impending failure. The County proposes to use this trenchless rehabilitation method as it eliminates the need for conventional replacement, reduces the impact to traffic, avoids disruption to the community, and lessens the overall impact to the environment. Trenchless rehabilitation is considered an environmentally friendly construction practice due to the fact that less raw materials are required to complete the work (no need for paving, granular material and pipe), it extends the service life of existing infrastructure, and is proven to minimize overall disruption to the natural environment
Construction Start Date:2017-10-02
Construction End Date:2017-10-27

properties.Name: First Street North West Dead End Sanitary Sewer Relining
properties.Description:
Project Description:Relining of 225 mm diameter clay tile sanitary pipe utilizing cured-in place pipe no dig technology. The current Clay tile pipe installed Many decades ago is exhibiting cracked and deteriorated sections as observed in the most recent CCTV inspections. This rehabilitation will avoid poor or no access to open cut trenching associated with the steep grade and elevation difference between First St North and Veterans' Dr. The pipe services a major off complex and approximately 5 residential homes.
Construction Start Date:2017-05-01
Construction End Date:2020-03-31

properties.Name: Village of Carp Water Quality Treatment  Facility Upgrades Including New Building and granular activated carbon contactors
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** "Added scope including improvements and upgrades to the electrical system within the existing Carp Water Treatment Facility building, including a replacement of the Motor Control Center (MCC), new priority alarm panel and surge arrestor termination panel, improvements to the chlorine pumping system, and additional of flow meters (2) on the water intake pipes. Switching the power and heating source of the GAC building from electric to natural gas. Remediation and removal of contaminated soil within the existing water treatment facility property. Design and construction of granular activated carbon contactors (GAC) to resolve taste and odour issues in the source water before chlorination. This will involve construction of a new building to house the GAC treatment. Electrical system upgrades will also be completed within the existing Carp Water Treatment Facility building, including a new transfer switch, replacement of the Programmable Logic Controllers (PLC), improvements to power monitoring, surge protection, and communication points to Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA) and the Human-Machine Interface (HMI). A project extension beyond March 31, 2018 is requested to accommodate contaminated soils that may revise the design/construction schedule. IO NOTE: There is an increase in scope, resulting in an increase in Federal Funding of $1,015,000 to be reallocated from OTT-033."
Construction Start Date:2017-01-20
Construction End Date:2019-12-01

properties.Name: Replacement of Waste Water Sewer Main Line (forcemain) from Ontario Street pumping station approximately.
properties.Description:
Project Description:"Rehabilitation of the Township's wastewater system by replacing the forcemain from the main sewage pumping station to the treatment lagoon will help ensure the uninterrupted conveyance of sanitary sewage from the majority of the connected users in White River (residential, commercial and institutional users). This will improve the reliability of this aged and failing infrastructure (the Township has dealt with numerous breaks in this forcemain in recent years) and help keep sewage from potentially surcharging the sewage pumping station and backing up into buildings, where it would present a public health and safety issue. The system serves approximately 600 residential users in addition to commercial and institutional users (e.g. food service, elementary school and medical center). Due to delays in developing the Transfer Payment Agreement and subsequent delays in procurement and its impact on construction schedule, we are requesting an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline to ensure successful completion of the project."
Construction Start Date:2017-06-01
Construction End Date:2018-12-31

properties.Name: Upgrades and Repairs at the Echo River Water treatment plant
properties.Description:
Project Description:Extension of reservoir, upgrades to pump and pressure tanks, replacement of chlorine dosing panel. Off-reserve benefits are increased safety and security of water supply results in reduced burden to provincial health system.
Construction Start Date:2017-02-15
Construction End Date:2018-03-30

properties.Name: Bring the aeration ponds and the basin pumping station up to code
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project will add a sequencing batch reactor (SBR-type), increase the volume of the basins, optimize their geometry and aeration and add a UV disinfection system. The renovation of the main pumping station is also planned.
Construction Start Date:2017-10-24
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Amber Crescent Culvert Replacement
properties.Description:
Project Description:This is an emerging project related to a culvert in significant disrepair. While the Town had limited funding for major culvert maintenance work, this project required dedicated funding. The CWWF funding allows this project to be implemented within its required need timeline.
Construction Start Date:2017-06-01
Construction End Date:2018-10-01

properties.Name: Final Engineering Design and Construction of watermain underground at King Street (Webster to George), in conjunction with road reconstruction works at the same location.
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project will include the installation of 150mm diameter watermain underground as part of the Road reconstruction works along King Street (Webster to George). This watermain will replace 60-year old, cast iron, 100mm diameter pipe, which is undersized by modern standards, and susceptible to leaks and potential breaks. This new watermain will be looped into the existing watermain system which will improve water quality in the overall system. In addition, the new 150mm diameter watermain will provide improved firefighting capabilities and flow to the existing customers on the street
Construction Start Date:2017-04-01
Construction End Date:2017-11-30

properties.Name: Minor upgrades to the raw water intake & pumping and piping systems low lift pumping station
properties.Description:
Project Description:Modifications to raw water intake and pumping system include (i) providing new screening and pump layout to meet Fisheries and Oceans Freshwater Intake End-of-Pipe Fish Screen Guideline and (ii) remove older ductile iron piping which is in very poor condition from the raw water piping system. This project will ensure that fish or any other debris do not enter our water treatment plant which could cause significant damage and or premature wear on equipment which could lead to expensive break downs and the potential disruption of municipal water service for the Town of Deep River.
Construction Start Date:2017-05-15
Construction End Date:2017-07-30

properties.Name: Water System Improvements
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project works will include: - Watermain replacement, approximately 1,109 m of watermain; - Watermain Installation, approximately 147 m of watermain; - Pressure Reducing (PRV) Station replacement: one below ground PRV station with one 150mm (lead) and one 200mm (lag) pressure reducing valve; and, - Powerhouse well replacement: replacement of well #3 including pump.
Construction Start Date:2017-07-31
Construction End Date:2017-11-30

properties.Name: Woking Lift Station upgrade
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project involves installation of a new pre-fabricated fibreglass sewage lift station.
Construction Start Date:2018-02-01
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: West Side Pond Rehabilitation and Sediment Cleanout  including Removal of approximately 2,500m3 of sediment.
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** "The West Side storm water management Pond is a rehabilitation and sediment cleanout project including removal of approximately 2,500 m3 of sediment. The project was identified in the SWMFMG report as a priority; the estimated year of sediment removal was 2012. The storm water management pond is located in Bowmanville, Ontario draining to West Side Creek; a watercourse that ultimately drains to the Westside Marsh which is a significant coastal wetland. The estimated cost for cleanout of the project is $600,000 which exceeds the annual funding amount ($90,000) and would not proceed in 2017/2018 without special funding from the CWWF. The removal works are capitalized as they extend the life of the asset. The project is anticipated to be under budget by $400,000 due to method of removal, density of soil, low tender pricing and over estimate of sediment volumes. IO NOTE: There is a decrease in scope, resulting in a decrease in Federal Funding of $200,000 to be reallocated to CLA-001, CLA-005, CLA-006 and CLA-008."
Construction Start Date:2017-01-01
Construction End Date:2017-10-31

properties.Name: Wastewater Treatment Plant N-VIRO Building Upgrades
properties.Description:
Project Description:Replace roof and upgrade HVAC
Construction Start Date:2017-10-01
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: New Wastewater Pump Stations
properties.Description:
Project Description:Objective: Enhance capacity and reliability of wastewater collection system by replacing two existing lift stations. Scope: Plan, design and construct two new lift stations with pumps, valves and controls, and all associated works. Output: Two new lift stations.
Construction Start Date:2018-04-16
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Programmable Logic Controller Rebuild (SELOG)
properties.Description:
Project Description:Rebuild the current programmable logic controller system currently being used. Successful completion of this project will ensure that untreated water does not enter the environment and negatively impact surrounding communities.
Construction Start Date:2018-07-01
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Design and construct a new Stormwater Outlet (surge capacity)
properties.Description:
Project Description:Storm Water Outlet Management to mitigate Climate Change (Collection and conveyance of stormwater), Design and build a stormwater system that pending design will include a retention pond and underground infrastructure (+/-200m) to convey storm water to an appropriate location to mitigate flooding of municipal roads and private property. The initial estimate was performed by our drainage superintendent. The eligible costs are limited to public/municipal property and assets.
Construction Start Date:2017-04-01
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Repair of 10 water valves in the drinking water distribution system
properties.Description:
Project Description:A total of 10 distribution system valves need repairs/replacement. This is a high risk item as the valves need to work in case of fire or water line break. Objective: To replace deficient valves to ensure system operability and ability to isolate during break event. Scope: A prioritized list of valves needing attention will be used as per the towns recommendations. Purchase required components, excavate, install, backfill with adequate material, follow all pertinent regulations and American Water Works Association procedures. Output: Functioning valve within the distribution system.
Construction Start Date:2017-12-01
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Distribution Pumping Upgrades
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project in Manyberries includes distribution pumping system, electrical controls and instrumention, programming and commissioning and engineering..
Construction Start Date:2017-10-01
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Repairs and Upgrades at Water Treatment Plant
properties.Description:
Project Description:Replace water treatment membranes, install submersible water pumps, repairs / upgrades to walkways, stairs and handrails and lights, perform energy audit of Water treatment plant. Off-reserve benefit is improved water quality results in less burden to provincial health care system.
Construction Start Date:2017-07-01

properties.Name: Rehabilitate the Victorian Village Stormwater Management Pond at 467 Victoria Street, Port Perry which was constructed in 1994 and services 38.1 Hectares of developed lands.

It will also include design and Engineering to ensure the optimization and improvement of treatment, and flow between the inlets, forebays, and outlets. Additional consultations with the Conservation Authority will also take place to ensure improved performance. The stormwater management pond was built in 1994 and treats a drainage area of 38.1 hectares. The removal works are capitalized as they extend the life of the asset.

Construction End Date:2018-12-31

properties.Name: Murray Street Water - Replacement of cast-iron watermain
properties.Description:
Project Description:OBJECTIVE: The Town is actively adopting wastewater infrastructure renewal projects that improve operation and maintenance requirements, reduce inflow and infiltration, provide enhancements to the natural environment and support long term sustainable infrastructure. SCOPE: The scope of this project includes the replacement of 630 metres of 200-375mm diameter vitrified clay sanitary sewers from Aberdeen Street to Waterloo Street that were constructed in 1925. The sanitary sewer is in a poor structural state and is beyond the end of its service life, as such, replacement of the sanitary sewer is the recommended rehabilitation alternative along with the replacement of maintenance holes and sanitary laterals. Additionally, the project includes the replacement of 240 metres of 150mm diameter cast iron watermain constructed in 1920 from Aberdeen Street to Central Avenue. The watermain is beyond the end of its service life and is prone to failure leading to water quality concerns. Considering the age of the watermain, replacement of the watermain is the recommended rehabilitation alternative. This is a priority project for the Town. Town Council has accelerated this project to design in 2016 and construction in 2017 through administrative report IS-22-2016. This project was originally forecast for design in 2018 with construction forecast for 2019. This project has a planned 2017 construction start. OUTPUT: The estimated reduction in stormwater (inflow & infiltration) entering the wastewater distribution system is approximately 4,000 m3 per annum as a result of replacing the sanitary sewer, maintenance holes and service laterals. The replacement of the watermain will improve system reliability; reduce operational issues as well as reducing opportunities for negative impacts to water quality. The project will directly contribute to reduce point source sanitary overflows to meet both regulatory requirements and objectives of the remedial action plan for the Niagara River.
Construction Start Date:2017-04-30
Construction End Date:2018-11-16

properties.Name: Membrane Filter Replacement at Plant
properties.Description:
Project Description:Worn water treatment plant membrane filters are to be replaced with new membranes which will relieve need for future provincial and federal emergency funding requests. On reserve benefits include increased potable water production for community demand and Fire protection. Off reserve benefits include minimized reject water stream to the natural environment and a reduced burden on the provincial health system from improved drinking water quality.
Construction Start Date:2017-03-15
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Replace high-risk sewer lines
properties.Description:

If the pipes collapse, sewage will spill into the environment, causing a spill and potential contamination to the environment. Off-reserve benefits are protection to receiving environment.

Off reserve benefits include minimization of off-reserve emergency response team utilization due to sickness from non-disinfected water supply, reduced calls to Spills Action Centre, and prevention of contamination to the natural environment from poorly operating equipment.

properties.Description:

This project is a priority as the water quality is believed to have changed from the time the pre-treatment process was installed. This study would lead to improved water quality being produced and treated at the water treatment plant and would help reduce the burden on the provincial health system preventing any water borne illnesses to the community and for visitors from off-reserve using our facilities. The as built information will be uploaded to a global information system for analysis. Section 4.5-SA to 4.12-strategic actions of the Lake Simcoe protection plan provides guidance for both existing and planned development in terms of storm-water management. properties.Name: New mixing system for the Trenton Wastewater Plant Sludge Storage
properties.Description:
Project Description:In an effort to reduce biosolids production destined for land application, or third party storage, the City proposes the installation of a Linear Motion Mixer in the Trenton Waster Water Plant Sludge Storage Tank. The current mixing system relies on a set of pumps to remove sludge from the bottom of the tank and discharging it from a pipe at the top of the tank. This mixing system has proven inadequate for both biosolids thickening and plant operations. If biosolids production can be reduced by approximately 50% (as estimated by the equipment supplier), this would result in cost savings of approximately $375,000 per year and optimization of the system.
Construction Start Date:2017-01-01
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Description:

The existing system has begun to experience failure and, as a result, City staff have recommended accelerating the project. In addition, the City has the opportunity to cost share the cost with Hydro One, who are currently upgrading their feeder system. This work, which includes the installation of a new transformer and underground primary feeder lines, will permit future upgrades of the Dundas Street Pumping Station and provide continued reliability in the power supply to the existing station.

Replace and increase capacity for 228 m of existing 300mm and 262m of 900mm storm sewer with proposed 245m of 1950mm and 40m of 1500mm all concrete. Estimated residential homes in the area is 30 to 40 as well as one school and one church in the construction area. Replace is required due to failing pipes and planning for increased capacity . Road will be reconstructed with no expansion or improvement once sewers and watermain work is completed. Other contribution funding is from Windsor Utilities Commission for the watermain work. Additional scope includes: Replace and improve capacity for 16m 1650mm concrete culvert at Mount Royal Drive including one 3600 x 2400mm storm sewer manhole, 25 m 250mm sanitary sewer, 16m 450mm storm sewer and road restoration. Replace and improve capacity for 22m 1500mm concrete culvert at Longfellow Avenue including one 2400mm storm sewer manhole, 10m 1350mm storm sewer, 17m 450mm storm sewer and road restoration. Lennon Drain widening and bank stabilization, and end discharge treatments will be included between west of Mount Royal Dr. and east of Longfellow Avenue, which is approximately 190 meters in length. Due to our deficiency holdback standards of our warrant period we are requesting an extension beyond March 31, 2018 to successfully complete our project.

Upgrading fire protection for the area may include changing the hydrant, or adding a storz steam port to the existing hydrant.

properties.Name: Renewal of water pipes
properties.Description:
Project Description:Pipe renewal works aimed at maintaining water services for citizens for 5 stretches of road and totaling 0.89 km.

Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Replacement / Optimization of Ultraviolet Treatment System at Waste Water Treatment Plant
properties.Description:
Project Description:The Town of Smiths Falls currently owns and operates a Class IV nitrifying tertiary treatment activated sludge plant that carries a wastewater treatment capacity of 14,700m3/day. The wastewater plant currently offers effluent disinfection through use of ultraviolet irradiation (UV). The existing UV disinfection system, (Trojan UV3000) was installed in 1992 and includes three UV banks with 23 modules per bank and 8 lamps per module. The UV3000 system has been discontinued by the manufacturer and will only be supported as long as parts are available. It is currently proposed that the 24 year old UV system be replaced with a newer model that will offer innovative features that will include variable output electronic ballasts, fewer bulbs, and an automated cleaning system. The project will offer environmental outcomes that will include reduced energy demands, reduced waste (fewer bulbs), and efficiencies in plant operations (i.e.. manual cleaning). The Rideau River is the receiving waterway for the Towns effluent. This federally regulated waterway also carries a UNESCO designation recognized internationally.
Construction Start Date:2017-08-09
Construction End Date:2018-11-15

properties.Name: Installation of a Booster Pumping Station in North East Quadrant of Warwick Water Distribution System
properties.Description:
Project Description:This project will see the installation of a Booster Pumping Station and check valves to boost pressure in the North-eastern portion of the Township of Warwick's Drinking Water Distribution System. Recent water distribution system modelling, completed in 2016, has revealed that the north-eastern portion of the distribution system does not meet MOECC guidelines requiring 40 psi. Sections of the north-eastern portion of the system are approaching pressures levels as low as 23 psi during maximum day and peak hour demand. The installation of this booster station is necessary in order to boost pressure in this area and ensure the system does not going under a boil water advisory (necessary at 20 psi) and ensure adequate pressure at hydrants in this area. The installation of this booster station will rehabilitate this portion of the distribution system in order to provide adequate pressures that meet Ministry of Environment and Climate Change guidelines.
Construction Start Date:2017-05-01
Construction End Date:2018-05-31

properties.Name: Orchard Crescent Reconstruction including new watermain, hydrants and services, sanitary laterals, storm mains and laterals, road base and surface.  There are 17 houses on Orchard Crescent.

The objective is to improve the reliability of the road and reduce the greenhouse gas emissions.

Construction End Date:2017-10-31

properties.Name: Water pipe replacement
