Construction End Date:2018-07-01

properties.Name: Henry Kroeger Water Treatment Plant Generator Upgrade Project
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project involves the replacement of an existing diesel generator with a larger diesel generator capable of powering all treatment systems and distribution pumps.
Construction Start Date:2017-10-12
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Feasibility Study to Meet the Upcoming 2021 Wastewater Systems Effluent Regulation Requirements for the Red Lake Water Pollution Control Plant
properties.Description:
Project Description:By 2021, the Red Lake Water Pollution Control Plant that currently practices chlorination of effluent prior to discharge will need to 1. Cease chlorinating (requires permission from Ministry of Environment and Climate Change unlikely due to recreational use of receiving water in Howey Bay). 2. Install and utilize dechlorination to remove residual chlorine prior to discharge, or, 3. Switch to an alternate form of disinfection (ie U.V.). The output benefit to the community is the creation of a feasibility study will provide the most viable solution to deal with the Provincial upcoming regulations. As per subsections 6(1)(c) and 50(4) of the Wastewater Systems Effluent Regulations (SOR/2012-139) made under the Fisheries Act, the effluent quality standard for total residual chlorine (TRC) will come into force on January 1, 2021 for continuously discharging wastewater systems with an annual average daily volume of less than 5,000 m3. The Wastewater Systems Effluent Regulations can be found at the following link: http://laws-lois.justice.gc.ca/eng/regulations/SOR-2012-139/FullText.html
Construction Start Date:2017-12-05
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Wastewater Pump Station Upgrade
properties.Description:
Project Description:Objective: Ensure wastewater works comply with provincial regulations while reducing the risk of emergency wastewater discharge. Scope: Plan, design and construct upgraded lift station one including ventilation, appx 13.1 l/s pumping rate, electrical and piping, and all associated works. Upgrades to existing lift station two including fencing, control panel, communications systems as well as backup pump and bypass and all associated work. Output: Upgraded sewage lift stations.
Construction Start Date:2017-12-01
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Repair of waste water pumping systems that services approximately 6000 homes due to failure at 2 Scott Road, Elliot Lake, Ontario.
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project will involve removal, reconstruction and reinstallation of 5 lift screws as well as the provision and installation of solid covers to insulate, dampen noise and protect concrete structures from the environment.

Construction End Date:2018-12-31

properties.Name: Wastewater Study about Gravity collection system

Completion of the Study will inform future potential projects which aimed at reducing the risk of contamination due to untreated wastewater entering the environment and affecting the surrounding community.

Construction End Date:2017-04-30

properties.Name: Update Intake Pumps (4)
properties.Description:
Project Description:"Upgrade (4) current pumping systems to a more efficient product. This will result in energy savings. Due to delays in developing the agreement and changes to local priorities, an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline is required. IO NOTE: This is a newly proposed project. This will result in an increase in Federal Funding of $30,000 to be reallocated from MSD-004."

properties.Name: Repairs and Upgrades at Wastewater Treatment Plant
properties.Description:
Project Description:Replace drives on rotating biological contactor, fix ventilation system, replace gas detection units, flush sewage lines. Off-reserve benefit is additional protection to the receiving environment.

Geotechnical work may involve new wells to evaluate water quality and quantity. Off-reserve benefit include more safe and secure water source reducing burden to provincial health care system.
Construction Start Date:2017-02-01
Construction End Date:2018-03-01

properties.Name: Rehabilitation of the Water Treatment Plant
properties.Description:
Project Description:Rehabilitation of the water treatment plant involving the replacement or upgrade of obsolete/ defective equipment including high lift pumps, low lift pumps, backup power generator. In addition to minimizing Boil Water Advisory incidents and emergencies, these upgrades will increase the reliability of the water supply and reduce the potential burden on the province's health care system.
Construction Start Date:2017-01-09
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Point-of-Entry Water Treatment Systems
properties.Description:
Project Description:Point-of-Entry / Point-of-Use water treatment systems for all residences of Saugeen and band buildings to treat water and make it potable. Treatment to include softener/Ultraviolet (UV) and/or reverse osmosis (RO) units, and back-up power to run well pumps and treatment during frequent power outages. Off-reserve benefits are reduced burden to provincial health care system by providing treated water to community.
Construction Start Date:2017-02-01
Construction End Date:2017-12-01

properties.Name: Needs Study of a Community Owned Waste Water System Servicing a 17 home Sub-Division and Public Daycare Located on Stoneridge Circle, Ohsweken, Ontario, N0A 1M0.
properties.Description:
Project Description:This is an engineering study which will assess the needs of a local peatland system which services a community owned housing development in order to keep the effluent within Federal limits as per the Wastewater Systems Effluent Regulations and minimize environmental impacts to the Lake Erie Drainage Basin. This would meet the funds goals of increasing the capacity or lifespan of the asset, enhancing service and improving environmental outcomes. Off reserve benefits: The improvement of our Six Nations waste water systems discharge into the McKenzie Creek and eventually into the Grand River will assist with water treatment for those municipalities who draw our effluent water downstream from the Grand River for potable water usage as well as help make rivers and lakes healthier, which would have a positive impact on municipal agricultural users and have an overall positive environmental impact on the Lake Erie Drainage Basin as well as help to achieve the phosphorous load reduction targets for Lake Erie as our waste water effluent has been documented to have high phosphorus levels.
Construction Start Date:2017-09-14
Construction End Date:2018-04-30

properties.Name: Arnaud and Area Potable Water Supply
properties.Description:
Project Description:Involves expanding the regional system to connect the Town of Arnaud to the Pembina Valley Water Coop (PVWC) . The expansion includes the installation of a booster station and approximately 75km of pipeline resulting in approximately new 50 hookups.
Construction Start Date:2016-10-26
Construction End Date:2018-02-06

properties.Name: Water System Improvements
properties.Description:
Project Description:Construct new intake. Construct new wet well/screening chamber and relocate pumps . Intake pumphouse  remove all black iron pipe and fittings and replace with more suitable material . Reservoir pumphouse  remove all black iron pipe and fittings and replace with more suitable material . Maintain water supply system during construction
Construction Start Date:2019-04-01
Construction End Date:2019-10-01

properties.Name: Water Main Reliability
properties.Description:
Project Description:Water supply redundancy in South Transcona is required. The discoloured Water Investigation Study undertaken in 2013 recommended that the City investigate opportunities to minimize water age (water travel time) in the water distribution system. These concerns in East Winnipeg can be mitigated by the construction of a 3 km. long, 300 mm diameter watermain along Dugald Road from McFadden Avenue to Ravenhurst Street and along Ravenhurst Street from Dugald Road to Pandora Avenue East. No new development is anticipated at this time. Only current homes will be serviced by this upgrade.
Construction Start Date:2017-05-17
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Water and Sewer Upgrades on Various Streets
properties.Description:
Project Description:Renew 300 m of sanitary sewer and extend watermain by 400 m and storm sewer by 600 m to accommodate Town's growth. Renew sections of storm sewer along Ealey Crescent and Bloor Drive. This project includes related road work necessary to complete the project.

Construction End Date:2018-12-31

properties.Name: Lorne Street Infrastructure Upgrade with Storm Water Mitigation Phase II
properties.Description:
Project Description:Construct a larger storm water retention pond, including stormwater inlet and outlet structures. Replace existing culverts under CN Railway and Crescent Street . Work to increase the capacity of the filtration plant serving the Cabano area as well as work on the drinking water system are also necessary.

properties.Name: Rehabilitation of the Stormwater Pond at Mayfield Road and Kennedy Road
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** modified project *** See notes for original information Rehabilitation and retrofitting of the storm water pond at Mayfield Road and Kennedy Road to restore the original operational design parameters and to meet the current standards for providing flood control and an ""enhanced level of protection"". The purpose of this project is to restore the original facility functions to protect the environment, enhance the ability of the region through improved technology to operate and maintain the infrastructure, improve the infrastructure efficiency and reduce long term maintenance costs. The facility was constructed to service a tributary area of 10.59 ha, being comprised of 8.24 ha of arterial road drainage and 2.35 ha lands additional area which drains to the arterial road right of way. This facility provides storm water Quality Control (Enhanced Level i.e. 80% Total Suspended Solids removal), Erosion Control and maintain Water Quantity flows below existing flow rates up to the Regional Storm. On June 6, 2008 the Ministry of the Environment issued a Certificate of Approval to the Region of Peel to construct, operate and maintain the prescribed infrastructure, including a condition (No.4) requiring the Region to properly operate and maintain the infrastructure to protect the environment. To demonstrate compliance with the MOE authorization, the Region operates a monitoring program. The program showed that the facility have deteriorated and that without rehabilitation, will not provide the function as per its original design. Due to delays in developing the agreement and consequent local priority changes, an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline is required. Unique solutions/new technology - (SWMshield) was implemented in the design process which substantially reduced cost. In addition, economies of scale (by tendering 3 storm water ponds - PEEL-01, PEEL-02 & PEEL-31) resulted in lower tender price.
Construction Start Date:2017-08-01
Construction End Date:2017-12-31

properties.Name: Repair and rehabilitate the roofs on Digesters 2 and 3 at Ravensview Wastewater Treatment Plant
properties.Description:
Project Description:"This project entails repairs to the roof structures on two digesters at the Ravensview Wastewater Treatment Plant. It includes removal of the old surface treatment, repairing structural cracks in the concrete roof slabs, pressure testing and re-installing a new weatherproofing system on rehabilitated concrete roof slabs. Due to delays in developing the Transfer Payment Agreement and subsequent delays in procurement and its impact on construction schedule, we are requesting an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline to ensure successful completion of the project."
Construction Start Date:2017-05-01
Construction End Date:2018-12-31

properties.Name: Variable Frequency Drive for 3 High Lifts at the Water Treatment Plant
properties.Description:
Project Description:Install Variable Frequency Drive (VFD) at all 3 high lift pumps at Water Treatment Plant - This would free up an operator during dig jobs. The water tower runs on the booster pump, but currently the Water Treatment Plant has to be manned at all times to monitor flows, change high lift duties and flows, and ties that operator up for the duration of the problem. If the pumps had VFD's we could eliminate this entirely. This would also help with energy costs and maximize energy savings. Reduce energy consumption by running the high lift pumps more efficiently instead of at 100% output at all times. Improved environmental outcome: Energy consumption is optimized and potentially reduce maintenance problems and extending the life of the equipment, potentially reducing the amount of waste going to the landfill.
Construction Start Date:2018-06-04
Construction End Date:2018-12-31

properties.Name: Renewal of water pipes

Project Description:Pipe renewal work for the maintenance of water services to citizens for 14 street sections totaling 1.067 km.

properties.Description:

Replacement of cast iron pipes with newer 150 mm, and 250 mm Polyvinyl Chloride (PVC) pipes will improve both water quality and fire flows to the areas 83 residential properties which service approximately 190 persons. Due to the lack of capacity among contractors/engineers in the region, we are requesting an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline to ensure successful completion of the project."

Construction End Date:2018-05-30

properties.Name: DeCew Falls Water Treatment Plant - Spillway Reconstruction - located in the City of St. Catharines
properties.Description:
Project Description:This project will replace the DeCew Falls Water Treatment Plant spillway structure (1925) to continue to control the passage of raw water (un-treated) from the middle reservoir to the St. Catharines Morning Star Mill historical site, and the Beaverdams Creek. The project scope includes the foundation reconstruction, and federal CWWF funding will support construction costs (not design costs). The supply of raw water (113.2 L/s) is a requirement of the 1954 agreement with the Mill. A steady supply of raw water is needed to ensure flows are maintained to the Mill site, DeCew Falls and Beaverdams Creek. This improvement will strengthen the security of the fresh water supply to this popular hiking and fishing area, it also removes the threat of reduced and irregular freshwater flows to the watershed. The total project cost is inclusive of all cost to deliver the project including design. The federal and provincial CWWF contributions respectively are based solely on the construction costs. The project is incremental in nature in that even though a design was near completion, the project had been removed from our 2017 capital budget due to insufficient regional funding required to proceed with the construction phase. The CWWF funding will allow us to proceed with a key infrastructure project.
Construction Start Date:2017-09-05
Construction End Date:2018-01-20

The project budget has been reduced due to recognizing price efficiencies as final tenders are received. IO NOTE: There is no decrease in scope, only a decrease in tender. This will result in a decrease in Federal funding of $650,250 to be reallocated."

Well performance has dropped off at these wells up to 50% loss in production (30.3 L/s to 15 L/s each well) resulting in the need for servicing to re-evaluate well capacity, and ensure fire fighting capabilities. Pre-Rehabilitation Well Performance Test, Removal of Pumping Equipment For Service (Wash/Inspect/Paint), Pre-Rehabilitation Video Survey, Well Rehabilitation, (Mechanical / Chemical Treatment), Post-Rehabilitation video survey, Casing Thickness Log, Pump Installation, Post-Rehabilitation Well Performance Test, Provide report documenting service program.

Sumps added to the catch basin manholes will further enhance the removal of Total Suspended Solids, reducing the peak runoff/discharge and will reduce the negative impact of storm water discharge at its outfall in an area of a steep bank and sensitive receptor extending the anticipated lifespan of the outfall. The project works include storm sewer collection system along 350 meters and 13 manholes while extending the lifespan by approximately 25 years.

properties.Name: Citywide Sanitary Sewer System Inflow and Infiltration Monitoring Program (Flow meters and micro meters)
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** This project will install and monitor flow meters and micro meters within mini basins identified as high priority areas. The data will be analyzed for significant Inflow/Infiltration occurrences and rain gauge data will be utilized in support of the flow monitoring program and associated data analysis. The objective of the project is to find sources of inflow and infiltration in the sanitary sewer system to support York Regions mandate from the Ministry of the Environment and Climate Change to reduce Inflow and Infiltration in York Region. Inflow and infiltration contribute unnecessary water to wastewater collection and treatment system resulting in higher operational costs. The City of Vaughan developed an Inflow and Infiltration Reduction Program which notes Flow Monitoring as a key component of the Program. High priority areas will be identified using the Region of Yorks flow monitoring data, past records of sewer surcharges and conveyance constraints, high peak flows during wet weather conditions and intensification corridors identified under the City of Vaughans Official Plan. The actual project value came back lower than the estimated costs due to following reasons: (a) initial scope was developed based on the information available at that time; (b) Market condition and lots of interest within the industry IO NOTE: There is no decrease in scope, only a reduction in tender. This will result in a decrease in Federal Funding of $1,664.50 to be reallocated.
Construction Start Date:2017-12-06
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Description:
Project Description:The Programmable Logic Controllers (PLC) system is not maintainable in the long term and requires a comprehensive upgrade or replacement. This project will replace the aging PLC equipment. Many components of the system are out dated and replacement parts do not exist. The plant control SCADA system is based on GE 90-30 PLC processors and IO modules that are obsolete and reaching end of life. The manufacturer has stopped hardware production and technical support is very limited and expensive. Due to age and legacy, status system operation is at times unreliable and performance and capabilities are restrictive to operations. As such the PLC system is not maintainable in the long term and requires a comprehensive upgrade or replacement.

properties.Name: Sewer Relining Program Acceleration - Design and Construction
properties.Description:
Project Description:Project is rehabilitation and lining of about 360m of existing 750mm sanitary trunk sewer located between Carling Arena (675 Grosvenor St) and Adelaide Street N, and Wallace St and St. James (North and South). This sewer is in poor condition and lining presents a cost effective alternative to replacement. The sewer runs through the rear yards of numerous properties with no access from the street for equipment. Inaccessible for a large portion so little maintenance over the years has led to buildup of debris and calcite, resulting in capacity loss. This work will require Maintenance Hole (MH) modifications to allow for liner to be installed. One MH is in a rear yard on private property. Other rear yard MH's will be lined through it will be necessary to bury a by-pass pipe in a couple of spots half way across Adelaide and run the main by-pass pipe down the middle lanes of Adelaide St from Wallace St to St James St. This will require the closing of the north and southbound passing lanes for the duration of the lining (one lane of traffic to remain in each direction). The eligible costs are limited to public/municipal property and assets.

Construction End Date:2019-03-31

Oakbank Pond is a self contained pond that receives over-land runoff (storm water) from the surrounding neighborhood. The pond supports various amphibians and wildlife. Because of urbanization pressures the pond requires aeration to promote and sustain pond health. Oakbank pond covers 18,000 sq.m. Additional scope to include implementation of preliminary works associated in support of the project. properties.Description:

The sanitary station is located adjacent to Birches Creek and services a large area of industrial, commercial and residential properties. The existing unit is nearing end of life and replacement parts are difficult to find. A more efficient replacement unit would see the station continue to be operational during power failures, minimizing the risk of overflows to the adjacent watercourse while continuing to see a safe, economical and environmentally responsible operation. Due to manufacturer/supplier delays, we are requesting an extension beyond March 31, 2018, to ensure successful completion of the project.

properties.Name: Rehabilitation of Sewage Pump Station 5 located at  59 Maple Cres in the Town of Atikokan by making upgrades to Sewage Pump Station # 5
properties.Description:
Project Description:Upgrade to Sewage Pump Station # 5 includes: 3 new pumps (each 50 L/s @ 16.0 Total Dynamic Head); replacement of all pipes and valves in station; two new motorized valves and piping to allow flows to be simultaneously conveyed to Sewage Pump Station and river (when needed); two new magnetic flowmeters to measure flows to Sewage Pump Station and any overflows to river; new genset; miscellaneous mechanical upgrades including new barscreen and sump pump; Supervisory Control and Data Acquisitioning upgrades and programming to improve Sewage Pump Station monitoring and control capabilities; removal of old unused equipment and wiring; and upgrade of building envelope. The rationale for the project is to improve the operational capability and reliability of the station and increase the peak flow rate conveyed to Sewage Pump Station #7 during wet weather, to support the other components of the proposed Wet Weather Flow Control Plan, especially the capacity increase at Sewage Pump Station #7. The proposed Sewage Pump Station capacity upgrades will allow more flow to be conveyed to Sewage Pump Station #7 and the Sewage Pump Station; reducing the volume and frequency of untreated sewage overflows at Sewage Pump Station #5; reducing the potential for basement flooding upstream of Sewage Pump Station #5; and reducing potential impacts on the environment (from reduced overflows) and public health (from basement flooding).
Construction Start Date:2017-11-01
Construction End Date:2018-10-31

properties.Name: Capital purchasing of new and/or replacement of equipment for optimizing the water losses and high inflow/infiltration issues from the Ginoogaming First Nation.
properties.Description:
Project Description:This project implements the outcomes of the engineering study and will include the purchase and installation of new equipment or replacing equipment as needed to address the water losses and high inflow/infiltration issues to the Greenstone wastewater system as per the feasibility and recommendations. This will reduce contamination of receiving environments (i.e. rivers, lakes) as well as reduce the wastewater treatment needs to the Greenstone wastewater treatment plant. At this time, the First Nation is returning excessive flows (surface, ground water, infiltration of water) that they receive to the wastewater treatment plant well above that which is originally distributed through the drinking water system. Successful completion of this project will ensure that untreated wastewater does not enter the environment and negatively impact surrounding communities.
Construction Start Date:2018-08-01
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Rehabilitation of Greavette Storm Sewer/Drainage System at 325 Greavette Street that serves 11 hectares of the urban core
properties.Description:
Project Description:The objective of this project is to rehabilitate the failing Grevette Storm Sewer. This drainage system is know to contribute to residential flooding and has been calculated as 600% undersized. From an environmental standpoint soil migration and sediments are also being collected and transported with the existing drainage system into Lake Muskoka, which would typically be captured within the sumps of the newer systems. This project intents on creating a more environmentally friendly drainage system and to reduce any residential flooding that may be occurring. The rehabilitation also will ensure that the system is no longer considered undersized and can accommodate storm events up to 100 year events.
Construction Start Date:2017-04-01
Construction End Date:2019-12-31

properties.Description:
Project Description:Correct storm water infiltration problems in the sanitary sewer system for three streets - Hector, Savoie and Augustin North: seal 15 manholes, seal sanitary pipes through high-pressure injection of materials into inner walls or installing liners, and separate combined sewers by installing surface or underground waste water drainage based on location. The project includes related roadwork required to finish the project.
Construction Start Date:2017-06-08
Construction End Date:2017-09-30

properties.Name: Pre and Post Treatment Upgrade at Lagoon
properties.Description:
Project Description:Upgrades to Waster Water Treatment Facility: Installation of new fine screens and a new ultraviolet effluent disinfection system, electrical and control upgrades.
Construction Start Date:2019-05-06
Construction End Date:2019-11-30

properties.Name: Electoral Area E - Baker Trails Estate Wastewater Treatment System Replacement
properties.Description:
Project Description:"The project will include: - Construction of a new wastewater treatment plant including structural, mechanical, on-site civil and electrical components; - Decommissioning and removal of the existing wastewater treatment plant; - Construction of a new dispersal field; and - Refurbishment of one of the existing dispersal fields and the removal of the other."
Construction Start Date:2017-12-06
Construction End Date:2018-03-15

properties.Name: San Pareil Water System - Treatment Upgrades
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project will include: - Construction and commissioning of a UV treatment building, equipment and interconnection piping. - Including the foundation, building, piping, UV disinfection equipment, controls, and electrical.

Construction End Date:2018-01-31

properties.Name: Twinning of the sanitary forcemain from Water St. Sanitary Sewage Pumping Station to the intersection of Carlan Drive and Regional Road 8 (Reach Street)
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** This project will be constructing a new 400 mm Polyvinyl Chloride (PVC) sanitary force main replacing the existing 350mm force main from the existing termination point on Old Rail Lane at the intersection of North Street, 700 m north on abandoned rail line to the intersection of Beech Street and Simcoe Street, northerly on Simcoe Street to Reach Street and westerly on Reach Street to Carlan Drive, for a total length of approximately 1.3 km. The construction of the force main is necessary to replace the existing deficient force main and provide additional capacity for development in the Scugog (Port Perry) urban area. March 2019 extension - the Region has requested extension to accommodate the lead time to apply and receive regulatory approvals, procure equipment and extensive construction schedule due to the complexity of the projects Construction methodology was changed from tunneling to open cut. Project is under budget based on awarded tender. IO NOTE: There is a decrease in scope, resulting in a decrease in Federal funding of $969,997 to be reallocated to DUR-015, DUR-016 and DUR-018.
Construction Start Date:2017-07-01
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Refurbishment of the Sainte-Famille pumping station
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project to reduce wastewater overflows includes a complete overhaul of the pumping station, including increasing its capacity.
Construction Start Date:2016-10-01
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Kimberley Drinking Water Loss Management
properties.Description:
Project Description:"The project will include: - Installation of 4 pressure regulating valves and water metering systems and associated buildings; - Recalibration of two existing PRVs to new pressure zone settings; - Installation of real-time monitoring of water system; - Replacement of approximately 435 meters of 50mm galvanized water main; - Replacement of approximately 82 water service connections; and - Resurfacing works."
Construction Start Date:2017-09-25
Construction End Date:2017-12-22

properties.Name: Montrose Wastewater Treatment Plant Upgrades
properties.Description:
Project Description:"The project work will include: - Install approximately 150 lineal meters of perforated pipe and curtain drain; - Install approximately 250 lineal meters of outfall pipe; - Additional outfall structure; - Interceptor sub-drain; - Excavation and backfilling for pipe and curtain drain; and - French drain installation.
Construction Start Date:2017-05-29
Construction End Date:2017-10-06

properties.Name: Highlift Pump Rehabilitation at the Sheguiandah Water Treatment Plant
properties.Description:
Project Description:This project includes the replacement of a seized high lift pump with a new like for like pump and motor. This project includes removal of the old pump, installation, electrical and all permits required. Rehabilitation of this seized pump is critical to the operation of the Sheguiandah water treatment plant.
Construction Start Date:2016-09-12
Construction End Date:2017-03-10

properties.Name: Repair 7 hydrants in township to improve water distribution system effectiveness
properties.Description:
Project Description: *** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** "Repair hydrants to improve water distribution system effectiveness. Works include changing defective and out of service seals and valves which cause problem in the distribution system. To repair all of them, we will turn off the water to a few street blocks, dig to replace valves and repair and replace valve stems and casings, lift apart the ones that are dripping to investigate and replace defective seat/seal. After completion of the work the operating authority (OCWA) will be able to conduct a thorough distribution system flush to help distributing a good water quality to all residence. The fire hydrants serve many purposes in the distribution system other than firefighting. They allow to do maintenance work such as conducting high flow flushing to help keep the distribution pipes clean, they are needed to flush out stagnant water at the dead ends in the distribution system. We need to have all fire hydrants and distribution valves working to conduct a swabbing program, swabs are inserted into the distribution system through hydrants and directed to a another hydrant by valving. This is why hydrants and valves are a very important and integral part of the distribution system. After digging, an inspection revealed that repairs to some of the hydrants were less than anticipated therefore reducing the cost of the project. We have one hydrant left to dig with hydro vac truck that will be done in conjunction with other work as it is to expensive to bring truck in for just one hydrant on its own. Due to delays in developing the agreement , an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline is required. IO NOTE: Due to the decrease in scope, there is a decrease in Federal Funding of $11,000 to be reallocated to OPA-001, OPA-002, OPA-004 and OPA-005."
Construction Start Date:2017-10-11
Construction End Date:2018-09-30

properties.Name: Construction of the Cody-J.Mance-Levis-Cyr-Kendall-Savard Integrated Road-Water-Sewer Renewal Project
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** "Good construction prices allowed this work to be completed under budget. Seeking ability to move the excess funds to another approved project with an increased scope of delivery. All the aging sanitary sewers within the limits of the project will be replaced except for 2 locations that were recently rehabilitated. A 75m section on Cyr as well as the sanitary sewer in Jeanne Mance between Cyr Ave and Olmstead St will not be replaced. The existing storm sewers are in good condition and will only be replaced if required to accommodate sanitary and water main construction. The water mains throughout the project limits require replacement due to age, condition and the presence of lead services. Full road reconstruction, including curbs and sidewalk rehabilitation, will be included with this project where required and/or where necessary to accommodate the construction of the sewers and water mains. IO NOTE: There is no decrease in scope, only a decrease in tender. This will result in a decrease in Federal Funding of $1,215,000 to be reallocated to OTT-015 and OTT-031."
Construction Start Date:2017-06-16
Construction End Date:2018-07-15

properties.Name: Queen Street Water and Sanitary Infrustructure Restoration
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project will replace the failing municipal water and sanitary sewer infrastructure along a section of Queen Street, including: replacing approximately 125 m of existing pre 1945, 4 cast iron watermain; replacing 125 m of existing pre 1945 concrete sanitary sewermain; replacing 2 sanitary manholes installed pre 1945; and replacing 2 fire hydrants. The project will replace existing water and sewer services to 11 residential lots and 3 new vacant lots. The project will reconstruct the road and replace road surface with new asphalt including asphalt gutters to control storm water as there is no existing storm water management infrastructure on this section of Queen Street. The infrastructure is original core infrastructure installed pre 1945 and current issues include; poor water quality from aged cast iron, water pressure due to undersized watermain, inadequate fire flows due to undersized 4 watermain which restricts flows to the 6 watermain (this section is a bottleneck in the distribution system, watermain break in 2013 and a water service break in 2016.
Construction Start Date:2017-07-01
Construction End Date:2017-12-19

properties.Name: Rehabilitation of the Backwash Filter Room at the Dunnville Water Treatment Plant
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project involves extensive structural work and renovations to the backwash filter room which still consists of the original structure built in 1927. The work consists of replacement of all the key structural elements and upgrading the wiring to current standards. The water treatment plant services the 5,800 residents of Dunnville.
Construction Start Date:2017-10-01
Construction End Date:2019-03-01

properties.Name: Ellor St replacement of 250 mm sanitary sewer, upgrade of watermain to 150 mm and new 900 mm Storm Sewer for separation
properties.Description:
Project Description:Installation of 600 m of storm sewer for sewer separation to address surface flooding/sewer back-up, watermain replacement for fire flow, sanitary sewer replacement for asset life
Construction Start Date:2017-07-04
Construction End Date:2018-05-31

properties.Name: Construction of 525 mm Sanitary Separation Sewer on Brodie Street - Neebing River to Dease Street
properties.Description:
Project Description:Storm sewer separation of a combined sewer by construction of 400m of new 525 mm Polyvinyl Chloride (PVC) sanitary sewer and connections and conversion of existing sewer to storm sewer. Directly services 66 households. Coordinated with watermain replacement.
Construction Start Date:2017-06-01
Construction End Date:2017-10-01

properties.Name: Renewal of water pipes
properties.Description:
Project Description:Pipe renewal works aimed at maintaining water services for citizens for 2 stretches of road and totaling 0.283 km. The work is located between civic numbers 9 and 32 on Morneau Street.
Construction Start Date:2018-06-18
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Replacement of the Delaware Water Tower (Standpipe) located at 11237 Longwoods Road.
properties.Description:
Project Description:This project is classified as a Drinking Water category project and falls under the CWWF eligible Treatment and Storage sub-category. The upgrade to the existing water storage standpipe will involve the removal and replacement of the existing tank due to its advanced corrosion which was noted during a condition assessment by Watech Service Inc. (dated June 2014 and attached to this application) as likely to impact the integrity in the near term. The outcome and benefits of this project included provisions for increased capacity to address current storage deficiencies (approx. 475m3 deficiency), extending the lifespan of the existing Delaware Standpipe by rebuilding this asset, improving the system efficiency and service reliability (particularly during high demand events), improving management of the drinking water system by addressing the severe corrosion lifecycle related issues identified, and improving the overall risk management. This project will impact 527 households. Due to delays in developing the Transfer Payment Agreement and subsequent delays in procurement and its impact on construction schedule, as well as complexity of the project, we are requesting an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline to ensure successful completion of the project.
Construction Start Date:2017-06-01
Construction End Date:2018-10-31

properties.Name: Prestressed Concrete Cylinder Pipe Condition Assessment Inspection Program
properties.Description:
Project Description:Prestressed Concrete Cylinder Pipe Condition Assessment Inspection of 3 kilometers of 1050mm diameter pipe using Remote Field Transform Coupling (RFTC) inspection affecting approximately 100,000 customers. The RFTC inspection will provide information on the condition of Prestressed Concrete Cylinder Pipe (PCCP). RFTC inspections detect breaks in the pre-stressed wires. These wires give the pipe its strength. These inspections serve to manage the future needs of these pipelines and to prevent the occurrence of major pipe ruptures.
Construction Start Date:2017-02-01
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Stormwater Management Pond # PD65-02 Sediment Management
properties.Description:
Project Description:Majority of the Towns storm water ponds had been constructed with permanent storage volume (wet ponds). The purpose of the permanent storage volume in a pond is to allow suspended solids (sediment) from the runoff to settle down in the pond bottom and release the treated water to the creek. Over the time, pond will accumulate sediment which will reduce the permanent storage, impacting the sediment removal efficiency of the pond drastically, resulting untreated water released to the Creek. Realising a need for a pond clean out, Town of Whitby conducted a ponds need study in 2011 to evacuate the pond permanent storage capacity and learned majority of the ponds require cleanout as bathymetric survey revealed fair amount of sediment accumulated in the ponds. Under this project accumulated sediment in the pond will be removed allowing required permanent storage in the pond, resulting pond will perform to its design efficiency which will improve the quality of the runoff released to the creeks. This project will remove and dispose of 530 m3 of sediment from the pond. The project includes cleaning of outlets and restoration of the disturbed area. The removal works are capitalized as they extend the life of the asset. Due to delays in developing the Transfer Payment Agreement and subsequent delays in procurement and its impact on construction schedule, we are requesting an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline to ensure successful completion of the project.
Construction Start Date:2017-09-01
Construction End Date:2018-10-31

properties.Name: Conducting of Hydraulic Engineering Drainage Study in the Intercity Area
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** "Hydraulic engineering study of a low lying drainage area and improvements to channel capacity and culvert system through a rail yard area. Project area is approximate 531 hectares in size and comprises a total of 1,415 parcels including 1,087 residential households. The study will provide the City with recommendations for future capital projects to improve the drainage and flood resilience of this area. Study Proposal came in under estimate - No Scope Change - Original estimate based on a budget estimate from another consultant, the winning proposal was substantially lower than this figure, and lower than the other proposals submitted. IO NOTE: There is no decrease in scope, only a decrease in tender. This will result in a decrease in Federal Funding of $98,640.50 to be reallocated."
Construction Start Date:2017-06-01
Construction End Date:2020-03-31

properties.Name: Gladwin Siphon Inlet, Odour Control and Outlet Chamber Project
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project works will include: - Design and construction of inlet chamber, odour control building, and outlet chamber; and, - Civil, mechanical and electrical works and supplies.
Construction Start Date:2018-07-16
Construction End Date:2020-02-28

properties.Name: Sanitary Infrastructure Protection and West Don River Bank Stabilization Project at Langstaff Park: Geomorphic Study
properties.Description:
Project Description:Bank scouring and undercutting are threatening a sanitary manhole and 35 linear meters of sanitary main on the left bank of the West Don River. A preliminary geomorphic study is required to assess the extent of the problem and develop concept design alternatives for sanitary protection works. This study will provide a better understanding of our local water resources and enable innovative designs to reduce sediment inputs into local waterways, improve habitat and provide infrastructure protection. This project is located near Langstaff Road and Basaltic Road in the City of Vaughan.
Construction Start Date:2017-05-01
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Upgrading to standards the drinking water treatment plant
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project aims at the setting to the standards of the treatment plant as well as an increase of the capacity, by the replacement of the processing technology.
Construction Start Date:2017-09-11
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Replacement of Existing Pumps at Wastewater Collection Pump Station #2 with Chopper Pumps
properties.Description:
Project Description:As identified in the Municipality's Water & Wastewater Master Servicing Plan, the replacement of the existing 2 pumps inside the pump station is required as both pumps have reached the end of their useful lifespan. Pumping Station #2, located on the Wastewater Treatment property, was originally constructed during the mid 1980's. The station has operated well and the dual pumps are becoming worn due to incoming abrasive debris. These existing pumps are to be replaced with chopper pumps in order to reduce the fouling of the pump and to optimize the pumping capacity. The Wastewater User Pay Capital Budget can only include funding for the replacement of 1 pump in 2017 as there are other projects committed to in 2017. The use of the CWWF will ensure that both pumps are replaced at the same time and will achieve engineering and replacement economies of scale by replacing both pumps at the same time.
Construction Start Date:2017-06-05
Construction End Date:2017-09-25

properties.Name: Kingsville Wastewater Treatment Lagoon Main Pumping Station Pump Replacement
properties.Description:
Project Description:Retrofit pumps with new high efficient pumps with Variable Frequency Drives included. This will result in more reliable and efficient supply in the system, fewer breakdowns, and reduced energy and carbon footprint.
Construction Start Date:2017-05-01
Construction End Date:2018-12-31

properties.Name: New Water Supply Pumphouse and Reservoir Rehabilitation
properties.Description:
Project Description:Objective: Increase capacity and reliability of raw water supply system. Scope: Plan, design and construct a new raw water pumphouse including power supply, building, pumps, electrical, mechanical and connection to the existing raw pipeline, and appx 20,000 m3 enlargement of existing raw water reservoir, and all associated works. Output: New raw water supply pumphouse and rehabilitated raw water reservoir.
Construction Start Date:2017-11-14
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Construction of Phase 1 of Lavergne - Joliet - Ste Cecile Integrated Road-Water-Sewer Renewal Project
properties.Description:
Project Description:The sanitary sewers within the defined project limits were largely built in the 1930s and 1940s. They range in size from 200 mm to 900 mm. There are approximately 50 sewer segments with a total length of approximately 2100 metres. The sewers are generally in poor to very poor condition. The watermains were built in the 1930s and 1940s ranging in size from 52 mm to 203mm. The total length is approximately 2200 metres. The sanitary sewers in Lavergne St, Garneau St, Ferland St, Frechette St, Jolliet Ave, Ste. Cecile St, Montfort St, Hector-Hotte Way, Ste Monique St and Perrier Ave require replacement due to condition, maintenance issues and historical basement flooding. The watermains require replacement due to age and the presence of lead services. The majority of storm sewers are in good condition, however, the storm sewers in Ste. Cecile St from Beechwood Ave to Ste. Monique St, Garneau St from Lavergne St to Jolliet Ave, Ferland St from Lavergne St to Jolliet Ave, and Perrier Ave will need to be replaced. Full road reconstruction including curbs and sidewalks will be included as required and trench reinstatement with resurfacing will be implemented where feasible. We request an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 because achieving the size and complexity of this project will expose the City to cost premiums from the contractor to expedite construction for the March 31, 2018 deadline; moreover, if any inclement weather or unforeseen conditions arise, the March 2018 completion will not be met. Phase 2 is not part of this project scope.
Construction Start Date:2017-04-25
Construction End Date:2018-08-24

properties.Name: Keady Stormwater Management Study
properties.Description:
Project Description:Completing the design to address stormwater quantity and quality issues in the hamlet of Keady at the intersection of Grey Road 16 and Grey Road 3. The lack of a proper outlet inhibits stormwater drainage which damages the existing infrastructure. Stormwater quality due to the presence of the Keady Livestock Market should be addressed.
Construction Start Date:2017-08-09
Construction End Date:2018-01-31

properties.Name: Water purification - Quartier Cléricy
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project aims at the establishment of a network for the collection, interception and a wastewater treatment system for the sector Cléricy of the City of Rouyn-Noranda to serve 60 permanent residences.
Construction Start Date:2017-08-07
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Killaloe Wastewater Pollution Control Plant Roof Repair
properties.Description:
Project Description:Contractor will remove existing shingles and re-install new roof covering to prevent damage to the existing building.
Construction Start Date:2017-11-11
Construction End Date:2017-11-22

properties.Name: Keene water treatment plant (WTP) Energy Efficiency Upgrades to Heating, Insulation & Lighting Systems
properties.Description:
Project Description:Switch to high efficiency electrical or natural gas heaters. Interlock heaters with fresh air vents to disable when generator is running to reduce heat loss. Install rooftop, wall and pipe insulation to reduce heat loss. Replace existing lighting with high efficiency lighting (LED). Install motion and occupancy sensors in appropriate areas.
Construction Start Date:2017-10-12
Construction End Date:2017-11-29

properties.Name: Replacement of Roofing Structure - Water Treatment Plant
properties.Description:
Project Description:This project will rebuild and replace the entire roofing structure on the drinking water treatment facility plant because of deterioration, leaking and risk of failure.
Construction Start Date:2017-09-15
Construction End Date:2018-05-31

properties.Name: Preliminary Design, Engineering and Construction of Storm Sewer on the Wilmot Employment Lands site, located on the North Side of the Highway 7/8 corridor between Kitchener and Stratford.
properties.Description:
Project Description:"The project will include the preliminary design, engineering and construction of storm water infrastructure to service the Wilmot Employment Lands site, located along the Highway 7/8 corridor. Project will include the installation of approximately 1,850m of storm water pipe through the Employment Lands development area. Works will be completed in coordination with the current property owners to have the land serviced and ready for future commercial/industrial Due to regulatory requirements and/or permit delays, we are requesting an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline to ensure successful completion of the project."
Construction Start Date:2017-07-01
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Water Freezing Mitigation Project: Installation of three Bleeder Stations
properties.Description:
Project Description:In 2011, a new water distribution system was installed; however, during cold weather, the Township experienced water main freezing in localized areas. With project funds, the Township would be able to install bleeder stations to allow a small amount of water to run through the lines to mitigate line freezing in the winter months. The water distribution system services 48 users/households, and the bleeder stations would be used to help mitigate the water main from freezing.
Construction Start Date:2017-10-23
Construction End Date:2018-06-30

properties.Name: Parkdale Water and Sewer System Renewals
properties.Description:
Project Description:Rehabilitation of approximately 2km of water distribution and 2 km of sewer collection system in the Parkdale area.
Construction Start Date:2017-10-21
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Village of Lytton Source Water Protection Planning
properties.Description:
Project Description:The Village of Lytton (Village) is exploring alternative options to increase water availability through the completion of an existing well project, while also ensuring that measures are in place to protect the current water sources to provide the best quality of potable water available to the community for consumption.
Construction Start Date:2017-09-20
Construction End Date:

properties.Name: West Lift station upgrade
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project includes: 1. Replace pumps, 2. Replace hardware, 3. Backup Generator.
Construction Start Date:2017-03-01
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Clinton Water Supply Main Replacement
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project works will include: - Clearing and grubbing; - Approximately 1,020m of 300mm PVC water main; - Bored/auger crossing (about 80m) through CN right-of-way; - Removals of existing Pressure Reducing Valve (PRV) vault and AC pipe; - Reinstate water service to properties in/around existing PRV; - Installation of mechanical water system appurtenances; - Construction of PRV station building, necessary appurtenances and electrical systems; - Communication cable for water system controls; - Water system tie-ins; and, - Rehabilitation of roadworks impacted by construction activities.
Construction Start Date:2017-09-18
Construction End Date:2018-11-30

properties.Name: ISMP Update and Implementation
properties.Description:
Project Description:In 2010, the Town of Gibsons (Town) completed a preliminary Integrated Stormwater Management Plan (ISMP) that positioned the Town to simultaneously manage land use and environmental commitments. The ISMP needs an update and key projects must be fast-tracked to meet local goals for asset management, stormwater quality, sustainable development and effective sustainable regulations. The ISMP update will include engagement with residents regarding assets, levels-of-service and affordability.
Construction Start Date:2018-03-01
Construction End Date:2018-03-01

properties.Name: Replace of Centre Street Storm Water Management System.
properties.Description:
Project Description:This project will upgrade stormwater capacity. The Town of Huntsville will be removing and replacing the Storm Sewer System on Centre Street with larger storm sewers to more efficiently manage storm water. The length of the project is two city blocks, impacting approximately 3000 residents and 40 businesses. The increase in pipe size will increase the flow capacity of the system by approximately 15%.
Construction Start Date:2017-05-25
Construction End Date:2018-06-30

properties.Name: Design and Contract Documents for the Completion of the Waterline. Initial Design Report and Contract Documents for the Completion of the Waterline
properties.Description:
Project Description:***Modified project*** See notes for original project information. "Complete the design and contract documents for the extension of the waterline in the community. Completion of this project will allow the construction of the waterline to proceed in order to ensure safe/ efficient supply of water to the community, thus reducing potential impact on the Province's health system. Additional work required to justify the re-allocation amount for Design Portion would include: obtaining survey information, field work for all road sections listed, (Tuscarora Road #251, Second Line Road #136, Cayuga Road #272, former Green Willow Property, Industrial Park) additional engineering for creek crossing & intersection connections. IO NOTE: This will result in an increase in Federal Funding of $80,106.00 to be reallocated from MNC-002. The Total Project Cost has been amended to reflect the actual cost of the consultant/design work to be completed to plan for the waterline. Extension Request Rationale: MNCFN is working with a team of participants to ensure this project is progressed to completion which has been very difficult to date. Having said that, a project extension is requested as more time is required to finalize the project due to delays and coordination within the original timelines in addition to the delayed approval timelines."
Construction Start Date:2018-04-30
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Conduct a survey and inspection of the Sewage Collection System to develop a work plan/tender package for required upgrades/repairs.
properties.Description:
Project Description:The sewer system is 29 years old and constructed of polyvinyl chloride piping, with a low lift station and two lagoons. The system currently services 162 residential units, 16 commercial establishments and 12 institutional properties, for a total of 282 user units (flat billing) in 2016. Currently servicing approximately 350 residents and businesses. With such a small limited number of users on the wastewater system, it is difficult to keep annual maintenance costs from increasing when faced with huge capital expenditures that the users are also responsible for. The current impact is intrusion of stormwater and snowmelt into compromised manholes and sewer mains. As a direct result, the municipal lagoons have experienced overflow events resulting in premature releases of untreated or partially treated effluents. This has also resulted in increased pump hours occurring at the sewer lift station also as a result of this intrusion. The funding obtained from the CWWF for this project will assist the Municipality in performing these major expenses to ensure the overall integrity of the sewer system is maintained. This project will commence with a Camera survey of the collection system and inspection of the manholes to identify any leaks or breaks. From the findings of the camera inspection, a work plan will be developed, with tendering for the repairs, etc.
Construction Start Date:2017-12-01
Construction End Date:2018-10-31

properties.Name: Water Treatment Plant Condition Analysis/Report to determine New Build/Rehabilitation Options
properties.Description:
Project Description:The Upgrade Analysis of the existing Water Treatment will assist the City of Dryden in determining if the current plant can be upgraded/refurbished under its current condition/configuration or if a new water plant is required. The plant is currently 40 years old and passed its life expectancy. All aspects of the Water Treatment Plant will be analyzed to determine the condition of all piping, concrete tanks, pumps, filters, mechanical systems, and electrical panels/wiring. The report will include current site and condition status, analysis of current repairs required with timeframe and dollar value, In addition it will determine if the plant can be upgraded or a new plant is a more feasible option. The Water Treatment Plant provide safe Drinking Water to over 3500 households.
Construction Start Date:2017-11-22
Construction End Date:2017-12-29

properties.Name: Asset Inventory and Condition Assessment Upgrading
properties.Description:
Project Description:The majority of the linear infrastructure (potable water, sanitary sewer and storm water) is not properly identified for the Village of Salmo (Village). The Village would like to integrate the asset inventory/condition reporting in GIS in partnership with the Regional District of Central Kootenay (RDCK). The RDCK has the GIS expertise and capabilities to maintain the system, providing a platform for the Village to incrementally build their asset register and have ready field access for public works and utilities.
Construction Start Date:2017-03-01
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Nobleton-Phase 2 Sanitary Sewer (Contract 1)
properties.Description:
Project Description:Construction of sanitary sewer collection system and concurrent works (Roads and Watermain) serving 63 single family dwellings in the west end of the Village core area.
Construction Start Date:2017-01-01
Construction End Date:2019-09-30

properties.Name: Wastewater Pump Station Upgrade
properties.Description:
Project Description:Objective: Reduce risk of raw sewage bypasses at lift station. Scope: Plan, design and construct upgraded lift station with new valving and cover assembly and upgraded control system, discharge piping, and all associated works. Output: Upgraded sewage lift station.
Construction Start Date:2017-12-05
Construction End Date:2017-12-08

properties.Name: Water Treatment Plant Energy Efficient Lighting Upgrades
properties.Description:
Project Description:Install energy efficient LED lighting to increase energy savings and lower maintenance costs. Improved interior lighting will provide a safer working environment for the occupants and will mitigate accidents, reducing additional burden on the Provincial health system (e.g. air ambulance to city hospital). Lower energy consumption will reduce usage of "off-grid" diesel powered electric generators and reduce emissions into the environment.
Construction Start Date:2017-06-01
Construction End Date:2017-11-01

properties.Name: Water Mains Rehabilitation
properties.Description:
Project Description:This project will complete the swabbing of the water distribution system as this is required for effective functioning of the drinking water system. Completion of this project will reduce the health burden on the provincial health care system.
Construction Start Date:2017-04-01
Construction End Date:2018-03-30

properties.Name: Improvements to the stormwater system
properties.Description:
Project Description:Retain a third-party contractor to complete planning / design and construction of stormwater system to address localized flooding issues. Flooding in this area has been an on-going issue as there is no drainage or ditches to direct stormwater, causing frequent flooding of streets and risk of property damage to nearby residences. Construction work will include installation of ditches and culverts and adjusting the grade of roads and driveways. Off-reserve benefits are improved watershed management and minimized erosion impacts on waterbodies.
Construction Start Date:2017-03-01
Construction End Date:2018-03-01

properties.Name: Water Membrane Replacement
properties.Description:
Project Description:Replace two Zeeweed 500D water membrane cartridge trains for the water treatment plant. Completion of this project will ensure that safe reliable drinking water is available and reduce the potential for additional pressure on the province's health care system.
Construction Start Date:2018-07-01
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Rehabilitation to the Water Treatment Plant
properties.Description:
Project Description:The main rehabilitation works will include restoration of the plant's communications, adding monitoring controls, in-line turbidity and chlorine residual analyzer. These works will reduce the risk of water contamination and the potential burden on the Provincial health system.
Construction Start Date:2017-01-09
Construction End Date:2017-03-31

properties.Name: Water Treatment Plant Repairs in the Community of Dog Paw
properties.Description:
Project Description:"The project will undertake repairs and maintenance to their existing water treatment plant at NWA#33, the Community of Dog Paw (Sioux Narrows) which is now approximately 10 years old . The repair work will ensure the asset performs adequately and mitagate and potential break downs or hazards which could result in to strain on the provincial health system should an emergency situation arise. Repairs to the plant include the replacement of 4 macrolite filters with new, replacement of 4 Ultrafiltration filters , repairs to 1 of 3 distribution water pumps, replacement of 2 existing water intake pumps, replacement of 2 Ultraviolet lights, repairs to the Programmable Logic Controllers (PLC) and Supervisory Control And Data Acquisition (SCADA) system. Due to delays in provincial project nomination, an extension to March 31, 2019 is required."
Construction Start Date:2017-06-05
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Feasibility study and assessment of water distribution and sewage collection system to address the water losses and high inflow/infiltration issues at the Ginoogaming First Nation.
properties.Description:
Project Description:The purpose of the study is to address sewage by-passes and reduce contamination of receiving environments (i.e. rivers, lakes) as well as reduce the wastewater treatment loadings to the Greenstone wastewater treatment plant. At this time, the First Nation is returning excessive flows (surface, ground water, infiltration of water) that they receive to the wastewater treatment plant well above that which is originally distributed through the drinking water system. The study will be conducted in two phases. Phase 1 includes an assessment study to conduct water audit of water distribution and sewage collection system to address the water losses and high inflow/infiltration issues at the First Nation. Phase 2 includes a plan for optimizing and address the water losses and high inflow/infiltration issues. Successful completion of this project will ensure that untreated wastewater does not enter the environment and negatively impact surrounding communities.
Construction Start Date:2017-09-01
Construction End Date:2018-07-31

properties.Name: Wastewater Management Options Feasibility Study for Walpole Island First Nation
properties.Description:
Project Description:Project will commission a study to identify and assess feasibility of wastewater collection and treatment options for Walpole Island First Nation businesses (60+) and residences (670). This project will assess options for wastewater infrastructure that will lessen the environmental impact both on and off-reserve on local groundwater and the Lake Erie Watershed caused by a high number of leaking septic systems and outdated and over capacity aeration units.
Construction Start Date:2017-02-01
Construction End Date:2017-10-31

properties.Name: Shickendaz 2 SWM Pond Rehabilitation and Sediment Cleanout including Removal of approximately 60m3 of sediment and installation of an Oil Grit Separator unit.
properties.Description:
Project Description:"NEW PROJECT: The Shickandanz 2 Storm Water Management Pond is a rehabilitation, retrofit and sediment cleanout project including removal of approximately 60 m3 of sediment and installation of an Oil Grit Separator unit. The project was identified in the Stormwater Management Facility Maintenance Guidance (SWMFMG) report as a priority for retrofit. The Storm Water Management pond is located in Bowmanville, Ontario draining to Soper Creek; a watercourse that ultimately drains to the Bowmanville Marsh which is a significant coastal wetland. The estimated cost for cleanout of the project is $130,000 which exceeds the annual funding amount ($90,000) and would not proceed in 2017/2018 without special funding from the Clean Water and Wastewater Fund (CWWF). The removal works are capitalized as they extend the life of the asset. Due to delays in developing the agreement and consequent local priority changes, an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline is required. IO NOTE: This is a new project to be submitted. This results in an increase in Federal Funding of $55,000 to be reallocated from CLA-002."
Construction Start Date:2018-01-01
Construction End Date:2018-09-15

properties.Name: County of Vermilion River - Stage 5 Regional Waterline Kitscoty to Marwayne
properties.Description:
Project Description:Stage 5 construction includes approximately 4.8 km of 400 mm, approximately 6.5 km of 350 mm, and approximately 29 km of 250 mm regional water waterline from Kitscoty to Marwayne.

Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Parry Drive Watermain Looping
properties.Description:
Project Description:The Batawa Development Corporation (BDC) is proceeding with a residential subdivision at the north end of Fraser Drive in Batawa. As part of their development requirements, they are required to extend a water main from the bulk water station to Fraser Drive, along Parry Drive. The extension of this water main gives the City a unique opportunity to partner with the BDC and the developer and loop this water main to Sidney Crescent. The installation of 270 m of 200 mm Polyvinyl Chloride (PVC) watermain would provide additional flows for firefighting, improve water quality, address future growth pressures, and provide a backup supply in the event of a break.
Construction Start Date:2018-01-01
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Preston Wastewater Treatment Plant Upgrades
properties.Description:
Project Description:Upgrade the plant existing headworks, blowers and electrical system
Construction Start Date:2016-06-01
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Description:
Project Description:Assess the condition of the underground water and sewer piping systems and prioritize the upgrades.

properties.Name: Piped W&S Assessment
properties.Description:
Project Description:Assess the condition of the underground water and sewer piping systems and prioritize the upgrades.
Construction Start Date:2017-10-13
Construction End Date:2018-12-31

properties.Description:
Project Description:Assess current NWT piped systems, document lessons learned, best practises, and propose research projects to reduce the costs of piped systems in the NWT.
Construction Start Date:2018-11-01
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Replacement and Upgrade of Debris Removal System in the Inlet Works at the Water Pollution Control Plant
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project will evaluate alternative equipment (e.g. Muffin Monster Grinder) and install the preferred alternative solution. The Water Pollution Control Plant (WPCP) services approximately 29,000 residents in the Town of Orangeville. The Inlet Works building provides the first stages of wastewater treatment. A compactor was installed in the Inlet Works building in 2011 as part of a major capital improvement project at the WPCP. Components of the compactor have failed almost constantly since it was brought online in 2011. The first failure occurred in 2012, and over $40,000 has been spent on repairs in the past 2.5 years (outside of the warranty period). Almost the entire unit has been already replaced even though the useful life was estimated to be 25 years at time of installation. The operators continue to have problems with this equipment despite the on-going repairs and maintenance. Not having a properly working debris removal system at the headworks leads to numerous operational issues.
Construction Start Date:2017-06-01
Construction End Date:2018-06-30

properties.Name: Raw Water Supply and Water Treatment Plant Upgrades and Reservoir Expansion
properties.Description:
Project Description:The water supply and treatment project will mitigate capacity issues in the existing system. Construct raw water supply and water treatment plant upgrades including building, mechanical, electrical, control upgrades, expansion of the potable water storage reservoir, and all associated works. One raw water supply system and one drinking water treatment system will be upgraded.
Construction Start Date:2018-06-01
Construction End Date:2020-03-31

properties.Name: Hotchkiss Creek Expansion- Essa, Anne to Gowan
properties.Description:
Project Description:***Modified project*** See notes for original project information. "Replacement of a large diameter storm sewer to accommodate the 100 year storm and therefore mitigate flooding. Currently flooding could reach depths of 0.16 m above the crown of this arterial road. This will reduce both health and safety and environmental concerns. The project scope has increased to include full replacement of the sanitary sewer, within the same excavation as the trunk storm sewer wich has been identified as being in deteriorated condition and therefore a priority for replacement. The sanmitary sewer and truck storm sewer are in the same excavation alignment and therefore the scope chnage makes use of the existing excavation work. Due to availability of additional funds, and subsequent delay in project submission and its impact on construction schedule, we are requesting an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline to ensure successful completion of the project. "
Construction Start Date:2016-04-01
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Village of Rockyford - Wheatland Regional - Phase 2 - WTP Upgrade/Waterline to Rockyford
properties.Description:
Project Description:Construction of a new raw water reservoir, raw water pipeline, and approximately 27 km of 150 mm regional water supply line to service the hamlet of Gliechen.
Construction Start Date:2016-05-25
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Upgrade/Replace the Sewage Treatment Plant Aeration Equipment
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** "Replace Aging/Failing - Waste Water Aeration Blowers and blower manifolds. The objective of this project is to ensure the Wastewater Treatment Plant continues to operate and treat wastewater effectively. The aeration blowers are an integral component of the wastewater treatment system. The plant operates with two blowers (only one operates at a time). The blowers are aging and one blower has recently failed so that now we have no back up. The objective is to take this opportunity replace the blowers, motors and aeration manifolds with new/reliable/more efficient equipment that will ensure the plant's continued operation for years to come. The scope of this project will include purchasing new, efficient blowers, motors, and aeration manifolds; pumping the aeration tank down and installing the new equipment. The expected output is a to have more reliable and efficient equipment installed to equip the wastewater plant to run effectively for years to come while saving on operating costs. Scope change: Originally had planned to replace the failing blowers with a high efficiency ""Turbo Blowers"", but after submitting proposal for funding we discovered that for the size of our treatment plant that the ""Turbo Blowers"" would not provide any energy savings since they would not be operating at capacity. We therefore elected to replace the blowers with ""standard blowers"" with energy efficient motors, at a substantial cost savings. IO NOTE: Due to the decrease in scope, there is a decrease in Federal Funding of $12,379.18 to be reallocated to MBA-001."
Construction Start Date:2017-07-01
Construction End Date:2017-12-31

properties.Name: Rehabilitation of  Biosolids Aerobic Digester
properties.Description:
Project Description:"Replace existing damaged earthen aerobic digester with a new, high efficiency aerobic digester to enhance sludge treatment, reduce operational costs, and meet future growth needs for the Municipality of North Perth. Due to the size and complexity of the project, we are requesting an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline to ensure successful completion of the project."
Construction Start Date:2017-11-30
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Sanitary Sewer Replacement on North Murray Street
properties.Description:
Project Description:The Citys Asset Management Plan has identified a critical need to replace the sanitary sewer infrastructure along North Murray Street due to its age and ongoing maintenance issues. During capital budget deliberations for 2016, the project was discussed and deferred until future years due to its estimated cost. The improvements will benefit the entire wastewater system with reduced infiltration and increased reliability.
Construction Start Date:2017-02-01
Construction End Date:2017-11-08

properties.Name: Conduct Facility Improvement Studies at 4 Wastewater Treatment Facilities across the city.
properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** "This Wastewater Treatment Plant improvement study will evaluate: Increased Phosphorus Removal; Capacity Optimization; Flood Proofing Measures. This study will evaluate potential technologies that can improve phosphorus removal while potentially adding plant treatment capacity. This project will also evaluate the vulnerability of the Adelaide and Greenway plants to flooding and evaluate the flood proofing measures required. Future projects will be identified. Preliminary recommendation of the study was to explore an emerging technology to reduce phosphorus in plant effluents. The increase in scope included pilot testing of CoMag and BioMag technology in order to validate the findings and preliminary recommendation of the wastewater treatment plant study. IO NOTE: There is an increase in scope, this will result in an increase in Federal Funding of $19,500.00 to be reallocated from LON-005."
Construction Start Date:2017-01-03
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Sewer Force Main Upgrades
properties.Description:
Project Description:Construct forcemain for lift station 3, reline sanitary main, upgraded water mains, approximately fourteen rehabilitated sewer manholes, planning studies for expansion and relocation of lagoon (focused on needs to meet federal wastewater requirements), and all associated works.
Construction Start Date:2017-07-04
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: High Lift Pump upgrades recirculation piping in the Dorchester Water Treatment Plant.

properties.Name: Rodney Sewage System Rehabilitation
properties.Description:
Project Description:This project is to address the aging infrastructure of the 40 year old Rodney sewage system with a useful life of 50 years. The dilapidated standby generator requires replacement, along with its fuel supply. The fuel supplier will no longer fill the fuel containment system and the operators have to add the fuel by hand. The Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA) system has to be upgraded to ensure the sewage system alarms are generated to operators when there are problems. The lagoon decant system needs to be replaced as it is failing.
Construction Start Date:2017-09-22

Construction End Date:2018-06-30

properties.Description:
Project Description:Replacement of 110m of storm sewer that runs between 542 Maple Street and 26 Mackay Court. The existing sewer is plugged with roots and is beyond its service life and requires replacement. This will alleviate flooding that has been occurring on Maple Street.

Construction End Date:2017-12-01

Construction End Date:2018-03-31
