Construction Start Date:2017-06-01
Construction End Date:2018-10-01

properties.Name: New water main on Taylor Kidd Boulevard from Bayridge Avenue to Blackburn Mews and northeasterly through utility easement to Gardiners Road
properties.Description:
Project Description:"This work entails the installation of a new transmission water main that extends approximately 1980m from an existing 600mm stub at the Bayridge Driver/Taylor Kidd Boulevard intersection to a utility corridor near Blackburn Mews, and then north easterly to an existing 600mm water main approximately at Gardiners Road near 845 Gardiners Road. This is to support growth in the west part of Kingston. Due to delays in developing the Transfer Payment Agreement and subsequent delays in procurement and its impact on construction schedule, we are requesting an extension beyond the March 31, 2018 deadline to ensure successful completion of the project."
Construction Start Date:2017-05-01
Construction End Date:2018-12-31

properties.Name: Elgin Street North Sewage Pumping Station Renovations
properties.Description:
Project Description:The objective of this project is primarily to complete upgrades at the Elgin Street North Sewage Pumping Station. This is to include upgrades to the existing incoming master control center (MCC) panels as well as replacement of the existing 20kW diesel generator and electric heater that have reached the end of their useful lives. The scope of work is to engage a consulting engineer to complete the detailed design and associated tendering and construction administration tasks culminating in the selection of a contractor and the replacement of the existing MCC panels with Variable Frequency Drives and associated controls. The MCC is to include Programmable Logic Controller (PLC) and Ethernet connections and be connected to the Towns existing Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA) system through an antenna or cell phone connection as appropriate. The work is also to include the replacement of the Miltronics level control unit and the addition of an electromagnetic flow meter in both pumping stations. The existing electric heating is to be replaced with a new system such as natural gas. The existing transfer switches are expected to be reused along with the existing dialers however a condition evaluation is to be completed.
Construction Start Date:2017-02-06
Construction End Date:2018-05-31

properties.Name: Sanitary Sewer Collection System Rehabilitation Project
properties.Description:
Project Description:This project involves the renewal and rehabilitation of approximately 30,000 linear meters of sanitary sewer pipe, 500 manholes and the rehabilitation of approximately 500 sanitary sewer service connections. The work generally consists of: 1. Camera inspections of the sewer pipes to identify: pipe condition; pipe defects; and sources of inflow and infiltration using trenchless technology. 2. Flushing and cleaning debris from the sanitary sewer pipes and service connections to facilitate leak testing and repair using trenchless technology. 3. Pressure testing, smoke testing and sealing of: mainline joints, cracked or otherwise leaking pipes, tee connections, clean outs, risers and sanitary service connections using innovative trenchless technology. 4. Structural repairs of sanitary sewer pipes where required using innovative trenchless technology. 5. Sealing leaks in manholes using rain shields, chemical sealants and latest technology. 6. Repairs and improvements to the Cedarwood (Gauthier) Sanitary Sewer Pumping Station.
Construction Start Date:2017-08-01
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Renewal of water pipes

Project Description:Pipe renewal works to maintain water services to citizens for 10 stretches of road, totaling 0.666 km.

Each pump have a capacity of 19.5 L/s c/w stainless steel propeller and shaft. Replace 3 existing high lift motor by 3 ( 25 hp ) energy efficient units. Upgrade to instrumentation ( drive ). Population served is 3642.

properties.Description:

The work includes replacing, upsizing and upgrading of existing 150mm diameter metallic watermain with 300mm diameter polyvinyl chloride watermain on Snyder Avenue North, approximately 420 metres. Replacement of existing 150mm watermain on William Street with 300mm diameter polyvinyl chloride watermain, approximately 90 metres. We will replace of underground water, wastewater, cellar drain and storm sewer systems, separation of combined cellar and wastewater system, increased watermain size, replacement of road structure, curbing and sidewalk. properties.Name: Renewal of water pipes

Project Description:Pipe renewal works aimed at maintaining water services for citizens for 8 stretches of road, totaling 0.744 km.

Construction End Date:2017-11-05

properties.Description:
Project Description:*** Modified project. Please see notes for original project information*** "Upon additional technical review, the project scope was reduced due to a change in the viability of the solution at the locations. Seeking ability to move the excess funds to another approved project with an increased scope of delivery. The project will complete a design to mitigate the risk of basement flooding by retrofitting public storm water assets (no work in private houses). This is achieved by retrofitting devices in catch basins to control the storm water capture rate at catch basins to prevent sewer surcharge. IO NOTE: There is a decrease in scope, resulting in a decrease of Federal Funding of $87,500 to be reallocated to OTT-005."
Construction Start Date:2017-03-17
Construction End Date:2018-07-01

properties.Name: Water/Sewer Replacement 2017
properties.Description:
Project Description:This project is to replace approximately 2100 meters of water main, 400 meters of sewer main and services. These areas represent sections that have the highest number of water main breaks per 100 m of pipe, poor water quality areas as a result of non-circulating lines and areas with lead service lines. The sewer main is not secure and has a large amount of infiltration that enters out treatment center that is costing the community and environment greatly.
Construction Start Date:2017-09-05
Construction End Date:2018-11-09

properties.Name: Upgrade to existing storm water infrastructure with a Rain Garden to improve quality of storm water discharge.
properties.Description:
Project Description:The addition of a Rain Garden is an example of an improved environmental outcome as it will assist with the removal of Total Suspended Solids, a reduction in the peak runoff/discharge and will reduce the negative impact of storm water discharge at its outfall in an area of a steep bank and sensitive receptor. This new construction project will increase the anticipated life span of the storm sewer infrastructure down stream of this project and is an enhancement of the remaining storm sewer infrastructure in this catchment area.
Construction Start Date:2017-07-07
Construction End Date:2018-06-30

properties.Name: Pender Harbour Water Systems Water Main Replacements
properties.Description:

Construction Start Date:2017-05-15
Construction End Date:2019-03-01

properties.Name: Upgrading of wastewater and stormwater infrastructure at the southern end of Allen Avenue to accommodate increased flows
properties.Description:
Project Description:Upgrading sanitary trunk sewer and storm sewer services to convey future flow due to additional new aquatic facility to the community complex at the south end of Allen Ave. The existing Joe Mavrinac Community Complex is located at 55 Allen Avenue in the Town of Kirkland Lake, Ontario. It is proposed to construct a 2,162 sq. m aquatic facility addition to the north west corner of the existing building. This additional aquatic facility will increase the discharge flow which required an upgrade to Sanitary sewer and Strom sewer to convey additional flow as the current study shows the existing sewer system (sanitary and storm) are not design to carry this additional flow.
Construction Start Date:2017-05-20
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Cast Iron Watermain Replacement On Two Streets in the City of Markham
properties.Description:
Project Description:This project involves replacement of cast iron watermain at the end of its lifecycle. Streets or part of streets for this work are prioritized based on Markham's Cast Iron Watermain Condition Assessment and include: 1) Steeles Avenue East - Leslie Street to east of Fairway Heights.; Steeles Avenue East - From west of Laureleaf Road to Bayview Avenue, 2) Church/Wooten Way Re-servicing Replacement of aging cast-iron watermains through this project will achieve the outcomes of reduced service interruptions, maintained water quality, reduced risks and liabilities, and proven of continued good customer service. In addition this project would avoid further maintenance costs on an asset that is almost at the end of its service life. The project component costs are estimated as follows: Steeles Ave E - $3,687,200; Church/Wooten Way Re-servicing-$157,800; External Consulting/Contract Administration-$274,900; Total $4,119,900. We are requesting an extension of 25% of the costs past March 2018 to allow for sewer trench soil settling/consolidation over winter and then application of top asphalt¿ in the following spring.
Construction Start Date:2017-05-01
Construction End Date:2018-11-30

properties.Name: East Royalty Lift Station
properties.Description:
Project Description:The East Royalty Lagoon will be replaced with a sewer lift station and forcemain allowing flows to be redirected to the Charlottetown Pollution Control Plant.
Construction Start Date:2018-03-01
Construction End Date:2018-12-01

properties.Name: 225 Street Pump Station and Force Main Upgrade - Phase 1
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project works will include: - Replacement of four existing pumps; and - Modifications/upgrades to HVAC system and other mechanical/electrical modifications.
Construction Start Date:2018-02-19
Construction End Date:2019-03-30

properties.Name: Enilda water reservoir
properties.Description:
Project Description:Construction of potable water reservoir
Construction Start Date:2017-04-01
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Gravity Sewer Inflow and Infiltration Investigation in Wiarton - work will occur throughout Wiarton, but will concentrate on Berford Street between Frank Street and Division Street
properties.Description:
Project Description:The sanitary sewer infrastructure within Wiarton is prone to infiltration and inflow during peak rain and snowmelt events, as evidenced by significant increases in raw sewage flows during such events. Past investigation work has confirmed poor condition of sewer in some areas but the system has not been extensively studied and records of previous investigation work have not been compiled in a manner that is practically useful for planning replacement/rehabilitation work. The current Asset Management Plan for the community identifies Closed-Circuit Television (CCTV) inspection of the sewers as a means to review current condition and help prioritize replacement. This project will have three goals: compile previous investigation work and identify data gaps, carry out further investigation work in areas requiring such investigation, and commence with engineering and planning for replacement/rehabilitation work in key areas. One such known area is the Berford Street corridor. "Actual Project Site" coordinates shown are for Town office; project location varies across the community.
Construction Start Date:2017-01-09
Construction End Date:2018-11-30

properties.Name: Replacement of aging/deteriorating drainage culverts on the Dawson Road
properties.Description:
Project Description:The replacement and upgrade to the aging drainage/stormwater infrastructure located along the Dawson Road will see: The addition of 4 new drainage culverts, one at 1050mm, 1260mm, 1390mm and 2500mm in diameter all at 15m in length. A total of 1840 tonnes of Granular A to raise the roadway at the 4 locations and 200 tonnes of gabion stone for bank stabilization.
Construction Start Date:2017-09-25
Construction End Date:2017-10-13

properties.Name: Bay Street Storm and Watermain Replacement
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project works will include: - 100m of 250mm PVC storm main; - 35m of 38mm HDPE watermain; - Tie-ins to existing infrastructure; and, - Rehabiliation of road works affected by construction.
Construction Start Date:2017-09-06
Construction End Date:2018-05-31

properties.Name: Lagoon Outfall Upgrades
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project works will include: - Temporary isolation of flow from the construction site; - Excavation and installation of new outfall pipe; - Repair of riprap dyke if needed; - Installation and removal of temporary bridge to access to the right bank; - Excavation and installation of rock vanes; and, - Reclamation of areas disturbed by project works.
Construction Start Date:2017-07-04
Construction End Date:2018-10-01

properties.Name: Wastewater Mains Upgrades
properties.Description:
Project Description:Objective: Mitigate sewage back-pressure issues and increase the wastewater system capacity. Scope: Plan, design and install appx 690 m of appx 150 mm diameter sewer mains, and all associated works. Output: Upgraded sewer mains.
Construction Start Date:2018-05-01
Construction End Date:2019-03-31

properties.Name: Water System Sampling Stations
properties.Description:
Project Description:The project will supply and install two dedicated water sampling stations on the municipal water distribution system.
Construction Start Date:2018-05-01
Construction End Date:2018-06-30

properties.Name: Trenchless Technology for Multiple Storm Sewer Pipes and Rebuild of Deteriorating Structures County Road 73 in Deep River.
properties.Description:
Project Description:This project involves the rehabilitation of the concrete storm sewer system on County Road 73 Deep River Road in the Town of Deep River. The concrete storm sewers range in size from 300 mm to 600 mm in diameter. The rehabilitation will use industry approved trenchless technologies to repair noted areas of deterioration. Typical areas are two metres in length. Areas have been determined through Closed Circuit TV (CCTV) inspections as requiring rehabilitation. The project will include the rehabilitation of deteriorating catchbasin and manhole structures, and will involve either the repair or replacement of the structures.
Construction Start Date:2017-07-01
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Geotechnical Study in support of the replacement of water towers located in Morrisburg and Iroquois
properties.Description:
Project Description:Geotechnical study in support of construction of new water tower(s); ensure proper flows and fire flows for the design and location of new water tower(s) to serve approximately 2,200 homes in the villages of Morrisburg and Iroquois. The municipality is currently reviewing the need to replace existing water infrastructure including two non-compliant water towers. The study will help identify synergies and cost saving across the entire Municipality. The towers are now considered a health and safety risk based on 2015 inspections.
Construction Start Date:2017-03-01
Construction End Date:2018-12-31

properties.Name: Environmental Assessment, Engineering and Design of a Gravity Sewer Extension north from Percy and Park Street to Purdy Road (between Elgin St and "The Big Apple") (3.4km)
properties.Description:
Project Description:Pre-construction engineering and studies (EA) for the sewer extension and road reconstruction to enhance municipal services to existing private business owners and to the growing industrial and commercial sector.
Construction Start Date:2017-11-01
Construction End Date:2019-01-31

properties.Name: Water Treatment Plant Rehabilitation & Upgrades
properties.Description:
Project Description:Replace actuators, repair service line, replace supervisory control and data acquisition, replace flow meters, separate Greensand turbidity readings, repair containment curb, repair chlorine system, decommission potassium permanganate system, upgrade bulk chlorine tank, provide secondary containment for the bulk chlorine, decommission truck fill line, install low and high lift pumps. These rehabilitative works will ensure delivery of safe water, protect the surrounding environment from on-site contaminates and reduce the impact on the provincial health system.
Construction Start Date:2016-12-01
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Removal of built-up sludge at the Madoc Wastewater Lagoon to restore design volume of 1008 m3/ day.
properties.Description:
Project Description:Removal of 16000 m3 of settled solids using loader and excavator to improve the quality of the discharged water. The removal works are capitalized as they extend the life of the asset.
Construction Start Date:2018-05-01
Construction End Date:2018-06-30

properties.Name: Repairs and upgrades at Sewage Lift Station
properties.Description:
Project Description:Replace pump, radio modem, fix locking handles, install fencing. Benefits will be more secure pumping of sewage with reduced risk of environmental contamination through pump failure. Fencing / locks / handles will provide additional protection to community infrastructure asset, and protect community members from hazardous sewage gases and sewage. Off-reserve benefits are protection to receiving environment and protection of health of community and provincial health care system be reducing possibility of accidental contact with sewage.
Construction Start Date:2018-08-01
Construction End Date:2020-03-31

properties.Name: Water Treatment Plant Repairs
properties.Description:
Project Description:Improvements for continued operation of the facility such as upgrading electrical system to meet Canadian Electrical Code, replace chlorine analyzer probes, modify chlorine injection point for better service. Successful completion of this project will ensure that safe, potable water is provided to users - mitigating health risks and burden on Province.
Construction Start Date:2018-02-19
Construction End Date:2018-03-05

properties.Name: Repairs and Upgrades at Water Treatment Plant
properties.Description:
Project Description:Replace supervisory control and data acquisition system, replace on-line analyzers, fix or replace de-sludge valve, replace high-lift pump and backwash pump, replace chemical dosing pump, replace battery of generator, and fix furnace. Off-reserve benefits include more secure and safe drinking water, reducing the burden to provincial health care system.
Construction Start Date:2018-08-01
Construction End Date:2020-03-31

properties.Name: Rehabilitation of the Village Lift Station
properties.Description:
Project Description:Replace low lift pumps including guardrails and replace odour control structure media. Proper functioning of lift station will prevent spillage into the surrounding environment.
Construction Start Date:2016-12-01
Construction End Date:2018-03-31

properties.Name: Waste Pollution Control Facility Upgrades - Phase 1 - LRAR
properties.Description:
Project Description:Construction of a Low Rate Anaerobic Reactor (LRAR) and associated piping and appurtenances which would be dedicated to the first phase of wastewater treatment at the Portage la Prairie waste pollution control facility. The new LRAR will replace the existing unit, which can continue to be operated until the new LRAR is commissioned.
Construction Start Date:2018-03-12
Construction End Date:2019-03-15
